I took it to the T-Mobile store and the man there adjusted a couple settings and this phone gets reception and network speed seemingly better than my old T-Mobile device! On top of that, I received two updates for my OS which says they're making sure my phone stays working and up-to-date.
The options and capabilities of the phone are multifold. I haven't really explored half of what it's able to do, but then again, I only do certain things with my phone...but to know I have options available for use in case my needs change, is great.
The phone just worked seamlessly out of the box. My profile transferred and my apps. It was just an easy and non-time-consuming experience.

This phone is perfect for the price. When you first turn it on, the screen will catch you by surprise because it'll look really damn weird, but you'll get used to it and after you get used to it, it'll look pretty freaking awesome. Performance is nice and I've only noticed occasional hiccups when I use snapchat and Facebook messenger at the same time. Not a problem. The camera leaves something to be desired and I honestly think they slapped the second camera on to be able to say it has a dual camera... You can get much better pictures with phones that have one camera but it still gets the job done... It's better than most in the price range but I think the ZTE Axon Mini's camera has it beat. (and it's cheaper)

I just began using this phone and the rating might change if I experience any early problems (within the first year of use). Right of the bat I can say it is a good phone at a great price considering its size, features and memory (about 19GB is available for use). It does not contain an insane amount of bloated apps and allows you to uninstall a significant amount, it is unlocked and works with AT&T, it has a very good camera and its very light and thin without feeling cheap. The fingerprint sensor actually works and just recognizes only the finger I registered which is pretty cool. It comes with a plastic case which I will not use as I donât think it offers proper protection, but curiously does not include headphones which is not a big deal.

I have had iphones,top samsung phones, the One plus One, you name it and will never, ever spend that type of money again as this phone is just as good or better for one third (1/3) of the money....OR more... what a joke... NOW if the underwear you are wearing are some fancy label and $300 dollars and that is important to you to have a ridiculously expensive label you can not even see...then go ahead get ripped off.....OR stop being so stupid, stop being a sheep and quit wasting your money and buy this phone.

While there are some pretty cool features, I won't even address them because a few neato features are not worth the sheer frustration and mental anguish this phone causes me daily. I can't begin to postulate the number of times I have checked and rechecked settings that this device ignores at random. It just stops obeying the settings! Even when I know I haven't changed a thing, it just stops doing what I told it to do previously. I have done multiple searches for fixes to find that I'm doing everything right. It's the phone that's wrong.

For instance, this piece of crap has recently decided to stop alerting me when I get a text. I haven't changed a thing. It simply stopped notifying me. It doesn't even show up on the messaging icon when I open the phone. I have to go into messaging to see if there are any new texts. And this is after it stopped letting me see text and email previews on the lock screen. I have it set to show me previews, and it used to, but it just stopped doing so a few months ago and I can't make it start again. There are certain apps that I never EVER get notifications for. Not once. Even though I have never changed the settings that say "yes, please notify me of anything at all". I have done system updates. I have restarted the darn thing. I have tried it all.

I'm pretty sure this phone is a narcissistic sociopath. It does what it wants to regardless of my wants or needs and it changes it's mind on a whim without a care as to whom it hurts in the process.

I hate this GD phone.

I have Cricket and after being through several of their phones in four months, I figured I had nothing left to lose.

This thing is great!! It downloaded my 3 banking apps, credit card app, credit karma, Facebook, messenger, and pages all under six minutes. The UI is quite pleasant, as is all of the customization you can do to the phone itself. It's speedy and efficient, and feels like an expensive phone.

No wonder Huawei is so big in Europe and India.

UPDATE:
After a month of heavy use I still enjoy this phone. It can be a little laggy and get hot if I'm running too many apps. I am pleased to say that it isn't glitchy often at all; it has only froze on me once.
No dropped call complaints, and everything is clear and still running well.

UPDATE: Here we are, April 4th and my Bluetooth doesn't work. The phone has been in a case and screen protector since day one. It's a huge shame I need Bluetooth for my business and after less than three full months of use a critical part of something for me is now broken.

Seriously love this phone! I always lose/break phones, so it didn't make financial sense to keep buying iPhones/Samsungs. So, I tried out the 6x. Once I broke that (because I',m a mess), I upgraded to this one. It is SO MUCH BETTER. It has basically the same functions as an iPhone (face unlock, screen recording, etc.). It is also durable. Like I mentioned, I am a mess, and I've dropped this phone already quite a few times. No breaks! I only have the case that it comes with, and it works so well!

The few minutes I got to spend with this phone before it updated to Oreo seemed promising.
But after updating this phone to Oreo, I had two major deal-breaker issues:

1. The screen dims to different levels depending on what screen you are on: like in apps or even Settings.
--- Other people are having this issue; go search "honor 7x oreo screen dims" on Google. Look for the XDA Developers Forum link (should be at the top).
2. Desktop(home screen?) widgets do not automatically update/refresh.
--- Search Google for "oreo update mega thread honor7x reddit", navigate to the Reddit page, and use Find on the page to locate "widgets not updating under Oreo".
--- You can also read posts about this on the EMUI Facebook page (@HuaweiEMUI).

I don't think these issues are hardware related so maybe these issues will be fixed by Huawei in the future. Your mileage may vary, but be wary before taking the plunge!

Pros:
- Nice feel in a hand (like flagship smartphone)
- battery life (around 6 hours screen on time
- design
- everything works great (expect notifications)

Cons
-notification center is lagging (I hope it will be fixed after updates)
- camera lit bit slow and it look like paint, not photo.
-no fast charging and USB C port

But anyway I'm happy with this smartphone for 200$

This is the best phone I've ever had, especially for the price. The high resolution makes it so clear. The fingerprint scanner works flawlessly. Haven't played too much with the camera, but with the two pictures I took, they seemed really good. Not the best picture quality obviously, but still really good considering it's a budget phone. The battery life is really good for me. I use it all day throughout work listening to music and podcasts, as well as get on facebook and such during breaks, and when I come home around 5:30pm, I'll stilll have about 50-60% battery left. Seriously, if you can afford the $200, get this phone. Especially if you use a lot apps. I use a lot of apps for school and social media and for digital books. This phone is great.

For the most part this is a nice phone. It looks great, and the fingerprint scanner is really nice and fast. The processor seems snappy so far, but the benchmarks show the GPU is pretty weak. The lack of fast charge and 5g WiFi is a bit of a bummer, but I knew that going in.

What I didn't know was that the wifi speed is incredibly slow if you simply have Bluetooth enabled. Speed tests put it under 5 mb with bt on, and over 60 with it off. I'm not sure if it's just my unit, but the audio via Bluetooth is really bad. Tested across three devices and it just has a distorted sound through this one. Wired earbuds sound just fine though.

All in all, it's a nice, attractive phone for $200, but the poor wifi with bt on, and the audio via bt makes it feel pretty disappointing for my needs.

Solid phone for the price. Sometimes I read the reviews and get a little nervous because it seems there are all these problems big and small but I have nothing but a smooth experience. For the price, you get Android 8 which is solid. Phone is fast and smooth with Face ID, touch ID, two cameras on the back that give you AMAZING photos akin to the iPhone X photos my friend takes with his phone. The default applications are surprisingly solid and the best part: if you don't like it because youre on Android you can download a myriad of applications to replace the defaults! I love the default camera and gallery apps because they have amazing features. The feel and build of the phone is incredibly satisfying; I sometimes just enjoy looking at the phone because of how awesome it looks. I like the built in themes option for easily switching to other icon and overlay themes. I haven't had such a fast, sleek, and modern phone for such a cheap price ever: budget phones have finally caught up!
Touch ID and Face ID are incredibly fast and you get 3GB of RAM which means no slow downs or problems. Phone Manager is actually pretty cool and for such a high tech phone, the battery life is phenomenal: rarely do I have to worry about battery life.
I am wholly satisfied with the phone and I think most negative reviews are simply expecting a lot out of the phone. Its amazing for the price and does everything you need and plus some

Absolutely in love with this phone. From build material to screen size, speed, picture quality, battery life, it has so much going on for so little price. If all you do is Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, and text and call, this phone is freaking perfect. The call quality is excellent, and the texting is a seamless change from my iPhone 6. Although I do miss iMessage a bit. This phone is miles better than that phone though. With this version you get 3GB RAM and 32 storage, or for $50 more you can buy the 4GB 64 storage...but for all I do, this one is perfect. It was $212 after taxes and make sure to check FREE SHIPPING at checkout because this automatically checks a shipping cost of like $10 extra dollars. The phone took about a week to arrive. One negative is the packaging...it was loosely packed in a way too big box. But the phone was flawless. Probably thanks to the metal construction. It also comes with a plastic gell case. The camera quality is OK. def good for the price and better than most. Hardly any bloatware too...so many good things to say so I'm rambling. Just buy it already and you won't go back to the iPhone! I get a lot of compliments on it too asking what it is. It's HUGE and looks like a flagship phone. 5+ stars

Really great phone for the price. I used to have an iphone but switched and I am so glad I did. This phone has a headphone jack, which is really nice because I use that occasionally. But It also has a really nice fingerprint sensor which is super fast, really nice build, loud speakers, decent cameras, and processor and ram that doesn't show any lagging for me. Very glad I bought this phone. Recommend it to all my friends. Only cons that exist because you are spending $800 dollars less: Not superb camera, no imessage because no IOS, and not insane processor and RAM, but I only noticed lagging on my old iphone. I've had the phone for 6 months now, and no aging has been apparent. Still super fast, and still super good battery.

Phone purchased on July 12th, Recieved on July 19th. And stated to use it on July 27th. It is indeed a nice little budget phone which provides what you need to get going. No it doesnt compare to the super exensive phones, but it holds its own.

The main issues I am having with it though is
1)the switch from wifi to mobile data. If I dont restart it, it will no longer go on mobile data once I take it off wifi. And even after restarting it, it takes a bit of patience not to get pissed off while it takes its time to adjust to mobile data.
2) and sometimes after ending a call, again I must restart to get my mobile data going.

So 2 stars out fot that.

I bought this Honor 7x to replace my wife's Samsung Galaxy S3 which stopped accepting charges even on new batteries - probably a worn usb port on the phone itself. When the phone arrived I could hardly believe the value for the money (under $190 shipped). The screen is nearly as large and crisp as my Note 4, which was a $950 phone when new. Instead of boring you with a repeat of the impressive specs others have rightly posted on this phone, let me share a sobering fact that punched me in the gut when comparing the numbers against "flagship" phones.

Three and a half years ago my Samsung Note 4 was $950 and Samsung no longer supports this (former flagship) phone. Even though it still works flawlessly for me, I will never receive operating system upgrades past Android 6.01. If I were to replace the phone today and amortize the cost over 3.5 years of use, it would come out to about $271 per year of ownership. If my wife's new Honor 7x lasts 2 years and we chuck it in the lake, walk away and buy a new phone, it will amortize to $90 per year of ownership. Another way to look at this is: I'd have to nurse my Note 4 along for over 10 years before the numbers pan out like the Honor 7x - all while enjoying a dated OS and no further factory support from the 2nd year on.

Meanwhile, cell phone CPU's, memory, camera's and screens all improve over time and new OS's make the phones more user friendly than the older "flagships" we try to cling to. Well, no more for me. I've seen the light and once I replace my Note 4 I'll cap the replacement at $250 or less with full confidence I'll lose nothing by comparison. As for my new attitude, I say torpedo the flagships and send them to the bottom of the sea. They've gouged me long enough.

So I finally upgraded my phone from an Apple iPhone 6 back in July. Man was it NICE to get off that ship. xD I was a little worried about getting a larger phone as I have small hands and women's jeans don't have pockets. LOL
However, it only took a week or so to really get used to it. I carry it either in my back pocket or in a bag/jacket.

The camera looks great as long as you have light, like most cameras. It's definitely an upgrade from what I was using. Has some neat features that are added with the second lens.

The fingerprint sensor is a dream. It's in just the right spot and works great as long as it's clean and your fingers are dry. The one on my iPhone didn't work so not having to type in my password every time I need my phone is extra nice!

Headphone jack is still nice! I use it every so often. Good for planes and road trips.

Battery life is wonderful. Lasts a good 18+ hours with pretty normal to heavy use. I usually can make it last a full day though. I do a lot of social media stuff so I use the camera and post things quite a bit.

The phone runs smooth and I haven't seen any issues with the current OS 8.0.

Definitely worth the price!!

I had this phone for only seven months and used to love it! The battery life was awesome and most of the functions worked as well as the more pricey phones. I bought 2 of these in June and they both started to malfunction. The one did not charge at all anymore, and sadly this phone has no built in wireless charging capabilities. I sent it to the manufacturer since it was still under warranty. They immediately sent it back stating there was liquid damage and they would not cover it. I really don't think they had it long enough to even look at it as it came back to me within the week. I feel they just don't want to stand by their warranty. The second phone was just shipped to them yesterday, as that one is having a battery problem as well and wont charge anymore. I would stay away from Honor phones and maybe steer clear of Huawei products as well, I feel they will just use an excuse to not repair your phone. The batteries should last a lot longer than 7 months.

I hate being tied into phone contracts so I always prefer to buy a decent cheap phone outright and use it until it dies. I went from an $80 LG G2 mini, which finally broke from too many floor drops during a house move, to this phone. All good so far, a bit too much bloatware I can't easily remove for my liking. I do appreciate that it came with a clear protective case included. It is not too heavy, screen size is great, easy to use. My one major complaint is the battery. I have yet to see 100% charge because it takes forever and I always need to use it eventually which eats away at the battery power so fast. I already have all kinds of power saving features enabled but they do nothing for how long it takes to charge. I am concerned about how it will do in a situation where it may not be possible to charge it often.

Man this was a great phone for like 2 days. But we're still sticking with this brand. We bought this brand new from Amazon. Not used to make sure it would be good. After connecting it to Bluetooth it had these lines appear and they just kept getting worse despite don't everything Honor customer care said. Company (phone maker) wanted us to send the phone to them so they could repair it but we're exchanging through Amazon first since we need a phone still. Maybe this one was just bad. Only a few other people online had the same problem. We own the 5, 6, and now the 7 in these phones so they are great. Hold up well. Great pictures and video. Hearing someone who's talking on speaker on their phone is hard to hear on these phones but it's ok. I hope the replacements works and I'll update this review cause I really enjoy these phones. Only 3 star cause phone was amazing until the lines. And both companies are working to fix the issue. So don't Chuck your old phone until you've made sure you won't need an emergency back up for whatever reason.

This phone is a great value for money. It has proven to very stable, smooth to operate and has great battery time. The camera is reasonable for the price and every other feature I need in a phone meets or exceeds my expectation. The phone feels and functions like a premium phone. I used this for while, gave it out as present to get the Huawei Mate SE Factory Unlocked, that has slightly higher ram and more memory. They exactly work and feel the same. I would be happy with either phone, except the increased 64Bit storage that helps with keeping more local files on phone.

I searched high and low for an Android operating phone that could do as much as this phone can do under $200, and let me tell you... THERE ARE NONE! This is the best phone I have ever owned, comes with a case which is awesome because I'm still waiting for the one I ordered to come in. I have had this phone for two weeks now and I absolutely love it! I was a little concerned because of some of the one star reviews, but I have not experienced and software issues, and have even dropped it on a hard floor once and it did not crack. The case it comes with isn't amazing, but it certainly offers a light to moderate amount of protection against drops. If anyone else finds a great screen protector for this phone please comment below!

Phones have gotten to be so expensive and they are outdated so fast. I have had Samsung Note 3,4, and 5. I decided to try something different cheaper. This phone 7x is great the battery life is amazing going on my second day of heavy useand it's still got life left. For the price you can not beat it the screen looks amazing!

Pros:
Super long battery life
Touch ID is extremely fast with responding
Camera is very good and has a ton of features and in pro mode you can even take long exsposer pictures.
Phone all so comes with a clear case that is actually cool.

Cons:
Speaker is just OK
No Wireless Charging
No NFC
The screen is not as responsive as some of the higher dollar phones.

My husband bought this phone for me thinking it would be faster than my last phone. Not only is it slow, but I continually have problems with receiving text messages especially group texts. They just hang up there forever until I go into my settings and put my phone on airplane mode and off for every message that is hung up. This is quite annoying and I hate it. Never had this problem on any other phone I owned. I wonder if it is too late to return it and ask for a refund? It also takes a long time to download long documents and send them. I guess you get what you pay for. Also, have issues with the camera getting hung up and takes awhile to get it set up to take picture, slow, slow, slow.

Waiting on support. Fingerprint sensor doesn't seem to work. More after i resolve that. Other than that this seems like a solid smart phone at a reasonable price. OK.. THE INSTRUCTIONS are wrong on the fingerprint sensor.. no "vibrate" . you smoosh your finger around the sensor until the little "icon" is filled then a message to touch your finger on the edge pops up.. so the sensor worked.. the set up is written wrong. Amazon support doesn't know this and Huawei has iffy support for Honor Phones as far as I can tell. The phone is great.. Machined aluminum case and gorilla glass.. tough..minimum bloatwear.. good size.. not too big like a "phablet" fits into a hand nce.. fits into pockets. great display. better than the ASUS this replaces.. The ASUS was OK.. too many annoying bugs (camera was slow.. like ketchup that won't come out of a bottle. I think this will be a very good phone, purchased on PRIME day at a very competitive price.

They said it will release on Jan 25 when i pre-order it in Dec last year, but I got it Jan 24. this is the best smart phone I have ever had. for the price and quality, it is nothing to compain about.
Some useful info.:
1. this phone came with a clear rubber case, so if you are not really care about the personality, the case is quite good.
2, there is curve on either side, so if you buy the screen protector, it may not easy to install.
3. it only support NANO sim card, NOT the micro sim card, so i need to change to a new card.
4. use the small pin provided to push out the side slot for SIM and microSD card.
5. support Daul sim card

This is a great phone.

Bought this for my wife to replace her lenovo Moto g4. The screen is amazing. It feel like a premium phone for a very low price. The only issues I've noticed:

the bezel makes the on screen home buttons very close to any case you put on it, making it difficult to hit them without a touch of practice, but very minor.

There can be a slight delay for the same reason above when typing on the keyboard.

Other than that, battery is great, lasts all day. Screen is very nice. Sound is very good. I have a Sony xa1 ultra as well, and the screen size is very comparable, but the honor 7x is much more comfortable to hold, not bulky at all.

If you want a premium handset without a $1000 pricetag, you won't be disappointed.

Love the phone but a lot of times it doesn't pick up my touch. I have the 6x and it recognizes my touch just fine. So it's very frustrating when I'm typing and it skips letters due to it not picking up the touch and also with the main screen buttons. I don't know if I have a faulty device or of this is a common issue. other than that it's a good phone.

Update.
Have removed the screen protector and so far it's doing good. Will update again if I have any problems.

This is an awesome phone!!! The price is amazingly low for a high quality device. Performance is great and very fast. Connection to LTE is great as well too. And the screen looks very good. I don't game so i couldn't tell you how it does, but browsing, watching videos, and normal phone functions work flawlessly. This is the best phone in its category for the price by far.

I love this phone. It is big enough, has fantastic features, takes great pictures, and great connection to my service 4LTE. I personally think paying $1000 for a phone is not cost effective when you can get something that does pretty much the same thing. It had face recognition before many of the"great" companies and it works great. The fingerprint recognition is also very good but takes some time to set up and memorize your fingerprint, but, nonetheless, I did fingers on both hands. Updated to Oreo right away and it just works great. I will say I am not a "power" user, I text and make calls, use the net once in a while.........so the power for me is great lasts 3 days. All the apps open quickly and run well. No big glitches. SO if you was an almost 6 inch phone, that is fast, takes pretty pictures, great sound, smooth and easy screen, and has decent battery power, this may be for you. I think it is great! Reviews on this phone rate it the best for what you get.

I love this phone!I waited a few months before reviewing and have yet to have any issues. I wish more people knew about it. The camera is amazing,the phone is easy to use and setup, plenty of space with great options to add more, battery life is pretty great and fast to charge, speakers are plenty good. I live in the Midwest in the middle of no where with TMobile and I haven't had any issues not even a moment of slowness.

This is my first android. I've had an iphone since they came out and I'm coming from a 5C to this 7x. I've had it for about 24 hours now and wow! For 200 bucks you couldn't get a better phone. The screen is huge and beautiful. This definitely isn't a 1 handed phone. I'm not a big gamer at all just some pokemon go. Android took some getting used to at first but I love this phone. My only gripe is the very very limited selection in cases (it does come with a flimsy clear one) but that's the price you pay for a cheap phone. Really though, nothing about this phone seems cheap. I threw on the IQ matte shield for the screen and if you can get phones like this for 200 bucks why would you ever pay 500+ again?

It's a good phone! It doesn't feel cheap it's not really lightweight. I got the blue colored phone.. On the photo it looks lighter blue but it's not its darker in person. The screen is crisp and vibrant. The photos are too. But the videos are crisp not really clear and the audio isn't clear. That's why I gave it a 4 star the audio in videos aren't the best quality. Other than that I haven't had any lags or issues with the phone. Loving it =)

UPDATE (3/13/18) - After reluctantly returning to my iPhone 6s, I found the Huawei Mate SE. It has snappy performance and is a better fit for me. My iPhone has been officially retired.

UPDATE (2/23/18) - Like this phone in so many ways but the laggy performance has convinced me to return it and keep looking.

I've used some version of the iPhone for the past 10 years and never thought I'd switch, but the pricing of flagship models has become ridiculous. After reading several reviews of the Honor 7X, I took the plunge and am so happy I did. I'm definitely not an Android expert nor a power user, but the learning curve has been relatively painless and now that I've got everything set up, I couldn't be happier with my choice. The phone is well built and performs great in every way for my needs. I feel really good about choosing this brand and model... for me, it's perfect.

For the price, this phone is an excellent performer. Seems really fast, the screen is crystal clear, with very nice colors. The battery life is excellent. It only loses 2% on standby over the span of 11 hours at night. sound quality is good, pictures taken with the camera look very good. Comes with a TPU clear cover which is ok. I replaced a Moto G5Plus with this and this phone in my opinion is a better phone.

I wanted to wait a while before reviewing this item as its meant to be a long term purchase and i wanted to see how it held up. I'm not the most tech savvy person so this isnt the most professional or technical review for this product.

I love this phone! I had the 6 for quite a while but dropped it into water at a theme park. The 7 was the same price at the time so i figured why not get the newer phone. I am very happy with the quality of this phone and the price. it runs most games very well and handles calls just fine.

Unfortunately, i have to agree with other reviewers that the edges of the touch screen have sensitivity issues. For some reason especially where the "P" is located on the keyboard while texting. the problem persists with games. i really have to smash that part of the phone to get it to respond. I've gotten used to it strangely, but its definitely still a problem and anyone buying this item should be aware of it.

If your looking for a low cost alternative to big brand cell phones and your not looking to do anything too fancy with it i think this phone would work great for you so long as your open to getting used to the sensitivity issue with the touch screen. I didnt have that problem with the 6 though, so that is another option.

has OTG capability and excellent viewing angles.
it is kept updated with the latest security patch, never happened with my moto g5+.
seems emui is not very patient with third party launchers, won't allow the twin app feature with any of them. i'm using Holo because it meets my needs but fluidity is somewhat lessened.

update 12/31: dropped holo and installed nova for 99Â¢ on sale and it is running flawlessly.
Jan 12: doesn't feature fast charging but it does charge fast.

Hereâs what I like about this phone:
1) Fingerprint reader - Awesome! It unlocks the phone instantly. Love this feature.
2) The metal casing and heft of the phone feel great on the hand.
3) The 16:9 screen is vibrant and pleasant to the eye.
4) The 16 MP camera - Takes great pictures ( see picture taken with phone)
5) Excellent battery life - Iâve been using it to watch videos, Pandora, taking photos, texting and the battery lasts for more than 1 day.

Here are features I wish it had:
1) Fast charging - Although not a deal breaker but nice to have.
2) OLED screen - Perhaps is too much to ask but it would be a nice feature.

At this price point, the phone is a great value for the features it has. I would definitely recommend this phone.
Just got it today, play with it a little bit,I think it is amazing phone

I've been using this phone from Toronto for about a month and a half now and it has been performing perfectly. It does work with any Canadian carrier on 4G LTE, I am with virgin mobile and it works with 4G LTE. Comes with a clear tpu case, a charger, the phone and a sim tray tool. This is a MAJOR upgrade from my previous phone (Moto G). Camera quality is Excellent in good lighting. Portrait mode isn't that good but it gets the job done. Battery life is good for a whole day and that's coming from a heavy user. finger print sensor is insanely fast. I recommend buying a good case as it is a bit slippery. Call quality is great. Oh and turn off the option where it picks up calls once u raise it to your ear because if you leave it on , it will randomly pick up when in your pocket

Over all amazing, this phone competes with flagship phones for sure
I got my phone a day ago, am so in love with it my kids are giving me the wierd lookð

Technology is getting to the point where having a high-quality phone no longer requires purchasing a $800+ device. Honor device is a perfect example of that. Not only is the phone made very well, but it has handled everything that my wife has thrown out at it, to include playing multiple games, social media, texting, Etc. Francis, he device at this price point will not have everything that the recently released Galaxy (insert model here) phone has, but if you really think about it...How often do you use every feature on the more high price phones? Seriously, I highly recommend this phone, especially if you're looking for a budget-friendly quality device.

Not the best but not the worst. definitely good for the money. The camera is less than advertised so that was kinda disappointing. Don't even bother trying to take a low lighting photo. Good outdoor photos though.
The battery is okay. It lasts all day, but if I use it for browsing and such nonstop it eats about 10 to 20% in an hour.
Haven't tried watching videos on it.
The led notification light it worthless, which was also disappointing.
Had there been better reviews at the time I probably would have gone with something else.
The screen quality is good though, it is nice and bright.

I would give it more stars if I could. I am not a phone expert. I use Tracfone and have purchased unlocked smart phones from Amazon. This phone is awesome. The camera (which was one of my primary concerns) is also awesome for my purposes. It was super easy to unlock and transfer all my remaining minutes/texts/data through Tracfone. I paid $199.00 for it using the six months interest free with my Amazon card. I never thought I'd pay that much for a phone....but, it's so much more than a phone. If I could manage Quicken on it, I'd get rid of my crappy laptop.

For $200, you get a lot of power. The phone is fast, has great battery life (I usually get around 2 days from one charge). Phone is unlocked out of the box so you can use it on a variety of GSM carriers (I use Cricket).

I've only had it for a few months but so far I am very impressed with this thing. I've had other budget phones where it just dies a horrible death within months (I upgraded from the BLU RD1 HD, which lasted me only 8 months before it became unusable). If you are looking for a great performer on a budget, this is a great choice.

The only things that I would gripe about (and they are really minor issues for me) are...

1. Setting wallpapers is weird. The image you pick will get LARGE, so if want a picture of your family, a kid, a pet, etc....a lot of times it will get cut off on the screen due to the warped size. Not a huge deal if you just have a generic graphic that you use.

2. Fitbits WILL NOT WORK with this phone. They are not a formally supported device. My wife has an Honor 6X and has the same issue with hers. Definitely a deal breaker if you rely on a FitBit for fitness tracking.

3. Some apps will not appear as notifications on the lock screen, but will appear in the taskbar when you unlock the phone.

The fitbit issue will be a dealbreaker for some folks but if you just want a phone that works fast, well, and doesn't break the bank....definitely give this phone a shot.

In October 2018, the price can't be better for a Android Oreo. The phone is fast - much faster than my Blackberry Keyone that costed a fortune.
Everything works great. This device is amazing. Great screen.
I miss USB-C charging and fast charging. Other than that, everything is great.

I have waited two weeks before submitting a review, so I could give my honest impressions. I have been extremely impressed with the Huawei Honor 7x. I'm just thankful I had done so much research on different phones in my price range. It is by far the best smartphone I have ever had. I have had LG and Samsungs in the past and they were good phones but I feel like the Honor 7x wins hands down. I protected my screen with Mr. Shield anti glare screen protector and I'm good to go now. Thank you Huawei!!!

I was getting this as a second phone and so I could have an android phone again as a side kick to my iPhone. I am in IT and like having both worlds for my job. The price is perfect and I really wanted to keep it! However I had a few issues with it so I sent it back. There was an issue with the olaphobic coating in the top right corner while made smudges that never went away! I also had other issues with the screen, colors, turning off when it wasnât supposed too, etc. I am hoping this was a fluke issue with my device but one I couldnât deal with!

I'll be short and sweet on this. The device is neither thin nor thick, and its weight is more than fine for someone like me whose wrists and hands can support more than a pound of weight for more than five minutes. For its price the build quality is commendable, and my only gripe is the choice to make the rear dual cameras have their own assemblies rather than being under one piece of raised metal and glass. Dirt and dust gets caught in-between the cameras frequently enough to cause some frustration.

The screen is in some ways better than I expected, with only slight color shifting at odd and infrequent angles. Camera is very good and i've taken some very pleasant pictures with it, and I've only slight dissatisfaction with the kirin processor in here. The single bottom-firing speaker is... alright, i suppose. You really should use headphones with this phone if you like listening to music. Also, the bluetooth reception can be quite shoddy since it doesn't have its own dedicated band, and I've encountered several issues with perfectly fine bluetooth headsets while using this phone.

Overall, not the best phone in its class, but it's hard to with how good budget phones are becoming. I'm happy enough with it to still be using it and still want to use it for a while yet.

Everyone thinks it's an iPhone when i have the case off. It's truly a beautiful phone with premium like quality. It takes amazing pictures which is what I use it for the most. One thing that'll take a while to get used to is the navigation panel being backwards for me. I'm used to the back buttons being on the right, but it won't be a problem after a few months of using the phone. Just wished they offered an option to switch the navigation around like in the new version of this phone.

Great phone for the price! It's super quick, I can use multiple apps at once and there isn't any bloatware on this phone. One annoying thing is that it keeps telling me when an app is using a lot of energy (like Pokemon Go), but I got this phone for playing games on. The pictures it takes are breathtaking and I love the dual camera because I can focus on the foreground or background for taking professional looking pics. I had a Blu Vivo XL2 that lasted 1 year before it broke, so I hope Honor 7X can outlive my last phone.

Penny pinching AT&T prepaid customer here. Purchased a very cheap phone from AT&T recently and determined within a week that the poor choice of buying a 60 dollar not-so-smart phone would have to be remedied. I did some research and narrowed it down to the honor 7x for a number of reasons. 200 dollars is not the easiest thing I've parted with but it wasn't until I had the phone in my hand that the quality put the praise worthy price point into perspective. The ability to trim down and disable alot of the manufacturer pre-loaded apps, dual SIM card capability, definition and clarity of both the display and the camera(s) are astonishing. The battery life is incredible compared to my last phone. I received the phone with 40-50 percent battery life. Discharging the battery via constant video streaming took around 4 and a half hours. The metal housing feels tremendously sturdy and the phone has a weight and presence in your hand that is comfortable. Last but certainly not least, download and upload speeds are ludicrous. I mean, this phone is FAST. 5/5 stars from me. Will absolutely purchase again.

For $200 there is no better phone out there! Everything about this phone is outstanding, except for the sound. Speakers could be a little better but that's the only drawback. If the speakers are a deal breaker, look elsewhere. If your just looking for a not only great budge phone, but legitimately good phone period, this is for you! It even came with it's own phone case and it's actually really nice.
UODATE: this phone really gives you the Galaxy S8/S9 feel for a quarter of the price.

I love the looks and the speed. It has slots for 2 SIM cards or 1 SIM and 1 microSD. I chose the SD thinking that I could load many of my apps on the SD, freeing up RAM memory, but no such luck. On the other hand, I can load all of my photos, music and data on the 32 GB SD without slowing down the OS. The camera is awesome compared to my old Samsung and the screen is bright and sharp, though it flickers a bit sometimes....and it has spontaneously rebooted a couple of times like I believe most phones do. Importantly, online support has been great. All-in-all, despite the flaws noted, I LOVE IT and don't think you can match it anywhere for the price.

This phone is amazing, having been a iOS user for the last few years I came to like the hardware but I wanted the Android operating system. This phone is the best of both worlds, feels exactly like my iPhone. You're getting flagship quality for a fraction of the price, phone is very fast and has an excellent battery. I use mine quite frequently throughout the day and my phone will only be around 50 percent when I charge it before I go to bed. Camera quality can't compete with the top of the line phones but it takes better photos than my old iPhone 6 and I can't complain one bit. I highly recommend this to anyone wanting a good phone on a budget!

I bought this for my gf and she's extremely happy with it,

great battery life!
great camera!
great build quality!!
extremely fast finger print scanner!
its also good for gaming (played pubg for a few hours on it and had no issues )

Not happy at all. Received first phone...won't send SMS or MMS messages . called company and tech said it's defective and to call Amazon for a replacement. Got replacement phone...... exact same issues can't text. Two phones defective? Doubt it. There is a hardware/software problem with this phone. Maker couldn't figure it out. My cell provider tech couldn't figure it out either. I use it for work and it's been a week and it's affected my business

6 months ago I switched from my Galaxy S7 (which completely shattered within 6 months) To this phone, I saw many people recommending this as a budget phone, I liked the price and no longer see a reason to get a flagship device when all I really do is browse the web, shop online, send messages, light gaming, and use social media, these newer budget phones can handle all that with ease, and this phone really surprised me, all the features built in to this $200 make it feel very premium, it's very fast and responsive, I'd say better than My S7 for a fraction of the price. Flagship devices are really an unnecessary luxury now, as there isn't a need for them as there used to be, this phone really proves that

I upgraded my Honor 6X to this new one and im very happy with it, the camera is excellent, the speed is good (it does not stutter at all) screen is huge but some apps are not compatible with this size of screen so you will see a blank space on the bottom..

It feels good on the hand even better than the honor 6x.. I have 0 issues with it and when i got it i installed the clone app (by huawei) and in 10 minutes my new phone was ready to use with all the apps and they configuration i have previously on my honor 6x that was super nice..

Nice phone for this level of price. The set up is very easy and the screen is so big. I love it. I had a T-Mobile SIM card and everything is working fine. Perhaps the camera can be improved but again, it is a 200 use phone, so it is fine for me.
I recommend this phone to whoever does not want to spend 1000 use for an I phone or Samsung
Great phone. The look is awesome. Photos/ videos are crispy, Cristal clear, and unrivaled. It is very light phone. The battery life is wonderful. You can go almost 2 days without charging.

My last 200$ phone was an absolute piece of trash that couldn't keep more than 1 app in the background at a time and was made of plastic. This was a far different story though. Honors(Huaweis) EMUI software is snappy if a bit heavy on killing background apps. On the other hand, if you have another 30$, I would recommend getting the Mate SE becuase that phone at 230 with 4gb of ram and 64gb of storage is an even greater value.

Update: This went from 5 star phone to a 0 star phone for me within the 8 months of owning it. This phone will eventually slow down and stop working. I finally called it quits with this phone when (just now) it factory reset my phone because I inputted my password incorrectly (even though I logged in a couple of times before). It gives you 9 tries to enter it correctly which I did do but then through the day I entered it incorrectly. It should have reset the 9 tries after I entered it correctly but it didn't! Now I lost all my pictures, contacts, etc. I hate HUEWEI!! I'm sticking to Samsung (for android) or Apple phones from now on!! Beware anyone who is tempted by the price. It isn't worth it in the long-run. You've been warned.
_______________________________________________________________
I am soooo impressed with this smartphone. My previous phone (Nexus 5X) bricked on me after a firmware update and I was need of a phone fast!

So I went out looking for the best bang for the bucks but I didn't want to spend more then $250.. I came to the conclusion that whatever phone I buy at that price range will be a used or refurbished one. A little bit of research had me looking into this bad boy and I was truly amazed at the price point. However, I was worried that being a Chinese brand, the quality would suffer (sorry, this myth no longer holds true to me after purchasing this phone and a TCL smart TV).

The final step of deciding to purchase this phone came in comparing what I can get instead for the same price range... Nothing came close after hours of research except the Samsung Galaxy S7.. the difference would be that the Galaxy S7 would cost way more for a brand new phone and a refurbished in most cases would also cost more!!
Verdict after 2 Weeks with the phone: Truly amazing and I'm not exaggerating. I am actually constantly looking at the phone amazed that I got it at this price. It feels like I'm easily holding a phone that retails upwards of $400 but I got it for half that. If anyone else is on the fence like I was.. jump right over! the grass really is greener on the Honor 7X side ( =

I have been using the iPhone since the beginning. I have never owned an Android device so I canât compare it to others. I even have the iPhone X. The reason I purchased this was I wanted a phone with dual sims. I hate carrying around two devices. I did a lot of research and wanted a good value. This phone fit the bill.
It will work with any gsm network. T-Mobile, AT&T and other prepaid gsm providers in the US.
Pros-
Fingerprint sensor is lighting fast!
Camera is pretty good.
Screen looks great
The phone is pretty snappy as far as speed. No real lag. I am using the stock software and from what I have read installing different launchers can slow it down.

Cons-
No 5ghz WiFi.
No fast charge, it takes a long time to fully charge.
No wifi calling
Second sim only 2G, you can still text but I donât know if it can handle picture messages on 2G
No native mail app. You must use a third party mail app. Yahoo, google.
I think it has some form of ad software installed.
The usb connection to most new car radios does not allow you to play music or streaming apps from the phone. That can only be done with Bluetooth. This might just be an Android thing and not a phone thing. My iPhones have always worked with the usb connection.

Android messages.. this is by far the worst feature of an Android phone. There is no comparison to iMessage on the iPhone. It has limited features and a character limit.. seriously? Its 2018 and text are limited to 160 characters ð. If you are a heavy texter which I am not, Android isnât for you if you are coming from an iPhone.
I guess some of my review is about the Android 7 OS. ð
I feel like I am using Windoze again. Itâs not too bad but If you are tech savvy you can figure it out.
Iâll keep using it for a couple of weeks and if my opinion changes Iâll update my review.

If you are looking for a good value then this is the phone for you. For $200, you canât go wrong.

UPDATE..

Well, I spoke to soon.. I am returning the phone.
It is now locking up. I have to constantly reboot it, I have had to reset it and when I install a few apps it starts happening again. I am guessing itâs the Android OS that is the problem but.. if the OS wonât run correctly it doesnât matter how good the hardware is.
I am not a gamer or a frequent texter.. I do use a few social media apps and shopping apps, thatâs about it..
still a good value if you can deal with the android OS.

I have had this phone for a month and, knock on wood, it's doing great. I like the glass as it's smooth and easy to clean and doesn't cloud up like plastic. Easy to connect to car through blue tooth for hands free driving. Loud and clear sound. Runs movies pretty well also. Charge lasts about 4 days. Make sure you let the charge get down to 15%, when it shows red, before recharging to extend the battery life.

This phone is now my daily phone and it definitely is a nice phone. I also purchased a case and screen protector for it and with those I've dropped it several times with no damage at all. This phone is not for those who don't like bigger phones as it is quite large, however it has no problem fitting in my pocket. I have noticed that the ram is a little touchy so you will have to boost it from time to time and not leave open certain apps. This phone charges pretty quick and the battery lasts me all day. the camera quality is nothing amazing however if you are just using it for social media it is fine. The screen looks great and and games look nice. Overall it's a pretty solid phone for the price.

We bought 2 of these and took them to the T-Mobile store, where a very nice woman activated them and transferred all our apps and data for us. It was important for my husband to have a magnetometer, which this phone does. The battery (after 4 days) seems to last a long time. Will get back to you if we have any changes, but so far we are very happy we bought these. Our previous (unlocked) phones were Amazon special deals, and they had so much bloatware that the phones became almost impossible to use. It was important to us to find an unlocked phone with little bloatware and a lot of storage space.

First time buying unlocked phone so I was super nervous. Shipped fast; OEM packaging as far as I can tell. Sleek phone; great performance so far. Camera is fun to use; not so great in low light so use flash. Still; portrait mode is gorgeous on both cameras. Haven't had a hiccup upgrading to Android 8 and works great with metro/TMobile service.
TLDR: fancy on a budget; works great

Had it about 2 months when it slipped out of my pouch and plopped into the slippery rock river. I slid down the bank after it and bunged my shoulder. It then took me 10 minutes to find it fish it out. It had self-powered down but showed no obvious signs of water penetration. I buried it in a bag of rice for a night and plugged it in the next morning and it fired right up. This is a grand phone for the money. I have never owned any flagships but my wife has always owned a newer iphone. I like this one better in overall design irregardless of the price. Upgrade to Oreo happened the day I received it.

Well, it works like what others have said about this phone but my phone kept getting the screen turn off, although, I already set it to 10min. I will only give it 4 stars until I or someone help me solved this issue.

(Update)
Okay, I seem to solve my own problem now with the lock screen time being short. When I do the transfer of data from my google account to my new phone, the backup data was carrying my old phone system into the new phone. In which, the old system info have conflict with the new phone system. After I do a factory reset and not do the transfer of data into the phone it actually solve the problem.

To start with I purchased this phone on Prim Day and after I found out that I had paid more then if I had ordered it an any regular day. Then I found out the company does not offer an extended warranty. Customer service rep was very abrupt and did not offer much help. Quality of the phones functions were average. the thing that turned me off the most was that the screen was very fragile and broke very easy. Cost was prohibitive to have repaired. Cost me $200 for 5 months use. Purchase a phone from one of the more famous companies.

I just change from iPhone to android, learning curve is not that big actually. Data transfer take sometime, but worth it. Phone is fast and smooth, battery is pretty good, normal use surely last for a full day.
Price is great for the this phone can do. highly recommend

Great phone for the price - got it for my 12 yo as a gift. As a young techie, he can't keep his hands off it (which says a lot about the design and features, especially in comparison that the previous phones that he had and their lack of features that he used to "hint" to us about ). It keeps the charge well. We already have experience with the phone so it says something when we decide to buy another one - now his is an upgrade over ours!

The phone looks nice and very cheap. But the GPS never work and you will be lost if you are in a busy city driving. The GPS will notify you where to turn left or right after you have missed the route. Sometimes, the GPS does not know where you are, sometimes it does not even start at all. Honestly, the calls are very slow and so many issues with it. I recommend better to get a different phone with higher price.

I always but a case and a screen protector instantly for my new phones. The one time I dropped this phone it stopped working properly. The first to go was the side buttons which was the most frustrating. Try having no way of lowering the volume and constantly having to do it manually instead of being able to use the buttons. Apps would always keep shutting down or not functioning properly on this phone. The only good thing about this phone is how well the screen is made.

Some of the software isn't made for the USA
Voice typing quit working by itself one day, even a factory reset didn't fix this problem.
Support fixed it for free, even paid for postage both ways.

Love this phone. It is so easy to use and I out the battery to the test the first day I got it using mid level battery saver that already built into the phone. In doing so the battery lasted 36 straight hours at 100% before it died. Way better then my old s6 active that I had. Now you will need a case with this phone because it so slim and light weight. I haven't personally tested the phone durability due to not wanting to break it. But over all an amazing phone for 200 bucks and it easy to clone your old Android phone data over to this phone

I have always been an iPhone junkie. I would never get anything that wasnât apple. I recently have been in the process of switching phone companies (because sprint sucks lol) and I didnât wanna get a new iPhone yet because Apple will release the new ones in November so I bought this phone on prime day to use because it was cheap and I can honestly say that I LOVE it and Iâm not sure that I will get a new iPhone when they come out. The only thing I wish was better is the camera.

Great smooth fast phone. Camera works like a dream and has a lot of cool features to it. Only problem is that I can't find a way to have the notification details pop up on the lock screen it always says "content hidden" and nothing in the settings help

This phone is replacing a iPhone 6 and I am astounded at how good this 200$ phone is. The screen display is vivid and the size is perfect for youtube, calls/texting is easy and reliable, camera is quick and responsive, and the fingerprint sensor is faster than my girlfriend's Galaxy s8! This exceeded my expectations for a phone and I don't think I can ever go back to paying more than 500 bucks for a phone. Definitely recommend!

Excellent value for the price. The phone screen and back are not great materials, but work just fine. Battery life is excellent. Many features are better than what is available for pricier phones: ability to get FM radio and dual sim in particular. Although it took a little doing, I was able to activate my phone at the AT&T store with no problems. I also used a Tracfone ATT sim without issues. I believe that this phone will also work on T-Mobile networks, although I have not tested this. The camera app is not quite as good as my Nexus 5x, but is fine for my needs.

I am pretty happy with the quality of the phone. Though if I compare it to my old Note 4, the Note (a phone from 2012) might winout in quality of device. Overall though I'm very happy. One thing this phone beats my old Note 4 on is battery. This thing has a killer battery, ending a day of moderate use at around 70% most of the time.
Combines a bunch of the newest features in the market and functions wonderfully. Works with Straight talk BYOP,

wow where should i start sure my galaxy not 8 is a beast, but this phone is sexy and beautiful. I wanted the blue one sold out twice im still gonna buy it from Huwaei if i have to they offer a swag bag deal tripod special case, so ill wait n see if Amazon gets the blue one back. Screen size is awesome speed is fast dual sim use one for a 256 gig sd card from samsung overall this is the best deal i hope Amazon gets the red valentines day edition when it comes out. great buy go out and buy this phone oreo 8.0 is out real soon so great deal.This is an update the screen lags a bit when scrolling up or down in apps hope this is fixed soon.

It was coming close to the time I usually start thinking about s new phone because the old one bored me/started having issues. The 7x brings that trend to and end. I love this phone and will use it till it dies.

Overall it's amazing. I can go all day on my phone with moderately high usage. (Mostly texting and Mobil gaming) I have left this phone cased most of the time and always screen protected. No scratches or blemishes on the phone. And best of all it doesn't feel like my phone's battery dies off a little more each day.

My only cons for this phone really is the picture quality. It's eh.. but acceptable. And I wish it had a type c charger.

Screen clarity isnt amazing but it's good for those who are screen snobs.

I love it. You should buy it. And splurg for the 4gb ram phone if you have the extra doe.

I'm returning it as soon as my replacement phone gets here. I'm sending it back for the following reasons:
1. The keyboard is annoying. It's a small gripe that I'd be willing to overlook if the phone were otherwise okay.
2. The camera is lackluster. I use my dedicated camera for "real" pictures, but this thing really does stink in less than ideal conditions. I use the phone camera to snap quick pictures I can send to family, but I'd rather use my actual camera and go through the hassle of uploading them to my computer and emailing them than to text dark, blurry pictures instantaneously.
3. The phone lags. I wondered what people meant when they said this and thought they were being fussy. After all, it's pretty remarkable to be using a hand-held computer at all. But it does, and it's annoying. I think that my keystrokes haven't registered and all of a sudden, I'm texting like a ham-fingered drunkard.
4. This is main reason. The call quality sucks. The people I'm on the line with come through crystal clear. I come through crystal clear to them, except when I don't. On several occasions on multiple calls, if I literally (and I mean "literally" literally, not figuratively) turned my body 45 degrees, my reception was dropped entirely. I could hear the person on the other line, but they couldn't hear me.
I mentioned this to a relative who is a huge tech guy and he had the same problems, but somehow lasted a month before ditching his.
He has a Moto E4 and loves it, but being a tech guy, is already planning on upgrading to a newer version. His girlfriend has had an E4 for over a year and loves it. I ordered an E4 Plus, just for the extra MP on the camera.

If I had problems 1-3 and the call quality/reception was fine, I'd keep it, but since its main function is so fickle, the phone doesn't offer any other redeeming qualities.

So far so good, I have no complain and I guess for the money is not too bad. This phone has a much better screen glass compared to others low badge smartphone. The phone responded pretty fast and the battery is one of the kind probably the best feature in this mobile phone. In fact, everything functioned as should be. And like I said before for the price it is a good toy. An update, the phone is still working perfectly with the new EMUI 8.0.0 Android version...The speaker is another great feature it can be heard 150 ft away inside my house. Good phone for the price, I'm impress.
