We never buy expensive phones, so when we needed to replace our smartphones, I read a lot of reviews. Settled on these for husband and I. So glad we did. We've only had them about 2 weeks, but we're very happy with them. Read other reviews for details. Responsive, clear sound, good picture quality.

Had this phone since Prime Day now. Had iPhones since 2011. No way I'm going to pay $800+ for a device these days. Never heard of this brand but took a gamble. I've been pleasantly surprised. Lots of pros and cons to consider if you are coming from an iPhone or you're just curious about this product. Just a side note, there is an option to unlock this phone using your face rather than your fingerprint if you like. It works quite well. I tried to trick it using photographs of myself and it never unlocked. It was quite intelligent.

PROS

-Expandable memory: I love the ability to store all of my photos/videos/music on a separate drive and never having to worry about running out of memory. This feature is like having a credit card without a limit.

-Battery life: I can get up to two days on a full charge. Sometimes I forget when I last charged the device. 30% can last all day. With the iPhone, that meant an hour or two :(

-Huge screen: I never want to go back to the smaller iPhones now!

-Speed: This phone is fast! Apps open quick and the fingerprint sensor recognizes your touch almost instantly.

CONS

-Brightness: Screen could be a bit brighter, especially in broad daylight.

-Bluetooth delay: My biggest gripe. If you have a Bluetooth headset, you will notice a delay in movies or YouTube videos. Read other reviews on here. It's just the way it is. Apparently it's due to the shared wifi and BT antennas. Nothing I have tried can solve the issue (developer settings, factory resets, different headsets). Restarting the phone will work temporarily but eventually the phone will delay again. Huge bummer since iPhones never had this problem. You could run a wired headset but who wants to use those?

-No NFC: This means no Android pay capability :(. I still have to carry my wallet around I guess.

-Camera: Like everyone says, it's pretty bad in the dark. It also takes really blurry pics if you have a shaky hand. There may be more settings I haven't played around with, but in all honesty I've been more impressed with photos from Apple's 8MP phones than ones from this phone that claims to shoot at twice the megapixels. Pics get much worse if you use the zoom.

-No wireless charging. At this price, I can't really call this a con, but rather a missed luxury.

-Vibration: The vibrator is much weaker compared to any other phone I have owned. If I have the phone in my front pocket, I will not even feel the vibration from a text message.

All in all, I only paid $167 shipped on Prime day for this phone. I'd buy it again even at the current price. Hopefully the manufacturer will read these comments and fix the Bluetooth delay and maybe I'll upgrade to the next version. I will wait for the reviews before I buy though!

This is the second Honor phone my wife has had and she loves it. She dropped her last one and cracked the screen because she didn't have a protective case on it. She got many years of use out of it before this happened. We just decided to buy her a new one for $200.00 instead of having her screen replaced on the one she dropped. You can't go wrong with this phone purchase.

I have been loving my Honor 7x so far :) It arrived quicker than expected, the phone came with its charger and a clear case.

For a budget phone, I am happy with its specs. I like both cameras, the phone is fast, specially its sensor for unlocking.

And the battery so far is great. I am a mid to heavy user, and it has lasted 1 day perfectly.

If I watch a 2 hour movie, it only takes off like 20% from the battery, which I think is great.

I have watched two movies so far with the same performance. Around 20%-25% of battery use.

The only cons I have found after a few weeks of use is the fact that the phone lags a bit when using the camera, specially switching from rear & front camera.

I don't know if it's a bug, but for the price I paid, I am a happy user!

The 2nd sim card slot is only 2G. Telus here in Ontario Canada does not operate on 2g. The main sim card is 2g,3g,4g. Does not work on Telus with dual sim, one sim card only.

UPDATE - phone gets randomly stuck in a constant reboot , turning on and off and gets very hot. I am returning the phone.

I wanted to like the phone but not really being dual sim and the complete unrealibilty due to occasionally turning on and off constantly I have to return it.

I bought my husband this phone to replace his Samsung S6. He dropped his Samsung one time and after that the screen would flash on and off especially when the battery got low. I refused to pay another $800 for a phone and the reviews on this phone were great. So far my husband loves it, especially the battery life which he says is awesome. He can watch videos and play on his phone all day and not need to charge it. His Samsung wouldn't last even half the day. It is definitely competitive/comparable with these overpriced iPhones and Samsung phones.
Excellent phone for an excellent price...

I've owned the Honor 6x in the past, and since it worked for me I was pretty confident the 7x would be no different. With prices of phones getting higher and higher I was looking for something that wasn't so expensive; I'd just returned the Mate 10 Pro for this very reason and decided to stick with Honor/Huawei.

I love that it gets VoLTE on my carrier (T-mobile), and that it includes a case in the box - definitely something other phone companies need to do. The handfeel is a HUGE improvement over the 6x, and though it's not what the market considers premium (glass) I like that if I went without a case the device would probably be ok too.

So far battery life has been about what my 6x was able to do, and for my usage/needs that's more than enough - I can get through a day in with 60% remaining, and that suites me just fine. I'm not a gamer, my apps are mostly time killers/utility apps, but I haven't had the device slow when switching or freeze while trying to load something.

EMUI isn't something that's a deal breaker for me, in fact I love that it has features that I sometimes have to unlock with an app or ADB on other devices (night mode, fingerprint scanner gestures, mobile hotspot toggle, data toggle, etc); about the only thing I wish it would include is the ability to load customer icons and/or make the default icons smaller.

Overall for what I paid for the phone I'm extremely satisfied right now, even if it does get an Android 8.0 update I'll still consider this money well spent as the feature set is pretty killer. There's some good competition in this space, so definitely look around but I'm happy with my purchase.

I originally had the ZTE blade. However that phone kept on glitching. Yet I still enjoyed the thickness of the phone. So I did my research and looked for phone that was supposedly supposed to be the same equivalent in size. After reading reviews and checking the price range I seen that this phone was ranking High so I decided to give it a go. After having this phone for approximately 6 months there are several things that irritate me. First the phone is not the same thickness as my previous phone it's very slim. Yes I know that's a personal preference not a flaw of the phone in general but if you're looking for a phone that's thick do not allow the stats on the phone too deceive you. Secondly, the phone jack does not work meaning if you want to plug in headphones it doesn't work. If I'm using the Bluetooth feature and try to sync it with another Bluetooth feature and speak the speaker and Bluetooth features on the phone seem to jump in between each other glitching. Also while browsing or going through several apps the screen tents to become non-responsive to touch. Overall this phone has many settings that are somewhat confusing and it does not play well or nice with other devices I don't know if that's because it's a foreign phone or what. But I would not recommend this phone

I never give 5 stars, but again the Honor line has left me astounded. I LOVED my Honor 6x...but after a year in my back pocket, it had like a 10Â° bow in the frame and glass. Never a crack or problem, till I sat on it one too many times, but unlike an iPhone, I never had a crack, scratch, or screen problem. It just had a butt-impression as bad as my couch, and it started messing with my beloved, amazing, dual lense camera.

Now the upgrade. Am in love again. How can this camera get better? I bought the 6x and figured it was a camera with a phone attached. Now it's a better camera with a way better OS, speed, screen, everything.

No matter Android or Apple, you simply cannot this amount of bang for the buck. This is a thermonuclear blast for your buck.

Did I mention this is an amazing camera?

Phone performes at the price level. It is fairly fast and not laggy but i dont download alot of apps etc. so i dont clog it up much, happy with the performance so far. screen is just o.k. its not amoled but it'll do. my only dissapointment lies with the camerea...its barely decent. my last phone was an asus zen phone 3 zoom and the camera on that phone was top notch so i was a little spoiled. all in all worth 199.00 i guess but my next phone will have a better camera.

So here's the thing. This phone is great, especially for the price. But you need to know going in that it's running EMUI. So it's gonna have some... issues. Sometimes it'll log you out of Chrome and there's just nothing to do. Both Huawei and Google know about this, but it's just kinda random luck. The screen looks beautiful, the camera is decent. Overall really happy with it.

Also, it's notifications are weird and I have no idea why. Like, it just won't give you notifications sometimes and you can't peek.

Not a bad phone but inferior to the Honor 5x. I loved that phone and when i smashed it on accident i looked for an upgrade. The camera is better then a Honor 5x but everything else is worse. The bluetooth and wifi use the same antenna. When i use my bose headphones on youtube the video lags in anything higher that 280p. When i turn off the wifi and use 4g everything is golden. Good thing i have unlimited data. The GPS is basicaly usless. Im not sure if its something ive done but the GPS is constantly seaching for signal. I have to basicaly hold out my window to get to catch signal but ill lose it constantly. So that is to be desired. All not a bad phone for 200 but i would not recommend or repurchase as it has many feature that are not usable.

Just got this phone yesterday and my first impression was that the build quality and look & feel of this phone is just amazing for the price. Battery performance seems to be stellar and I did not face any lag while accessing my applications. Touchwood!

I bought this phone after doing a little research and deciding that I needed something with more memory than my Samsung On5. I have MetroPCS and they don't always give the best opportunity to get a good deal on a new phone if you already have them so I bought this one from Amazon and figured at $199, I can't really go wrong. The phone has exceeded my expectations in every way so far. The screen is larger than my old phone and it has 4 times the internal memory, the processing speed has had no problem so far. The cameras work great, the graphics are clear, the battery life is amazing. For the price, I really can't complain, also it showed it would not be in stock until the 26th (I ordered on the 24th), instead it ended up shipping the same day I ordered (the afternoon of the 24th) and arrived the next day! So far I'm very pleased with this phone!

This Honor 7x is surprisingly excellent. If you don't need th experience bells and whistles of top of the line smartphones, get this one.
Note: I got this for my daughter to replace her Asus Zenphone II Laser. She loves it so far. It fits her criteria : bigger screen, not too bulky, fingerprint sensor, dual lens camera, headphone jack, pretty color (we got the blue one).

I bought this after my Samsung S7 shit the bed. This is just as good and only at a fraction of the price. I think I'm done with flagship phones after realizing you're paying for nothing more than the name... And they're designed to fail after a certain amount of time anyway. Capitalism at its finest lol

Upgraded from my old K20 plus to this. Works amazingly and the camera portrait mode makes pictures look amazing. For all those asking, yes it works with Metro PCS. You just have to call and say that you got a new phone that is confirmed to work on their service and provide them the information they request.

Phone worked great for about five months then intermittently doesn't allow incoming calls to come through. Completely random. Incoming calls at different times from different phones randomly go directly to voicemail (I'm told). These calls don't even register on my call log. Also if my phone's been inactive for a bit and I make a call or send a text all of a sudden I'll get a bunch of texts pop up all at once. Trying to figure out how the warranty works. Very disappointed.

I am SO GLAD I bought this phone. I love everything about it! The storage is great, the photo quality is amazing, the fingerprint scanner works wonderfully. The only teensy tiny problem is how small the notification light is, I hardly notice it.
I haven't updated it because a past review said it messed up their phone, so I'm avoiding it.

Plug and play phone that was easy to setup and switch. I was a loyal Samsung user but with the price of an average smartphone, I was ready to veer off the path and I couldn't be happier for $200. The phone feels like it's of quality materials, has excellent battery life, and connects seamlessly to Bluetooth devices. I wouldn't recommend this phone to a data junkie or someone who loves taking pictures, as the camera of my Galaxy s4 was better than this one and the internal storage isn't the best but it does have an micro SD card slot, so at least the storage can be remedied. Overall a great buy. I've been using without a hitch for over 2weeksðððª

I like the phone a lot. I'm coming from an apple phone and I'm impressed. This they mid-range phone and it do so much more than the x. I got me a 256 gb memory card for the joint and I can put all my pirated music on it. No more apple music payments. And you can lock your apps for your girl won't be all in the joint . Facial recognition. Good camera And I made some good movies with it already. Umm I'm sticking Huawei from nown on. Bluetooth stay connected as well

this is an amazing phone. I used this phone for 6 months and loved it. it did everything my Samsung Note 5 did for the most part. I did have some issues when it came to missing APs on google play store but that could have been the version of android installed on the phone. The battery life is great. I could go all day at work with out needing a charge. The phone worked for UBER and Lyft while playing music.

The only thing that was not great on the phone was the camera quality but I watched dozens of reviews and knew it wasn't the best coming in.

So the GPS on this thing is horrendous, it seems to only take readings around every half a minute or so, and it won't work for Pokemon Go or Google maps navigation. Other than that it is a near perfect phone, especially considering the price. I went to hihonor.com and talked to a honor representative about my GPS problem, but they just told me to factory reset my phone and It didn't fix my problem.
I needed a backup phone and have previously used other brands that were much more expensive. For the money this phone does an exceptionally good job. I was expecting much less and got so much more.

Very cheap, very high quality. Nifty fingerprint sensor is far more convenient than normal passwords. The only catch is that the company that makes these phones is famous for spying on it's customers, to the point that the DOD bans the sale of these phones on government property.

Of course, I'm sure Google does more spying than whatever it is the chinese manufacturer does (after all, it is in china that google is testing all of the latest and greatest consumer spying, censoring, and manipulation methods), but if privacy is a concern, don't buy this phone.

Other than that, very great phone for very cheap.

Love this phone. I will never buy a 1000 dollar phone again and get locked into 2 year contracts. Screen resolution is beautiful. It takes high quality pictures which makes it stand out from other phones in this price range. looks, feel and acts like a much more expensive phone. Was super easy to set up on my AT&T account. Set up in seconds.

Great phone, extremely happy with it. Snappy performance for a "so called" budget phone that is borderline flagship quality.

Camera takes amazing picture.

Build quality is superb. It has some weight to it, you actually know when you are holding it in your hand.

Compared to previous phones I have had in the past, this is the best one by far (Note 2, OnePlus One, Moto X Pure, Zenphone 3 Max).

This phone still has a headphone jack, which nowadays is considered a premium feature IMHO. The sound quality from listening with headphones is amazing.

The lack of NFC shouldn't steer you away since NFC payments aren't status quo yet.

Definitely getting the most bang for my buck. Bought a second one for my Daughter

I have ordered this phone and it is arrived on time. Before this, I have order Moto 4, but that phone was heating up after and not to easy to hold. Honor 7X is one of the best phone without any heating issue. Features are good, Camera is wonderful for average use. Very good processor for playing games. Overall the product is good.

I bought this phone for travel purposes. I travel a lot for work and don't feel comfortable going everywhere with my iPhone. So, I take this with me. You can put in 2 sim cards or 1 sim and an SD. It takes calls, pictures, you can load music on the 32Gb and one very nice feature is the clone one that's on the phone. Lets you activate two WhatsApp, Messenger and so on at the same time without having to download an app from the PlayStore.
Overall best $200 phone I've ever had.

Best feature: This phone is a bargain at this price point. Lots of the same or similar features as the Google Pixel 2 that cost 3 to 4 times what I paid for this. I'm very satisfied with the quality and appearance of this device and will definitely buy an upgrade Huawei next year.

Worst feature: After two weeks of normal use, my biggest complaint is that I've had to restart the device twice because it locked up. Not a deal breaker by any means.

This has been an awesome phone until 9 months after I bought it. It still works fine, but for some reason a blue splotch has appeared in the middle of the screen. Getting a hold of Huawei has been a chore, and I have been unable to locate their US service center (if one exists). Next time I stick with either LG or Motorola, as both have been the most durable phones I have owned
Love this phone defiantly great phone and great purchase will recommend it for anyone

I've had the phone for almost a week and a half. It should be said my uses and needs are basic; I only use it to browse, read, watch YouTube, and other basic stuff.

PROS
- Screen ratio is really good I like it alot. Splendid for reading and writing even. Split screen is awesome too.
- Battery lasts about two days with casual use.
- Price is of course unbeatable for a new smartphone that works well.
- Overall UI is alright
-32gb storage

CONS
-Only 2.4ghz wifi. Not deal breaker but would be nice
-I have had it glitch out once or twice, where no apps work properly for a period but that could be an app problem. It corrected itself soon enough.
- Takes forever to charge. Almost 2 hours from low battery if I remember correctly.
- Bluetooth has glitched off a few times.
- GSM only.

These are all the pros and cons I can think of in my case. I'm not a heavy user though.

Overall, even with the cons I'm happy with the phone. I'll have to update this post with how it's held up in a few weeks.

I purchased this for my high school son to replace his old Tracfone cell phone. It is easy to transfer from old tracfone device to this honor 7x as long as the new sim card is inserted into it. The phone number and minutes left in the old phone are kept. After about 2 weeks usage, my son like it very much and feel pretty good on the camera, finger print unlock feature and sort of Apps provided by the manufacturer.

I've lived with this phone for seven months. I bought it to replace my Galaxy s8. It is honestly an alright phone. I've only recently noticed slowdowns and weird random glitchyness. This phone just really doesn't compare to any of the previous Samsung phones i've used and for the price I really wish it had more to offer.

Save yourself some money and go for a Samsung or an Apple.

This phone is generally a good phone. If I never took pictures I'd love it, especially for the price. However, I am a mom and my main use of my phone is taking pictures of my kid (at least it feels that way! Haha). I've definitely noticed a huge difference in the quality of photos compared to my last phone, a Nexus 5x. I plan to find another phone with a better camera and pass this one to my husband who uses his phone mainly to play games.

I am loving this phone, I did months and months of research on what phone to get and I started at the s9+, for the dual cameras but eventually I found this, a great phablet with dual cameras that blow the doors off 500$ flagships. In the end what got me hooked was the amazing battery life, big screen and dual cameras. And honestly, you can't go wrong for a phone of this price (especially when upgrading from a galaxy s4)

I don't know how long it will survive, but the phone is perfect. when you watch video in this phone the quality is not so high. But for this price it is very nice phone. I order one for my mom, and I will order one more for my dad)

I'm loving this phone so far. I came from the nightmare that is BLU, and Huawei is leagues ahead (which is interesting when remembering that BLU rips off Huawei phones...). Anyway, it takes some getting used to the new UI, but that is true of all non-pure Android phones. The phone has a snappy response, takes decent photos, and simply *works*. I play a lot of phone games, and it holds up well with that demand.

It's great! If you want to spend 800+ $ for the phone that's completely fine. Camera is great however if you want to take action shots ie games your doggie running you want get it obviously. But for the money you save you can actually get a decent camera for that. As far as apps, emei etc. Hey I got this phone to replace my Nexus 5. Yes I keep it for almost 5 years. I am more than satisfied. It is an amazing phone. I compared moto5x in any review I could and couldn't be happier to choose Honor7x. I hope that Amazon will continue to carry Huawei products unlike what Best Buy did. Price/features ratio 20/10.

It's the best phone you can get for $200. The aluminum build is awesome but if your going to get the blue one because you think it looks good I would reconsider the black color. The blue isn't bad and my friends are always asking me about it but I think the black would have been a good too. The camera is actually really good if your patient with your shot, none of these photos are edited in any way because I know some people will try to make that point. I come from an iPhone 6s plus so I definitely recommend this if you want an Android device that can do just about anything you ask it to do.

So far so good. It's not water resistant and I know the Moto G6 is supposed to be better, but for the prime day price of 169, I had to go with this. It even came with a clear case! If its' still running in 1 year, I'll bump this to a 5. If it doesn't, I'll drop it to a 3.

I'm from the USA and am currently going through family mobile. I have no issues with my service. Setting it up was a pain but that was on family mobile'side. If you are already a family mobile user than I would recommend purchasing a byop Sim card online while you wait for the phone to be delivered as they are $1 compared to the $55 you are forced to purchase in the store (comes with one month of service but still charging you $25 for the sim) other than that, I absolutely love this phone and will be purchasing another for my fiance.

Good size phone, feels well made. Awesome battery life. Good looking screen. I've had the phone for less than a year and there are some problems too. It used to randomly think I was in Chicago several times a day, changing the phone time and causing me to miss some alarms. It won't recognize an external microscope plugged in to the USB port where every other phone I've tried works fine. Tried it in Google cardboard glasses and was unusable. The position tracking was all over the place. Screen brightness is usually all the way at the bottom and if I slide it up the tiniest bit, the screen gets super bright right away. None of this is enough to get me to buy another phone. For the around $200 I payed, it is certainly a usable phone if I get a years use out of it. I guess I was spoiled with $600+ Samsung phones before.

Great Phone
-Nice display!
-Great software!
-Clean!
-Comes with case!
-Low price!
-Good performance!

Suggestion
-Add full glass protector
-improve cpu speed

The gps never works, data speed is extremely slow, and I havenât even install much apps yet the phone was already slowing down like crazy, even the phone says I have 1GB of ram left it still lag like crazy and barely could switch between apps

The phone is ultra sleek and the blue is beautiful. The finger print scanner is pretty accurate and it does have some nice features, but reception is really poor. I would blame it on the network but others don't seem to have the same issue with other phones.

Bought this phone cause I had the older honor and enjoyed it and liked the upgrade on the speed and picture quality on this phone and came with a U.S. warranty. Got the phone loved the look and the beautiful pictures only down side was when you zoomed to far it got blocky but not a bad deal for a 200.00 dollar phone. The issue was after 2 weeks the phone started having issues not receiving texts or calls, then screen started fading and wifi as well as my 4LTE stopped working. Got no help from the customer service no replacement even tho it was warrantied. So I had to spend another 200 dollars with in two weeks for a new phone. Very let down on honor.

This is a decent phone for less than a fortune. Sound quality is fairly good; photo/camera quality could stand to improve which was surprising to me.

I also miss having the option to set specific ringtones AND text sounds to each contact like with the Samsung Galaxy; but no biggie.

I'll update once I've had the thing longer than 4 hours

Was anxious to get delivery on this phone, and was not disappointed when I received it today. Absolutely awesome. I got the blue one, and it is beautiful. Feels like my son's very expensive iPhone. The finger scan instantly unlocks. Watched some Amazon prime today. Big bright screen and speaker is great, too. I used the Huawei phone clone app, and it worked flawlessly transferring everything from my old Samsung S4. This feels like a huge upgrade, as you can imagine. No need to hesitate on this $200 phone. Will try to update after a few weeks.

I had the two previous versions of this phone and I love this one the best.
It's fast, nice screen.
The best feature of this phone for me is the battery life. At the end of they day I normally have 50% to 74% battery life.
If I break this phone, I'd buy it again (or it's upgrade) I use it with an AT&T sim I got from straighttalk.

I have an Hornor 6x that is a real good phone. But there were a couple of things that I didn't care for. Those problems were solved with the 7x. For $200 it is a steal. I've only had the phone for a day but I see and expect good things from this phone.

This was purchased for one of my family, several others have this same cell phone -- all of them LOVE it. It is very easy to use, takes really clear pictures, functions well, fits easy into the holster-type cover. Great phone!

Excellent, excellent phone for the price. I have friends who are locked into contracts who tell me they wish they weren't because this phone has changed their mind about unlocked GSM phones. If you use Straight Talk like I do, this is a great phone to have. Highly recommended.

An unauthorized update essentially broke my phone for my purposes. Inexcusable. CS refused to fix it. Also, a small drop that would have been fine with any other phone shattered the screen. Avoid this company.

I have always purchased cellphone brands that were less popular. I bought BLU phones for 5 years. I ran across this phone and gave it a chance based on the awesome specs. I bought an at&t byop kit for straight talk and it worked immediately. Awesome phone. Easy to use. Beautiful in every way. I'm glad I went with this one....

Works amazing for the price! Can't get anything better than this for the price. The huawei mate se is the exact same thing but has 64gb internal memory and 4gb ram if you perfer that for 250$ and the huawei y9 is 230$ and has dual rear and dual front cameras with 4000mah battery so if you want a better camera and battery go for that one but other than that its almost identical to the honor 7x and the mate se. I was happy with the specs and price on the honor 7x so i chose this one and so far it's worked really good.

High resolution and fairly snappy speeds. It feels substantial with the metal case. The software for the camera makes it more useful and the picture quality is good with the proper lighting. Sound is only adequate from the one speaker. Call quality is ok. Sometimes the GPS loses contact with the satellite during navigation. The phone is good for 160 dollars. It would be great for 100.

Great battery life so far and tons of features. Fingerprint scanner is quick and the overall performance is snappy.

Two big things it's lacking are a Type C port and AC Wifi but for $200 I'm not going to complain.

Very satisfied so far, have had for a couple of weeks now & can't believe how good this phone is! Don't think I'll ever go back to paying those outrageous prices for another brand again. Went to Best buy & was browsing when a worker there told me he had this brand & loved it, I'll pass it along!

So far I have used this phone for two weeks straight, the battery holds up good from a full charge in the morning 5am to 2pm without charging and at full performance. Have upgraded the software to Android 8 and it still runs smoothly, I had one hiccup when I just got it but not since the update. The camera is great with great quality detail. Each shot is captured nicely. I can do plenty with this phone if the internet works with me, split screen and various other functions that I am discovering everyday.

I just purchased this, and it's a great phone so far. First off, the battery is fantastic. It charges really fast and lasts all day long. The screen is bright and has a quality picture. There's tons of storage space. Honestly, I don't know what more to say, other than I just love it so far. Of course, we'll see how it does in the long term, but so far, it's a great phone. Especially for the price!

Good deal for a budget phone.. seems to lag behind when mutli tasking.. ok camera quality, though the camera response time is laggy at times. Ok for video playback..1080p ac3 is poor. Recommend no more than 720p videos.

Great phone for 200 bucks l. Anyone who says it sucks cause they cracked it is a wast of time. I cracked mine because i was being ignorent so buy a case. So far i love this phone i had an HTC one M8. This phone is good for gameing and almost never lags . It's comparable to the phone 7s and the Samsung Galaxy S8

Pros:
From the software features, of which there are many (go look up videos of things you can do with this phone!), to the beautiful screen, and the lightning fast fingerprint scanner, this phone is the best bang for your buck on the market. It's durable, I've dropped it and had no issues, the aluminium back was scratched, but not very much, and that's to be expected.

Cons:
Low light environments do not fare well with the phone's camera, however at this price point you can only get so much camera wise. There isn't as much RAM as one would like, the processing power isn't particularly incredible, and not having USB-C is a bit annoying, but once again, you can only get so much at this price point.

Overall: I will tentatively say that it is currently the best phone on the market for $200 or less.

I bought this phone in March of 2018. I haven't even owned it a year. The battery is swelling and it's disfigured the whole phone. The screen is slowly popping out and there's discoloration on the screen from the pressure. Apparently this is an early warning sign that the battery's getting ready to explode. The battery cannot be removed or replaced on this phone, of course, so the whole phone is now useless. The cause of this is a battery with cheap, sub-standard materials in it. And that's apparently what this phone uses. Buyer beware.

Wow, what a decent phone for 200 monies.
Picture? CRYSTAL

Performance? SUPERCAR

Storage? EXPANDABLE BABY! but decent.

Camera? NOT AT NIGHT! Also decent though.

Battery? AVERAGE AT BEST! but not terrible.

Sound? WHO NEEDS GOOD SPEAKERS? The 7x apparently.

But I am a happy boy with a shiny toy.

Muy bueno el telÃ©fono, era para regalarlo y lo Ãºnico que me hizo fue que no me guardo los contactos pero despuÃ©s muy muy bueno el telÃ©fono, resuelve, tiene buena cÃ¡mara y es econÃ³mico en comparaciÃ³n a como lo venden en mi paÃ­s.

I have dropped twice today. No scratch or dent on the steal body. Screen still looks brand new. Phone is mostly water proof except phone speaker. Don't submerge it on purpose. great for people who sweat and ruin their phones. This phone is just as good as Samsung and iPhone. I've had both. I feel ripped off by both companies. Buy this phone you will not regret it !!!

Iâve just returned from a trip to Europe and Africa and used the phone as my travel phone. It worked as advertised and I am glad I got it. Iâve owned an iPhone for several years and my experience with this phone and android was pretty good. Highly recommend it especially for the price, quality, and functionality.

Considering its price (I paid $180) this is an exceptional phone. The camera is above average, obviously not a good as the higher end cameras on newer Samsungs and iPhones but for my purposes, good enough. Workmanship is phenomenal. An included app made it a breeze copying apps and settings from my older (also android) phone. Highly recommended.

Itâs an impressive device for $200. But for some people, paying more to get a better phone still makes sense. Also, no 5GHz Wi-Fi and no NFC are two big bummers. I wouldâve liked to see USB-C, but Honor has to reach their price, so oh well. Overall solid for $200.
A truly beautiful phone, and a budget one too, a very high class phone . And no one will know. Buy you will not regret, oh, I got my 8.0 Oreo download a week laterð

This was one of the best phones I've gotten myself in the recent years, so good in fact someone thought they have it, not me. I am a college student and its ability for dual application use and its super fast speed really saved me (and my GPA) more than once. I would recommend this for anyone who needs top of the line but is also on a budget. The only thing I would warn people with is to keep it close to you, and always check your pockets. I plan to order a new one in the near future.

Honor phones are not just hype. Got this for my Mom to replace her samsung S7 and she is very happy with the switch. Great larger screen battery life is way better and she can still use her old 128gb memory card. And its running andriod 8 oreo such a great deal.

Fast smartphone but ended up returning. I do not understand how this is recommended as one of the best budget camera phones and it has such a high megapixel count but it looks very poor. The only thing it provides is more saturated photos but the quality is not really good at all. Fast though
My son is very happy with this phone. It replaced his note 8 that he broke and I refused to let him spend that kind of money again. He says it does everything his note did it's just not as big.

I previously had an old android phone that served my purpose.
I felt it was ready to die on me so my Grandson who is 15
did some research and felt this would be a good phone for me.
I absolutely love it!! Did not know what I was missing. It has good
reviews and I am glad I took my Grandsons advise. Easy to use
and if beautiful. Lots of tutorials on YouTube if you need some
help figuring things out and lots of tips and shortcuts.. Awesome phone.

Was a sweet pickup until it started having problems after two months. I bought and received the Honor7x in Feb, and writing this review in mid April. I was thinking of writing the review after using it for three months, but it's suddenly been problem after problem. First month went by fine. I enjoyed the camera and it ran fairly smooth. Fingerprint sensor is really quick.. Now for the cons; calls don't last more than 15 minutes before it disconnects and I have to recall. It wasn't a big problem, but now calls won't last a minute. I've been experiencing some strange stutter when switching between basic apps. My phone has also randomly crashed about 4-5 times and just rebooted by itself. Sadly, this is all within only two months. Who knows what else will random start malfunctioning. Nice phone in specs, but save your money and perhaps look elsewhere.

Wanted a good sized screen & performance . It has exceeded my expectations. A quality product made for a higher range. Thank you for the speedy delivery. I have been putting my 7x through the paces and happy with results.

Beautiful and powerful, this device is so friendly and easy to use, I have using it for a couple of days without problems or lags, the performance is superior and the quality is unbearable like they say. I'm a happy owner of this Honor 7 x

I don't know how to start my review on this. Because im so happy after receiving this phone. It's so stunning and cool and really easy to use. The battery backup is going well than other android device I used before. 100% of charging easily goes long for whole day. Even i used it heavily gps, music and apps. Its a well valued phone and amazon.com delivery is amazing always on time. And i want to advice the packing department of Amazon warehouse please use some bubble wrap or plastic bags with the product. Don't throw the only item in the box. I know you guys worried about your rates but please think about customers item not to be damaged in that way. Rate only 4star because of packing not well done...

I really like this phone. There are many cool features that don't come with other phones at this price point. There are a few quirks that are keeping me from giving 5 stars. I'm slightly tech savvy and I don't mind the quirks but I wouldn't recommend this phone to a person that isn't tech savvy.

Got the phone. Surprising me a lot. Only 200 dollars. But works axcelant for me. Texting is good. Searching Google is good. Everything is good enough for me. That is all the review for those 5 days I use.

One of my favorite phones I have ever owned... at a fraction of the price. Very well built. Fast. Great screen. Very good (not fantastic) camera.
Updated to Oreo without issues. I miss the lack of NFC. I miss USB C. But WOW! I will definitely buy the next version of this phone. Warning for smaller hands: it is 3 inches wide. You may not find that very handy....

Upon receipt, phone shape not as attractive as in photos. I also never expected it to be so big - a bit cumbersome. Someone else bought another Huawei just before mine and both surfaces crack after just one fall. I've owned other brands before and they were more durable.
After buying this phone I think I'm done with Samsung for good!!

The phone looks great and is easy to navigate, but everything is super glitchy. I've not yet had it for a year and there are a ton of issues. It won't scroll up when I'm trying to see back in a text, you can't archive texts, no visual voicemail works, my GPS is failing/not accurate... I could go on and on. Not sure why this is happening. About to start looking for a new phone.

I've had this phone for about 8 months at this point. Overall I'm pretty happy and it works well. I'm quite disappointed with the camera specifically. It performs poorly in moderate to low light (smudgy, pastel-looking pictures) and I have essentially stopped taking pictures of my 18 month old child with it, whereas my prior phone (Google Nexus 5x) performed without complaint in the same scenarios. Pictures look okay outdoors or in well lit areas. But for a budget phone or a bridge to tide you over if you don't want to splurge on a nicer model for another couple years, this one will work pretty well overall.

Loving this phone. I bought this one after my iPhone start glitching and was informed it was about to completely die on me. I think it was a financially wise decision... Honor for $200 vs iPhone for $700-$1000. INSTANT SAVINGS!

I am normally an LG person, but this phone really took me. I was surprised with the amount of available settings and customisation of the phone. Phone calls are great, SMS works well, 4G datab no complaints here and definitely the best phone I've had yet.

Mine freezes from time to time but I run alot of big apps at the same time and I understand this is a budget phone. It looks and feels good and is very well built and its features always work. The camera is brings up alot of red but besides that it's amazing.

Honestly, I can't believe how cheap this phone is. It is really good for the price. Is it not as fast or lacks certain features of the $1000 flagship phone on the market today? Yes, of course it does. However, in my opinion, those features do not equal the price differential between this and a flagship.

I got this phone a month ago as I switched from my old Samsung phone to this and it went through easy, the phone still works fast but at times it can slow down if you have a lot of apps in the background, but not much of a worry. The camera is very great has a lot of features on it making it useful for taking photos. The screen is very good, lots of color on it. It's battery lasts for about 14 hours on heavy usage for me which is pretty good. Over all I haven't found any other issues or anything I didn't like so I really would recommend this phone.

I bought this phone on Amazon and have been using it for 2 weeks. It looks premium and shockingly beautiful for a $200 phone. All the apps run smoothly and fast especially browsing the net, watching youtube video and playing games. Bottom line is I'd recommend this phone for those who looks for a decent budget phone instead of wasting money on the overpriced high-end phone.

This phone looks nice on the outside but does not have a quality build. After having the phone for 5 months the phone all of the sudden started to display white vertical lines on the display. So I opened a case with Huawei and sent the phone to get repaired since it was still under warranty. Once they received the phone they then told me the phone is showing liquid damage (which was not the case) and wouldn't fix the phone. Don't know how the so called liquid damage would case straight vertical lines to show on the display but obviously didn't want to repair the phone. I guess that is what to expect for a $199 phone made in China. So buyer beware !!!!!

Perfectly living up to it's billing and the descriptions that got my attention.
Not an expensive option, but gets done, a reasonable level of work that a mobile phone should do.

Price is great, phone is great, been using it for over a year now, my wife and I both have one and no issues other than the slight curve to the screen which doesn't allow for glass screen protectors so don't get one, the silicone ones are the only ones that work

I love this phone in every way but one. There is no way to set a custom sound for applications that use the new notification management in the OS. This restriction is VERY annoying. I can only set one sound for all applications, and no customization for messages, emails, contacts, etc.
Honor / Huwai has not responded to any of the messages I've googled for to answer why they took this out of the OS. Android stock version allows different sounds by each app and even in messages by each contact.

I have been using the honor 7x for a month now and there haven't been any problems. The phone is reliable and fast given its price. For around 200 USD, the phone has many useful features and the battery can last up to around a day on normal use. However, I've found that the phone doesn't run stock Android (like google) but uses EMUI, which is a software with some skins layering android. Nonetheless, the honor 7x has been a breeze to use and I hope it improves in the future.

Good:
-18:9 ratio
-Screen (good viewing angle, resolution, size)
-Built quality
-Looks (have gotten compliment)
-Enough storage and RAM
-Battery life (tend to use it in battery saving mode and lasts me the day and sometimes more)

Bad:
-Perhaps the EMUI skin
-Bought the phone with the intention of unlocking bootloader but they stopped providing key (disappointed but not enough to detract from phone's overall quality)

Average:
-Speakers
-micro-USB

I just think it can work for call and wechat is enough to my dad. Is very good phone with a very cheap price ever , and prime day has discount . But is too late for me. Anyway my dad loves this phone, deserve to have one.

This is the second Honor phone I've purchased. This is one fantastic phone for a very low price. The camera is amazing and the best I've ever seen on a smartphone. I use this phone on a net10 network and have used it on ATT and others. It is a true charmer. Well worth every penny and will be my go to again!

Purchased this some months ago and I REGRET too many problems the sound sucked and picture quality only kept it because i really needed a phone so I delt with it but its now to the point where it gets extremely hot and screen goes blank I haven't dropped it or no water damage spent $20 on a very great protective phone case so its the phone

My wife's Huwaei died and would not hold a charge , Needed a replacement phone I reviewed all the phones available and for the price and specs this was the best available phone. Ordered it and once received set it up with our T-Mobile account. Works well and suits my Wife;s needs. Excellent product

When Honor released the 7X I was all over it since day 1. After owning the 6X I figured the 7X would be worth the upgrade. For $200 you are getting plenty bang for your buck. The blue color is nice, the screen is nice and the camera is okay. But having owned it since February there are some downfalls. Honor still hasn't fixed the auto brightness bug, the touch screen responsiveness is still a bit wonky at times, and the battery is starting to drain pretty quick. On top of these issues, the rattling sound from the camera made me think I had a defective device but it seems to be just the phone itself. I will admit that the 7X does take pretty nice pictures. The phone gets pretty hot quickly during normal usage and the battery drains fast. I never had that issue with the 6X. The lack of cases available for the 7x is also another downfall for me. I just wouldn't consider this device a major upgrade from the 6X. If you have a 6X, hold off until the 8X comes out. If you need a phone, look for another option or wait until the 8X comes out, which should be soon in the US actually!

I was skeptical, as always. I wanted an iPhone but couldn't afford it. I thought this was going to be a phone wthat would give me problems or something else. But this phone is amazing, fast, sharp, the picture quality when watching things and playing movies is amazing . I highly recommend this phone , you will not regret it.

Phone runs smooth so far. The only downside is the single antenna making it near impossible to use bluetooth and wifi at the same time. I did have a pretty frustrating experience when I first turned it on and connected it to wifi. After about 5 minutes it kicked me off, and everytime I tried to reconnect to wifi, it showed "Denied access to network". I tried forgetting and reconnecting, power cycling the phone and router, and making sure there weren't any MAC filters preventing connection. I finally resolved the issue by updating the phone's software which took 8 hours of using purely data. Since the update went through, the wifi is working perfectly.

The device is working well. I choose to stay with this brand of cellphones since my last Honor ( 6x) worked so well. I had the 6X for 3 years and only towards the end did it start giving me a little trouble (flickering of the screen.). I bought the Honor 7X hoping that this new device works as well for me and most importantly, it last a few years. Can't wait for the Honor 8X

so far so good. takes a bit get use to like most new toys. but strait away. the screen top area is tooo small and annoying. maybe I will find away to make it bigger? but over all fast. feels real classy to. its slimmer than the picture shows it as. so better in person. good weight to it. doesnt feel like gonna snap strait away. LOL

Decent phone for the price, but don't expect it to work like a Samsung flagship phone.
Pros: Nice big screen, screen brightness works well in Bright Florida Sunlight.
Cons: Slow response occasionally, you can feel the lag after pressing a key. Even crashing sometimes ending in restarting the phone.

I bought this phone in mid July and it's probably been the best phone I've ever had! After 4 months it doesn't look like it's showing any signs of wear or slowing down! The picture quality on the back camera is amazing, but the front camera definitely has some room for improvement... The only other problem I can think of is that I can't seem to transfer apps from the device to my SD card, but it isn't too much trouble since the phone has a pot of space on it.

I Love it, I'm an iPhone owner and order this phone for my business and WOW for $199 you can have this type of device WOW. Big screen, fast phone, excellent camera, the resolution on the screen is amazing. If you don't want to spend a lot of money on a phone but want a NICE phone get this one! Did I mention it comes with a free case???

Fantastically camera, good battery life, good gaming graphics, fast and accurate fingerprint scanner. Huawei did it again with this phone: My wife has the 6x that was current when purchased and has also had a fantastic experience, I would expect as much from the 8x that has since been released.

I was coming from a OnePlus 3T which is already a couple years old now. So I thought this device would be at least as fast as the 3T if not faster. But it was really slow performance wise. Another problem was the amount of time it took to charge since it does not come with fast charging. I believe there would be much better phones around the $300 mark. Returned the device after using it for a month.

I have used a different brand for the last 12+ years. Changing carriers so decided to change phone brands - I could not be happier. A colleague had one and really likes it. Bought mine and two others I know also bought them. A great phone for a great price

I bought this phone for my son. It was damaged when it was left by the door. The speaker was damaged, the screen had small crack. I wanted an exchange but was refunded and i bought this phone again. But my son said it was good for what he needed. Very nice phone.

Im very happy with this phone. It keeps up with constant use and maintains a strong battery after not putting a full charge for days on end. I wish there was a more manual option for picture taking but it still takes some great photos.

I have the Honor 7x for a couple months and I like it. It has all features that much more expense ones have (dual camera, dual sim, finger/face recognition login, etc). Unlike my old phone, there are no finger prints on the screen so it always looks clean. The reason I only give it 3 stars is because panorama photos are blurring under low light. I can only take sharp panorama photos under bright day light. Anyone has this issue?

Up until now I have been a Motorola fan (Have had two versions of the Moto X), but when my last one broke, I needed to spend a bit less money. This phone is great! It is faster than my Moto (bigger RAM). The camera is not quite as high of quality, but it's not the end of the world. It's still really good compared to a lot of other "cheaper" smartphones (my husband's cheaper phone's camera is much lower quality).
I love that it has soo many apps so no worries about downloading them. Soo much to do on here, never a dull moment with this phone

I am an avid Android user now. (Used to be iOS). It's Feb 2019 and this phone is still holding up to par with other phones on the market. MIUI 8.0 is pretty legit. You don't need an expensive phone for it to be good.

I have had people ask me if this phone was the iPhoneX... With the screen off it's comparable. When the screens on. It's obvious.

4GB RAM + SD Card + Dual-Sim...

Perfect phone.

It is a good phone but it people keep having pb with something or other then it is useless.

I'm holding off on giving this phone a 5 until I get more time with it, as it just arrived today. If you get blue, be aware it's a darker blue than the picture would suggest. It's more of a navy than a bright blue, but that's fine with me. I haven't tested the wifi as of yet, so I can't verify any claims about how good/bad it is. Pro's and Con's so far:

Pros:
- Contrary to some things I've been reading, we ordered two of these, one black and one blue, and both are getting 4g service through AT&T, so that hasn't been a problem for us.
- The fingerprint sensor is SUPER snappy so far, by far the fastest way to unlock the phone, and to my pleasant surprise you can register up to 5 fingers in the settings, so multiple people can be given permissions to unlock the phone with that option if you so choose, which is incredibly nice. It's also good to note that out of the box the phone has the option to toggle on and off extra functions for that sensor, which lets you answer calls, pull down the notification menu, etc., which is quite convenient.
-The phone feels well constructed, and the aluminum body makes it feel stout. It's been in my pocket (with thin rigid case and screen protector) through work and I've stopped worrying for the most part about accidentally cracking the screen. The phone is quite rigid and feels durable.
-The camera is great. There's a plethora of features built in with Huawei's software, and it's given me some amazing shots (I'll include at least one with this updated review). It'll take some experimenting to get used to, and it will also take practice to learn what works best when, but overall I'm extremely happy. It won't do 4k or anything that great, but I hardly expected it to.
-For a "cheap" phone the speakers are more than passable. You won't get amazing depth of sound or anything (these are phone speakers, after all) but audio is clear and loud enough for my uses.
- I've yet to get this phone under %50 battery, but I'm not a power user. It's greatest test so far as been as a GPS device for about a 4hr round trip, with the screen on about 3/4 of that time along with my normal light use. Heavy users will likely have more problems with it, but if you manage how many things you have going on in the background it's not a problem.
-I cannot complain at all about screen quality here. If anything I'm thoroughly impressed. Colors are true, lines are crisp, and it responds to touch without issue. It looks beautiful.

Cons:
-The first minor thing is that if you're ordering it for AT&T you might need to mess with some APN settings when you first set it up. It's an inconvenience but nothing serious that other phones don't also have to deal with.
-I do have one mildly irritating issue with headphone audio, which honestly is barely worth mentioning. I think it's due to the phone turning off power to audio devices to conserve battery life, but when I have headphones in (and only then), a second or two after audio is stopped there's a squeak or pop. It's the same noise you would hear plugging headphones into the headphone jack or wiggling the wire on a dying pair of headphones to get it to reconnect and play sound. It's slightly irritating, but not enough to dampen my enjoyment of this phone.
-Some will consider this a Con, but I don't mind it personally. As of now this phone is still running Android 7.0 Nougat, without an option to upgrade to the newest Oreo software. This is supposed to change, however I haven't found a solid date on when the update will roll out to this device.
- The phone does not support USB type C. This doesn't bother me in the least, but some people prefer it for various (legitimate) reasons.

Overall, this is an amazing device for the cost, and I can't recommend it enough. It doesn't help that I'm still getting a kick out of showing it to people and seeing the look of shocked disbelief on their faces when I inform them that this sleek, snappy device is a Huawei, which in my area has a reputation for being the bad end of cheap. Holding it up to a friend's Samsung Galaxy Note 8, it's nearly identical in size, and in brief comparison seemed just as high quality, and it's a surprise to people that it's not a flagship phone.

Been awaiting delivery of the Honor 7x for a couple weeks now. Just for comparison sake, I owned a OnePlus 3T prior to picking up this phone. The OnePlus was slowing down quite a bit, so I sold it and took a portion of the proceeds and gave the Honor 7x a try. I owned the Honor 5x a few years ago, and had a decent experience with it.

Like I said, so far, so great. I'm only 6 hours into the experience, but I can say that this is one impressive phone for the price. I did quite a bit of homework before purchasing and was between a few devices, but this was the only one under $300 that I was considering. The screen ratio is one of the best aspects of the phone. The build is solid and the software layer is pretty usable. I haven't yet needed to go to Nova. If you put this in front of anyone with a bit of knowledge about the landscape of phones out there, I would bet they would guess that this phone is priced between $300-$400.

Will update after a week of use. Don't hesitate...buy, buy, buy!

Also, there are dropouts in the signal when I use the Bluetooth connection to my car's stereo, more dropouts than usual with this car and my old phone. Also, if you want near field communication, this phone doesn't have it. Battery life is great.

so far so good, nothing less than my Samsung cellphone. to be honest, it could have a better camera but i already saved enough to get a dslr by going with this over Samsung , so no complain. great lcd, very beautiful design, good battery life , and the finger print password works awesome.way faster than my previous devices.

**Edit**
Recommend going through Honor chat support to get ticket if needed (don't leave message on unattended chat - won't be answered). Turns out hotspot issue was operator error - I used a hotspot name my computer "remembered" so it wouldn't prompt for a password. Once I renamed it, it was fine. However if it had been the phone other than clearing cache, it would have required a reset - or maybe repair.

I think phone on "automatic" makes some pictures outside a little bright and tinny feeling right out of the box. That feels a little unfortunate. I'll update after I have tested more. At least this phone offers some basic settings to play with. The portrait mode doesn't always give me the bokeh effect. Again, more testing needed. I wasn't expecting professional but for novice was hoping for a little better point and shoot good results.

**Original**
So far, putting it through it's paces, I'm really happy. But I'm stepping up from $100 phones, with the last one still being on Android 5.5, so any comparison is relative. I had a great experience with Ting, including a free sim card when I asked them some presale questions, and the phone activated without any issues.

A clear flexible case for the back does come with it which was a bonus. The blue is a pretty color, wouldn't want to cover it up. Missed having gorilla glass from my Moto G a couple years back. So, pleased it is one of the phone features. Overall it's not too bulky for its size, retains the earbud plugin port, has a nice clear display, seems responsive and I liked the pictures I've taken so far. Nice options all the way around in this Android version 8.0 Oreo. Fast charging seems to work as expected with the included cord. Fingerprint scanner works great. Calls were clear both ways.

Have had a few glitches worth mentioning:
- does not support wifi calling (Ting does, so it's the phone)
- when I set it up as a hotspot, even though I created password and the icon on other devices saw it as locked - they were not challenged with a password request (have sent a message to support, so we'll see). workaround is to manually allow devices.

I'll come back and edit if I have any further problems, or get an answer to the hotspot issue.

Everything is exceptionally good except the camera, which is still good enough for me since I don't take a lot of photos.

Update: It's been a few months and I still have no objections with this phone other than the camera, but I had worse before.

I value reviews on products I intend to purchase. Typically, I don't do reviews but I felt obligated to do so on this phone. I consider myself to be tech savvy but not a tech snob when it comes to phones. That being said, I know what I'm looking for in a phone and I thought this phone had it. I had been patiently waiting on the Honor View 10 to come out (guess I should've waited a tad bit longer) but decided to bite the bullet and just buy this phone until its release.

THE GOOD:
Beautiful phone- solid build. Love the aluminum body and how it feels in the hand. Love the skins and themes you can download to customize the phone. Transferring all of my apps / accounts / etc from my previous phone was a breeze and only took about an hour or so.

THE BAD:
I'm coming from a ZTE Axon Mini 7 which has given me hell with performance issues. Watch Netflix on the Axon 7 Mini is a lot crisper than this phone (sure it has something to do with LCD vs AMOLED).

THE UGLY:
RAM RAM RAM! Imagine my heartbreak when this phone started to lag not even a week after owning it. Imagine my frustration when I realized there was a Mate SE model with more RAM that was available for $30 more.

Needless to say I am in the process of returning the Honor 7X and purchasing the Mate SE. Totally worth the money in my opinion.

I liked the phone design and it worked fine for about a week of light use. Then the first sign of trouble appeared - screen flashing purple streaks that would not stop until reboot. Invalid MMI code error appeared although there was no connection problem initially.
A few days later screen froze and unit would not boot up.. After factory reset the phone worked for a day and then froze again. From that point on the phone got stuck in boot up screen with no ability to even turn it off. Factory reset stopped working, clearing cache had no effect. HiSuite software was no help since phone settings had to be adjusted every time it was connected via USB, otherwise HiSuite would not detect the phone, even though Windows had no problem seeing it and accessing files on the phone.
Call to Huawei tech support, although pleasant enough, provided no solution other than offer of shipping the phone for repair.
It may be that I was just unlucky and the unit I received was defective, but since I consider reliability to be the most important feature of the cell phone I have to mark it as completely unsatisfactory.

I've had this phone over a week now and like it more each day. I had been attached to my HTC One M9 but it had contracted degenerative terminal battery disease; symptoms include spontaneous power off and battery standby of an hour or less. As the disease ran it's inevitable course I knew I had to replace it. Investigation of possible battery transplant offered little hope. The new HTC U11 was way out of my price range also one thing I really wanted was offline FM radio and because wireless companies prefer that you use data it's frequently only on one-off brands and cheap phones. I kept running across the Huawei honor7x. While there are some scathing reviews, there are some scathing reviews for every phone so the percentage of good reviews must be taken into consideration. The screen quality, camera, battery, processor & GPU, my offline FM radio, and Tricorde-resque plethora of sensors, overall build tells me I've made the right decision. Since receiving it Wednesday I've charged it 3 times. I was charging my HTC 3-6 times per day and even that was insufficient. The complaints in the harsher reviews of the Huawei honor7x frequently indicate "lagging" but they also say it's resolved by a reboot, " only to return again at some point in the future.
So for a $200 phone with premium features, occasionally one may have to turn it off then on again. THE HORROR!!
Others dislike the micro USB vs USB-C. I personally am relieved I don't need to replace my numerous charging cables. Also, complaints about no Qualcomm quick charge.
With light to moderate use, the H7X lasts me 3 days between charges. Also, it's 1/4 the price of a premium phone. If they are going to omit something I'm glad it's that. What else? Oh no wireless charging either. While inductive oscillating charging is kinda neat, it's slow, hard on circuitry due to heat and testy, if your device isn't right on the correct spot it doesn't charge so you just put your phone down for a while, which can be a good thing on its own, but it still needs changing. So again, it's$200, and if you feel that strongly about wireless charging you can buy a kit. Personally I think my $200 phone should go to work for me in the morning so I can sleep, keep me sexually gratified and cook my dinner, but that's not what phones do. Conversely, if you are not willing to spend close to $1000 on a phone there are some things that you are going to have to do without. That being said, the H7X isn't really a compromise, you are getting far more for your money in my book! Thank you Huawei! Excellent phone at an excellent value!

UPDATED REVIEW:

Changing my four star review after a month of solid use to a measly two stars. The original review is below. After a month of use, about half the time the phone locks up. You can have about three or four windows open at a time before things start getting a little unusable. Sometimes it'll happen with just a single window open and sometimes it will happen with NO WINDOWS open. Still, this is not the worse part. The worse part is that the phone and/or apps will become unresponsive without you knowing. Many times, my Nike Run Club has crashed and missed 15-30 minutes worth of my run because it crashed and the phone still showed the app running in the background. I never had the same issue with my Axon 7 or my Galaxy S7. Using GPS to get to a work-site you've never been before? Good luck. Same problem happens.

The sound and video quality remains solid and I still think the phone itself is absolutely BEAUTIFUL.

Although this is nothing against the phone itself, I am unable to find tempered glass that will stay on longer than two weeks which leaves my phone vulnerable to damage at super inconvenient times and forces me to rush order new tempered glass so that I can preserve it as much as I can. It's disappointing that not many manufacturers are manufacturing good quality accessories for this device. Again, nothing against the phone but if you really want to protect it, there's not many good options that will work long enough to be worth it.

I kept thinking to myself, how can a phone this beautiful have such subpar performance on a regular basis? I get overheating phones, or having way too many apps and windows open, or trying to do too much at a single time but this phone can barely handle an email window open, a browser in the background, and a water time app waiting in the background for my water intake. Save yourself some headache and buy something different. I'm going to have to replace it with something that can handle my typical usage, which believe me, is not crazy. I mostly use my phone for work. At most it'll have my work app, my work email, and a browser open. Even then it suffers in performance. If you're a power user or use your phone a lot for everything or just use your phone in moderation, this is a hard pass. If you only ever have one or two apps open at most, and you're okay with your phone locking up at any time for any reason, then you'll probably get by.

ORIGINAL REVIEW:

For $200.00, you can't beat the quality.

Especially when you first setup the phone, the phone will be under a great deal of load. It's a no-brainer since your phone is usually installing all of your apps from your previous phone and the corresponding updates for the system as well. Still, even casual use will lock up the phone. This isn't a huge deal. Close your 4 million apps and try performing the same task again, it should work without issue. That being said, as someone who needs to use this phone for IT work, the lock up can be frustrating sometimes. If you're on a budget and you want a little better performance, plop down the extra $30 and go for the 4GB, 64GB version of this phone found here (trust me, I wish I had done the same but it's not worth the effort just yet):Â Huawei Mate SE Factory Unlocked 5.93" - 4GB/64GB Octa-core Processor| 16MP + 2MP Dual Camera| Grey (US Warranty)

The 5.93" phone screen is AMAZING. I put it right next to my brother's iPhone X, who by the way had been bragging about his new iPhone X for months, and he went quiet before releasing a subtle "wow." When I told him how much money it cost, he shook his head in disbelief. Screen transitions can be customized, you can add 5x6 app tiles, and the stock backgrounds and lock screens are visually pleasing to look at. Sometimes I find myself waking my phone just to remind myself of how awesome the phone really is.

Storage is a bit of a bust. The system takes about half the storage of the phone. If you buy a 32GB, be ready to have about 18GB of storage to actually use. Again, if you're on a budget but you need double the storage, check the link I posted earlier because that is the exact same phone with an extra GB of RAM and an extra 32GB of storage on top of what this phone currently has.

My only regret is that I didn't upgrade for $30 to 4GB RAM and 64GB of storage but you can be assured that once you have this phone, you'll forget what a galaxy or iPhone is, or why they even exist.

I don't usually review but the phone is great for a budget phone, it even has some features that some more expensive phones have! It takes nanosim so be cautious if you have an older phone. All I wish is that it could've came with the Oreo update and some headphones, but besides that it really seems worth it!

After constantly buying crappy metro phones. I had enough and wanted a better phone that'd last me a while. I saw this phone while looking at the Sony Xperia. Phone looked beautiful but the bezel was too big. Then I saw the honor 7x. I drooled at the features this thing had. I watched videos. Read reviews. Even purposely looked at why you shouldn't buy it the reason weren't enough to make me not want to buy. It came 2-3 days than expected and the box itself looks extremely sexy. The way they have the tape at the bottom so you'll know of someone was in it. Then when it came to opening the box it came off like butter and seeing the phone was an instant nut. It was smooth, had a nice weight, and screen. Mmmamamia it was sleek. When turning it on the UI was amazing. It had an iPhone and Android mix. Forget team Android or iPhone, phone had both. Settings it up was a breeze. Downloading apps. Easy. Then I went to settings to turn on all the cool features. I went straight to looking for the option to expand the screen on any app. I tell you what, with this option my phone looks like any iPhone someone would have. You keep the back of the phone down and nobody would know the difference. This phone is more than awesome especially for only $200. All I have to say is to not download too many apps. It will take up all the Ram and it will start to slow down.

Once again the Chinese have done an incredible job of giving flagship phone build quality with upper tier internal components as well as high end features like dual cameras all for 200 dollars. I ended up giving the my 6X to the misses as she really needed an upgrade while I'll preordered this 7X. They improved on the screen size as well as improving build quality and material feel. The slight curve towards the lateral edges of the device give it a pseudo S8 kind of feel in the hand. Side buttons have a good feel and click like a top notch device. The also went with protruding lenses in the back like Apple, possibly do to light restriction on the previous model when a case was used. Huawei also makes it super easy to put everything from your old phone to your new phone with their clone app that even a smart phone novice could do in less than ten minutes. Good job on making the best budget phone out there Huawei. You've got a lifelong American customer here.

At first it was great. An ideal phone for the price. The camera was buggy as hell and took forever to start, but installing a 3rd party app fixed it. Then it would occasionally freeze and hang, but I didn't mind too much. After all, it was $200. THEN this morning, it died with no reason. It worked last night, and this morning I wake up to a dead phone. Just like that. No warning, nothing. There's no smell, the charger works, the cable is fine, it's just dead. Yesterday I got a popup from one of the pre-installed apps saying I could use it to contact their customer support if I ever needed it. I hadn't seen that. How suspicious that it died within 24 hours of that message. How does a phone die right at the 2 month mark? Baloney. This was my second Huawei phone and the other one wasn't great (the battery lasts less than 8 hours only a year after purchase), but was a real budget phone. I won't be getting any more of their junk if this is how it works.

This is a truly unlocked phone. I love it. I got rid of an iPhone for a Samsung Galaxy. It was a good move. Now I got rid of the Galaxy S5 for this Honor 7x. I don't need a cleaner app, or an anti-virus app, or a launcher (because I didn't like the forced home screen, etc) - because these types of apps or functionality come standard in the phone. I can set the grid size of the screens, set how the screens transition, etc.; all the functionality I wanted in Nova Launcher. The response time is fast. The fingerprint access is faster than the Samsung. This is certainly a "flagship killer". I use it with Straight Talk and it works just fine. Even switching my number to the new sim (I was already on ST) was quick and painless to do myself online in my account. I would definitely recommend this phone to my friends and family.

During the 2 months of use, the system kills my alarm app 3 times, and twice of my game (playing). You can do some search up on Google about this "feature" they called "ram management." The feature is good to improve the performance of the phone if executed perfectly; especially for phones with less impressive hardware. Huawei, Xiaomi, Oneplus, Meizu, Lenovo, and Asus are well known for this "feature." Unfortunately, these companies code "so-so" quality software experience. For the first 3-4 weeks I had this phone it was great. I never experienced any hiccups or lag. Call quality was good. I did have some minor bluetooth connectivity issues but it was nothing major. More annoying than a problem. However, the phone bricked itself. I'm not crazy, I promise, and I'm not lying. I had turned off my phone every night since getting it. Last night, it seems to have decided it didn't like that because when I went to turn it on this morning it got stuck on the "Honor Powered by Android" blue screen. I tried holding the power button, holding the power button + the volume up button, nothing. It wouldn't even turn off. So sadly I had to return it and I likely won't be buying a replacement. I understand I'm probably one in a million to have such an issue, but I'd rather not take my chances buying something that turns into a $200 paperweight after a month.

I've had this phone for a little over 2 months and up until this last week I was thrilled with it. The body design is sleek and looks on par with bigger brand phones, and the interface had all the customization I love with androids as well as being user friendly and streamlined like apple products. It was a little glitchy or laggy with some higher memory usage apps like Snapchat and it doesn't do "fast charging" like the bigger brand phones do now, but overall I was over the moon with the performance and design of this phone for the price. However, in the last week when I plug it in to charge I've been noticing it either isn't charging all the way or it seems like the charge has decreased. I thought maybe I was unplugging it without thinking about it and then forgetting to plug it back in. But today it has almost completely stopped charging. I've tried 4 different chargers, including the one it came with, and it does not even acknowledge being plugged in.
I gave it 3 stars because while it took a charge, it was an awesome phone for the price. However, 2 months is a very short phone life. So if you're looking for a high quality-for-the-price phone for a short period of time, this phone would probably be perfect for you. But if you're looking for a phone to last and perform consistently for a long period of time, it's probably best to shell out a little more cash for higher quality.
