I have always used iPhones and bought this just to try out an Android phone. My previous phone was an iPhone 6s. I have been using it for my main phone for a couple of days and I really like it.

Pros:

Screen - The 18:9 screen is big and easy to use. The text is much sharper than on my iPhone (407 ppi vs 326 ppi on my iPhone). The viewing angles are a bit worse than my iPhone, but not by much. The display gets just as bright as my iPhone.

Batery life: It lasts quite a bit longer than my iPhone.

Build quality: The phone feels like it cost way more than $200, however the matte black version is like a fingerprint magnet.

Buttons: The power and volume buttons feel solid and not mushy.

Fingerprint scanner: The fingerprint scanner is so fast and accurate. Opens in less than half a second. Much faster than Touch ID gen 2.

Call quality: The sound from the earpiece is load and clear.

Camera: The secondary 2MP camera for wide aperture mode does not do such a good job at blurring out the background, however the primary sensor can capture very nice images on its own, especially closeups.

Cons:

WiFi and Bluetooth issue: When bluetooth is on Wifi speed drops significantly. This is because they share the same antenna, but I was still able to play 1080p YT videos to a bluetooth speaker, for $200 I can't really complain.

Main Speaker: It lacks mid and bass frequency and can easily be covered. My iPhones speaker was much better.

No 4k recording: This is due to a chipset limitation.

MicoUSB: At least you don't have to buy a bunch of new cables if you have a lot of microUSB cables.

No fast chrging: It charges as fast as my iPhone with the 1 amp charger.

--- After looking at my iPhone after using this, my iPhone just seems so ancient.

Either mine was defective or this has a 10 year old WiFi radio/receiver. I can't stream 480p or lower quality videos more than 10 feet from my router, more than 30 feet from my router websites take 1-2 minutes to load. I have devices hooked up all over my home that have no issues streaming video (Roku, game console, smart TV). I looked online for solutions thinking I have to be doing something wrong. Found a few (disable Bluetooth while streaming, software updates, etc.) but nothing made it better.

The display, which reviews indicated was a high point, is bad. Colors look washed out and muted. It has some sharpness to it, but the colors on my 3 year old Samsung J7 look much more vibrant. I tried messing around with all the display settings to no avail, simply can't make it look as good.

I give it an extra star because the design of the phone is sleek and the OS seemed snappy, but since it couldn't fulfill the basic promise of outperforming my outdated Samsung J7, it's hard to like much of anything.

Frank C (Tue, 5/15/2018, 11:02:18 am)
We been having some issues with the recent updates but It's really helpful when people contact us as soon as you get any new update in order to let us know about any glitches/bugs the update might come with.

Update (4 days later after purchase)
Unfortunately, I had to drop 2 stars after using the phone for 4 days. I started to hit serious lag. It seems like reviews you may find on youtube are reviewing the 4GB/64GB international version, because the US version with the 3GB/32GB is just not on par with the international version.
Why I dropped 2 stars?
- No 5ghz wifi connectivity. This is a serious bummer, since I only connect to the 5ghz frequency on my home wifi, since I had problems with other devices connecting and my wifi router routinely dropping some off the wifi-list,unless it's on the 5ghz freq. This is kinda interesting, since as far as I can remember, even phones from 2014 had ac 5ghz option.
- Extremely slow charging. I just can't get around with this. I can see people charging their phones at night, but there are phones out now with the same $200+ price range that do fast charging. Micro USB is one thing, there are phones that fast-charge with it, but again, we are in 2018.
- No NFC. Granted, there are only a few budget phones with NFC, but we need to look at from the point of view of the year 2018 just began and within a few months, more budget phones are coming out, packed with more features than ever before, even with NFC. Let this be the least of the problems, it's a compromise that most people can live with, if they don't use NFC (not using their phones with Google Play or transfer files etc. )
- Here is the worst. After several days, the phone began to lag. Whether it's from the new update, that popped up during setup, whether it's something to do with lesser memory than most phones or the interface itself, I don't know. I ended up disabling apps to gain some speed back, including disabling amazon apps, navigation apps and the built in Huawei apps. Then it continued. Browsing a webpage is like the scrolling acceleration is disabled or just the lag gets worse. Keep shutting down recently used apps won't help. Rebooting won't help, there is a constant lag while browsing in Chrome and in Facebook, something I don't experience in other budget phones for years now. Hopefully Huawei can address this in future updates, or could be just a few particular models effected, I don't know. It can get very annoying. There is something going on with the memory management, whatever, I am not an expert, but it just ruins the experience.
Speaker is ok, but still very tiny sound. Again, we are talking about a $200 phone, but consider the trade-offs.
In a nutshell, here is what to keep an eye out for when purchasing this phone:
+Nice bright screen, small bezels,
+Good camera for the price
+notification LED (many people prefer it)
+battery lasts a day for most people
+fingerprint reader is lightning fast
+Love/Hate heavy launcher skin over Android OS
---------------------------------------------------------------
- Lag can creep up after a certain amount time, restart needed, apps needs to be disabled, /wait for more updates?/
- Still on Android Nougat, no confirmed date for Oreo update
- Heavy launcher skin over Android OS
- No dual band wifi
-No NFC
-US version : 3GB RAM/32GB of onboard space
-Micro USB
-No fast charging
-No 4K recording capability
-No image stabilization
-tiny single speaker at the bottom
----------------------------------

Past phones: Moto droid, droid x, droid x2 droid razor, S5, V20, Note 5, Note 7, Moto G5, and some other low end phones. Nothing beats the note 7 before it was bricked though.
I am really impressed with the phone for several reasons.
PRO:
The phone construction is great, camera is better than expected for a low level phone (about the same as the S5, but not as good as the Note7 or V20 and better than the others listed above), button feel is perfect, color is as advertised, screen looks good and the brightness level is way better than expected and much brighter than my Moto G4, speaker volume is very loud, but tonaly quality isn't that great but not as bad as others I have had. I really like the overlay of the gui and the options for customization are close to flagship level and equal or better than other big brands I have had. Response time of the processor is good and not a let down, the 3 gig ram seems fine for the phone also. Battery life is great and closely 30% longer lasting than the G4 I still have. The real surprise is the fingerprint sensor and how well it perfectly and instantly recognises several programed fingers. The Note7 was a joke in comparison .

CONS:
What I dislike is the fact the touch screen anywhere around the edges is kinda iffy, not really responsive at all. Using it as a hotspot is worthless as the speed is a joke and not even capable of playing youtube vids at a 240p setting. I still have 2 other working phones for a direct network comparo and this phone just sucks for use as a hotspot. My only SLIGHTLY MINOR COMPLAINT, is that this thing is slippery! lol Good thing they included the slim fitting, great quality cover/case for it. Given the battery life the last complaint is that it isn't a fast charging phone at all, but being that it needs charged less often that other phones I can still get a 12.5hr work day out of it before it dies. I have not charged it for 2 days on my days off, so the battery life is great in general, but having the turbo charge that other phones offer is still lacking on this phone. Again, just a minor con.

Overall:
I really like it and would buy it again if needed, but the lack of it being a hotspot is a big issue for me, as I used my last 2 phones a lot for this as my home wifi blows in some rooms and could use the phone to stream through the pc, smart tv, and the roku with ease for netflix movies. This phone just completely fails in that regard. Because of this I am wanting to give it 3 stars, but as it works so well in all other areas I will gift it an extra star and give it a 4.

I love Honor. I had an Honor5 before and it was great and this one really doesn't dissapoint. Great features & performance for an affordable price. In addition, the chance to carry 2 SIM cards at the same time really comes in handy when you're travelling and you want to have a local line.

The previous phone i had was a Xiaomi Mi4C and it was a great phone for its price range of about 150 bucks the detail on that camara was far superior to this one and it was supposed to be worse in paper. The dual camera is a good gimmick for Facebook pictures with simulated out of focus areas but that's about it, if you want detailed pictures this is not a good phone, specially for macro. Also the colors are off
Now on to the rest of the phone its alright i guess, good memory. The sound is really low. It feels sturdy.

First.
Out of the Box. The GPS on this is highly inaccurate. It would "drift" upwards of a half mile away. It would never steadily track my location from the moment I turned the phone on. I factory reset the phone twice nothing fixed this. Also I'm located in New York City...this isn't pennsyltucky or the amazon river basin. I also set the GPS onto all 3 different settings (GPS only, wifi + gps, cell+wifi+gps) still...massive issues driving or using running apps. this phone in particular is discouraged by major running apps like strava for this exact issue (amongst others like the battery optimization garbage which i also turned off).

second. water resistance is horrible on this phone. i was caught in the rain. phone had a case on. i got pretty wet, that's fair but rather than the usb port being damaged or condensation in the camera the SIM CARD PORT someone stopped functioning? Sim card has one of those trays and is located 3-4 mm into the phone. "Water Damage" voided my warranty despite the phone becoming useless due to a sim port issue. I no longer could use my cellular network, otherwise phone was working as normal.

third. the screen is very cheap. mine cracked while in my jeans as i was sitting down. the stress of denim fabric apparently bent the phone just enough to crack the screen. i wear some tight jeans, i'll admit, but this has never happened before with any other phone, including larger ones.

After exactly 1 month(Product arrived Jan 27, today is Feb 27), the phone is bricked. I was just listening to spotify, heard a notification go off, so I tried to unlock screen to view my message. The screen wouldn't cut on. I pressed the power button a few more times, eventually it cut on for a brief second and then just cut off again. I figured it was just being slow, so I opted to restart the phone. When the phone turned on, it constantly goes to the EMUI eRecovery page, which always fails to update to fix my phone. As of now, my phone is bricked and unusable. I've heard that flashing the stock firmware might work? I don't know much about that stuff, but from what I understand, Huawei doesn't normally make their stock firmware public for months after release and I cannot go months without a phone due to the nature of my work. I essentially just have a $200 paperweight now.

What I liked:
Best display available for the price at the time of this review. The proprietary Emui interface is really pretty and works like a charm. Split screen functionality is super useful. Fingerprint sensor works perfectly.
Build quality feels amazing. Metal body feels like a much more expensive phone.
Super slim

What I don't like:
The speaker is terrible. I had read other reviews that mentioned this and thought nothing of it, but it's really tinny sounding, no bass at all. It's a bigger deal than I thought it would be.
There are no great screen protectors for this phone! Not sure why. Best I've found so far is a skinomi TechSkin.
The only other issues are the sorts of things you expect on a $200 phone.
No USB-C
No fast charging
Not as much RAM as I'd like
Etc.
As I said no real issues yet, just budget level everything.

CONCLUSION:
Great phone for the price. Probably the best sub $500 phone available.

My first impression of this phone was that itâs a great phone which rivalâs phones that cost double its price. Both the build quality and display are premium. Initially, I was a little worried about purchasing a phone with something other than stock Android on it since thatâs what my previous phone (a Nexus 5x) was running, but the EMUI interface isnât bad at all and I didnât consider it a downgrade once I used it.

The Honor 7x ships with a little bloatware installed, most of which can be removed. Some apps such as SwiftKey cannot be uninstalled, although you can set the default to the Google keyboard app instead. The phone also ships with a clear case thatâs good enough to use until you know youâre going to keep the phone.

I spent almost an entire day getting everything setup only to later discover that the Honor 7x is not compatible with Fitbit devices. It will not sync no matter what and searching for the problem reveals that everyone else with this phone is experiencing the same problem. I'm not sure if itâs a problem with the phone or Fitbit. Based on my research, both the Bluetooth and Wi-Fi share the same antenna on this phone. Anytime the phone is restarted, the Bluetooth is automatically disabled and has to be re-enabled.

Pros include a beautiful and large screen with small bezels, great performance, and premium build quality.

Cons include no NFC (used for mobile payments), no 5G Wi-Fi support, and Micro-USB instead of USB-C.

Sadly, I had to return the phone due to a lack of compatibility with my Fitbit Charge 2. My recommendation to anyone purchasing this phone is to test it with your Bluetooth devices before investing a significant amount of time configuring everything else.

People on the other side of the phone said I sounded faint or far away from my phone. When in reality my head was next to the mic. I really wanted this phone to be my current phone. But it came with too many issues. I already requested a refund and received. I don't blame the phone or the manafacturer, because it's a mid-range phone not a high end phone. I really wanted to like this phone but I couldn't.

Hey all! I hope you all find this review super helpful: I'm going to break this review up into what I consider the Good, the Bad, and the Ugly. I'll reverse the order and start with the

UGLY: This phone is extremely slippery. It slips on couches, beds, tables, pretty much any surface. A case is mandatory if you want to keep this phone protected. Luckily, there is one included in the box! Because it's slippery it also gets scratched easily. I have a small crack on the front unfortunately after my 3rd week with the phone. Lastly, the charging time is unremarkable. If you ever had a Flagship phone and used quick charging you will be disappointed. This phone takes well over 2 hours to charge.

THE BAD: This phone has no NFC. Personally, not a big deal at all for me but maybe something worth noting for those who use Android payments. The software isn't like the Nokia 6.1 or Moto G6. Pretty much those phones have vanilla Android with no bloatware. This phone will have bloatware and that may/may not be a dealbreaker for you. Again, personally, I don't mind but maybe you want a smoother experience. I use Nova Launcher and I am perfectly happy. Finally, the phone looks... generic. There's nothing about this phone that stands out but then again it's super cheap!!

THE GOOD (MY FAVORITE PART!): Dat Aluminum Build quality though! Unlike my Moto G5+ (previous phone) I actually want to caress my fingers all over the brushed aluminum. It feels very cool to the touch and premium. Honestly, if I didn't know the price beforehand I would think this phone cost 2x or 3x as much! It's right up there with the iPhone 6S+. I know I just bashed this phone for being generic but the fact that this phone feels so damn premium for so little is amazing! The battery life has continued to impress me. Not sure what Huawei did but the 3340 MAH battery last easily throughout the day, I could get 40, sometimes 50% at the end of a night. And even in heavy usage, it will be at 30%. The near bezel-less display is amazing for a phone so cheap. You literally get a screen that's nearly on par with Flagships. It gives way more room for content and maximizes screen real estate. Oh, and movies and games look glorious. Tons of features!! One-handed mode, multi-window, Night Mode, double tap to wake, notification shade gesture using the fingerprint scanner, App Twin, Navigation Dock, and wayyy more. Performance is great and despite being a low-end chip I have experienced very little lag. Runs efficiently without any slowdowns. Anyone who wants a decent pic at a very affordable price is in for a surprise. After using Moto G6, Nokia 6.1, and even the Moto X4 from last year this is probably (I'm not a professional here) the best camera in its price point. Lots of filters, plenty of editing options, and the camera even have pro mode for further enhancements.

Conclusion: Even the bad things aren't deal breakers. I don't really need NFC (and I doubt any of you will). Slapping a launcher on this makes it even more customizable and smoother. The phone looking generic really doesn't matter when even most flagships struggle to stand out.

I purchased directly from the Huawei Honor website, but I feel like Amazon is a large enough market and should get to hear what my experience was with the product.

In short, for the abysmally low price of $200, you will not get a better everyday phone for average media consumption. The screen is beautiful and massive. The performance, going from app to app and opening things one after another is snappy. Camera is just generically beautiful.

However, do not buy this for PRIMARILY gaming. This phone has a pretty good CPU, BUT the GPU (the hardware that makes a big impact in gaming) is quite mediocre. Now please don't think that this means it's bad phone; it's not at all. I can still play the normal, farmville-type games without any issues. It's just games like Asphalt 8 and such will be a little slow (But not unplayable, mind you).

That being said, you also need to understand that outside of gaming, the phone is spectacular. Smoother than butter, with minor glitches that any android device can have. Coming from an iPhone, I just love the amount of file management you can do on android, and with the large screen on the device, it feels like a legitimate portable "work computer." More so, the split screening and youtube picture in picture mode works really well, without any lag.

And good god, that fingerprint sensor is so freaking fast. It feels like the phone can sense your thoughts before you even put the finger down.
So what's the takeaway? If you're down to $200 - this phone every time. If looking specifically for a GAMING phone (primary use) - no, save the trouble and don't give the 7x a bad name. In fact, I think this is a great phone for grandparents, because if its massive screen, low cost, high performance, and the android "simple mode" feature along with floating docks and such.

Overall for the price, a great experience. The battery life is generous, the camera is completely fine in the daytime, and the daily experience is good. It runs all my social media, email, and work apps just fine. The screen is perfectly fine. I'd say that the phone is aggressive in how much it dims the screen at times. If you manually turn up the brightness, it is completely visible in direct sunlight. I would say to any prospective buyers, do some things to help yourself. The stock launcher has a setting to close apps as you lock the phone. Adjust ones you frequently use to stay open. I found that making them reload from the disk vs RAM makes a big difference with commonly used apps. Make sure to use a sd card and set it as the default storage location. For the first week it seemed extremely choppy. Now it's fine. I want to have to buy a flagship out of habit but honestly... I just don't need more phone than this for what I do.

After searching T-mobil does have a App ( T-Mobil DIGITS) That allows calling / texting via a internet connection so I expect the WIFI calling will be a non-issue for me. I did use WIFI calling the few times I vacation in the mountains with no cell signal but now that I have a Digits app I'm okay.

This phone wifi will only do 2.4 ghz, not 5.0 ghz but I have improved my home wifi with a mesh system and I find most hotspots around town use the 2.4. My phone is very fast however when I do a wifi speed test I do not get the speed I do with a 5.0 ghz phone but the 7X phone is actually a faster phone? I would like to see dual band WIFI and I considered another brand because of only 2.4 but the other brand at this price point did not have this beautiful screen size so I am very happy I purchased this phone.

UPDATE: I have had this phone almost 1 year. I do love this phone. this is the only phone I have EVER used that has not locked up at least once on me! The operating system works PERFECT! The camera is much better than lots of more expensive phones. I own mega expensive pro cameras so I know! This phone camera may not be what is in a $1K phone but I would say almost! I like the camera, its looks fantastic.
Issues is using the phone in my home office. I have a new metal roof that blocks cell signal and I truly need Tmobil wifi calling. As I understand wifi calling is only on unlocked newer like 6+ iPhones or phones purchased from T-mobil so this phone can not do t-mobil wifi calling. I need this feature as I can't get good cell coverage at my home office. Tmobil has the digits app that somewhat helps but its a bummer I don't have wifi calling.
The lack of 5 ghz ( only 2.4 ghz ) makes for a slower wifi connection, not a deal breaker but on the new Honor phone its needs dual band wifi. needs to be USB c connector on the newer phone as well.
If you can live without wifi calling I still think this phone is the phone to buy! Almost a year and I still get 3+ days on a charge! Fantastic!

I ordered this phone direct from Huawei out of their Texas headquarters. Tried to order here @ Amazon but itâs been sold out. To be honest the phone feels like a real true premium build quality. The interface runs smooth and have no issues so far.

I bought my wife the Honor 6x for Christmas and was really surprised by the look and feel and itâs performance. So I waited for the Honor 7 to be released and so I got one. To be honest these are great quality phones. I use to be in a jump program with Tmobile where I traded in my device up 2 times a year, but I paid $150 a month for 2 phones lines and the ability to do this. Iâve had all the Samsung Notes, and one I phone 7 plus (I hated). So I know what a quality of phone experience is.

Since Tmobile made made itâs jump customers start paying $150-$250 down to upgrade I jumped ship and went to Metro PCS and bought my phones outright. I originally bought a Moto G5 Plus w/ Amazon bloatware which ran fine, and no issues. I wanted a premium feel phone. I believe I got that in this Honor 7x.

Donât worry about the Government and the public ridicule of Huawei. Theyâve been here for a long time in the US, also selling phones around the globe )3rd largest phone manufacture in the world). I phones and Galaxy phones are also built in China. As long as itâs a quality build I have no problem buying it. I rather pay $200 than $800-$1100. Iâm looking forward to next yearâs Honor 8x. Hopefully theyâll have 5ghz wifi in an update or in next years model.

I've had this phone for a week now and love it so far. The phone feels very solid and has a beautiful display. The fingerprint sensor on the back has worked flawlessly and it is so nice to be able to turn a phone on with just a finger touch on the back. It is blazing fast and has performed flawlessly. My son who purchased the Note 8 said he would have purchased this phone had it seen it before buying the Note. This is an exceptional phone for the money.

UPDATE: After using this phone for a couple of months I still feel this is by far the best phone for the price. I've noted that it periodically needs to be rebooted. I've also had some issues with the camera responding very slowly. I checked last night and I was low on storage which may have been causing the problem with the camera. I deleted some files and apps and I will see if that fixes the camera slowness. I put a simple Spigen case on the phone and have since dropped it twice. It has sustained no damage whatsoever. It easily has enough charge for the day. I use it with a Samsung watch and so it advises me that the Samsung app is consuming a lot of power, but I have never run out. I did notice some hesitation at times when using the browser or apps. After researching the issue I found that the phone only has one antennae for both wireless and bluetooth. I turn off bluetooth when I'm not using it and that alleviates the problem. One antennae is the price of a higher end phone at a low price. Everybody I have showed the phone to has been impressed with its solid feel and nice screen. I was disappointed to see a big box store drop the Huawei line. I believe it is under pressure from other phone makers that want to keep the price elevated. Again, if you want a really good phone at an affordable price - this is the phone for you.

Unfortunately, i'm going to have to return this phone. I wanted to love it, everything about it seemed perfect. Large display, great battery, nearly vanilla android, dual camera, dual sim, speedy processor for the price. It seemed like a dream come true! Except, for one extremely important thing:

This phone does not have 5G Wifi. I will admit, i honestly did not even look at this spec when i was researching the phone, but it virtually cripples the phone. I live in an apartment building in downtown Austin, the phone is completely unusable when on Wifi. 2G Wifi works fine if there is not a lot of wifi signals around you, but in an urban setting with routers everywhere, it is so slow i can't even load google without waiting for a minute. Email doesn't work, pages don't load, app store is unusable....just forget about it. As soon as i turn Wifi off it springs to life, but unfortunately without the wifi i can't install updates, or install many apps, or do anything useful really without crippling my data plan.

Huawei, i wanted to be a believer and i really thought i had found a great phone, but i guess you get what you pay for.

Cheers.

Purchased this phone as a replacement for a One Plus Two phone that took an unfortunate water bath. I was looking for a phone that would do everything well for someone who does not game heavily on the phone and does not really require a high end chip set.

The build quality of the phone is excellent with a beautiful screen and well laid out buttons and fingerprint sensor. The phone looks like a $800 phone. The performance of the phone is fine with no issues after two weeks of use. There is no lag when switching screens and the camera works quickly producing very nice images.

Not sure I am in love with the 18:9 screen ratio. The screen seems slightly narrow for typing but it does help

The bottom line is that is this phone represents the best value in the smartphone market today and it rivals the performance of phones costing $400. You are certainly giving up performance and speed when comparing it to more expensive phones. You could buy 4 of these phones or 1 Apple or Samsung phone. And those phones are NOT four times better than this phone. The raw processing speed maybe that much better...but not the rest of the phone.

If your looking for a good smartphone that looks great....this is it. And your not going to be crushed if something happens to it.

Swapped nano SIM chip from my Windows phone and inserted a new MicroSD chip before turning on and it a booted up just fine. Going from tiles to icons required a little learning curve but that too went smoothly. Loaded Outlook containing all my Contacts and Calendars. Down loaded numerous Apps from Google Play. Downloaded Alexa App and serveral IOT Apps with no usage problems at all. I use both Google and Bing as well as the Edge browser and the One Drive cloud if desired. Finger print scanner is fast but a dual security of a Pin number can be used too. When turning on the phone you have a choice to finger print scanner or tap the screen and input a Pin number. All in all, this phone is a great value. It did come with a clear flexible case in addition.

My previous phone was a Moto X, and I literally despised everything about it, and started researching for the best phone under $250.
The honor 7 had the best specs and very favorable reviews. I've now had it for almost 3 months and I absolutely love everything about it. Fast and easy to use, and incredible battery life! I use it constantly, often browsing or playing a game while listening to audiobooks or music, and I have to remind myself to go ahead and charge it every few days, even though it rarely gets below 50%.
I've also dropped it dozens of times without any issue.
Calls are crystal clear. External speaker is great, I had actually bought an Anker Bluetooth speaker, but returned it, because (at least for audiobooks) I preferred the phone speaker.
Love the large screen too. Overall a great phone, and nothing comes close to it in terms of value for the money.

Husband, logged into wife's account. I purchased this unlocked Huawei last week to replaced my LG. I've had an iPhone and Samsung in the past and all smartphones have their up's & downs. This being my first Huawei I was a little skeptical however the reviews provided me some encouragement. I really like the design and although not as wide as my LG, it still fit in my leather phone case, which is a personal "perk' for me.
Setup was a cinch. The device instructions are EASY to understand. It took a while since I had a ton of information to move over (12g) but when the process was all done, the two phones practically mirrored one another. All my contacts, photos, etc were there. Fast! Did I mention fast?! A big difference from my LG, which I have no complaints over other than when the memory capped, it was DONE.
The Huawei is the most programmable phone I've had. You can set your preference on just about anything. My one negative on this and it may be operator error, is I can't seem to figure out how to set an individual text-tone. Ringtones, yes, but texting.....?
The Huawei has an "easy eye" feature that blocks out the blue light for easy reading. Wonderful addition! So much so that my wife, having a history of Migraines, purchased her own Huawei and it's on the way. This feature and the matte screen protector, I purchased, reduces the glare considerably. Another added feature I like is the dual sim. With this option I will be able to purchase a prepaid SIM card for when we travel outside of the U.S. on our vacations. No more adding the international plan or buying a cheap burn-phone when I get off the plane. This phone has a dual camera function and, for me, it takes great pics. I'm not a photographer so as long as what I snap is clear, I'm good.
Overall, I am very happy with my purchase and would recommend the Honor 7 to anyone.

We had an Honor 5x we grew tired of. I still went for the 6x and that pleased me enough to have my wife get a 7x when the Moto G5 sucked software wise. Man I'm jealous. Nice screen quality, lag not noticed as per the wife. Screen size is what WE like, we are both around 6 feet tall and have zero problems with the 6" screens though this is just under that. We'd actually like a bigger screen but can't be so picky at this beautiful price.

I have concerns that Huawei is not loved by our government but... that concern is pretty vague considering so much of our stuff is made in China anyway. And I can't afford to be buying a LG or Samsung and still love myself. I have a Samsung tablet so what am I saying... Hah!

Love it. If they added some more color variations such as silver or rose gold they might look even more pimp and sell out all day every day. Maybe.

I must say this is a excellent budget phone.
We picked 1 up from honor in Dec. Received Dec 20th.
I use a galaxy s7 wife uses the honor. But I used the honor 7x for a few days prior to giving it to her.

The battery lasted my normal all day use with plenty left over. Possibly 1.5 days. While I charge my galaxy s7 2-3x a day.

Only cons for me is no wireless charging.
And mine had a small scratch on the back when I received.

Cons for others
No usb c
No fast charging
No nfc

The performance of the phone is very good. The camera works great. I'm looking @ getting myself a honor 7x or better. Then giving the s7 to our 2.5yr old.

Also I rated 4 stars mainly due to the scratch.

Now need to find a good screen protector and case.
Phone works great and a great phone for the price!
Great little phone. Some flaws but still real nice.
Good for money
i like this phone and recommend it.

Either mine was defective or this has a 10 year old WiFi radio/receiver. I can't stream 480p or lower quality videos more than 10 feet from my router, more than 30 feet from my router websites take 1-2 minutes to load. I have devices hooked up all over my home that have no issues streaming video (Roku, game console, smart TV). I looked online for solutions thinking I have to be doing something wrong. Found a few (disable Bluetooth while streaming, software updates, etc.) but nothing made it better.

The display, which reviews indicated was a high point, is bad. Colors look washed out and muted. It has some sharpness to it, but the colors on my 3 year old Samsung J7 look much more vibrant. I tried messing around with all the display settings to no avail, simply can't make it look as good.

I give it an extra star because the design of the phone is sleek and the OS seemed snappy, but since it couldn't fulfill the basic promise of outperforming my outdated Samsung J7, it's hard to like much of anything.

Love the phone, awesome seller
Great cellphone.

After years of running mainstream phones (iphone, Samsung, HTC, LG), I believe I can say "never again". I've only been using the 7X for a couple of weeks, but it's my new favorite. Apparently I'm not alone because my phone was back-ordered for a week or two. So far, it's been worth the wait. The phone looks and feels like a much more expensive phone. I don't do a lot of gaming, but everything I've done has worked well.
If you are coming from a phone that uses a micro-SIM, you'll need to get a new SIM from your network vendor as this phone only takes a nano-Sim, but that was my only (brief) hangup.
UPDATE(3/18/18): I'm still a fan of the phone, but one characteristic that could be troublesome for some buyers is the WiFi performance. First, it only supports 2.4Ghz wifi. This shouldn't be too big a deal, by itself. Secondly, the WiFi antenna is shared with the Bluetooth radio. This causes a significant decrease in WiFi performance when using Bluetooth. For instance, in my house, with Bluetooth turned off, I get speeds in the 22-25Mbps range (download). If I turn on the Bluetooth and connect my headset, that will drop to around 15-18Mbps. If I start my podcast player, so I'm actually listening to content via Bluetooth, it drops further, to the 3-7Mbps range.
Since most of my content consumption is pre-downloaded content (podcasts, mostly), this doesn't affect me much, and I had not noticed until someone else with the phone (actually a nearly identical Mate SE) mentioned it, and I did my own testing.

UPDATE(6/21/18): Still using it, still like the daily experience fine. Since the last review, the software on phone has gotten two updates, one to a "Project Treble" based Android 8.1, and the second update just a periodic security/bugfix update. So, I can't say I'm disappointed by the software support. However, in the last couple of weeks, Huawei announced that they're no longer going to support opening the bootloader on these (or any of their other) phones, so I'm not quite as happy overall.

Had to replace my Galaxy S6 and thought I would try a less expensive phone. The Honor 7X is a great phone. The screen is bright and clear and the phone is very responsive. It works fine with my Bluetooth devices and GPS with Waze responds just fine. I've had no problems or lag with any of my apps. It does not have NFC, so no Google Pay, but not a deal breaker for me. If I want great pictures I have a camera, but the camera on the phone takes good pictures and the quality is fine. I have had this phone since they were first released and it's a purchase I would gladly make again.

(READ UPDATES!)
First off, this is a fantastic budget phone. So good in fact that I will be writing this review as if the product is a flagship model, considering pros and cons in equal light.

PRO's
-Good resolution display (1080p)
-bright
-light, thin
-small bezels
-fingerprint sensor is lightning fast
-good camera
-easy to use UI
-comes with a decent case

CON's
-NEEDS MORE RAM! only has 3gb and it will slow down like crazy if you have more than a few windows open at one time (Huawai, if you read this review, this needs to by fixed like ASAP, at least offer a 4-8gb model, even if they are more pricey.)
-not the best viewing angles
-speaker isn't very good
-I have issues setting the wallpaper, every few days it resets the lockscreen for a few hours and then fixes itself (RESOLVED 8/16)
-can't get rid of google search bar on home screen (RESOLVED 8/16)

SO... SHOULD YOU BUY IT?
My answer would be that if you want to spend less that $300 on a phone then yes, buy it. It is a great phone even if it were priced much higher. In my eyes, it competes with the Iphone 6s (before they started slowing them down).

UPDATE 6/18: Noticing problems when using gps. Signal gets lost and has trouble reconnecting. Also the fingerprint sensor is having issues where it needs to be brushed off before it works. Sometimes even that fails. -1 star

UPDATE 8/19: GPS has completely stopped working at this point. -1 star

UPDATE 9/02: Fingerprint sensor works less that 50% of the time. Phone calls say "Dialing" for about 10-20 seconds before making a phone call. I really regret purchasing this phone, but at this point, it's too late. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND TO ANYONE at this point.

Pros: it actually works. It has good battery life.

Cons: the fingerprint sensor isn't very good. It can only use 2GB of the 3GB ram. The touchscreen keyboard is sketchy, the swipe function is more miss than hit. The autocorrect is terrible. It drops wifi with no warning. The screen isn't optimised for apps, none work in full screen mode.

I rarely ever review, but I'm so disappointed with this phone. First off the FBI ,and CIA, have both issued warnings about using Huwaie phones. Secondly, this phone is so buggy!! I really wanted to like it , the display is great, the design is flawless, and camera is good when it works correctly. With all that said the problem lies within. The phone just doesn't work well at all. It's so slow while on the internet, it stalls out a lot, the charge is lackluster, taking pictures is a chore and can take up to 30 seconds to work correctly , and typing can drive a sane person into an asylum.I hope I purchased a defective phone, but given the warnings from the FBI I'm returning it , and never looking back.

This is a great phone especially for the price! I got this for my daughter to use on the Cricket network. Hooked it up with no issue. Great service and durable. but, the camera is hands down the best!!!! I now make her take all the pics anytime we go anywhere. I'm about to order this phone for myself I am so impressed!

Great phone, had over a month and no probs, it's fast, never slowed down, handles anything I throw at it, call quality great, LTE and WiFi excellent, no probs. Display is ð, and the screen size is great, colours etc. Battery lasts two days with normal use and camera is great in daylight and good/ okish with night pics. The build is great, it's sleek and it don't look like no cheap handset. Lots of features and more than worth the price I paid. I bought the blue one and it looks ð. The loudspeaker is good, not the best tho, but with all other pros, it's a minor. I would recommend this Honor 7x to anyone.

my husband ordered these phones when we needed new ones, we thought it would be cheaper than going with Samsung. boy were we wrong! they worked amazingly well in the beginning, but after having them for about 3 months the GPS started to go haywire, and the reception was terrible. they also started dropping calls like crazy. so we had to order new phones about 6 months or so later because they deteriorated so fast.

I've had this phone for a few months. Ordered it off of the hihonor website because it was back-ordered here. Since my Nexus 5x had bootlooped I couldn't wait a week+ for it to get here. Here is my review:

Performance 7/10
------------------
Does 90% of what I need it to when I need it. I am by no means a power user, I have no social media apps on my phone and use it to mostly check the news, navigate, and make calls. Biggest gripes is the occasional hang up on apps, where it will not load data when I tell it to. For example, sometimes I'll click on a link and nothing will happen. It's not an app problem, but a problem with the phone. Phone gets really bogged down if you are trying to run multiple apps at once (ie phone navigation, listening to an audiobook over bluetooth, checking messages). As many others have mentioned the camera is VERY slow. I am not exaggerating when I say it takes 10-15 seconds for the app to fully fire up and allow you to take pictures. Don't expect to capture any kodak moments with this phone.

Interface/OS 8/10
------------
I didn't really like EMUI, so I downloaded the nova launcher. A lot more slick. After making that change early on, I'm still waiting on the EMUI 8 update which I have yet to get. However, I am not going to complain much for a phone that does what I need it to do.

Price 10/10
--------
Probably best bang for your buck even after the complaints to performance. Will make calls when I need to and call quality is good. That should be most of the reason you need this phone. Uses google maps just fine and I have few problems running any single app. Not having a USB-C doesn't bother me, as most of my other devices are still the old USB standard. It's nice to be able to travel and use one type of cord for my PS4 controller, phone, and tablet again. I've never been caught in a bind because my phone takes 2 hours to fully charge instead of one. . .

Final Thoughts: I am not feeding into the phone consumerism nonsense, where it is now the norm to spend $600-1000 on a phone every 2-3 years. I hope Huawei can stick to releasing quality phones for under $400 in the U.S. I plan on using them for as long as I can.

There is a known hardware problem on this phone where the GPS receiver doesn't work. It simply will not connect to any satellites. Huawei knows this as do I and many other owners. I've been trying to work with customer service for weeks to resolve and no dice. They won't replace it even though the phone is under warranty and is eligible (their words).

I do not recommend.

I absolutely love this phone! I was skeptical about buying it at first, because I have never ordered a phone online before. & I never thought I'd start by buying one off this app. but I am so glad I made this purchase. the camera's are good, the shipping starts fast & mine was delivered right on time. the battery life is AMAZING. I wake up at 7am every day, go to work for 8 hours & when I leave work my battery is only on 92% most days, sometimes it's higher! and then I don't have to charge it until I go to bed. I absolutely would recommend this phone to anyone! very good quality and great looking phone great for people on a budget or for people who just don't like paying $700+ for a good phone.

I donât will be a put a large review this phone is good is fast but have 2 problems.
1 Bluetooth donât connect with my sonata 2017 automatically every time I going to my car I need set up connection manually is very annoying.
2 screen is very good but smug with nothing all time I need clean for keep sharp.
I work for celular store I have a bunch of smartphones like iPhone X xiaomi mi a1 pixel 2 and more . Just for be clear I bought the red edition from honor website I recommend buy th phone from amazon because the return process from honor USA is very slow. I am still waiting for the rma and label from more than 12 hours.

After two weeks of usage, i can say that dont go by the price tag. This phone can easily give competition to some flagship phones costing 4 or 5 times more. The phone looks premium and people often mistake it for galaxy phone. Battery easily goes for 2 days , camera is good and portrait mode also comes out good. Face Id works pretty well, and finger print is snappy. Love the way u can use the finger print to pull down notification bar or scroll through photos.

Coming from iphone 6, this phone is simply amazing. Everything works smoothly after 2 months, and with Android Oreo recently updated is even better. A phone with face id at this price and all the functionality at this range of price is incredible, considering that I also have a micro SD of 128gb. No need to spend 1000 dollars for a phone.

Wouldn't recognize SIM Card. Sent it in for repair. 10 days later received the phone with a note. They refused to repair and honor the warranty because of the liquid damage. I have never dropped or put it in the water. Only took three pictures at a light raining day. All my friends' phone are fine at the same situation but mine.

I was extremely disappointed as soon as I gave it to my daughter it fell and the screen cracked so bad I couldn't believe it. When I checked to see how much it cost to get fixed it was almost as much as the phone.

I was unlucky with the phone, it died completely after 2 days of purchase, I got it on a Sunday, die on Tuesday, suddenly, it won't start, searching on the net found some other people with the same problem, some after a week some after a month. Returning it to Amazon for refund. I may have gotten a lemon, but I won't be buying another Honor again.

Before I bought this phone, I read about how terribly it lagged, how it takes forever to open an app and how incredibly frustrating it is when you are trying to do something. I went and bought it anyway, directly from the honor store. It worked well the first week, then I started noticing some lagging the second week. This is my third week of ownership and the negatives far outweighs any benefits this phone has.

Damn near perfect $200 phone. I had a few glitches to work out but they were primarily a function of me ignoring the instructions. The camera is a little weak - but good enough for almost every use I have. An excellent $200 phone..Absolute best $200 phone I have ever seen or used.

I bought this phone off eBay brand new for 254 because at the time the Honour store and Amazon were both out of stock of the phone. Everything works well except the Bluetooth, I had to download a third party app from the play store in order to connect to my Bluetooth speaker, it will not connect to any Bluetooth devices using the software it comes with and that really sucks. Also when you are paired the WiFi slows down significantly.

Also the phone unlocks with the fingerprint sensor but can't be locked with it.

This is a nicely designed device. The screen is large and colors pop, the body is all metal, and the fingerprint sensor and camera are great. Unfortunately, after about a month of use, I can't recommend this. I don't use my device for gaming, just videos, email and social media. It has slowed down so horribly in the short time I've had it. Snapchat and Facebook regularly crash. Having more than an app or two open brings the speed to a crawl. This is the second phone I've purchased from Huawei, the first being the 5X, and neither have had great, or even good, performance. I'd try out the Moto G5S or something comparable. Overall, not worth the buy. Don't be fooled by the low price tag and fancy body.

For the two months that i had this phone, it worked ok, until it was updated with BND-L24 8.0.0.330(C567) and all my apps stopped working over cellular network, they only worked on WiFi. I had to reset the phone to the previous operating system for my apps to work again. This is very poor update from Huawei.

I ordered this phone for my sister, and within the time I opened up the box and pulled it out the new film and everything, It had scratches on the phone. I didn't buy this refurbished, I bought it new, so for there to be deep scratches on the front of the screen and new in a box was unacceptable. I returned it, and I'm ordering it again, for the last time, if I have the same issues, I will not be buying this phone.

Great Phone sturdy and easy to use great features. camera and video quality are very good. features galore this phone does a lot. Great size screen clear display. Just cant under score the amount of features. Camera modes, low battery mode ,

Purchased an Honor Phone, Back separated from the screen. Huawei said is was my fault and would not honor a warranty after 7 months of ownership. The electronics still worked fine. What a joke! The Phone separated and then just got worse and worse. What crap.

it's the best phone I have ever owned.Everything works well,fast and snappy ,excellent voice quality,duel rear cameras and the only Android phone I have ever had that I can get 2 days of battery life.What can I say,it's just a great phone and for under 200 bucks.

The battery is amazing! It lasts all day I do use YouTube a lot, maybe 5 hours throughout the day. The pictures are horribleðwhy can't I send multiple pictures at a time? The sound for me is so bad because it's too low I love hearing music on my phoneð. I did accidently dropped in my tub with water, it turned out fine ð® ð

This phone simply died after 7 months. I sent it in for warranty service, and they told me it had "liquid damage." Apparently there is an indicator that shows red if exposed to "liquid". However, Huawei support told me that simple vapor, even high humidity, can cause it to turn red! They acknowledged that (1) the phone is billed as water resistant, and (2) only "liquid" voids the warranty... but in the next breath told me that water vapor is considered liquid. Hence they will not honor the warranty. AVOID HUAWEI!

I love this phone! I never wrote any reviews previously on anything I bought. But this phone is too good to ignore. I have it for a few months now, and it works really good. It's a great phone for a great price. I fell in love with the camera, I just wish the 'honor 7x' didn't show up on every picture I took. It's also hard to get a clear picture while in movement. Other than that, it is a really nice phone to have. I would totally recommend it!

Works great , no issues. I have the honor 6x from last year and bought the Honor 7 for my wife for Christmas this year. I bought it for $158 on Black Friday. you all keep on paying big buck for the IPhone's and Samsung's. I'll keep the $900 in my pocket. These are the best phones I researched for the price.

I'm annoyed by the simple fact that nowhere in the description did it say it required nano sim card and now I have to wait a week to potentially two weeks for the earliest one to come in that I could find. That and now I have to transfer everything from my old phone manually which is also annoying and hey how great is it to finally have a new phone that I can't use anytime soon because of poor marketing? I could have ordered the sim card along with everything else. I'll change the review if/when I get the nano sim card and it actually works.

Very good Phone for the price, no major issues.
gets a bit slow after some months, but can be ignored for the price.
Camera was very good. And No it doesn't take actual Portraits as iPhone.
It should be stated in the product summary that this phone is not compatible with Verizon LTE in the US. Verizon does not support this phone.

I had the phone for 3 weeks and I returned it. The design and the camera are good, the best is the battery but the phone crashes a lot if you use Bluetooth or the camera and it freezes with Spotify or games. I wouldn't recommend it.

This is an amazing phone, I had it for a week and accidentally dropped it down a 100 foot waterfall. I went to retrieve it and the phone still worked!! I was surprised because of the water and massive cracked screen, I'm still able to make phone calls and the audio still works!

I don't know how the warranty works but if I had the money Id buy it again! <3

This phone is very nice looking and has a good camera, but the software is the low mark for me. Mine gets sluggish and does not perform as well as my other Moto G5 plus. Battery life is really good. I am waiting for when there Android 8.0 comes out for it, I was real disappointed it was running 7.0 not even 7.1.1 which gave it more features. Finger print reader works great and is in a good spot for me on the back, the Moto has it on the front. For $200.00 I don't think you can go wrong. P.S. If you have 5gz wifi it will not connect only 2.4gz.
Update:
Phone was very unresponsive, however I unchecked close power consuming apps and it is now working fine.

Let me make something clear... This is ONLY compatible with a NANO sim card. So for all you out there with the typical micro or mini...your going to have to get it cut. I scoured through the reviews and QA's to make sure it was compatible with T-Mobile, and it is! BUT your gonna have to most likely cut the sim card. Good news is in my area Best Buy does it for free, it only took 2 minutes. But I love this phone!
I have had many Samsung phones S7, Note 3, etc. this by far stomps the competition.

Update/Edit: After the number of issues I've had with this phone I decided to do even more research on it, including checking benchmark scores. I wish I had done that first! This phone scores abysmally! Yes, it's a $200 phone and should not perform as well as a $500 phone... but keep in mind that you're taking a HUGE performance hit. (About 1/3 to 1/5 as fast as phones in the 400-500 dollar range.) If you have all the time in the world and don't care about performance of your phone or how long it takes to open apps, particularly the camera, then go ahead and waste your money on this.

Though, I will admit that this phone does have two pros. First, the screen is quite nice. The color reproduction is good, the brightness is reasonable (I can see it outside in all but the brightest conditions), and the resolution is quite pretty. Second (and lastly), It puts up with abuse. I have dented the back of the phone, through the case I have on it, and it still functions as good as ever (which is to say, sadly, still awful), and the screen is still intact. Which is unfortunate because I've been hoping to break it so I have an excuse to buy a new phone. Oh well. I went ahead and bought a Mi MIX 2s anyhow.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
First off, I bought this off of hihonor.com - the manufacturer's website for their phones - because the phone was back ordered on Amazon for like a month.

Having said that... this phone is simply no good.

I wouldn't say I had high expectations for the phone necessarily (it's $200 after all), but I definitely didn't expect my streaming app to constantly stop or hiccup, whether on WiFi or 4G. I also didn't expect to have to wait 30 seconds or more for the camera to be ready to use, nor did I expect it to be inoperable once it was on the screen (pressing the shutter doesn't always work... sometimes it takes a LONG time to respond, sometimes it doesn't respond). Then when it does finally work the quality of pictures is subpar. Sorry, let me correct that, in full blazing daylight the pictures look great. Good color and great detail. I can see the individual strands of fur on my dogs. However, if there's a single cloud in the sky the pictures are awful. Heaven forbid you try to take night or indoor shots.

Another big issue is that the alarm app. doesn't work. I have no idea why... it just doesn't. I had to download a third party alarm app. to even use the alarm on the phone. I tested this multiple times and multiple ways (alarm vs. timer, overnight vs. a few minutes, etc.) and the alarm only sounds if, and only if, you manually turn the screen on while it should be going off. So, in other words, if you don't manually turn the screen on at 6AM when the alarm goes off, you'll never know it's going off. Yup! Fun stuff.

Want to turn down your phone? TOO BAD! This only lets you turn down the call volume a little bit. The lowest volume is still eardrum blastingly loud. I'm quite certain the 30 minute call I just had damaged my hearing. (Yes, this sounds like I'm being a bit dramatic but I assure you it's still very loud. And to top that off my supervisor speaks loudly, which is why I SHOULD BE ABLE TO TURN DOWN THE VOLUME... but alas, the brilliant minds at Huawei apparently know what's better for my ears than me.)

Sadly I threw away the box just a couple of days ago, so now I can no longer send it back. So, basically, I'm out $200 unless I can sell it and recoup some of my losses.

DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS PHONE. Seriously. Cough up a little bit more and get a better phone. This is a shame because the V10 looks like it might be a solid phone, but due to the issues with this I simply won't ever buy it.

if you plan on using Android Auto with this phone don't bother with it. Phone is great otherwise and very fast and smooth with Android Oreo. However there are known issues with Huawei phones and Android Auto. The Huawei dialer does not work correctly with Android Auto- when someone calls no screen comes up you and you can't connect or disconnect a call. This has been a known issue and Google or Huawei is refusing to fix it. Only way to correct it is to side load some hacked google dialer apk to the X7. This is just unacceptable. The other issue is that Google Play music has no sound at all in Android Auto. This is also an issue with Huawei/Honor phones in general. All other music apps like Amazon Prime music and Spotify work fine, it's just Google Play music. The fix for that is to install a third party equalizer app and have it running when Android Auto starts. I travel a lot and both of these issues are big IMHO and the phone is not worth the effort to get AA to work. It seems both Google and Huawei have no concerns to get this fixed. There are facebook pages and twitter accounts dedicated to this issue- just do a Google search.

I've been using this phone for a month and it's fantastic. Large, bright screen, fast-charging battery that holds a charge for 3 days with normal use (I don't typically game or stream movies), fast, and great looking. There's a good reason that Huawei just surpassed Apple as the 2nd largest manufacturer of smart phones in the world. Their phones are top notch.
Watch the youtube reviews. It is a great phone for the money. I switched from an iPhone 7 and haven't looked back. I love it.
https://www.amazon.com/dp/B078NCL7GK/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_14
Amazon's customer service is great. The phone is better than I expected. I am satisfied

Short and sweet: looks and feels great, unlocks quickly.

But this phone can hardly handle a few low-intensity apps running in the background. The navigation buttons feel unresponsive and often don't listen to your input.

The camera takes a good few seconds to actually open up, and I'd you're stuck in the wrong orientation, flipping it around from selfie to front facing will take yet another few seconds. By that point, the opportunity is lost or your friends are fed up with you and your phone.

Flipping between apps by double tapping the square is always a clunky, rugged transition, with animations skipping several frames. Switching between keyboard languages is also clunky and slow-to-load.

Coming from an iPhone digital keyboard, the auto complete is a huge step back. Misspelling a word, having it auto complete to a correctly spelled word, but it's not quite the word you're looking for, so you backspace to tweak it a bit, only to have the word revert to the original misspelled word, is way more frustrating than I thought it could ever be.

These all seem like minor annoyances. They are. But when they're all working in unison it makes for a very frustrating experience.
I absolutely LOVE this phone. Updated to Android 8 (Oreo) within two weeks of getting it.

Had this phone for over a month now. It is fast, responsive and had everything I needed in a phone at the moment. For the price, it is hard to beat. I don't game and make few demands of my phone but it is perfect for me.

It's fast it looks great and very affordable my only complaint is the launcher and the lack of rounded corners but you can easily change that with the Nova Launcher app and the rounded screen Corners Pro app but overall 10 out of 10 would buy from xiaomi again :)

The audio jack is a lot bigger than most phones, so I had to order a new pair of ear buds. Other than that I've had no problems it's a good cheap phone. It runs every game I play very well. Couldn't have asker for a better phone.
As expected geat phone for the price
Great phone...

It would take an hour to write how unbelievablely,ð¤¯ð¤¯mind blowing AMAZING this phone is!!! Best phone I've ever owned! And something new about it discovered every day!! And it's absolutely GORGEOUS!!

The phone seemed okay when I bought it, as months passed by started showing it's true colors. It started slowing down, hanging etc. I have to give kudos to Amazon Customer Service for helping me with this purchase.

I got my and 4 of my boys on Huawei products ( two 7x and a 8) and all of them stopped functioning, including mine after the second month. screens stop functioning, unacceptable hard half minute stuttering, you name it. Not accceptable. find another product.

The phone is awesome for$200 and now since it has the 8.0 software update it's even better

I ordered this phone from the Honor website and I honestly loved the phone. It has a slim clean design, though a bit large. The camera was nice. I really appreciated the small things that was considered like a pedometer that I did not need to set up. They include the status of not only the phone battery but also the status of the bluetooth headphones battery. These are just two of the conveniences that I did not expect but appreciated. In the end, I had to return the phone because the apps continued to freeze up giving me a wait or quit app alert. This happened a lot when trying to use the camera. Then the EMUI would crash. To summarize, The Honor 7 was nice when it worked, but it would stop so regularly, that I could not sustain it. I reset the phone to factory settings but it still did not work. No updates seemed to help.
very nice phone . working well
I bought this for my wife, she loves it. She says it is much faster than her old Moto G4. I still have my Moto G4, I will be upgrading to this as soon as I can.
Ok if you don't need GPS. For some reason GPS worked the day I activated it then nothing. Wouldn't buy had I known
With the latest Oreo update it becomes fast and responsive. Best phone at price.

Excellent in all respects - battery life, camera, high tech, great value. I have to laugh at the Amazon trolls who put this amazing phone down!

I bought the red VD release after loving the Honor 8. Apple and Samsung, there's a new kid in town and he is good.

Incredible phone! This is coming from a diehard iphone user. It's very responsive, excellent reception comparing with others, and a great camera. When you consider the cost, this is absolutely a no brainer.

I received this phone 3 days ago and my god i felt cheated... The phone keeps freezing, overheats & Shutdown. I liked this phone but ended up returning it. Too many cons I couldn't get past even though I loved how the phone looked.
- lagged/froze often. Esp when googling or using Facebook
- camera delay. I'd often miss shots bc the camera would not launch quickly enough

Returned it and got a G5 plus which is corny but reliable.

First of all I bought this phone back in December directly from Honor's website.
Pros: Large fairly beautiful screen, very fast fingerprint sensor and a decent camera. Good build quality body.
Cons: The screen material feels like plastic not glass. The worst part of the phone is the EMUI skin they put over Android 7.1.1 is very laggy. I tried everything to get the phone to run smoothly, the software comes with a lot of tools to clear memory and it still didn't help. It seems that it's just EMUI that's buggy. For instance, Twitter was extremely annoying to use because as I scrolled it would randomly sense my scrolling as selecting and I would open a tweet, same occurred on YouTube where it would randomly select a video as I was scrolling. It happened when browsing the internet, basically anywhere. I tried changing the launcher but it did nothing to help the lag and random selecting.

on 2nd day we got the dreaded Headphone jack bug. Phone thinks there is a headset connected. they skimped out on quality around the headset area and it's causing massive probs all around. Its with the connections inside the phone, reset wont fix.
With the Oreo update this phone is great..As good as phones 2-3 times its price....

This phone indeed looks like a nice option! But be aware, I'll describe my 2 hour experience with it: just got it last week, I live outside US and need to pay shipping and taxes to get it (My cost increase)... Once with me, I must admit the phone looks nice and stylish, the screen resolution and ratio are super, the camera is mediocre but it is a $200 unit, I did the basic setup and began using it, after some seconds of inactivity it will turn OFF the screen as most phones do and here is where my issues began, I was not able to turn the screen ON again, only a forced restart will do the job.
I contacted Amazon for this issue and a technician helped me to do several factory resets and the phone did not fix the issue, we did both Soft Reset and attempted a Hard Reset (Phone never show the Recovery after several attempts, this is something unacceptable for an Android phone)... We were not able to fix it and my only option now is to sent it back to get a refund (I will need to pay shipping again).

All this problem makes me believe that Honor/Huawei is not a brad to trust, how can a device get into the market without proper quality assurance to validate the screen and Recovery are working fine?

My advice: look into another option and save your time and money.

all of my apps freeze. email, camera, photos, DJI go, work app, blue iris, whatever i throw at it. i upgraded from a $40 POS motorola phone and this 7X POS makes the cheap unlocked prepaid look awesome. a reboot clears it temporarily. i optimized it with some easy steps and still no go. i had this phone for less than 2 weeks, purchased directly from hujway store and it looks every day it looks more like its a waste of money. OS and all apps are up-to-date. next stop is a dumpster. spend your money elsewhere.

I am writing this review from using this phone as my personal one for a week.
I was really excited to try this phone out and maybe replace my iPhone se with it.
Hereâs how it went.

The pros of the phone
1. The screen is huge, vibrant and beautiful. I am seriously impressed by it and the looks of the phones metal casing.
2. The finger print reader is amazingly fast and it so much better the iPhones by far. The placement of the scanner it perfect as well. Although, this phone doesnât support android pay...how?
3. This is a half and half.
The cameras are nice but itâs kinda funny how this has an 8 mp camera compared to the iPhone seâs 2mp. Yet, the iPhone camera quality looks way better than any that this can take.

Annnnd thatâs it for pros lol

Cons:

1 Camera: as I stated, all the hype not allot of preformance takes forever to try to get to the app and you canât access it from the lock screen. Youâll always miss the shot.
2. Battery life: this phone drains extremely fast itâll be dead before the day is over and thatâs only light use. Occasionally texting and a couple calls.
3. GUI: the user interface is an awful experience making you go to extreme lengths to do the simplest tasks.
Very little shortcuts for cameras flashlights or screenshots. Basically all the things you need to do fast.
4. Maybe one of the worst things about this phone is the vibrating motor and notifications.
This phone always fails to show you that you have a text or a call.
No matter what you do it never shows anything in the lock screen.
You have to constantly check every single one of your apps to see if you have a new message. Example: Snapchat there is no notification and no badge app icon. You have to check the app frequently to see if you got one.
The vibrations motor, when it does go off, is the lightest feather-like vibration ever. Youâll never feel it.
So if you want everyone to hate you because you never reply...this phone is a good option.
5. Processor: the processor is really underpowered for what they are trying to make this phone do. Maybe this is what is causing all the other problems like short battery life (proccecor being overworked by its normal use).
From day one I had this phone freeze up at least twice a day. Itâs very slow trying to run or send anything.
6. Speakers: the single down firing speaker is awful. The volume is very quiet for what you would expect from a phone this size. There is absolutely no bass and from an equalizer standpoint the sound it flat.
7. Micro USB port: seriously?
Micro not even USB type C? Not only that it is designed incorrectly so when you plug in a charger to it the cord will just fall out with the force of gravity on the cord. (Very fun to wake up to a phone with 3%).
Also, it doesnât support fast charging.
8. Honor? Okay this phone and itâs software is basically an iPhone 7 ripoff. Literally everything. Even the settings menu is made to look identical. To think they named this phone âhonorâ with the absolute lack of it.
9. Hacking.
Very angry about this and it was the point in which I sent it back immediately.
When you take a photo it provides a location of where itâs taken.
Well when I started taking photos. Every once in awhile my phone would show that my photo was taken in China. China? I was in the U.S. not China.
So my photos are being sent to China and thatâs the last of that phone.
Iâll upload the screenshot of the proof of this.

For $200 my expectations shouldnât be high at all but this is just awful.

1) micro usb usb pathetic. Itâs 2018
2) great size screen and aspect ratio but not responsive
3) the UI looks like an iPhone. This makes the UI look super cheap.
4) camera is decent but itâs no where near other budget devices like Motorola
5) it has 4GB of RAM but runs like it has 2. Super glitchy.

Donât waste your money. Spend the extra couple bucks and either a moto G5 plus, essential phone or one plus 5T

Once with me, I must admit the phone looks nice and stylish, the screen resolution and ratio are super, the camera is mediocre but it is a $200 unit, I did the basic setup and began using it, after some seconds of inactivity it will turn OFF the screen as most phones do and here is where my issues began, I was not able to turn the screen ON again, only a forced restart will do the job.
I contacted Amazon for this issue and a technician helped me to do several factory resets and the phone did not fix the issue, we did both Soft Reset and attempted a Hard Reset (Phone never show the Recovery after several attempts, this is something unacceptable for an Android phone)... We were not able to fix it and my only option now is to sent it back to get a refund (I will need to pay shipping again).

All this problem makes me believe that Honor/Huawei is not a brad to trust, how can a device get into the market without proper quality assurance to validate the screen and Recovery are working fine?

My advice: look into another option and save your time and money.

all of my apps freeze. email, camera, photos, DJI go, work app, blue iris, whatever i throw at it. i upgraded from a $40 POS motorola phone and this 7X POS makes the cheap unlocked prepaid look awesome. a reboot clears it temporarily. i optimized it with some easy steps and still no go. i had this phone for less than 2 weeks, purchased directly from hujway store and it looks every day it looks more like its a waste of money. OS and all apps are up-to-date. next stop is a dumpster. spend your money elsewhere.

I am writing this review from using this phone as my personal one for a week.
I was really excited to try this phone out and maybe replace my iPhone se with it.
Hereâs how it went.

The pros of the phone
1. The screen is huge, vibrant and beautiful. I am seriously impressed by it and the looks of the phones metal casing.
2. The finger print reader is amazingly fast and it so much better the iPhones by far. The placement of the scanner it perfect as well. Although, this phone doesnât support android pay...how?
3. This is a half and half.
The cameras are nice but itâs kinda funny how this has an 8 mp camera compared to the iPhone seâs 2mp. Yet, the iPhone camera quality looks way better than any that this can take.

Annnnd thatâs it for pros lol

Cons:

1 Camera: as I stated, all the hype not allot of preformance takes forever to try to get to the app and you canât access it from the lock screen. Youâll always miss the shot.
2. Battery life: this phone drains extremely fast itâll be dead before the day is over and thatâs only light use. Occasionally texting and a couple calls.
3. GUI: the user interface is an awful experience making you go to extreme lengths to do the simplest tasks.
Very little shortcuts for cameras flashlights or screenshots. Basically all the things you need to do fast.
4. Maybe one of the worst things about this phone is the vibrating motor and notifications.
This phone always fails to show you that you have a text or a call.
No matter what you do it never shows anything in the lock screen.
You have to constantly check every single one of your apps to see if you have a new message. Example: Snapchat there is no notification and no badge app icon. You have to check the app frequently to see if you got one.
The vibrations motor, when it does go off, is the lightest feather-like vibration ever. Youâll never feel it.
So if you want everyone to hate you because you never reply...this phone is a good option.
5. Processor: the processor is really underpowered for what they are trying to make this phone do. Maybe this is what is causing all the other problems like short battery life (proccecor being overworked by its normal use).
From day one I had this phone freeze up at least twice a day. Itâs very slow trying to run or send anything.
6. Speakers: the single down firing speaker is awful. The volume is very quiet for what you would expect from a phone this size. There is absolutely no bass and from an equalizer standpoint the sound it flat.
7. Micro USB port: seriously?
Micro not even USB type C? Not only that it is designed incorrectly so when you plug in a charger to it the cord will just fall out with the force of gravity on the cord. (Very fun to wake up to a phone with 3%).
Also, it doesnât support fast charging.
8. Honor? Okay this phone and itâs software is basically an iPhone 7 ripoff. Literally everything. Even the settings menu is made to look identical. To think they named this phone âhonorâ with the absolute lack of it.
9. Hacking.
Very angry about this and it was the point in which I sent it back immediately.
When you take a photo it provides a location of where itâs taken.
Well when I started taking photos. Every once in awhile my phone would show that my photo was taken in China. China? I was in the U.S. not China.
So my photos are being sent to China and thatâs the last of that phone.
Iâll upload the screenshot of the proof of this.

For $200 my expectations shouldnât be high at all but this is just awful.

1) micro usb usb pathetic. Itâs 2018
2) great size screen and aspect ratio but not responsive
3) the UI looks like an iPhone. This makes the UI look super cheap.
4) camera is decent but itâs no where near other budget devices like Motorola
5) it has 4GB of RAM but runs like it has 2. Super glitchy.

Donât waste your money. Spend the extra couple bucks and either a moto G5 plus, essential phone or one plus 5T

I liked this phone but ended up returning it. Too many cons I couldn't get past even though I loved how the phone looked.
- lagged/froze often. Esp when googling or using Facebook
- camera delay. I'd often miss shots bc the camera would not launch quickly enough
- text/ mms issue. The msgs would not download automatically for some reason I cannot figure out.
Returned it and got a G5 plus which is corny but reliable.

First of all I bought this phone back in December directly from Honor's website.
Pros: Large fairly beautiful screen, very fast fingerprint sensor and a decent camera. Good build quality body.
Cons: The screen material feels like plastic not glass. The worst part of the phone is the EMUI skin they put over Android 7.1.1 is very laggy. I tried everything to get the phone to run smoothly, the software comes with a lot of tools to clear memory and it still didn't help. It seems that it's just EMUI that's buggy. For instance, Twitter was extremely annoying to use because as I scrolled it would randomly sense my scrolling as selecting and I would open a tweet, same occurred on YouTube where it would randomly select a video as I was scrolling. It happened when browsing the internet, basically anywhere. I tried changing the launcher but it did nothing to help the lag and random selecting.

on 2nd day we got the dreaded Headphone jack bug. Phone thinks there is a headset connected. they skimped out on quality around the headset area and it's causing massive probs all around. Its with the connections inside the phone, reset wont fix.
With the Oreo update this phone is great..As good as phones 2-3 times its price....
