The image just looks way too digitized. For lower contrast and lower light shots, the pictures are great. But high contrast, bright pictures tend to look almost like a bad oil painting when zoomed in.

Update 12/19/18 - After 6 months of use, I find that I am constantly cursing at this phone because of the Bluetooth. It won't go 15 minutes on an audiobook without freezing, skipping, or speeding up. When I'm on a call in the car, it will constantly switch from handset to bluetooth, back to handset, then to bluetooth. This renders is useless for hands free calls. I spend a lot of time in the car and depend on blutooth, so I'm likely going to chalk this one up as a loss and go back to Samsung. It just isn't worth the frustration.

I have been using this phone for a month on T-Mobile and have had no issues with it. Its a solid phone and it was worth the $200 I paid for it. Its fast and has a good quality build with a bright screen and the OS is pleasant. And news flash, every country is spying on you and you use facebook, so I think the hype about privacy issues with Huawei is overblown, unsubstantiated, and shouldn't factor into your decision when buying this phone.

I really liked this phone except for one thing. The navigation never worked correctly in either phone. Called customer service and did everything that they said to do still would not work properly. Problem is that it could never tell location properly. Could be driving down the freeway, and it would show me a mile or 2 away. Occasionally it would show proper location then just would not move again.
After some research I found that this is a problem with this and other models also. Apparently sometimes replacing antenna. Or putting in a larger antenna fixes problem. Needed phone right away for work so did not have time to send back for repairs to manufacturer. So took to local repair place. They put a new antenna in. Still not working. Put in a larger antenna. Worked for a couple days, then back to the same problem. Needed the navigation for new job so had to get a new phone. Got another Samsung. Never had any trouble with them before. So bought a new S8 and works great.
Was really disappointed in this. Really wanted to give this phone a chance. And I did like it other than the navigation issue.
If you ever plan on using your navigation spend a few more dollars and get something else. If you just want to call text. And take a occasional picture this will be just fine. Very disappointed wanted to give it a chance.

Overall, very impressed with what was done with my 229.99. Some subtle lag after the initial launch. However, the security update seems to have mitigated this issue. Construction quality also superb, metal finish seemingly premium. Unlikely to find a better deal for a smartphone of this price at this point in time. Hopefully, Huawei continues their line of budget smartphones, unlike many other companies.

Battery on this phone was bad. Less than a month and when went to sleep had half charge. Phone not used, but battery out by morning. Contacted company through Amazon and their solution was for me to send in the phone for servicing. 2 weeks to a month with no phone. Suggested that I speak to my phone company about a "loaner" phone. No companies would ever issue a loaner phone, so not sure what that was about. The camera was great which earned the extra star. Sent this phone back and will never buy this brand again.
Phone was very fast. Worked for one month and shut off and wont restart. Warranty work denied.

I had a BLU Advanced 5.0 prior to getting the Huawei Mate SE, and it was a decent starting smartphone. I decided to upgrade to something with more processing power and internal storage. I spent a long time looking at other bargain phones with exceptional quality and features, and I finally chose the Huawei Mate SE.

It's been a great phone. It runs quickly even with a weak signal on my MetroPCS plan. The display is surprisingly good for something that is not a premier phone; even the video and sound compare really well to the iPhone 7 (the choice most of my family prefers).

The camera, although it takes objectively good-looking pictures, produces somewhat grainy macro images, even at short distance, which was something I found slightly disappointing.

However, its battery life is incomparable. I can play music and get GPS directions on the road and still have about forty-percent of battery life by the end of the day.

The 64 GB internal storage is great as well, since it guarantees plenty of storage for pictures and video. The phone runs fairly smoothly when I run three or four apps at once - especially Google Maps, Amazon Music, and the camera (I use the phone as a dash monitor).

If I ever had to get another phone, I'd definitely recommend a Huawei product.

2nd Edit: After receiving replacement phone - 4 STAR REVIEW

Amazon quickly sent my replacement, and I'm in love! The speaker phone still sounds fuzzy, people tell me. But me, I'm thrilled. (The workaround is to use WhatsApp, speaker becomes awesome!) Additionally, the notifications ping & flash accurately on this phone, so I can tell what's a text & what's the phone. Anyhow - overall, best phone I've ever used. I'll update again if it falls apart but so far, I'm LOVIN' IT. I had to dock it 1 star for the sketchy speaker phone but heck. It's still good.

Edit: One week later - 3 STAR REVIEW

Soooo sad - I've started having the phone jack & speaker phone issues others mentioned. Headphones didn't work while plugging in on a work-related call. And I cut out & people couldn't hear me when using the speaker phone. I'm gonna return & try to replace with a new one & will update again. I SO love this phone.

At purchase: 5 STAR REVIEW

Just purchased...but looks like, this is why the US is trying to keep Huawei out of the country - they'd put Apple out of business. And def Samsung, with its slow-loading speeds on devices (at least the older ones).

I'll update my review later, in case the phone dies or whatever or I find new things to like. I haven't played with a lot of the functionality, mostly used in normal operations, but here's what I can tell now:

Pros:

- It's the fastest device I've ever touched. Loads faster than I can blink almost, unbelievable. This alone is a reason to purchase, I'd say. I measured it side-by-side with a Nokia 6, to gauge loading times & in most cases, this phone was speedier. Sometimes notably so.
- Fingerprint scanner/phone unlock in the back works 100% of the time and it's amazing not to have to use a password anymore.
- Ability to easily split screen & have two apps open is really cool.
- Camera is amazing, both selfie & regular views. Fast shutter speed. Allows macro photography. Captures photo ok in different lighting (though I haven't taken a lot of photos against windows yet).

Cons:

- No normal text notifications. The LED is very small & hard to see, so that doesn't really work. I read up on how to set tonal notifications, but now my phone rings like a call when I have an e-mail. Somehow I got texts notifications to ping, by playing with the settings. I'll still have to research how to get this set up right. It's def weird.
- The speakerphone isn't as good as the Nokia 6, for example, when I play music. Lacks bass. I'll keep playing with equalizer apps & see if this improves.
- Speakerphone during regular calls (to Canada) is more muffled than when I use Whatsapp! Not sure why this is.

I really enjoy using this phone, and I laugh every day that I didnât have to sign a new contract with my cell phone provider. I had a 6plus that wouldnât hold a charge and kept freezing so it was time for a new phone. Iâve had this phone for 3 weeks and I can tell you that I will never pay $1000 for a phone again, nor will I spend the extra $35/ month to lease a phone and then 18 months later not even own it and have to sign a contact once again. These cell phone companies are making record profits not only on the cellular service but on the mark up on smart phones. Buy this phone and be free of indentured servitude. With moderate use, going on Twitter, watching Netflix, and texting throughout the day, this phone holds its charge for 1.5 days. In my opinion this phone does just about everything the $1000 phones do except the sound quality is a little less than par. But really, is that worth being locked into a contract and worth also paying $750 extra? Happy shopping!

I really wanted to like this phone - its characteristics are great and it looks and feels like a higher-end product. However, I could not make a compromise with the quality of the sound. Whether using the phone speaker, or whether placing a regular call, or whether using a car bluetooth device with it, the sound is hollow and sub-par, worse than the sound of any other phone I've owned in the past 5-6 years. I also found the phone screen to be less bright than expected even at higher brightness levels. I've never used Huawei products before and while their EMUI is pretty similar to the standard Android interface, I found it a bit of a downgrade in terms of navigation. The phone also comes with Android 7.0, rather than with 8.0.

On the positive side - the phone makes good pictures in bright daylight and its fingerprint sensor works seamlessly. Its battery life appears good but not phenomenal. I used the phone almost non-stop for about 4 hours (installing software, browsing the net, etc.), during which time its battery level went from about 60% to about 15%.

Overall, the price tag is very attractive, but only if you are willing to make a compromise with the quality of the sound. I am returning the phone because I listen to a lot of music through my cell phone, and need something that sounds good. This Huawei model does not.

I'm a tech-savvy Galaxy Note 4 owner, and I've wrestled with buying an upgrade for months, ever since AT&T pushed Android 6.0.1 on me last year, my beloved Note4 has been unstable, cranky, and crashy. I had looked at the Note 8, and I didn't like the price tag approaching $1000. I also didn't like the Samsung treatment of Android 7. So I kept looking. The downside of other non Galaxy-note phones was they didn't have all features, but I could come close. This Huawei Mate SE is the closest I found to the Samsung S8, S8+, and Note8.in terms of specs and features.

And still, I was hesitant, because the Note4 had become a trusted friend over the years, even though it was suffering from unreliability.

After getting the Huawei Mate SE, all that worry went out the window. The Mate SE is SPECTACULAR.

Setup was a breeze, migration of my data, apps, etc from my Note4 using the Phone Clone software in the SE was flawless (of course it is smart and didn't move apps that weren't compatible) and moving everything took less than 45 minutes. The heart and soul of my Note4 is now in my Huawei Mate SE. And wow, does it ever work great!

PROS:
Fast - browsing, scrolling, app launching, everything is super fast compared to my Note4. Octacore processor
Good screen- easily readable, fast response auto-brightness control, crisp and colorful AMOLED
Fingerprint reader - placed properly, instant unlock, integration with some apps in lieu of password,seems to never fail
Dual SIM cards - one for work phone# one for personal#
Storage - 64 GB and 4GB RAM same as Galaxy S8/S9
Great camera - almost as high end as S8/S9 with HDR, time lapse, slo-mo and audio control
Superior reception - added two bars in most every location using same provider
WiFi Hotspot - works great where previously wouldn't on same provider.
HUGE battery - 3340mAh - S8 has only 3000 mAh - S8+ 3500mAh
Overall experience is like a Galaxy S8/S9 - minus the Bixby annoyance
Figured out a way to make it take notes like Note4/Note8
Supports "Bring Your own Phone" SIMs for all major carriers. I'm using AT&T
Comes with a clear protector case
Price - a $800-1000 class phone for $250 - DEAL!

CONS:
No Gorilla Glass screen - tough glass but get a screen protector for $10
No water resistance like the S8/S9
Bluetooth seems to be limited to one connection at a time - not a big deal, worked with my Dodge UConnect just fine
Screen res 2160x1080 where S8/S9 has 2960x1440, but this made text easier to read for me, so maybe a plus.
Rear camera doesn't do as well in low-light conditions as Samsung
LED status indicator on top right is a little small for my tastes
No wireless or fast charging - but charging still faster than my Note4

There was some news recently about the U.S. Government flagging this phone (and other Chinese mfgs of phones) as having spyware embedded. AT&T was going to offer this phone in their line, and pulled out at the last minute because of this. This was a political move, not a technical one, because the Feds wanted to protect Korean mfr Samsung at this time of historic North-South Korea reconciliation. I ran Norton, Kapersky, Malwarebytes, and a others on my stock boot-up of the Huawei Mate SE and found nothing. This claim is just political BS and even the U.S report doesn't say the actually found any, only that it is "possible"

In summary: after months of searching, I'm pretty happy with this phone, and I'm glad I bought it. Can't beat it for the price. If you want a good modern phone without all the extra price and bling features, this is it. Copy/paste in browser to buy and give me a small tip: https://www.amazon.com/Huawei-Mate-Factory-Unlocked-5-93/dp/B0791VS3N9/ref=sr_1_3?s=wireless&ie=UTF8&tag=wattsupwithth-20

Had the Mate SE for about a week. First impressions it installed well from scratch though the Android 8 update took overnight. It's fast and screen navigation is excellent. Features like my own ring tones installed flawlessly. One gripe a lot of the native themes and images are not easy to turn off or Uninstaller. It does let the user opt out of the native Huawei apps like subbing Google photos for Gallery. But then when on tries to customize wallpaper and Screensavers from Photos the Huawei Android blocks access. So far that is the only negative. Doesn't feel like a $200 smartphone. The included poly case is very adequate. Screen is big real estate. I like it a lot. Tons of free Ram and lots of extra memory even without an SD. I feel hooked!

Update after 1 month: super fast, very responsive screen, tons of storage. Tends to slip out of my trouser pocket in the car, of course because its so big. Screen super bright, I am running it at 40%; no pixels apparent. The bottom row of buttons that were hardware on old phone are soft and change between apps in this version of Android. Will probably add a thin glass screen cover. The 5 stars are secure...

I've used the phone now about a month and can adequately give my 2cents. The phone is amazing (and for under $220). The camera is fantastic. The battery is a workhorse in longevity. The speaker is adequate. All the standard android apps are pre-installed. Navigation is very easy if you are familiar with Android interface. I have owned the Huawei Honor 8 phone for about 2 years prior to this one, but was looking for something with more internal storage (64GB), bigger display. The phone hits all the buttons.

The only criticism is the "Micro-USB" charging port, cable. I would rather had this phone been built with a "Type-C" port. The phone charges much slower than my Honor 8 did (which has Type-C). But the battery seems to last longer with the same amount of use. There is no reason to spend $900 on an iPhone X or a Galaxy S9 when this phone is a solid workhorse. If this phone were broken, lost, stolen or damaged I wouldn't be crying over the $220 spent on this phone. Good choice for a budget conscious buyer or looking to get a phone for your phone phone-abusive teenager(s).

This is my third Huawei phone. The one thing I really appreciate about them over other smartphones is they are simple unlocked smartphones that are not loaded with bloat. Likewise moving my information from my old honor to this new phone was extremely quick.
The display is crisp, the camera works well, and apps perform as they should.
Now there is one new thing I noticed on the phone, and that is the camera app has a great deal more these days.
Now mind you...feature bloat has become a thing and higher priced phones usually take more battery life and are more fragile.
Either way, I am not likely to move off of Huawei if they keep offering decent unlocked phones at an affordable price. It is hard to find a phone this good with these specs at this price level.

I bought this phone based on a coworker's recommendation. I'd owned by ZTE Pro Max for a few years and was desperately in need of an upgrade. I received the phone, switched it over to Metro PCS with no issues, and it's quite quick and responsive. Apps act as they should, and overall it feels good in my hands.

So why the two star review? Having only owned it less than two weeks, I've already encountered a couple of major problems.

PROs

Very responsive in terms of speed
Updated to Android Oreo (8.0) with no issues
Easy to configure

CONs

Sound Quality - I'm hard of hearing and it's significantly quieter than other phones I've used, even on max sound settings.
Screen Quality - I'm a klutz, so I put every phone of mine into hard cases with screen protectors. I owned my ZTE for 3ish years and I've dropped it more than once with minor scratches to show for it. I dropped this once from my nightstand (about 2-2 1/2 feet high) and I have significant cracks along the front of the phone. In the end, it's my fault that it dropped, but the fact that it could be cracked by such a small distance (even through its case) serves as fair warning to anyone that might be considering this phone and deals with the same issue.

I'm going to keep the phone and eventually replace the screen with something better. I just wish I didn't have to right out of the box.

I waited 2 months before positing this review as i wanted to live with the phone for awhile. I have to say, 2 months in, I love this phone! It has everything I wanted and a great price! You can't beat the screen for this price. It is full HD and perfect. I love the fact my phone just upgraded to the latest Android OS, Oreo 8.0. It has plenty of on board storage and the 4gb ram is all I need! The camera is fine and the battery lasts me for 2 - 3 days! All i can say is it is a lot of value for the price! I am very happy!

I did quite a bit of research on different android phones and finally decided the Huawei Mate SE had the most bang for the buck. The 64 GB drive and 4 GB RAM was a major deciding point as well as the compatibility with T-Mobile. I have only had the phone for a few days, but the setup was a breeze transferring from another phone as well as personalizing the phone to my likes. After starting the phone up, the updates to Android 8 were immediate and the enhancements by the update are nice. The Huawei website has a lot of useful information concerning the Mate SE that I found extremely helpful, from camera use as well as other programs and features. I am amazed at the quality of the photos I have taken so far, and realize there is a learning curve, so I am sure they will get better as I use the camera more. I have the camera set for a watermark on photos but is easy to turn it off as well as use other watermarks. The screen resolution is also amazing, videos play smoothly and are crystal clear. Sound quality is not bad, although I tend to use headphones. And the phone and messaging are flawless. All in all, I highly recommend this phone, for the very reasonable price you are getting a high quality phone, and Amazon is great with fast shipping and service.

Decent phone. Absolutely not waterproof. Dropped it in the pool with a case on it, removed it within one second of it touching the water, took the cover off and dried it immediately with a towel and in the sun. I had no issues until a day it bugged out on me a bit and finally had no reception. I figured that's my bad but most phones are at least water resistant.. coming from an S5 that I would drop in my water at restaurants as a hat trick and take underwater photos and videos in the ocean with it was very disappointing to see they didn't seal the phone one bit.

I bought a replacement as again I did like the phone and the replacements GPS doesn't work. Very dissatisfied with that as I commute 4 hours daily and use Waze for traffic... Since the phone has no warranty I'm stuck with it... And do I really want to buy another phone? I could have gotten a similar Galaxy phone for the price I've spent so far....

This was purchased as a replacement for my broken OnePlus 5T which was a beast of a phone. My 4 star rating is relative to its price, don't compare this to a Samsung S9 or iPhoneX.

Summary: Get this phone to save money, get a large display, and the current design style. Its reasonably good for gaming, watching movies and everything else you want from a smart phone. BUT, as I said, its no iPhoneX or S9.

Pros:
Price â Mate SE $250 vs. $1000 for the cool phones. I've had expensive phones, they're not worth the extra $750 IMO.
Looks â It looks as good as most highend phones.
Battery Life â At 100% charge I start my day at 5:30AM: Gaming 1hr, Youtube for 1hr, GPS track my jog 1hr, google maps, web browse for an entire day and still have maybe 15% by bed time at 11pm.
Weight â Its light for its size
Screen Resolution â FHD+ | 2160 x 1080 ... It's not QHD, but anyone who says they can tell the difference on a 6" screen must have superhuman eyes.

Cons:
WiFi â Connects to 2G not 5G for me. Thats ok, still plenty fast.
NFC â No NFC. That's ok for me.
USB â Uses old school Micro USB vs. USB-C. This is good and bad.
Charge Time â 1% between 1.5 minutes to 2 minutes. SLOW.
UI â Example: Accessing the camera options is confusing.
Crashes often when I have Youtube playing in the background but not when I'm actively watching.

Its a phone made in China, so it may be spying on me and sending my data back to the Chinese Government. But that's ok, I'm not looking at anything worth their time and most likely you aren't either.

This device is awesome! I've had it for a few weeks now and am completely satisfied coming from a galaxy s6 active. I paid $700+ for my Galaxy s6 almost 3 years ago and was the best phone I've had until now. The screen is nice and large and pictures are great! The fingerprint scanner is instantaneous. I don't mind microUSB since I've never had type c to miss it. The phone is lagless and snappy.

The battery life is ridiculous. I have had 19 hour days and I have never seen my battery lower than 50%. Incredible

Buy this phone!!!!

When my Fire Phone (my first introduction to a smart phone) finally bit the dust, I searched for days for a replacement. Until I got my Huawei, I had no idea what I'd been missing using the Fire Phone. This phone is feature-rich and amazingly fast online. Text messages seem to save forever. And why not--with 64GB of memory. I have mine loaded with apps, games, and photos, and I still have 2/3 of the space available. This phone is actually faster and more reliable than my desktop computer for almost any online function. Oh, and it makes phone calls too--nice clear phone calls.

After several years of purchasing top tier phones, I got tired of spending that kind of money on a PHONE. Spending around 1K to make phone calls, check email, IG, surf, and watch the occasional Youtube video is ludicrous.

Coming from a Galaxy Note 6, I wasn't prepared to be impressed at this price point, but I am.

Pros:

Price point - I mean, seriously.
Size - great to hold. Slim and the 18:9 screen makes the shape comfortable.
Quick - the processor is quite quick and 4GB of RAM is nice.
Less uninstallable software than carrier branded phones
Unlocked
Fingerprint reader - wow is this thing FAST. Love it.

Cons:

Screen - definitely not AMOLED which is what I'm used to. This is the biggest drawback, but I understand that it would have upped the price a bit. However, I would have paid the difference. Some things look a little washed out with little depth to photos, etc.
LED notification - wow is this thing TINY and not bright at all. I wind up checking my phone more often when in silent or vibration mode. My Note had a nice bright LED which I customized the color per application.
Charging port - no USB C. Maybe next time.

This is from about 1 week's worth of use, so I plan on updating on reliability in a few months.

I have bought several phones to use to play Pokemon Go game. I had to return several for various reasons such as bad battery, non working GPS, of inablity to access the SM card. This phone was in the middle price range of the phones I bought to try out. Initially this phone seemed like it would be adequate for such a purpose. although it seemed slower than other phones that cost the same or less. The display was poorer than other phones I used that cost the same or less but adequate although it often required increasing brightness to be visible. But now it has developed an instability that makes it unusable for playing the game as it won't hold the balls steady anymore that one needs to throw to play the game. Other aspects of the game still seem OK. The wi-fi seems good most of the time. I haven't used it for regular phone calls as my poor hearing make it unusable for phone calls as speakers are much weaker than my older ZTE phones that were half the price. Text messages seem OK as does internet browsing.

The reviews speak for themselves. I was pleasantly surprised. It's got to be one of the best mid range budget phones on the market. The gov will tell you otherwise. Personally if the "you know who" wants to spy on me, collect my data and what not, it isn't anything that my previous phones haven't done already! This phone is as good if not better than my ageing S7 edge which cost a hell of a lot more back then. It will take some Android users a while to get used to the UI but it's pretty much the same. No more expensive lock in contracts for me. At the end of the day it's fast as and meets my needs. If it dies on me or takes that death plunge to the floor, It's not going to break the bank. Dual Sims make overseas trips much cheaper, just pick up a cheap prepaid sim card when you get to where your going. So there you go, this phone ticks all the boxes for me. Hope this helps you decide.

I have had this pretty awesome phone since April 2018 & over all I am pretty darn happy with it. It has a pretty decent battery and with a proper charger with an output of 5V, it charges pretty fast. Plenty of memory and with an added sd card, I have way more than enough for now even though I'm constantly recording videos. Picture quality is decent and has a lot of edit options. I've been using a few unlocked phones since my Galaxy S5 & and this phone feels top of the line. The fingerprint sensor is awesome. I do wish it had a louder speaker and my GPS sensor seems to be on the slow side. I am not sure if that GPS issue is due to the dozens of drops it received already. I cracked the screen once and had it replaced with an Huawei Honor screen and that one ended up cracking as well, but it is way more resilient and has not deteriorated to where it needs replacing.

Hello. I purchased this phone May 1 2018 to replace an old note 4.

Major issues:
1. This phone has some bad GPS tech. I use my phone for hiking and car navigation since google maps is more accurate than my garmin navigation at times. In my city, my phone will constantly drop gps signal (searching for GPS signal). I am forced to add my garmin navigation as well because my phone will lose signal like 20 times. I took this phone too the woods many times and had countless issues locating my position.

2. The touch screen is bad as others have claimed. Sometimes you must double touch in order for something on the side of the screen to be activated. My old note 4 ironically had a much better screen and it did not suffer from this, even though it was an insanely old phone.

Conclusion: I have no issues with anything else, however the GPS thing makes this device a total waste of money. I regret not waiting for a drop of other competitive android products that are pricier. You live and learn. Save your money and go for their android competition.

I love my new phone, and have not had too steep a learning curve to use it. It's attractive and works really well. It takes great pictures, and easily does all that it should. The case I bought is pretty slippery and so I drop it a lot, so I may return to the clear case that came with it, which is really nice, actually. (I hadn't realize it came with one until I accidentally looked under stuff in the box). The only thing I don't like about it is a factory sticker on the phone at the bottom that doesn't look too bad, but I wish they would have not put it on there. (It's small and silvery, so not super ugly, but with a clear case it's not my fave thing to have on there.) One strange thing to me is that the sound comes out at the bottom instead of the top, I think, but it's not bad. Great phone overall, and I like it a lot. It's much better than the last phone I had!

The Huawei Mate SE supposedly has an IP67 rating. IP67 means the unit can be dropped into a body of water up to a meter deep for half an hour. I dropped mine into a 4 inch bowl of water for less than 2 seconds and it was damaged beyond repair. Huawei itself refuses to fix the phone since it was dropped in water and it therefore voids the warranty (odd that the warranty doesn't guarantee their IP67 rating, but that's probably common for phones). I tried to get it fixed at a local repair shop but they tried and failed, claiming that they would have to replace the motherboard and the LCD screen. At that point it would be cheaper to buy another phone.

Had it not broken so easily, I would've given the phone 3.5 stars.

Everything is true to description and more. The phone arrived in a nice little box, with charger and clear phone case. No screen protector. The color is gold.

I was skeptical due to the reviews being mixed (which are mostly positive and supposedly Amazon's pick)...we took a risk and went for it. So glad we did and very pleased with the purchase. The phone is extremely beautiful, sleek and fast. Boy is it fast! So many phones malfunctioning in the past for us and having to return them all, this one is flawless so far. 2 weeks going strong. I'm quite jealous now that we got this for my boyfriend, I want one now to replace my LG Stylus 2 Plus (and it's a decent phone).

A heads up to anyone looking to buy this phone, please be aware that it only takes nano SIM card. Meaning, the smallest size SIM card. Micro SIM will not fit. Had to go buy a SIM card kit at Walmart which cost $56 in order to switch phone number & plan over to the new sim.

The phone is very nice. Got a few compliments on it. I would recommend a good bulky case because it feels so slim and fragile in hand or pocket. Speakers are good, screen resolution is off the wall. Fantastic camera with very good pictures. I'm not even joking. You won't regret this gem. It's an awesome phone.

So far I am very happy with this phone. I am never wasting a ton of money on a phone again! It is reasonably fast and has been very reliable. The display is very good. The battery is very good and so far easily lasts 2 days with general use. I do not play games on my phone but I do text often and perform the basic things like checking my e-mail, banking, phone calls, Facebook, etc. The phone handles these tasks easily. I have only been using it for a week or so but so far I could not be happier. The camera is adequate. I read some reviews knocking the speakers but I don't listen to a lot of music or anything like that on my phone. I have played a few videos off YouTube and I thought the speakers were fine. Phone calls sound good to me. If it starts acting up I will update my review but so far 5 stars all the way.

Hello this review is about the Huawei SE 5.93 now this is exactly what the phone is really like , it is a 5.7'' and not 5.9 much smaller than what is advertise on Amazon or Amazon say it is A 5.7'' please be advise the PH is 5.7'' I measure IT and did a comparison with an LG 5.7'' Even the case fit both Phones of a 5.7'' from different Companies ??? .
Plus this phone is not at all as wide as regular phones it is slimmer than most phones i ever had or used !!!

MOTO X PURE EDITION and the Huawei the LG is the same size as the Huawei mate SE 5.93'' I OWN the LG and Moto- x PURE Edition all is 5.7'' but both the LG an Moto - X Is wider .................... On the positive side the Hauwei seems a better Quality Phone over all buy with confident now you all know the phone is like have lots of space Smooth To The Touch very nice Phone just not what is advertise as far as the size only . the phone really have all that is advertise 4GB RAMS MEMORY , 64 GB ROM STORAGE Good phone will buy again !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!............

Well, I have had it about a month, but so far, it is amazing. After reading many reviews here on amazon, I was convinced it was a good phone. I am glad I purchased it. My previous phone was the Zenfone 2 Laser, I definitely feel like this is an upgrade. I am not a gamer, so I havent tried any games, but as far as videos, browsing, and other apps, everything is top notch. Very responsive UI, no lag. Phone came with Android 7, but I checked for updates right away and it updated to Android 8 and the latest version of EMUI.

This is my first Huawei phone, but I have a feeling it won't be my last. At this price point, this phone performs as well as the more expensive ones.

Was concerned a little about volume since there is only 1 speaker, but it does just fine. Call quality seems great, havent had any complaints.
Screen is bright and colors are vivid...I am impressed. Nice job Huawei. Love It.

I am glad I bought this phone. It is a great value for $219.00 plus tax. I do not experience any connectivity issues with bluetooth or any other device. It's fast and reliable. Fingerprint reader is extremely fast. The volume can be turned up quite loud. The camera is pretty darn good too. I really have no complaints and I'm pretty picky about this type of stuff. I'm done with expensive smart phones and hope this lasts a while.
If you're looking for a great value I recommend this HUAWEI.

This is our initial take on this purchase after just 1 day, but the other half is extremely happy. The main features for him are: (1) more RAM and storage; (2) faster processor; (3) better screen resolution; (4) easy setup; and (5) auto-detection of resources like WiFi and SD card. The first 3 were a given with this phone vs his OnePlus One. The easy setup was a bit impressive though... as always, it offers to install any apps that your Google account had listed as installed... but it also has an option to clone your data from your old Android phone. To our surprise, after all was installed and it updated to Android 8.0 (Oreo), we tried the camera app... and it notified us that it had already directed photo saves (except burst-mode) to the SD card... the music app automatically found the music on the card without any prompting. The phone also asks to detect when you are home so that it can turn on the WIFI and connect to your home network automagically. OK... cool enough for him.
I wanted him to have this phone for the first 3 reasons and for better coverage, as this phone supports 4 of TMobileUSA's LTE bands (B2, B4, B5, and B12)... though they have recently introduced a 5th band. It also has EMUI 8.0 which are the HuaWei Android interface add-ons which typically include extra battery options and the ability to control certain app permissions in the phone. The build quality seems really good... similar to my Moto G5... yet it looks much better and it feels much more sleek.
Also, the dual rear camera is quite the surprise... it is quite good at taking pictures and it seems to have lots of other options in the HuaWei app... though we will explore other from the GPstore. The larger battery might have been a plus, but until he uses it more I am thinking that the extra RAM, bigger screen and processing power will negate that extra battery life at least a bit...
So far, this is one of the best phones I have ever seen in this price range... USD229 well spent!

Notes: (1) there is now enough space to install all of those pesky apps right on the phone (no SD necessary) leaving the SD for music and pictures if you install one; (2) starting and switching apps are brilliantly quick tasks with the octa-core processor backing the 4G RAM; (3) the screen is large and bright and responsive with loads of pixels (2160x1080) and great for watching things in HD as well...

This phone is fast, comes with plenty of builtin storage, and fingerprint reader is a huge plus but overall I would rate it three stars only as I find it not quite up to par with 3 other awesome Huawei phones I have had in the past. Huawei seems to have cut corners on this one. Now on, I'll have to think twice or may be thrice if I should continue to go with Huawei on my next upgrade. At least I'll be sure to check out reviews thoroughly. Read below to know why.

The most annoying thing about this phone is the touch quality. Clearly touch screen has flakiness near edges. For example, if you write something using the builtin keyboard (I think it is called g-board) you will find that most of the taps to "backspace" key would not work. Similarly some other keys as well, such as letter P. The touch quality seems to improve little bit after taking Android 8.x upgrade, and then followed by some system app upgrades (specially related to g-board app) via Google Play, but some flakiness still persists. Well, Huawei may claim that this is not normal and could be an isolated problem with my phone unit only, but hey I own two of these phones (one for me, and one for wife) and both have this same *exact* issue. I even replaced one, and that one also had the same issue. So I know this is a real problem and not isolated one.

Dual Sim is a false advertisement. Although you can have two nano sims installed, but only one of them can be enabled at a time. The one that is enabled will show carrier name, while the other sim would show "Emergency calls only". Effectively, you cannot receive calls / sms on both SIMs at a time. Another setback.

Networked apps feature does not work correctly. If I set an app to not work on Mobile Data connection, it would not work on Wifi as well even though it is allowed on Wifi. I typically do not like to allow apps such as WhatsApp to use mobile data connectivity, but due to this bug I cannot keep such apps from using mobile data. This bug also seems to affect System Apps. If Google Play is disallowed over Mobile Data, it would not work on Wifi as well. Very annoying.

Google Maps voice prompts always miss last part of message playing over bluetooth connection. Most of the time important information is missing, for example, "In quarter mile turn". Now you must take a glance at phone to see where are you supposed to turn. Not sure if this behavior is specific to that particular version of Android, or this phone.

This is a very good phone - fast, excellent software and hardware.
Easy to transfer settings and contents from my old phone.
Work with TMobile network after I moved my sim over from my old phone.
This also comes with a very nice soft transparent protection cover - No need to buy one.

I've had the phone for about 6 months now, after my friend recommended it to me as an upgrade to my S6. The phone material feels high quality and it has a decent weight to it. Since it's a bit longer than average phones, it does kind of sit awkward in the hand, and sometimes it can be rather difficult to reach all of the screen while using it with one hand (I'll just blame me having small hands.) My phone had some weird bubbling under the screen, but it hasn't impacted usability, and if I chose to, I could send the phone back to have it repaired as it is a manufactures defect (I haven't though, due to pure laziness and the fact that it's pretty easy to tune out.) Apps run snappy, but some may have display issues due to the longer screen. I personally haven't come into any who have had the issue, but I get the prompt every time I expand an app to full screen that there may be some issues. The back camera is good, I can say that it is better than the S6 but can't say the same for the front camera. I can't tell if its the OS and the UI that limits the function of the front camera (like being able to focus on a face while taking a selfie) or if the front camera is just bad. Either way, I can't really be upset. The true winner of this phone is the battery life. You can go all day with moderate to heavy use and by the time you go to plug it in at night, there will still be half a battery left. It's a good phone for a tight budget, but let its low price convince you that it's low quality.

I got this phone to replace my aging Blu Life One X. I'm mostly happy with it, but there are some issues with default settings that could stand to be a little more user friendly.

The most egregious example is with the default music player, and how Huawei really, really expects you to use it, whether you want to or not. Apps also (by default) don't keep running after the screen locks, which is kind of a pain in the ass if you just want music while you're driving, or cooking dinner, or if you hate yourself and decide to go jogging. You have to really play around with power, permission, launch, and cache settings to use play store apps in place of the OEM stuff. I should note that my phone updated to Android 8 the day I got it, so I never got the chance to see if it was the same on Nougat.

Hardware-wise, it's easily the best phone I've ever owned. The screen is lovely, there's a generous supply of ram, and I didn't even really need the extra micro SD storage space. I don't have anything to compare the fingerprint reader to, but it seems fast enough. A solid buy for $230.

Love this phone. Works flawless on metro by TMobile in NY after calling and adding IMEI to account. Great 4g LTE speed. Camera is good, sound is great...Huawei is an awesome brand with great products This phones feels like a high-end device with amid-range price...fast, snappy, lots of space and ram, fast cpu.. ignore that Chinese spying on you nonsense. Will be sticking with this brand, tired of the insane price gouging going on in the US mobile phone market. $1000.00 for a phone...gimme a break lol.

I had been waiting to get a new smartphone for a few years. The smartphone I used prior to the Huawei mate se was the iPhone 5, which I started using in 2013. It was fine for a few years until the iOS updates started slowly down my phone and shortening the battery life. A few years ago the iPhone 5 was no longer supported, and I was left with a phone that was not too useful anymore. Somethings I liked about the iPhone 5 was the camera, the iMessage, and the form of the phone. What I disliked was the amount of memory, amount of storage space, general slowness of the phone, the apple apps filled with ads, the touch detection accuracy, and the low battery life. Since I have switched to the Huawei mate se, my iPhone is being used as a iPod touch which has to be recharged every 2 days to be used, even if it is turned off.

What I disliked about my iPhone 5, I looked for in the recent smartphones. The Huawei mate se was the cheapest smartphone I could find that was the best fit for what I was looking for. It has 4 GB RAM, 64 GB storage space which can be expanded with micro SD card, a faster processor, a bigger screen, and a long battery life. Compared to my iPhone 5 which required recharges every 2 days, I only have to recharge my mate se once every 5 or so days. The camera is somewhat comparable to the iPhone, but does not seem as clear regardless of the mode. However it looks like it has more customizations when using the camera. Since this is an Android phone, it is lot more customizable that the iPhone. It runs on EMUI which is Huawei's Android variation, and it updated usually every month with security patches. The fingerprint sensor on the back of the phone is very handy for unlocking the phone. This phone has been an improvement to my life since I have switched smartphones. The only issue I have been having with my phone is with messaging. There are occasional instances where my group messages are sent and lost, but there is no indication that these messages disappeared into thin air. The only way I have been able to solve this is to get to area where the mobile data reception is 4 bars or greater before sending the text.

The phone comes in a white box inside a cardboard box. It comes with a plastic phone case that can be used unless you want to switch to a decent phone case. There are no screen protectors, and the SIM card slot pin is provided. Getting the phone setup was easy, and it was easy for me to switch from using iOS to EMUI.

This is one of the best cheap smartphones out there right now. If you don't want to spend $800+ to get a fancy iPhone or Samsung Galaxy, this phone may be for you.

Best customer service: GPS stop working after a month. Huawei was easy to reach, got me a shipping label, repaired the phone and sent it back to me within 10 days.
Works perfectly. Great phone and it seems that my issue was isolated.
Can beat the value plus a great customer service

China is determined to be a major player by providing top quality devices at bargain prices. Read the reviews, look at the specs. This phone compares to others costing 3x + more. Some pro reviewers say the camera alone is worth the price. Ignore the propaganda about factory installed malware, it's b. s. Last year Huawei outsold Apple globally. Apple & Samsung are absurdly over priced! I love this product, it performs. Look at the numbers, 64g, 4g ram, octacore 2.4g processor. I use it like a laptop. Please, do not believe the negative rumormongering. This devise is quality and value. Buy it, use it, see for yourself.

It was great... Until it started to restart by itself multiple times a day. It won't update claiming theres an error. Also apps started crashing. The specs and everything on it just great but it's unusable if it does those things which is why I'm giving it a 1 star

I've owned a Samsung Galaxy Note 3 for the past several years and enjoyed it very much. I shopped several months for a new phone so I would have one waiting in the wings as mine grew closer to retirement. I took a chance on the Huawei Mate SE based on all the info I could find and the price here at Amazon, as well as the fact that it is an unlocked phone. Unlocked only for this girl! Some aspects of the Huawei are equal to my Samsung, some are better, and some I'm still getting used to. I say I took a chance because I was not familiar at all with the brand. However, I recently mentioned the phone to my brother-in-law, who is a retired computer chip designer and a pretty tech-savvy guy, having worked for some of the biggest electronics companies over approx 40 years. He was familiar with the brand and seemed to think well of it, so I am doubly happy with my choice. Oh, yes. I almost forgot. The Samsung had a cable/plug that was unique to the phone or the brand, but it had a replaceable battery, which I preferred because I live in South Florida and could keep a half dozen charged batteries on hand for hurricane season (we had 2 of the Samsungs when I bought the spare batteries). The Huawei uses a universal mini or micro USB cable, but cannot be opened by the consumer to replace the battery. Before we come into hurricane season this year, I guess I will have to get a few portable chargers and keep them charged up for emergencies.

Endless wifi problems. Wont detect the local hotspot that me other devices essily see and connect to; at my gym, constantly loses connection. Same witth signal at cafe; no connection, even after factory reset.

Bluetooth and Wifi issues . I really like this phone for the fact that it is very affordable and offers a same level of high end smartphone options. problems that I am having with this phone is the Bluetooth and wifi connection. I have never had this issue before even though Bluetooth connects to my car but it doesn't feed phone connection. I have to reboot the phone in order to get it work. Other than that great device. Picture quality is better than most of the low budget phones. It does not have NFC which is a must for me since I use Google pay often. Wifi connection has intermittent issues that gets extremely slow for no reason. I thought it was the router but the other devices side by side has no issues. Huawei is a budget phone and it gives you exactly what you pay for. BEWARE.

I bought this phone for my sister a few months ago and she loved it. Just had another family member looking for a new phone. I saw this same phone on sale and recommended it to them.

The phone itself is definitely not a flagship phone but for a mid range priced phone, it's not bad at all. My sister plays games on this phone and didn't have any complaints. The family member I'm buying this for is definitely not a gamer and only uses it for lighter tasks.

He previously owned an LG G6 and this phone was a bit heftier in weight and the screen size was also larger on the Huawei Mate SE. The response times are pretty good most of the times. I noticed slight lags once in a while but nothing too bad. Setup was simple and we were asked if we wanted to bring our data and apps over from the previous phone. It's done using the Google account so apps can be automatically downloaded back to the new phone. The phone downloaded about 20+ apps and were were on our way using it shortly afterward. The apps were responsive and we didn't notice any lags.

The phone came with a cable, charger and case. The case is the slim TPU type which won't offer much protection if you drop it. All the buttons and ports were accessible so that won't be a problem for those who are more careful and prefer to use a slimmer see-through case.

We took some pictures and the quality were not bad at all. Definitely not photographers here but we mainly use the phone for taking pictures on the go or on vacations. The phone pictures quality are pretty good these days so we usually don't need to have a separate higher quality camera on hand.

The audio from the phone is pretty clear when we played back videos and made phones calls. No issues so far.

Overall, glad with purchasing this phone again at a good price. It's perfect for anyone who doesn't need to use any app/game that consumes a lot of CPU and memory. There's no problem playing most of the games and I know my sister plays a handful of games on her phone.

I really like this phone but it is starting to come apart in the lower left corner.

After talking with Huawei support I learned that a simple 1 foot drop onto carpet will void the warranty if you have any damage that can be assessed as physical damge. Now I have a phone that was in a case to protect it and slipped off the couch, that has a screen separating from the case and they will not repair or replace it. I am not happy with this at all. I have had other phones endure much more drops and they were still covered. I can't believe a company would want to make this right.

I love this phone. I purchased my first HUAWEI when my Samsung Galaxy Note crapped out after only a couple of years. I wasn't willing to pay the exorbitant price for another Samsung flagship. So I bought a Huawei Honor 6x. So when my husband's phone died, he took over using the Honor 6x and I bought this one.

The memory is great. The fact that it has ability to have a memory card inserted is great. The photo quality are crisp and clear. I was able to connect it to my carrier (StraightTalk) by just inserting the SIM card is definitely a big plus. I love everything about the phone except for the screen.

I read a lot on my phone and I also use it to write notes to myself when I'm away from my computer. The touch screen is not anywhere nearly as responsive as the Honor 6x. And if you add a screen protector, it is horrible. Touching anything near the edges of the screen involves repeated touching, sometimes pounding keys on the virtual keyboard (when I get frustrated). I have given up on using screen protectors for that reason. I now live with the fear I will drop the phone and the screen will crack. And I am so frustrated at times, that I consider finding a different phone.

This is the only reason I've given it the number of stars I have. And had the screen been as peppy as the Honor 6x is, I'd have given it five stars

Likes:
Photos of front facing camera are very good to excellent quality.
Very good battery life, i.e., usually more than 1 day, i.e., 1 to 2 days, even with heavy use.
Quick start up
Little to no bloat-ware if you buy an unlocked phone and insert SIM card from a vendor
Instant fingerprint recognition to make security an ease
Good size, i.e., decent screen and still fits easily in pocket
Affordable

Dislikes:

SERIOUS LIMITATION: The major problem I have with this otherwise very decent smart phone, is that the contact information only allows searches on names, titles, and organization fields. A search on contact information using a Samsung phone would generate a search on ALL contact fields. So for example, if you wish to search your contacts for people or companies you know in Chicago or Denver, you can't do it with the Huawei Mate SE. If you used the "Note" field in contacts to indicate friends or businesses who participate in various activities like SCUBA, Skiing, etc., or perhaps you use the Note field to indicate contacts who provide resources for your mother or other family member, searching Huawei Mate SE contacts for "SCUBA" or "Skiing" or "Mom", will NOT bring up any information. Furthermore, if you search Huawei Mate SE for the string "MD", it will bring up contacts with MD listed as their title, but it will also bring up irrelevant names and organizations which contain the letters M...D, such as Mary Dorney and Mark David. So whereas Samsung "Makes it possible" to search contacts for relevant and useful information other than name and organization, unfortunately Huawei "Makes it IMPOSSIBLE" to search contacts for such information.

Other dislikes include:
Rear facing (selfie) camera takes poor quality photos.
Camera HDR mode seems to have little to no impact on photos.

If it wasn't for the serious limitation on searching contacts, I probably would have rated the Mate SE a 5.

Firstly, I came from and LG G5 and used an battery case that gave me an additional 150% charge. So, with basically 250% battery my phone would barely last 20 hours total, all I really did was play music from my music player while I worked. Before that I had a Samsung Galaxy 5, that battery was better but still lacking. This phone gets me through an 8-10 hour shift of constant music streaming from Tunein radio with about 60% left on the battery. Just incredible. Now, for some reason my sd card kept coming back as malfunctioning and my music on that would not play. Nothing that the app Poweramp did not fix on that end. The camera itself isn't that great, but serviceable. The speaker isn't overly loud, either. But for me these weren't big concerns for me. The phone is excellent overall, and the price is very low for what it could be. I did buy mine on sale for $219. Very happy with this device.

This phone has exceeded my expectations so far. I've only had it for a couple weeks this far but in this short time I have to say this device is amazing for the price. I purchased this phone to replace my beat up and aging iPhone 6 plus. No one can tell it's a budget phone. It looks top of the line and in many ways functions that way as well! It's got a large screen, and it's larger than my iPhones screen. The screen looks amazing and it's full HD. I can't see the pixels at all. The sound is nice and loud too. Much longer than my 6 plus as well. It outperforms my 6 plus in basically every way except the camera. The camera is not bad but it's not on part with an iPhone. It's still a pretty good for a budget phone and will still take pretty good quality pictures. The only real complaint I have is the feedback from the audio jack when connecting to my car's auxillary port. Other than that I have no complaints. The fingerprint scanner is super quick and it's packed with plenty of feature overall. There's no wifi calling, is usb, 5 ghz wifi chip or nfc chip but these are all extra feature that I would expect from a much more expensive phone and nothing that j need by any means. Best $220 I've spent in a while!

First reason to buy this phone, The US government said not to! Seriously this was a huge reason for me as I noticed they were dwarfing samsung in sales and getting closer to toppling I phone from #1. If you looked at the Honor 7x and wanted a extra Gb of ram and 32 more GB of storage this is a must have. It also boasts a large 5.93" screen with minimal bezel. Oh so sexy for a budget device. It has a solid build and beautiful screen. After having it for over a week I noticed most complaints were unwarranted since some people are spoiled by more robust screens.

Granted this is not a "flagship level" phone but for the price it delivers above what any reasonable person would expect. The finger print sensor needed some getting used to. I have never had a phone like this before. It defiantly beet the Galaxy s4, Blu energy x plus, ZTE and other phones I have owned in function and form.

I love the screen most although it is not for small handed people except for the shrink feature allowing one handed use. It even has eye comfort built right in. Love that. The US government has no real proof to there allegations since there has not even been a formal charge filed against Huewai and seriously I doubt this company would jeopardize their profit margin with such foolery.

If you need a honest opinion buy it you will love it, just remember no matter how good the phone apps can still be less than perfect.

What an amazing phone I totally love this phone I can't believe the money that people spend on Samsungs and iPhones that's ridiculous. This phone is absolutely the bomb for the price if absolutely cannot be beat. I've been a Apple user for the past decade and I think I'm now going to change. This Huawei rocks and I'm looking forward to getting there Mate 10 laptop. The fingerprint recognition is super fast. This camera also takes amazing pictures and it's response time is really quick I don't have to wait for anything to open up boom it's there. The biggest downside for me is that you can't hook it up to a TV via HDMI adapter. You have to have a smart TV and you can mirror it Bluetooth Style. I guess I'm going to have to get a smart TV because I'm sure not going to get rid of this phone. This is my second Huawei phone due to my negligence I had to buy another one. The first Huawei phone, I jumped into the ocean took it out let it dry overnight and it came back on and worked perfectly I don't know how but it did. The second time I left it out in the rain and it was never quite the same after that. The phone turned on but it never ran properly. I'm still impressed because I never expected it to work after I jump in the ocean. Great phone well-built durable it's a rockstar.

It's a great phone for the price. I was looking for replacement for my Moto (battery dying slowly). Moto g6, Nokia 6.1 and this one were the options, I choose Mate just to try something new. I'm not regreting it.
Body quality is great, I like slim design and material quality. Shape it great, despite a big diagonal for my taste it doesn't feel big in hand.
Screen it bright, angles are ok. It's fast. Immidiatelly after getting online it grabed Oreo update.
Battery it good, 2 days without problems with normal usage, location and BT are constantly on. Old USB port is convinient if you have stock of old chargers.
The only downside noticed so far is luck of fast charge. While overall charging time is average, about 2 hours it's linear function of time, which can be a problem if you forget about it in the morning and need to run fast.
Camera is average, while portrait mode is good. Also spent some time removing rubbish preinstalled apps.
Overall its a great phone, I would buy it again.

I had this phone for about 6 months before I broke the screen and had to deal with the minor nightmare of Huawei customer support. It takes a series of phone calls, emails, webiste visits and multiple payment attempts to get them to repair the screen at the near $100 fee. It shouldn't be that hard. I knew when I broke the screen, I was going to have a hard time replacing it since its an offbeat Chinese manufacturer. None of the local places can replace the screen. The replacment screens you can by are plagued with bad reviews as being inferior. So, if you want to replace your screen, its $100, a fair deal of frustration and two weeks. At half the price of the phone, its really not worth it.

Also, I scratched the screen after having it for about a week. I've never scratched a phone screen before. I don't know what kind of glass this thing is made from but it is soft with a capital S.

Other than the screen, the phone has its quirks, but seemed to work fine. Battery life was good. I honestly couldn't recommend this phone to someone due to the gyrations and frustrations of dealing with the manufacturer.

I absolutely love this phone. I have an issue with the screen not turning on shortly after receiving it, however Amazon swiftly sent me a replacement. This phones user interface is fantastic. I am die-hard android, so that may make me biased. My previous HTC Uplay was a great phone, but the camera quality is unbelievable. I would warn others to avoid sticking this phone in your back pocket, as I did notice mild bowing of the phone. I was skeptical of buying a "non brand" phone, but I'm so glad I did.

I had been shopping for new phone since my S5 is already 4 y.o. and I can't seem to decide on which newer Samsung Galaxy I want but then I remembered that my niece back in Asia has this brand and thought, if she can like this phone like any other iphones out there, then it must be that good. So I went looking for reviews here on Amazon, and I'm pretty satisfied by the amount of positive reviews that I decided to buy this the same day, and I never looked back! I mean, why pay for $600+ for a phone when you can have similar product at a fraction of the cost, bought this along with screen protector and case, all came together. And soon realized that I needed to go to Metro PCS for a nano sim card, and it cost me another $27.70 at Metro, but well worth it! If I get 2 yrs out of this phone, I'll be happy but hoping to keep it longer than that. The best part is the 64GB, now I don't even need SD card, plus I can have more room for the apps that I had to give up due to limited memory on my previous S5. The Metro guy who helped me was so impressed by the feel of this phone, he is ready to get his own from Amazon, too!

I was hesitant at first, being that I had never heard of Huawei, but with the ratings and reviews I decided to replace my S7 with this and I will tell you that I am extremely glad I took that chance. The battery lasts well over a day of constant use and, even better, is SUPER fast to charge. I was expecting this phone to have problems overheating (like certain competitors), i was wrong...watch hours and hours of video and not even have to worry about it getting hot or even warm. I would recommend this to anyone in the market for a new phone. 64GB (expandable to 256), unlocked AND at the price it is at, I promise you that the ratings speak for themselves.

Great Phone! Updated to Oreo with no hiccups. Cloned my old phone and transferred all my data and apps without any hiccups. The phone is so customizable and intuitive. I upgraded to this phone from a LG stylo 3 and it blows rings around that phone. My only gripe is the camera, under certain lighting conditions it can be a little washed out, but you can always tweak the settings to clean up the image. I have been recommended this phone to anyone who will listen. If this phone lasts for more than a year without any major problems, Huawei has a customer for life.

And unless you're working for the military or government,I wouldn't be too concerned with the Chinese hacking your phone. If Huawei is able to move forward and put this behind them, I see them as a formidable competitor in this arena.

This is my second phone by this company, and,for a lower- priced, smartphone, I honestly cannot complain. My first one, the Honor 6x was getting a bit glitchy after owning it for about a year and a half, but I also rely 100% on my cell phone for everything, and that one was one of the first models I believe that was sold. They do have excellent customer service, available at the touch of a button 24/7.... actually speak directly to a helpful person right away. The camera isn't bad at all,and has improved greatly since the 6x, but is not going to be the quality of a high priced Samsung or iPhone. I've had this now about a month, and will update again at 6 months to see how it's going.

Best "bang for your buck" smart phone. Ive been an Apple iPhone user forever, with an exception of a short stint of switching over to a Galaxy s3 for a little bit, then going back to the iPhone once they started selling the bigger screens.

Well my iPhone 6 plus finally took a dump after so many years of apple trying to slow it down with their os upgrades and trying to have me upgrade to their newer iPhones. i decided to give this Huawei a try since it's pretty affordable. Well, I haven't been disappointed yet...it does its job well and I'm very happy. My wife is pissed off because it seems I wanna stay with android while my fam is on Apple. Well, how 'but them apples?!? ð

I had a bad experience with the purchase of an s8+ recently and just wanted to get an affordable phone with decent specs. Came across this phone, the reviews seemed good. I have not been disappointed. Been using it about 2 months now, and it is a great phone. Battery life is great, phone is snappy, more than enough RAM, and added a 128GB sd card to it for plenty storage. It has one minor issue however, and that is the bluetooh. It can be a little dodgy, especially when switching between calls and streaming music. The bluetooth also slows down the WiFi speed, because it shares an antenna.

That being said, the bluetooth issue is not enough to lose a star, because the phone itself is solid.

With a small budget, I was looking for something good and reliable and it seems AMAZING for the price! Having two sim-cards ports, excellent camera, works fast (which is very crucial for me), plenty of storage and a big and bright screen!
The screen also can be divided into two screen which is pretty cool if you wanna do two things at the same time. On the overall, the phone has really cool features. Probably the only cons in that the sound is not amazing, but I can totally live with it, and another downside is that it is very hard to find accessories for the device, as of now, there are none screen-protectors that are suitable. I eventually managed to find a good hard case for the device. Great value for money, Huawei and Amazon offered me a great service when I ran with problems when I got the first device and completely refunded me and I was able to get a new one.
Very recommended device!

I really thought I was going to love this phone. Right out of the box, it integrated with all my apps right away. I literally signed into my accounts and everything was set up. Then, as time went on, one thing after another stopped working smoothly.
First, the phone wouldn't connect to my Pandora app on my car like it did a hundred times before. Then I stopped getting messages for my Fitbit until it stopped working with my Fitbit completely. I have to sync everything, every time now. It won't just do it automatically like it did in the beginning. Not sure what's going on, but the Bluetooth integration is garbage. So I'm not very pleased with the phone. I missed my return window by a week and just wish that I exchanged it as soon as I noticed these issues.

My advice, if you want a cheap phone this is a good phone to get. If you start to have any issues with it At All while you are still in the window to return it, do it! Don't wait till this amazing phone becomes another crappy phone you hate using.

If you have read my reviews you know that I don't immediately review a new phone, I like to get a good feel for it before I post my opinions for the world.

The Good: Great Phone, Good Build Quality, Big Clear Screen, Good Battery Life, Almost stock Android OS, Plenty of Ram, Fast Enough Processor, and Plenty of Space (plus you can add a MicroSD card for more).

The Neutral: Huawei has been in the news quite a bit recently for all sorts negative things, unless you work in government I wouldn't let that impact your opinion, this is a solid phone.

The Bad: System updates have bricked my phone twice. Once was right after I got the phone (annoying but okay) the second time was last night. Its easy enough to boot into recovery and wipe the phone to get it back up and running (I keep most of my data on micro SD card so data loss isn't an issue) but setting all of my apps back up and getting everything back the way I want it is time consuming. So -2 stars and Im returning it.

This is an exact replica of iphone in every aspect. I ordered two times of this phone. Each time had some issues right after setup, returned in 2 days.
1st - reading memory card error, stuck in the process of setup and being frozen.
2nd - reading memory card error, after setup, respond abnormally, very weird.
If you wish to keep your privacy and confidential information, do not use this phone. Huawei's devices are very famous at data theft.

Thank god for Capitalism! I needed a new phone and the flagship fruit phone was 800.00, 1000.00 for the one i wanted. But this phone is just as nice. Switching to droid will take some time but I think anyone would switch for 800.00 saved. Put in my t mobile sim and it worked no problem. Finger print thing is really cool. Now the test of time but so far super happy and Amazon dont play when it comes to delivery in the Denver metro area

6 weeks later I have been using this phone all day at work and it has been flawless. I am a service tech and I run different apps all day long, navigation, music, phone calls, texting, and camera my Huawei has been rock solid. Great phone gonna get my boy one!!

I love this phone and was very excited to see what it could do. So many functions at a great price. I wish it could have worked with my service provider. I was able to activate it easily, but where I lived I could not receive or make calls. When I was out and about it worked perfectly. Unfortunately because I am a stay at home dad to a 3 year old, I had to return it for safety purposes. If something should happen, I had no way to make a call out for help. It just happened to be where I live is a gsm nightmare. Hated to return it and settle for a phone without all the great features of this huawei mate.
It has great memory, I love the fingerprint capability, and the size is pretty nice. However, picture quality is terrible! Please just save your money if good pictures and video matter to you.

Has fingerprint unlocking/ID, the voice to text works great, it has dual sim for extra space and it works great. Keep in mind that this phone is not compatible with icloud so it does not get .mac or .icloud email unless you go to the icloud website, log in and then access your (miniature) email. Takes a little time to get used to the answering interface but I'm not great at using cell phones anyway, so there's that... However, the phone does *everything* that more expensive phones do and at an amazing price... and if I lose this phone or it gets stolen I'll be sad -- but not as sad as if I lost an $800 phone!

I upgraded from an old Samsung galaxy 3 that I had been using for about 5 years. It was a huge jump, and the best choice over the Samsung phone I was looking at. I got a decently fast phone, android 7os (hopefully 8), and it came with all sorts of features. The camera was not bad.

I bought this device after using a Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge. I broke the screen on it, so I needed a replacement, but didn't have $600-900 for a newer device. After researching several models, I decided on this one. The specs are better than my S7. The quality of materials is very good, feels like a much more expensive device. The screen is bright and colorful and responsive. The sound quality, call quality and reception is excellent. I use Mint Mobile and when I transferred the sim card over, it took it with no problem. I actually get more bars with this phone than I did with my S7. The newer OS is nice, and I notice more system updates with this than with the S7 as well. The fingerprint sensor is really cool. When it works, it is very fast to unlock your phone. However, it is very picky about taking your fingerprint. I'd say it actually works about 70% of the time - when it doesn't take my print, it makes me put in my pin number. Somewhat Irritating, but not a deal breaker. Picture quality when not zoomed in is pretty good. When zooming in, picture quality disintegrates. Videos are pretty good when not zoomed in. I wish I complain more about the picture quality, but I really can't at this price point. Overall I am extremely satisfied with this device. I am a happy Huawei customer.

I was using a terrible Samsung J7 Perx from Sprint and I was so unhappy with it. I bought this Huawei (Hoo-way-we) and I was able to keep my phone number by going to Walmart and buying the "Walmart Family Mobile" plan powered by T-Mobile. I now have unlimited text, talk, and data for $40 bucks! All I did was buy the SIM card activation kit and wait one day for the number to transfer and I was set. Sprint plans do not work with this phone. T-mobile does. I am not sure about other carriers. I love this phone, it is so fast and looks like an iphone and it comes with a clear case! Winning!

Huawei is a great phone.
I really admire the phone.
However, there are two unsatisfactory things noted on Huawei Mate: the camera is not as great as I expected. The battery discharges so fast unlike typical Huawei batteries even though there is an additional support option on ultra battery save on battery icon.
Unfortunately, these 2 are the priorities in my decision of choosing a smart phone.

I've only had this phone for a few days and I only have positive things to say about it. The 5.93" 18:9 screen has a slimmer, and easier to hold, body than my previous phone that had a smaller screen size. The screen resolution is stunning with vibrant colors. The octacore processor is way faster than my ex-phone's quad. The camera is fast and takes amazing pictures. The sound is generic but not bad. The battery life is good, I had 40% after 10hours of moderate use. The price went down by $20 a few days after I bought it but I'm so happy with this phone I just can't complain. BTW, did I mention this came loaded with 64Gb memory!

This phone has some good reviews online. Unfortunately my experience with it wasn't that good. I have had consistent issues with the Bluetooth radio. This phone consistently looses the connection to my Sony headset, it won't stay connected to my JBL speaker, and it absolutely hates my Fitbit. Additionally it buffers when I'm watching YouTube constantly. I've gone to watching videos at 144p and it still stops every minute or two. This happens whether I'm on 4G or Wi-Fi. After three weeks the menu started flickering whenever I pull it up. Icons would jump from one spot to the next as though they didn't know which order they were supposed to be in. Most recently the phone decided to just restart itself while I was typing a message on Facebook. I've had to restart it at least once a day for the past week so with the auto restarts I'm sending this back. My two year old Blu R1 is more reliable at this time.

I know, it's not the name brands we all "want". But I can't afford those name brands. And, really, who needs so many bells and whistles?

This phone does plenty of what those phones do and at half the price. I've had a Huawei in the past and liked it well enough that when I was forced to replace a dying phone, I went with this brand because I had such good luck with it.

This one is a good size. If you have eyes that don't see so well, you may have to download a text enhancer for bigger text. The messages are not color coded and the text size is limited. Easily fixed with apps, but that's one of those bells/whistles I do miss; customization.

There are some apps on it I didn't expect and found very helpful. I'm really not missing too much that I know of. :)

Good value. Works well; better than a Samsung I once had...just sayin'. A good mid-level phone.

I did a lot of searching before I decided on an upgrade to my Moto X Pure. I was thinking about the moto G4 and Honor 7x but ultimately picked the Mate Se which is an upgraded Honor 7x.

Shipping from Amazon was fast and hassle free. No surprises there.

The actual phone is great. It came with a clear case which was unexpected. I had already purchased a case. The biggest pro about this phone is the battery life which is crazy. I can go days without charging it. The phone is lightning fast and responsive. No waiting or slow transistions. The fingerprint scan on the backside of the phone is great. It works flawlessly and recognizes my fingerprint instantly.

I normally root my phones for performance reasons but decided not to root this phone. Sometimes it's more of a hassle than what it's worth. I like stock Android ROMs. EMUI is not a "heavy" interface like Samsung phones. I use Nova Launcher and the phone is as, good as stock android. There are a lot of apps out there now that allow you to block ads so this phone runs great without root.

Transferring apps and messages was a breeze using Huawei's transferring app.

Only thing to remember is there's no NFC and no 5 ghz capability for WiFi. It's a non issue to me.

Only con in my opinion is the speaker. The Moto X Pure had two speakers so you got a louder, more stereo sound. the one speaker on the Mate SE is some what loud but very tingy. Overall, I love the phone. Great purchase.

This phone was a step down in terms of display size from my Ascend Mate 2. I was, frankly, a bit underwhelmed when I received it.

However having used it for a day or two, I realized that it is a gorgeous phone with an amazing screen and some really cool features having Android 8.0. Huawei includes a cover or case to use with the phone which I have found to be extremely helpful as well. The actual phone looks super nice compared to most of the videos and most of the images you can find on the web. Highly recommend!

Cons: Occasional lag.

.......if you end up having a problems with your Huawei phone you are in trouble if you have a warranty or not. The Huawei repair shop is a nightmare and they will put you on a run-around and not want to fix your phone. I sent my phone in to get the battery problem fixed and they sent my phone back in 2 days all dented and scratched up and denied that they did it.
