I took a picture of my phone before I sent it and they still said that it was dented on the picture. Don't buy any Huawei phone, because if it ends up having a problem you better learn to fix it yourself. The first picture is how my phone looked before I mailed it to them and the other 2 pictures is how it looked when I got it back.

It's a great phone. But it's very slowly, and can get stuck. I get kicked out of maps and some apps for crashing all the time. Picture quality is not great,but does the work.
But I will tell you this, for the price, SO WORTH it. Don't expect to pay this price and have a Lamborghini phonem. This a great "Toyota Corolla" or "Kia Soul" of a phone. Looks great, cheap in price and does the work! (Says the person who cracked two Samsung Galaxy s9 in two weeks, and this phone has survived 3 months!) WORTH IT! Insurance protection price, awesome.

I switched to this from an Honor 5x, so I was a pretty smooth transition. I'm in love with Huawei phones, great quality for a fraction of the high dollar phones out there and does everything I need a phone to do. I hooked it up on my straight talk service with no issue, it does take a nano SIM card only, I didn't know that and had to go buy a new one because the one in my Honor was too big. Been using it for a few days and love it! Picture quality is great and that battery life is fire! It even came with a clear flexible case, which is amazing!

I got this phone at $249.99 before tax bummer should of wait ð­ð¢ lol but I'm glad I did purchase phone so far great phone I had a previously purchased the mate 2 yrs ago and I had a very good experience with phone batteryð was awesomeðâð I decided it was time to upgrade I was surfing tho see which one to get I was between galaxy brand but I was thinking I'm not going to expend a crazy money for a phone so I decided to get another Huawei phoneð± and I'm more then happy with my phone. Great size, ð·, ð²application, emojis. ð is wonderful last all day with out chargingðâ¡.i will recommend ðð

This phone does not look or feel like a $230 phone, it looks and feels more like an iPhone with it's space grey backing. The performance is pretty solid and the Hauwei launcher is not too bad either as it has some useful features. I'm pretty impressed with this phone especially at it's price point when you factor a dual sim card setup and the audio DAC sounds really good with headphones. So far the fingerprint reader has worked reliably to unlock the phone.

Display Screen dimming frequently very annoying. Huawei technical support unable to troubleshoot on the phone and recommended I send in the phone, I had for only four days, for repair or replacement. Multiple Huawei web complaints indicated that display dimming and flickering is a known problem with many Huawei phone models. Phone returned.

I noticed a difference between this and other smart phones out of the box. I especially like that I can completely uninstall bloatware and that apps like Facebook aren't system installments / requirements. The screen is crystal clear and resists fingerprint buildup. The phone's processing speed is incredible. No lagging. Just an incredibly beautiful, high performing choice. The price point could double and the phone would be worth it, though perhaps not morally. Economic accessibility without minimizing features. Yes. Can't say enough good things so one con: those terms that must be agreed to before operating the phone are a little scary, but make me wonder what's going on behind the scenes of phones that don't make us aware of their software and data practices.

I was in need of an upgrade from an LG. Four years ago I decided that the monthly contract with either AT&T and Verizon were jut not worth it. I have been with Straight Talk ever since. I purchased this phone, brand new, works on Straight Talk AT&T SIM. I was able to activate this phone very easily. The phone itself is excellent. Has all of the options of my daughter's S9 and I LOVE that the screen is not curved on the edges like the S9. I had no problems at all with this phone. The phone has had several software updates and I have not had problems since the update. I waited several months before getting this phone, it was worth the wait. I have no complaints. Although there still is a lot I need to learn about it still. As of today, I have had the phone for 2 months.

I got the phone a year ago to use on the road, and while I was happy with it for a while, the honeymoon ended and I was stick with a phone that failed some major requirements. The Huawei implantation of Bluetooth headsets made it impossible to use the Google Assistant - it refused to open the mike, and the built in mike couldn't pick up voice over road noise. The WiFi receiver got worse over time, to the point where I had to reboot if I wanted WiFi to function. That's a problem when you live on the road, connecting to several truck stops and motels a day. Dual SIM was useless, since the second SIM only supports 2G, which is no longer available for some carriers. The camera is subpar, and the speakerphone is unusable even in a quiet room. I finally bought a Moto 6, and relegated this phone to my backup line. That will allow me to benefit from its one outstanding feature, its long life battery.

Excellent budget phone. Practically fulfilling the needs on latest aps, camera, battery, performance, storage, ram etc. Nothing more to expect for $200. Thanks Amazon for bringing this product as many other shops don't sell Huawei phones.

Great phone, I got it to replace my Huawei honor 5x that I had for a few years. This phone is really snappy, and sleek looking too. It kinda looks like an iPhone 7, which is nice because I always liked their design but never wanted to spend the money on one, so this was the perfect choice for me. The storage space is amazing, on my 5x I couldn't even update my apps anymore for lack of space. Now I have all my apps and still have 46gb left, not to mention the SD card slot for extra space. I only wish they had it in blue like the 7x. It was a tough choice between the two for me because the 7x has the awesome blue, as well as the facial recognition. But the mate se has double the storage and an extra gb of RAM for $30 more. Not to mention the se is also getting an update for facial recognition. I did get a blue slim case so I can pretend my phone is blue. FYI the tudia tamm case is very nice, it keeps the phone slim without extra bulk, but also makes it feel protected. The tempered glass for this phone are awful, none of them seem to stick because of the curved edge on the screen. I did purchase the super shields tempered glass, since they have the best rating with a whopping 3 1/2 stars, but fingers crossed it doesn't pop off.

I love this phone twenty times more than I expected to. I would actually go so far as to say that it's the best phone I've ever owned. The build quality is impressive and it feels very solid. The pictures it takes are incredible for what it is; I frequently have people ask me what camera I took my pictures with and they are always surprised when I tell them my phone. The display is bright, clear, and crisp. There is absolutely nothing I don't love about it; would purchase again in a heartbeat! You could pay three times the cost and still not have a better phone in my opinion. Buy it, you won't regret it!

This is a very good phone. I doubt you can find a better one for less than $300. Build quality is at flagship phone level. The screen is beautiful. Fingerprint scanner and facial recognition are very fast, so is the camera. And the battery lasts quite long. Overall the phone is very quick. I do have some minor software issues with the Outlook and Yahoo Mail apps. Specifically, I am not able to select the notification ringtone for these apps. I don't believe the issue is with the apps because I have another Android phone which doesn't have the problem. I could (probably should) give the phone a 5-star considering the quality, performance, and cost, but decided to give it a 4 for now.

I do wish the phone is little bit smaller. The phone is sort of too big to fit into jean pockets comfortably. No manufacturer seems to be making small form factor phones anymore.

First let me say that I have been using cell phones for the last 2.5 decades and have watched them progress to where they are today.
Over the years, out of a the blue companies (we all know who they are) starting producing phones at MUCH higher price levels and the public bought them which generated MASSIVE profits for those companies.. After all they are selling you phones that cost less then $150 to make for $700 + dollars to you.
I have never been one of those people, I always looked for value however I have A LOT of experience with expensive Apple and Android phones as besides my personal phone (and those in my family) my workplace supplied me with those expensive phones. Quite honestly, except for trying to "show off" I never really liked them.

Anyway it allows me to make direct comparisons to our less expensive personal phones and I never knew what the big deal was by owning the expensive ones, except to brag to friends about the most expensive phones someone bought.. To me that is a waste of money and I always knew those people who had those expensive phones never really "bought" them and only had them because they made monthly payments, anyone can do that.

Ok on tho the Huawei, our family has 3 cheaper versions on ATT service called the Elate, beautiful phone, cost us $70 each.
I was so impressed with them, I started to look into other offerings from Huawei and read up on the Huawei Mate SE.
I was pleasantly surprised at how well the Huawei phones review at ALL price levels. So I decided to buy myself the a New Huawei Mate SE as a sort of after Christmas present from my wife.

All I can say is WOW, this phone is AMAZING. Fit, finish, construction, beautiful refined feeling that you get with high end phones, yet this one is only around $200. NOT $1000 dollars.
It does everything any phone costing 4 times its price can do and do it with really good battery life.
Now lets get real, of course if your some super gamer/power user who needs a super high speed processor for some reason of course you will want the latest greatest processor at MUCH higher cost and much higher profit for the phone company.
For the average to above average American, they would never notice a difference, same with he camera, great camera, better then expected, is it as good as a $1000 phone? I can not answer that because when I take REALLY serious photos I use a Nikon digital SLR camera. I can tell you, Im not sure which is better, the camera in my work Iphone or this phone, so that is saying a lot.

Anyway, if you are someone who is considering this phone, I can honestly tell you, you cant go wrong. Just do it, I cant see how ANYONE can be disappointed and I see my wife now, holding it in her hand and it wont be long until she retires her other Huawei for another Mate SE. :o)

I should have bought this long ago if I knew. This phone is so good that I had to buy one for my phone after I used mine for just a month.
I used to have network issue in my house with my HTC MORE but I have full signal in the same house and on the same career on this phone.

Internet, Bluetooth and everything is great.
Voice mail and everything is working.
NOTE: phone doesn't have infrared so you can't install remote on it but you can do that through the internet. You will need an adapter.

For a $250 phone I can't complain at all!!! More storage , ram, and reliability than my Iphone 6 I was using at a fraction of the cost. Took this to Europe for a trip with a seigen case and a wrist grip.com strap and it was great for monument photos and hard to be snatched by passerbys! I've attached a few excellent photos I took with it. Love this phone!

WOW! I took a very long time to research various phones to see what I could get that was within my budget, had really good specs, and was at least close to one thing I REALLY wanted, which was a 6" phone. This one is 5.93" The specs are fantastic. It works perfectly, and the customer service that Huawei provides is second to none. Very speedy, no delay in anything I've done. Takes nice pictures (I was not looking for "the best" pictures - I just wanted something that produced good ones). I really can't say enough good things about it. I'll be looking at Huawei first the next time I need a phone.

Recently, my wife decided to drown her Samsung Galaxy 5 and this phone was purchased, by me, as a replacement. She has had it almost 3 weeks now and does not have any negatives to say about it. In fact, all she says is, "I love it!" She runs a lot of apps so her first love is its battery which she now can get by with a daily charge. Second, she loves the camera. Third, is the screen resolution and size and finally, it the ease of operation with the Android OS. She was a bit concerned that the phone's physical size might be excessive but now she adores it. Oh, she also said that the phone only has 2 buttons, volume and on/off and both buttons actually required a good push to make contact unlike the Samsung which, annoyingly, needing nothing more than a mere breath. The more she continues to heap praise on this phone, the more I am considering buying one for myself come Christmas. All-in-all, great phone, great price!

I'm glad I checked the reviews on this Huawei Mate SE. This phone is fast, has beautiful graphics, easy to set up, well made and is the OS is updatable to 8.0. The Moto phones that have an Amazon OS variant have not got an upgrade to the latest OS. I love my Huawei! This phone is well worth the purchase. It doesn't have the Amazon bloatware either....nice! This phone also has a much more stable and lasting internet connection than my Moto G5 Plus. I've been able to use my Huawei Mate SE in the weak signal spots in my home...better than the Moto G5 Plus.

reviewerName: The infamous El Guapo. AKA Paul
reviewText:
Well I just got the phone yesterday 12/14 I didn't set it up until today 12/15. I inserted my sim card the phone needed to "format sim" and now my sim card doesn't work on the new phone or my old phone. So for tonight I have no phone. Needless to say I am not at all happy with my purchase. I am strongly considering returning this phone.

***Update I am not as smart as I thought I was**" I tried to enter the scan disk memory card instead of the nano SIM card. The phone is working now. I still think the phone feels like cheap plastic, but I need some time to see what I really think. Will review again in a couple weeks.

Nice specs, phone was easy to set up and seems nice and fast out of the box. The build quality is high, and the phone feels more expensive than it's price. Battery was at around 80% when it arrived, and seems to hold it's charge well compared to my old Samsung. Minor complaints, the screen dims when looking at it more than maybe 15 degrees off center vertically. Horizontal brightness seems better, but not perfect. This is common on cheaper phones and not a huge deal, overall the screen is nice looking and feels good. Good touch response. The speaker sound as well as the sound output through the headphone jack is not as good as other phones I've had, but is more than acceptable for what I'll use it for. We'll see how it holds up, but first impression of this phone is pretty good.

I've been using this phone for around 6 months and it's easily the best phone I've had.

Build Quality-
The build of the phone is solid and has some weight to it. Granted I have a case on it, I've dropped it a couple times and not a mark on it. The touch sensor located in the upper middle on the backside is a good location and easy to reach, works very well.

Screen-
While not a 4k screen, it's full HD and looks incredibly sharp. The colors look very sharp, and you're able to change the color temp in the settings which is a nice touch.

Speakers-
While only one on the bottom right side, they're fairly loud and sound pretty good. Nothing spectacular, but they get the job done.

Cameras-
This is where the sacrifices were surely made. In low light, the camera quality is pretty bad. In normal lighting they're OK, so if you're keen on photography you'd be better off looking elsewhere.

Battery -
This is a huge thing for me since I'm a heavy user. I'm always streaming music, watching videos or surfing the web. The battery easily lasts me the day, 12-15 hours, with 40% left to boot. In the off chance you need it, there's the standard battery saver, and the very handy ultra power saving mode at 10% that puts up a black screen with only the bare necessity apps for communication.

Performance-
This phone is no slouch, it's incredibly fast for the regular tasks. It can multitask very well without any hiccups. As for gaming, I'm not too keen on mobile gaming but I imagine this can handle most apps you throw at it. For a visual spectacle this might not be an ideal phone for you, but that's up to testing.

I'm very happy with my purchase!

If you know the size of an iPhone 6 plus it is the same size and actually looks like one. It has been a great phone. The case it comes with isn't the greatest, but overall for $250... You can't beat this phone. I had an LG G4 prior to this phone. Oh and it constantly updates it's software which makes me super happy. I chose this over the new LG G7 thinQ. Very happy with it

I have been buying the newest flagship phones for about 8 years now. I got tired of the high cost of contracts and the high cost of having the newest phone. I wanted to go to prepaid and started looking for good phones that weren't pushing $1000. Pretty quickly Huawei popped up and in particular the Mate SE. I went from the Note 4 to the iPhone 7 plus to this. Wow! This phone is an amazing deal. I have always leaned towards Android and having this phone has definitely reinforced that. I bought a couple of other prepaid phones before this phone.....there is no comparison. The Mate SE is an AMAZING phone at this price. This brand name was a little foreign to me until I started some research on the best phones for the price. Great screen size, great picture, great power, great battery life and very good camera. I will be looking to Huawei and it's sub brand Honor for my next phones. This phone could easily cost 2-3 times what it does and still be a great phone. That alone speaks volumes. I always loved having the newest and greatest phones.....this phone is so close to flagship and the price is 1/4 of a flagship phone. Highly Recommended!

This phone grabs my attention for three things:

1) The RAM size. You will not experience lag between applications. This is hands down the best RAM available for this price point. This alone will make the purchase worth it.

2) The durability. I am a careless user. I dont believe in taking care of your phone. If you pay this much you should be able to live free from worry. I have dropped this phone so many times on the concrete and the screen has not shattered and the case that it comes with has held this up. I am surprised this phone takes a beating and still looks relatively new.

3) The size. I have small hands and this phone does not feel huge or hard to hold. The Mate Pro was too large of a form factor and this one fits perfect.

This phone is a vast improvement over the more expensive LG phone I had before. I had been cussing my service provider for no service in certain areas on the old phone, but now there is service where those cuss words hung in the air. I don't use the camera very much, but I have taken a couple of really good pictures with it, one portrait and one landscape. Physically the phone is very solid, and survived a couple of drops with the included case, and a purchased screen protector. It has a large bright screen, and does not come loaded with crapware, although Google manages to sneak some in. Note that this is a GSM phone, only valid for ATT and T-Mobile in the US, and in all the rest of the world. I managed, with very little help from my service provider, to make the transition from my old phone.

Coming from a Nexus 5 which had started to give me problems, this is an amazing upgrade. The smoothest move I've ever had on a smart phone using Huawei's app to bring every thing over from my Nexus. Even configuring my provider (Ting) was amazingly simple (that had always been the hardest part of switching phones for me). The phone is gorgeous, quick, great battery life, no complaints so far. I was expecting some kind of problem but encountered none that couldn't be resolved. Highly recommended!

I have used Samsung Galaxy's since the first one. This phone blows away Samsung. It is hands down a better phone. Battery life, user interface, picture quality, speed, no bloatware! This is the first review I have ever written for a phone, probably my second review ever on Amazon in 10 years. Buy this phone if you're looking at the Galaxy's.

I've had the phone for two months and purchased it prior to a European tour. The Dual SIM feature was good. I got a Vodafone SIM for $30 in London and I had phone and data in the five countries we visited. I took a camera, but the phone took great pictures and video. Should have left the camera at home. Battery life is long. I'm not a heavy user and, in the evening, after being in and out of my pocket all day, I still have about 85% battery. When traveling and getting directions and taking lots of pics it got down to the 20's and 30's a couple of times. There was a problem with Bluetooth slowing Wifi down to a crawl when I first bought it but it upgraded to Oreo and that problem was resolved. The fingerprint reader works well except for when my hands are wet and I have to wait for them to dry before I can use the phone. I have no regrets.

Pros:
- Inexpensive
- Free silicone case
- Headphone jack
- Fingerprint scanner
- Dual Sim capability
- Aluminum body
- 4GB of RAM
- 64GB of internal storage
- Support Micro SD up to 256GB
- Excellent battery life
- Hardly overheat
- Acceptable performance/camera quality

Cons:
- No 5GHZ (802.11ac) WIFI
- Outdated Bluetooth 4.1 standard
- Micro USB
- No NFC
- Not waterproof
- CAT 4 LTE with no carrier aggregation support
- Doesn't support T-Mobile LTE band 66/71
- No OIS/EIS
- OEM bloatware

Overall the Mate SE offers a ton of great things at an affordable price, it does come with compromises that can't be overlooked. At the end of the day, you get what you pay for.

Everything about this phone is great. Iput it on par with Samsung 8 and iPhone 8. My last phone was iPhone 6 but due to Apple programing I was very unhappy with it. I got this phone because I perfer Android over iso and was surprised at the quality.

Very happy with this phone. The only con is that the camera isn't super great but at $230 I'm not going to knock a star for that. Otherwise it runs very smooth, no lag with apps, everything is nice and responsive. Battery life so far has been great, I'm easily getting a full day+ with moderate usage.

Be sure to run the system update when you get it so you get the latest android version.

I was looking for a smartphone that if I dropped in the toilet I wouldn't be too upset over, but I wanted large size because I am a large man. So I wasn't going to pay for an iPhone or Samsung, and didn't want to spend more than a few hundred dollars. I have been a customer of TracFone for years, and I knew they have a Bring Your Own Phone program. I saw this phone at Walmart under an AT&T subscription. So I did a little research and figured out that buying a factory unlocked phone and a TracFone AT&T SIM card would suit my needs. I purchased both from Amazon, and went about the set up when they arrived. As soon as I turned the phone on, it began auto updating it's software and apps. This took the better part of 20 hours! They only real issue I had was that altho I used Tracfone's website to activate the SIM, it didn't happen. After 3 days of no service, I went to the TracFone's website and used the Chat feature with an associate. The SIM activated and the number ported in about a half hour. BINGO and Win Win!

Since I began using this phone in late July, twice I have gotten automated calls from AT&T to verify the account. First it asks for the last four of my social security number, which I typed in. Then it asked for my AT&T account number. At this point I did not enter any number. After asking twice more, the computer gave up and said Thank You! I never lost service.
As to the phone it is really very good! Altho like all Android phones I've had it doesn't allow you to completely delete unwanted apps, or move them to the SD card memory, it does have the ability to stop updating the apps you don't want and thus save the phone's memory.
The SD micro card and the SIM both live in a pop-out tray. If you travel internationally, this feature theoretically allows you to obtain a SIM card in the place you are visiting pop it into your phone and you are ready to go.
Other reviews have panned the camera quality in low light on this phone. I can't say I've done enough pics on it to notice, but I was buying a phone, not a camera.
All in all I heavily recommend this phone and the TracFone system to anyone looking to purchase a larger smartphone for 25% of what an iPhone or Samsung costs.

I bought another 6" phone about 2 years ago, but for some reason I just didn't like it. Decided to buy this one; it's just slightly smaller (I mean maybe 1/16" in each dimension), and it's much lighter than the other. I have small hands to begin with, and arthritis in my hands and shoulders, and didn't realize that was what was putting me off about the first phone; the weight difference irritated me just enough to make it uncomfortable. All that aside, the phone has a stunning 2560px display (as good as Iphone), works beautifully, is quick as a hiccup, and the fingerprint id works on the first shot every time. The cameras do a lovely job. I got the Orzero case which fit beautifully and looks great. For the price, you can't beat this phone!

After a few days of owning the phone I have to say it is one of the best phones I've ever purchased. The only flaw I've noticed so far is the bluetooth connected issue with wifi. While I am using my bluetooth headset the rate at which it downloads data dramatically decreases. Other than that I am veeerryyy happy with the phone so far. The battery last like 2 days its amazing.

I'm a mobile electronics installer and one of the big things today is using your mobile to play music in your vehicle, which Android Auto compatible radios are designed to do. Sadly, Huawei phones do not work with Car Play. I think there should be a big notice in the description NOT COMPATIBLE WITH ANDROID CAR PLAY.

Huawei needs to stop being lazy and fix this. I would not have purchased this phone had I known this. Otherwise, I'd have given it 5 stars.

I could not tell much difference between this phone and my iPhone7Plus. It is fast, screen/picture quality outstanding, and the best part is that it has dual sim/memory slot. This is super convenient for international travelers. Works perfectly in Asia and Europe. Switching between the sims is seamless. You can also boost the memory big time with your own microSD card.

Cons: the face recognition is a slightly slower than finger print.

This phone is worth every single penny you pay.

The 1st phone had a software glitch. Screen would not stay on. No adjustment possible. Huawei offered to fix it no charge, Amazonâs superior customer service replaced it, and I sent the other one back. Itâs a great phone. Good quality, and fast. The sound it good quality, better than most, approaching Iphone quality, (and 1/3 the price), and the pictures look good to me. The apps from Huawei are also useful and good quality. So far, after getting one that works correctly, Iâm very happy with the phone, Amazonâs service, and the Huawei Company. I recommend buying this phone through Amazon.

So, after 3 months the screen became detached from the left hand side of the phone. There's a slight gap where you can see inside the phone. Note, the screen is not cracked or smashed in any way.

It looks like I have to work this out through Huawei and the process has been solw so far. I do not have much hope at this point that I'll ever get a phone that works. Currently, it's taken 3 days to process my claim and I'm still waiting for instructions on how I can send in the phone.

I bought my wife the same phone a couple of months ago and it looks like my kids need replacement phones as well. I will be looking at some other alternatives.

Awesome smart phone! Upgraded from the Honor 5x and the difference is significant and noticable. Considered the 7x but the Mate SE provided the extra RAM. Glad I made the switch and I would highly recommend!

Phone worked fine for a few months despite not getting notifications consistently. I'd receive notifications intermittently. The GPS is HORRIBLE. It takes about a minute to find my current location. That's a crucial 60 secs when being out of town. Next issue is the caller ID. It no longer works. I've done troubleshooting with my carrier and it's not their issue. I've downloaded a 3rd app which works, but the CALLER ID on the phone will not. Customer service has been useless. You win some and you lose some. This was a loss.

Bought this for our daughter who broke her iPhone but not eligible for an upgrade and no insurance. Still have to pay on a broken phone, but daughter needed one. She actually likes this one better than her iphone!! Less glitchy, and she's always liked the Android apps better. I couldn't be happier with this purchase and for the price, you can't beat it! Husband and I are seriously considering Huawei phones purchased outright instead of Samsung and monthly payments!

I've had this phone for about 5 months now and don't have a single complaint. Like others, I was skeptical at first. I've always had Samsung Galaxy phones and my current one needed upgrading, but didn't want to spend another $900 for a s9 plus.

I came across this one based on something I read on cnet and decided to give it a shot. It's completely lived up to expectations and more. Everything I do on a Samsung phone can be done on this one to the same level. It's fast, never freezes, streams videos with ease, and the sound quality is good. Battery life is great. It lasts forever. Picture quality is fine, but not as good as you'd get from a Samsung or iPhone. I don't take many pictures so I really don't care about having the best quality pictures, but it's more than adequate for me.

In short, if you're on the fence about this phone, don't be. Get it. I'll never high prices for a Samsung again when phones like this are available.

This phone is absolutely awesome. I have had a couple of galaxies in the past, the most recent being the S7 Edge, and I had more hang ups and problems with the Galaxies. The phone looks and feels really nice, the screen is beautiful, and the fingerprint scanner is great. The photo quality seems fine to me and the camera app opens very quickly so you don't miss any good shots. I have only two complaints: it has good specs and plenty of memory, but you can't install Fortnite on it, and it has the 18:9 screen ratio, so 16:9 videos have space on either size, but this is just my preference.

OMG! I will never spend $1000 on a phone again. My carrier is MetroPCs, which uses T-Mobile bands. I have no issues with LTE or phone signal whatsoever. I did make a mistake when switching SIM cards though. When I received it, I switched SIM card and it didn't work. I thought it was the phone not compatible with my carrier, but it turns out I had to call the Carrier and they will have to reactivate the SIM card using the new phone's unique ID. That took 2 minutes over phone and it was done absolutely free. Ever since then, no issues at all. So please call your carrier to inquire about the SIM card transferring to the new phone. Phone runs super fast and has the exact same internal storage amount (64GB) as my old iphone 6s that has been giving me issues charging for months. Not to mention, I can buy a SD card to extend the storage to $256GB!!! This phone has very long hours of battery and fast operation. Takes decent pictures as well. I can't believe it took me so long to switch! The only thing is that the selfie camera is not as good as my iphone, which is ok with me, since I barely take any selfies anyway.

I needed a smart phone in the mid budget range. Most are cheap with the next step up at the high range. Iâm needing only a good camera. To my surprise, daylight scenic photos match my Nikon P510. Low light photos are average. Telephoto shots are not too bad. For the price, it does near everything the $660 -$800 cell phones do. It is perfect for the average user. Sound fair but I use ear phones anyhow. Phone clarity is good. Heavy users might want to spend more to get better sound, and a Gorilla glass display with is lacking. If you depend on your phone to take wedding picture quality, this one is iffy. Youâll need to spend twice to get any better. BTY it looks just as good as the more expensive ones.

I went to downtown yesterday. My son used my phone playing games online for one hour on the way. Then I used my phone google map as my GPS for one hour. My son played games during lunch time and break time. I took some photos at night. Then it was still 50% power left when we got on the train. My son watched videos for a hour on the train. It was 40% power left when we arrived home. Cool! It is in winter. My previous Samsung phone never had such long standby time. Moreover, charging battery is super fast. I am very happy with it. However, about taking pictures, the phone has an automatic beautification function. Although I turned off the beautification function, but in the pic the human skin is still too smooth, and even my lunch is beautified. This, I don't really like it.

I will update this review in a few weeks if necessary but so far I am absolutely happy with this phone. I had to get a new sim card bc my previous phone carried a different size. I went to my current carrier MetroPCS and dropped $15 for the card and they tested that the phone worked which all took about 5-7 minutes.

The phone takes great low light pictures. I understand that the latest model is amazing but this was what my budget could afford now. Google Playstore is accessible and I haven't had any issues with any of my previous used apps.

I crossed my fingers on this purchase. I am so far very glad on the outcome.

This phone is absolutely a great choice. They call this a budget cellphone? The Huawei Mate SE is solid and well made. It's made better than most expensive cellphones. The screen is crystal clear and vibrant. The bluetooth and call quality is excellent on AT&T's network. So many great features to name on here. I rate it an A+ in my opinion. My only con is the battery probably won't last you all day if you're a heavy user like myself. Charging the Huawei Mate SE is pretty quick though. The Huawei Mate SE is another winner at a reasonable price!

Very happy with this Huawei Mate SE purchase! The overall quality is excellent especially for a $200 phone.
The main feature I value is the 4GB of Ram. Apps run well, internet pages load quickly, app update installs are quick, etc. The local storage allows many multiple apps to be installed along with videos, music, etc, Additionally I use Nova Launcher instead of the native one and there is no lag whatsoever.

Other features I like include:
- Being able to access the SD card without opening case
- There is a 3mm headphone jack
- The fingerprint reader is lightening fast
- The screen size is large enough to comfortably watch videos while not making the phone so large so it is unwieldy
- Screen resolution, camera quality, sound quality are all great especially at this price.

This phone exceeded my expectations. Plus it looks sleek especially in the gold color. The Huawei Mate SE has the same external design as the Huawei Honor 7x model which was a wide selling phone. This means that many accessories designed to work with the Honor 7x will also work with the Mate SE.

I've had the Huawei Mate SE for about three months and highly recommend it if you're looking for a $200 - $250 cell phone with excellent quality and great selection of features.

I've had this phone for just under 3 months. After only having flagships (iPhone, Samsung & LG), I am very happy with this phone.

The only thing I am unhappy about is no NFC. But for the $224 I paid, I can't really complain. Also, I knew going in the camera was not flagship quality. I don't really use it that often, so I am ok with that. This might be a concern for others.

I find it to be a fast and responsive phone. The battery life is great. The screen is fine. Battery life is excellent. I can leave it unplugged over night at 100% and it's going to be at 98% when I wake up 7 hours later.

I'm with T-Mobile and it works well with their signal. Voice calls have been 100% relaible. It should be noted, I live in a large city

I've had the Huawei mediapad m3 for one year and now the Mate SE. I plan on getting a Huawei flagship for my next phone. I can't say enough about my user experience with Huawei products. I figure I will get a Huawei flagship one iteration behind for $300 and I know I'll be very happy.

Having been an iphone user for the past 10 years, I have to say this is easily the best phone I've ever owned. The display is simply stunning, the battery lasts forever, apps run very fast and smooth. The battery lasts days on a single charge.
I especially love the selfie cam, it performs amazingly well in low light environments. My understanding is that when you take a selfie with it, it actually takes a bunch of pics behind the scene and use AI to select the one that looks best. I know it's weird but I always get the most natural facial expression when I take pics with this phone.
Overall, I think this phone feels even more premium than iPhone X. The only thing that bothers me a little is the lack of apple's iMessage. But if you are an android fan, this is a very solid choice.

Great phone for a great price.
-Beautiful, vivid screen, great for viewing videos and games
-Sleek, attractive design, easy to operate with one hand
-Responsive finger print unlock is super convenient and time saving
-Lots of space left even after built-in apps (about 48gb free out of 64gb)
-Screen flash means low light selfies are better than my previous phones
-Front facing camera takes good quality photos
-Battery lasts ALL day with consistent use on WiFi
-Comes with clear, jelly case which does a fair job of protecting the phone without obscuring its beautiful design (wouldn't count on it to protect against drops, however)

One weakness:
-Built in speakers are not great quality: a bit hollow, tinny sounding and not super loud (although usually use my headphones or bluetooth speakers, so this does not bother me)

Would definitely recommend to a friend.

I ordered this phone because of the price it featured the components I liked . Behold the feel weight and form felt right to me much higher quality than expected . screen viewing is average build is excellent . nothing out of the ordinary just feels like a quality product.i was overcome with a feeling of lucky pride to have this phone in my possession.i set up the accounts this was above the price category it was smooth responsive and fast. Not the fastest I encountered but fast as I could go great pace and fluidity.its been a few days since I have first ran it.no flaw's of any kind.it had I believe in house computer processers . excuse my lingo. I like company's that stand by there crations this brand seemed to houner that stand.verry nice I will have to get some of the other phones and products in the future .I truly appreciate this phone because it is original in it's presentation.it has instructions on the back kudos to the design engineer and company for taking an out of the box idea and creatiand marketing this phone.i love it it is among my most recap need at this price range.love and peace out miles

Replaced my nearly 3 year old LG G4 with this phone. Didn't want to pay flagship prices for a phone I am only going to own for another 3 years. Saw the reviews on this phone and decided "why not?" Have had this phone for 2 months now and not regretting the decision at all! Am new to the brand and it's very easy to learn (it is Android-based). Removed some of the pre-installed software that came with the phone that I wasn't going to use. I've taken some really good pics with this phone, without having to play around with the advanced settings. The phone is fast while navigating different apps as well! I'm heavy on Facebook, Yahoo Finance, YouTube, Mail, and Google. Sound using the phone speakers could be better. The volume seems a bit low. However, when connected to a headset or Bluetooth device, is quite good. The best part of this phone, you ask? The BATTERY LIFE!! I only need to charge this phone every 2 DAYS! Hopefully the battery life stays like that for a while. So I am pretty happy with this phone. Glad I purchased! :-)

After months of researching a new phone I finally decided on this one. It has met all of my needs and beyond. Quality is top notch, screen is beautiful, plenty of storage space, smooth OS and the camera is spectacular(added some pics to review). I'm extremely happy with this purchase!

Only issue is you cannot play audio externally via an auxiliary cable. I purchased a Bluetooth adapter for my car though and that solved the problem.

After almost 3 months of use, I will say I am somehow satisfied with this phone. My biggest problem is the speaker, it's so low, many time I have had to switch speaker off because it's either too low, poor sound quality. Another problem I am beginning to face is the battery life. I am not a heavy user but little games like free cell or buble mania will run the battery down so fast! Takes nice pictures better than my old phone, I am still to experience glitches, crashes! I know it's still early for me to give a full review on everything, still learning things about it! Overall, it does what a phone is supposed to for now! Fingers crossed. Thank you.

The phone was really good but had one issue. The touch screen was very laggy. I am not sure if it was only an issue with the one I received because I did not see this in the reviews but the lag was bad enough for me to return it the same day. I would have loved to keep it for the configuration and the features.

I owned the honor 7 before this phone and it was really impressive however I had to give it to my brother as he was leaving for school ( he too was and is still impressed). I decided to upgrade to the 64 gb 4 GB ram mate se and I have never regretted it. This phone has the feeland performance of a much more expensive handset ,my only gripe is that the sound is a bit low but the headphone jack makes up for that I would easily buy this phone again and again without hesitation

The screen is great, good viewing angles, and despite not being in the 'right' aspect ratio for watching 16:9 videos it has above average clarity. Battery lasts for more than a day on a single charge, which is really important for me as I travel long distances and can't afford much downtime.
Camera is alright, quality is definitely in the ballpark of other dual-camera configs. Front camera is meh, good enough for Snapchat but don't expect much.
Finger print sensor is snappy and quick.
WLAN connectivity is eh. You don't get AC wifi on this so you won't be able to utilize the full potential of your wifi if it's faster than 30mbps. Doesn't matter because I don't need that much bandwidth.
The only complaint I have is that EMUI is complete garbage. Installed a third party launcher within 5 minutes of using it. Largest complaint is that it doesn't show the number of notifications I have on the icons, instead it just shows a single red dot and expect me to click on it and check it myself. Comes with minimal amount of bloatware that can be manually removed.
Rubbish speakers, but I don't go anywhere without my bluetooth stereo so they don't matter to me.

For the budget you are actually getting a very good deal. Yeah some compromises here and there but $200 is $200.

I've had this phone for one week so far. It arrived with a hairline crack, but I had to use it as my other phone was not functioning. I've ordered a replacement so hopefully it goes well with return. My review is based on the phones performance, not this crack. AT&T. It works perfectly. The camera is excellent in good lighting. Low light it lacks but for the price I certainly can't complain. The fingerprint sensor is lightning fast. It's fast. Has plenty of storage, which is expandable with the SD card. Buy this phone.
This phone is amazing I love it,the battery life is really good been using it for 4 days now . Awesome ððððð

I am usually a Samsung shoper, I decided to make the switch because I was tired of the high phone payments and the plan payments. So when time came to buy a new phone, I decided to buy a budget phone, I was expecting a downgrade but I so no difference quite the opposite, this was better than the expensive samsungs. The battery life is great, I didn't have to charge it everynight, unless I play video games with it :) ... The useability is awesome very slick and fast processor and the price is where I need it to be. My wife says that pic quality is much better on Samsung but for that price I am fine with this.

*updated to reflect over 7 months of usage*

Pros:
-large storage
-large screen with great image (until con- screen burn chances!)
-long battery life
-many camera options (*does not mean great results)
-Dual Sim (I don't use but for those who do...)

Cons:
-screenburn after about 8 months
-bloatware
-no 5g Wi-Fi connectivity (other budget phones have this so I think it's a fair comparison)
-sound (tiny speaker--alarms can be a challenge to hear!)
-Bluetooth (constant interruptions and need to reconnect after extended periods of time)
-incompatible with Android Auto
-many apps require you to perform special go arounds for them to work (pill reminder, TrueCaller to name a few)
-camera software takes awkward selfies (weird proportions, unclear)
-no fast charge abilities

Summary:
I purchased this to replace my Moto. I was most hoping for at least a similar experience however while there are some great aspects (screen, battery life) I found there to be many things surprisingly lacking.

But first let me start with the good so this review isn't all gloom! The battery life is amazing, and I do love the screen size and quality. Transferring files was an easy, though long, process (took about 4 hours despite the 2 hour estimated time) to help make my phone switch rather seemless. The phone is responsive and I'm enjoying the large memory--both ROM and RAM.

*note that this phone uses Nano Sim cards so you will possibly need to change your Sim card out if use another size*

Within the first day I was disappointed at the amount of bloatware. Besides some huawei apps you can't remove there are also some Android apps you are stuck with (Gmail being an example). I also found the speaker quality to be highly disappointing. Being on the bottom edge of the phone the sound is rather quiet and doesn't sound as clear as other phones.

Within the first week the disappointments continued. The selfie camera is not really useful--most always blurry and at times the aspect ratio would leave photos distorted. No 5G WiFi I can live with, but I miss having the option to connect to another network. Certain apps are incompatible with Huawei devices and others require you to go in to your settings and follow a series of steps just to get important notifications to work (specifically my pill reminder app, Medisafe, cannot remind me of pills automatically; TrueCaller cannot scan phone calls actively without special changes to settings). Also I have found the alarm app to be unreliable due to the poor, low speaker quality I've have missed several of the-something I have not had a problem with when using other devices.

And within a month of use I was also bummed to find that Android Auto does not work with this-or most all Huawei - phone. Using Bluetooth I had to become used to songs cutting out sporadically for a few seconds and after about 40+ minutes of use the signal would stop completely requiring a reset of Bluetooth on the device.

After 7 months Bluetooth continues to be a disappointment with increases in not connecting to other devices (especially car). Then I was surprised to find it get screen burn- I didn't realize that was still a thing but apparently so. Tried several apps that were to help. Didn't seem to quite work, perhaps over time it'll get better--but the way things are going with this phone it'll probably get worse.

Overall while at first the price point was attractive, as more aspects disappointed me I have come to realize this switch was not a very good one. Can I live with it? I can, and need to, but with other budget phones having many of these features I think this will be the first, and last, huawei phone I purchase. There are definitely better options in this price range out there if you're someone who uses a phone beyond battery life and general practical use.

I just got the phone for barely over 24 hours but so far I am impressed with it. The only features that I wish it had are 1. dual band WiFi, 2. stereo speaker and 3. NFC. None of these are deal breaker for me and I am very happy with the purchase. I will report back if something go wrong after a few months of use.

An interesting thing is when I received the package, it is obvious to me right away that somewhere along the delivery process someone has opened the box and inspect the contents since the phone is all by itself and not in the original white Huawei box. But the phone is in good shape and didn't seem there is any missing parts or accessories. I guess instead of worrying about the Chinese government is spying on my phone, I now may have to worry about FBI/NSA/CIA may have bugged my phone :)

A beautiful, very capable Android smartphone for $230, a fraction of flagship phones! Looks nice, performs well, and quick. I have not enabled its phone-use capabilities yet, so can't comment on it until I do. I am currently only using it at home with my WiFi network for surfing and entertainment uses. Great purchase.
8/14/18 Update: I've obtained a prepaid cell phone service provider who uses Verizon's network about 3 weeks ago. The phone is working nicely.

I got sick of paying for OVERPRICED cell phones. My 6 month search for the best budget phone is now complete. In fact I am blown away by the features this phone has... Huge 6 inch screen, amazing battery life, 8 core CPU, 64 GB storage, 4GB memory, super fast finger print reader, FACE UNLOCK ID, Android 8.0, aluminum construction! Dual SIM card slot, expandable storage, camera is pretty decent. All for only $229 Goodbye Apple and Samsung....

I haven't noticed many issues, sound quality is okay, not paying high price so I didn't expect much. Not waterproof, never owned a waterproof phone so I don't care much about that feature.

Had it for over a month now. It's holding up. No problems yet, or at least no significant problems. I use T-Mobile on this phone and it works, however I'm getting delayed text messages. Not sure if it's from TMobile because I contacted them and they said their nearby towers are all working fine and they reset my service or my connection and I'm still getting this problem from time to time. Not 100% blaming it on the phone yet, this is just something I've noticed.

I purchased this to replace my Note 3. I enjoy it a lot. This phone has many options like turning off mobile data but keeping the regular cell services on; which my Note 3 said it did but it didn't work correctly. The pictures are wonderful and it is well designed. It tells me when apps are using a lot of battery which I like to know. Many apps are not made for such a long screen though so it asks every time I open an app to make it full screen or not (not a pop up, just an option at the bottom of the screen) which is obnoxious.

Technology is at the point where purchasing a cell phone for $800+ is no longer a necessity if you want a quality device. So many manufacturers are creating devices at budget friendly prices that are quite comparable to the more expensive ones. And, the Huawei device for perfectly into the budget friendly category. Granted, it can't do EVERYTHING the newest device on the market can do, but honestly ask yourself - do you use ALL those features. I, personally, do not, so the Mate SE suits me just fine. It is a great price for such a well made, well functioning phone. I've had it for almost two months now, and I have had no issue whatsoever with it. And, if you care about the version of operating system your phone is running, this phone I'd upgradable to Android 8.0 - Oreo. Seriously recommend this phone if you are budget conscious, and desire good quality.

Had a Samsung S4 prior to purchasing this phone. It was becoming obsolete, apps would not work on it. After reading all the reviews on many phones, decided on the Huawei Mate SE, so happy with it, fast response, great battery, never runs out. Love all the features. The tip section is great as you don't get much of an instruction manual with it. My husband bought one also after seeing mine.

The phone is fast and has a lot of storage. However, the camera sucks. The pictures are grainy and don't have enough clarity. I'm coming from having a Moto x pure for two yrs which has a 21 mp camera with really decent pictures. Also, the phone doesn't have quick charging. Overall, it's not bad for the price but I feel like I'm taking pictures with a 10 yr old flip phone

This is the one to get. Price is right. Not looking buy the latest flagship phone. I compared my old iPhone 5 to the Blu Vivo recently and It went terribly. See my Vivo review. 2 Gb ram vivo was no competitions in performance to my iPhone 5. 4 Gb ram Huawei Mate did the trick. Itâs fast enough and does everything the flagship phones can do at a quarter of the price. No problems connecting to Bluetooth in my car. Iâm able to move files from my Mate SE to a usb drive with no problems. Big screen, good sound a sturdy build, fast performance, GPS, great camera, and an FM RADIO (a trick iPhones canât do) Iâve found my new âDaily Driverâ.

This phone has massive storage. I recently owned a Samsung 5 and it feels great to be able to put any app I want on it without deleting another. The sound the speaker gives off is loud and clear as well. I had the phone next to my portable speaker and I thought my portable was on and it wasn't. Camera works great as well. Way better than my Samsung 5. Since that was my last phone that's all I can compare it to. Update to Android 8 was very easy because it prompted me to do so, pretty much just a tap away. I would recommend this phone to anyone who hates contracts and wants a lot storage while having a solid camera. Only 2 dislikes for me. 1. The speaker phone itself isn't as loud as my Samsung was even though playing music and watching videos blows it away. 2. I have to hit the back button to remove the keyboard while using messenger. This just means I have to hit back 2x to get out of anything I'm typing. Kind of a plus and minus because sometimes when you want the keyboard to go away on a Samsung 5 its difficult, at least for me.

Apparently $200 for a phone has is considered in the lower end price range.
It has a battery that last around 2 days, nice display screen, and good sound. It seems well made and has a lot of great functions.

This is a beautiful, powerful, amazing smartphone, with similar or better quality than phones of several times of price. Long lasting battery, super performance, great pictures, comfortable design and touch. Phone is cool while playing videos. Setup is so easy. Dual Sim. PERFECT size. Fingerprint unlocking works flawlessly. The only drawback in my opinion is that the battery is built into the phone and may be hard to be exchanged by the consumer. This phone is a great addition to the US phone market for consumers to choose.

I think its a great deal, a very good phone. No complaints except that it comes with a protective case in its factory box. It should be mentioned and leave the choice to customer to order another one if they like. I did not see a warranty card or booklet in the box i am going to check if it really carries the warranty or not. I don't want to make it an issue So ! thank you .

I bought it for my daughter, and she likes it a lot. This phone is fast, it always gets the strongest wifi signal compared with 4 other phones in my home. Some people complaint about the camera, but I think the pictures took by the phone is pretty good. You even can use Facial ID to unlock the phone. For some reason, used the GPS on Google map didn't work at first, after I restarted the phone a couple of times, it works very well now. Thanks Huawei for making such a nice phone at such a reasonable price. I hope the Honor 8x will be here soon.

I've been using this phone for the past few weeks and I can't say anything bad about it. Big screen, fast processor, enough RAM and an SD card expansion slot to store plenty of music and video files. The speaker is loud enough and the battery lasts for a long time.
Keep in mind that this is a $230 phone so you will not get all the bells and whistles that other expensive brands have. Personally, I don't care about those extra features because I don't use them anyway. I'm very pleased with this purchase.

Absolutely stellar phone for the price!
My last five personal phones were all Samsung Galaxies. After almost purchasing the new Samsung Note ($1000),I decided to give this highly reviewed and affordable phone a shot first.
I am extremely happy that I did as I am absolutely astounded that a phone of this capability and capacity is available at this price.
I installed my favorite launcher (Smart Launcher) and I was all set.
Great speed, great pics, ultra fast fingerprint sensor, and all around fantastic piece of equipment.
Definitely recommend this affordable powerhouse of a phone.

Its literally an iPhone for a 1/4 the cost. The fingerprint is amazing, three months in the processing is fine, the battery is leagues beyond apple. The sound quality is ok and the volume variability is absolutely abysmal. I use a samsung tablet in my car for spotify instead of my phone. It works ok enough when paired with my powerbeats3 since they can boost the volume too but the loud is too soft and the soft isn't soft enough. Picture quality is good. Literally everything else is good except the sound, but hey saving $600 on an off brand iPhone.

My phone was shattered for a while before it finally died, died and I was forced to buy a new phone. I spent forever reading reviews and trying to decide. This phone has met every expectation and then some. I didn't want to spend $500+ for a phone that would last maybe 2 years. Plus, I don't really care about technology. That being said, I travel a lot and wanted a phone that took good pictures, this one meets that requirement. My boyfriend and I compared pictures on this vs. Samsung S7 and I think mine came out sharper and more vibrant. I'm happy with this phone!

After using a LG G3 for years, this was a great upgrade, despite it's consideration as a cheap device. For one, the fingerprint sensor, which is fast, is located on the back, similar to the back located button on the G3. Second, it has more RAM and storage with expandable support for up to 256 GB. Only downside is no removable battery. Speaking of the battery it is large and easily lasts all day. Overall, a snappy device that is a steal at the price I paid.

Seems to be running faster and better than Nuu G3. I like small,4 inch phones which are probably no longer available. Even thou it says 18:9 aspect ratio, they must mean the viewing screen and not what is actually in your hand. Nuu G3 is smaller width wise. Mate SE has pretty much the same width compared to HTC Desire eye from 2 years ago. The glass is curved on the side much like Galaxy S9. So a glass screen protector could have problems with the sides. Original clear silicone case that came with phone protects the glass screen when you place it glass down on a surface. Doesn't have a color reverse, which turns white into black when using it at night. But then every color gets reversed.

If you're looking for a new Android phone and don't want to pay the ridiculous prices for a Samsung or LG or all the others charge, this might be a good option for you. But be advised, the camera / picture quality is not great compared to an iPhone 7 / iPhone 8 or Samsung. I did a comparison this weekend at my son's football game and this phone does not measure up to the quality and resolution that even my old 2014 Motorola Nexus 6 offered. The pictures are OK but not great. You might want to spend a little more to get a better camera section if pictures are a top priority. Everything else on the phone is great. A+ lightweight, nice touch screen, runs fast and has plenty of storage. Overall Rating is 4 stars.

In general I love the phone. However I began to notice a problem with notification with two apps. One is ebay the second is my ring doorbell app. For one the ringdoor bell app is missing the app ring tone page to customize notification. Spoke to RIng and he mention this is a problem with certain phone, though he did not mention Huawei in particularly. Also missed some Ring notification until I manually brought up the app. My ebay notification for some reason have stopped working. I have adjusted battery optimization and notification setting for ebay app and got it to work once and then stopped again. Still working on the these two problems. I have noticed searching the web that other people have complained about the same problem with Huawei phones in general. If I can get this resolve I will have to buy a different phone.

update 12/17/18
I seem to have gotten the notifications working again. You have the adjust the battery optimization settings on a per app basis. I have set ebay to manual control in the battery optimization. I started receiving notification again.

Great "budget" smartphone! I've had an LG Stylo 3, ZTE Z Max Pro, LG G3, and iPhone 4, and now this Huawei Mate SE is definitely one of the best smartphones I've had. Runs fast and smooth, looks great, battery life is decent (but could be a little better imo), speaker quality and call quality are sufficient. The screen looks awesome and the interface is very responsive on all apps so far! I was in between this and the Honor 7X and from what I've read so far I'm happy with my decision. I'm using MetroPCS as phone carrier. Really enjoy this phone and I'm looking forward to the update to Android 8 Oreo (EMUI 8)!

UPDATE: I received the update to Android 8 Oreo/EMUI 8!! This is a great phone for a great price! :)

Great phone, everything works and now with Oreo it runs even smoother. Multitasking( nav in small window while I browse home) and split windows work smoothly. I had honor 5x prior to this phone and I am quite happy with the purchase. I play emulators for the psone and psp in this phone. Works great so far only psp games have some sound and lag issues now and then.

I've only ever had cheap phones, and this too can be considered a cheap phone by some, but the quality is outstanding. I love the fingerprint sensor feature and the large screen. It also runs many apps without lagging and the battery seems to last forever which is surprising since I seem to be on my phone 24/7. The picture quality is still very good -not $1000 iPhone quality- but it has a multitude of cool filters to choose from. It is also not exactly a device I would play music on without headphones because the sound is tinny. I bought a wallet case and a screen protector for this phone. The screen protector may make the screen a little less sensitive, and it is also sometimes hard to unlock the phone via fingerprint because of the case, but I find that these add ons make using this phone more convenient overall.

I went to Bestbuy to buy this phone after looking at it on their display lineup and they no longer have it in stock. At all. They don't sell it anymore so I bought it from Amazon. Great phone with great specs. It is fast and smooth. The camera is great. Low light can be bad but there is an option to lighten up the photo if you tap on the screen before you take the picture. Nice big screen, thin and only 250 bucks. I will never sign a contract where I pay monthly for a phone and then through the nose for a plan as long as I can find homes like this one. Only downside is it is operating Android 7.0. so sending a gif in a text is not possible. Not a deal breaker but annoying. Waiting for the update.

I set this up to wake up the phone or answer calls using the finger print scanner. It works every time! Display is beautiful and responsive. My wife and I both have Huawei phones and love them. Great bang for your buck.

Best budget phone in my opinion. Got to try this for half a day when it was sent after cancelling my order.(waiting for the Huawei View).
As with other reviewers, this is smooth as butter, fast, and just beautiful. I read issues about the wifi slowing down when using bluetooth , which I confirmed to be true, but not that bad compared to my Note 5 which slows down too when using both. If not for the upcoming release of the other Mate 10 Pro variant, I would have kept this one. If the "View" won't impress me, I might just reorder this one again.

Everything works as intended on this phone, camera stabilization isn't what I was used to, however given the price point and coming from a flagship this was more than acceptable since I don't take many pictures. battery lasts me a good 3 days of normal use, 4 if skip out playing games on my lunch break. Got it used with a minor scratch on the rear. You will need a case of some kind as the phone feels slick with dry hands, which thankfully it came with a clear rubber one. update pushes have been steady and feels like they push more updates than my old phone which I'm grateful for, makes me feel like the product will continue to be supported rather than left and forgotten after a year. The finger print reader is hella fast and 90%+ it gets it the first time even with sloppy pressing.

Very affordable phone with big screen and fast processor. I don't play games on my phone, but it's got more than enough juice to handle Netflix and Youtube. The call quality is great. The fingerprint sensor on the back is very fast. The only negative is that I could do more with the fingerprint sensor on my old Honor 5. On my old phone, I could launch different apps using different fingerprints, so that made it very convenient to make calls and play music on the fly. This phone doesn't seem to offer this function, otherwise it would be a 5-star rating.

Love this phone! I have had it for several months. This is the first non flagship phone that I have owned. The only thing it is missing is NFC, which I don't use anyway. Bloatware is almost non existent. User interface is smooth. Phone is plenty powerful. Camera is acceptable. The phone is a nice size. The screen, while not OLED, is of solid quality. I love that it has a micro SD card slot, although if we are being honest, is not as big of a deal as it once was. My experience with this phone has been so positive that my Sister and Dad have both purchased one too. Solid purchase.

Had this product for many months now and have loved using it so far. Very snappy and great value for the price. I recently noticed my fingerprint sensor not registering very well and called Huawei's customer service, and they instantly let me send the item to them for repair free of charge and with free shipping! :)

This phone is overall amazing for it's price! As everyone said in the reviews section, the pros of this phone are quite exemplary. Amazing interface the phone is lightweight, and everything is just good. Understand that the good comes with the bad and this phone has some bad features such as sometimes poor camera quality.

I really don't know much about phones. I've been an Apple user and this was such a different kind of place, but a good kind of place you know? I'm really surprised with this phone though. I've abused it so much (dropped it, installed some extensive things, sat on it, used it for 20 hours no break) but this phone didn't seem to become worn. Everytime the phone faces adversity, it kept plowing through and just kept working. Even though there were some times that it had froze or shut done unexpectedly, I believe it was my fault for overdoing it a little bit too much.

So yeah! I love this phone and wouldn't want to part with it! It has everything I need and want and that's good!

I love this phone. Great features for a fraction of what Samsung and Apple would charge for a similar unit. Of course, these expensive brands will give you a better camera when it comes to image quality but the Huawei camera on this phone is great and with the rest of the features, ram, storage, etc, you can not go wrong!!! I would buy it again and probably my next phone will be a Huawei.

I've only had this phone for 2 weeks but I couldn't be more pleased. I bought this phone to replace the Oukitel Ok6000 which I had for about two weeks and dropped from about a foot and the screen cracked and I'm happy it did because then I bought this phone which was supposed to be my work phone but I have since switched the SIM cards and made this my primary phone and made my Samsung Galaxy s9($950) my secondary phone. In my opinion this phone is better than the Samsung and for $700 less if I had only known. The only question left for me is will it last and I would guess that it will being it appears to be well made with quality materials. I would definitely buy this phone again and would highly recommend this product!

I can get reception where my wife's iPhones can't. For the price, this is the best smart phone I have ever had. I have had iPhone and Samsung before this and I'm sticking with this brand. Battery lasts longer too.

Overall I really like this phone. Haven't had any issues with it, has lots of storage space, fast, fingerprint works. By far my best phone yet. Thinking about upgrading to an iPhone but honestly this phone is close to just as good so it's hard to think about switching when this works fine. Only gripe is the text messaging wouldn't send pictures, I had to install another texting app and that sends them as a group message to the sender and sends my text back to me as well which is annoying but that's more of a software issues. Want to root it but it seems tricky to unlock it. Has a little bit of bloatware but nothing much. Overall a great deal for the money. Any other brand Android would cost about twice as much for a phone this good.

This is a fantastic phone! Compared to ANY phone in this price range, it is the best! Not sure I'm a "power user" but I use a lot of graphics and drawing apps, as well as a highly-customized launcher and keypad. As reasonably priced as this phone is, $250+ is still a big purchase for me. And this is one that I am very happy to have made!

Haven't experienced a "con" yet. And the Oreo update rolled out last week!

I went from an LG V10 to this Huawei Mate SE. My LG V10 failed on me twice. This Huawei phone is already miles ahead of my LG product. If you want an excellent phone at a great price, look no further. This thing puts phones at three times the price to shame. Good job on this one Huawei. I'm not brand loyal by any means. I've had Sony, Samsung, HTC, LG and other smartphones, but if Huawei keeps this kind of quality product and prices, they've just made a customer for life.

Transitioned to this from a galaxy s6. This is an amazing budget phone, you can't beat it at the price. Much better than the honor 7x as you get an extra gig of ram and twice the storage. Great battery life, beatiful screen

My only complaints:
Screen scratches easily. I've constantly used tempered glass screen protectors to help stop that.
Still no Oreo update in May of 2018.. but it is supposed to be here anytime.
App crashed are random.. far in between, but random and unexpected.

Got an additional one for my wife and talking my grandmother into transitioning from her galaxy s5 to this too.

Excellent phone...I have on At&t and works great ...Yes I have 4G LTE ..The speed is better than any phone out there..Looks really nice..you get so much its worth it... First you get 64 GB alone then 4 gig of Ram.. also it updated to Android Oreo....listen plain and simple want a phone with all stuff you need get this phone

Note : no NFC ..but I don't use google pay..and the battery is not removable...but for me who cares the price is right.

For $229 ..You Can't complain.

The Huawei Mate SE is the best budget phone I've ever purchased. For $229 is was an absolute steal. The phone arrived quickly and was packaged nicely. Everything about it says high quality. The free case they throw in is good quality, fits well, and looks nice. The build quality on this phone looks nice and is very solid. That being said the phone is very light and feels good in the hand. The screen quality of the display is also very nice and it gets very bright in direct sunlight for easy readability. The operating system is filled with options and is not limited like other budget devices. Sound quality is very good and call quality is excellent. On T-Mobile I have had less calls drop then on the Moto Z2 Force which was purchased through T-Mobile. WiFi works extremely well even without the ability to use 5G WiFi. Overall, I recommend this phone to anyone who wants a great budget device or primary device at a great price. This is my new daily driver.

I use my phone primarily to listen to music, videos, podcasts, and audio books, both with and without headphones or bluetooth. My old LG G4 for $250 has a great speaker and this phone was no where close to the same speaker quality. The speaker on this phone is quiet, shrill, and very poor quality even when using the headphone jack. I returned it.

If you're tech savy enough you can pretty much have the best of ios and the best of android on this phone with ease. Since hauwei did the first pixel. You know, the pixel that actually worked properly. I'm not surprised at all at what a wonderful job they've done with this phone. Ill be a customer for life if they can keep this up. Even replacing it once a year at this price beats buying 1 flagship. You can break it 4 times and replace it. You can also have the same experience during that time frame but for much cheaperIt might not be ip rated or having wireless charging or a fast charging butttttttt. It's got everything else. It's brilliant.

This is a pretty good Android phone. The fingertip lock is in a weird place, on the back of the phone, but after a while you get used to that. My big beef with this phone is that, no matter what I try, the sound for an incoming text message is so faint as to be almost indeciperable. And when you're waiting for a text, that is an important feature. My late iPhone had a nice clear bell tone that was easy to hear, but this phone just doesn't seem to have the capacity for a loud text alert. If anyone else has solved this problem, I'd love to hear about it. Otherwise, I'm happy with itl

I've been using this phone for around 10 months now and so far I am pretty happy with it. Given the price, this phone is amazing. Fast, fluid and not heavy at all. The only thing I can tell the doesn't work very well is the automatic turn off of the screen when you're calling: sometimes the screen turns on and you realize you've accidentaly opened some of the apps, or turn on/off the wifi/Bluetooth/etc.

Pros:
* Excellent screen size
* 64GB space/4GB RAM
* Great battery life
* Beautiful display
* Runs fast and smooth with the 2.36GHz octa-core processor
* Bang for your $$
Cons:
* Cannot pick up my GPS signal after about 4 months of use
* Disappointed with GSM only, I've had terrible luck with AT&T
* Camera's not bad for the price but I'm not impressed with the picture quality in low light
Honestly not everything it's made out to be. It is aesthetically pleasing, and good for the price. But the camera isn't all that and it runs like shit after like 6 months.

Love the phone! Specially once updated to Android Oreo it's definitely the best phone in this price range and above period! Can do stuff even my friends with iPhones are jeleous! Camera is good, fuzzy in low light though but definitely good in normal/well lit places. The quality of this phone is amazing I paired it off with some all metal gray ziomi headphones and couldn't he happier! The grey metallic shine definitely makes it feel like it's a good quality build, also like the fact that it came with a clear gel case. Face and fingerprint recognition is super fast. Works with Cricket and has plenty of options. I know the huwai OS/UI can be a hit or miss but I enjoy it simple but can be customized to suit your likings like androids. 64gb and the ability to upgrade to 256gb down the road is a huge plus! Love the fact that I can videos in small screen formal while using the internet or another app, super useful!

Odd thing I noticed after using this phone for a few days: I'm left handed, therefore I hold the phone with my left hand and support it with my right thumb.
Unfortunately the speaker is exactly in the spot where my thumb goes on the bottom. I keep turning up the volume, wondering why the sound is so low. Then I move my thumb and it's loud.

No other issues I can think of yet after using it for less than a week. Will update later if anything comes up.

I've only been using this phone for a week, but the first impression couldn't be better. Fast, reliable and, even though I'm not a photographer, I think that pictures are more than decent. Screen is big and bright, nice resolution. Totally worth it considering the price point.

I chose to switch to the Huawei mate se after a TON of research. I've had it alitte over 7 months now and couldn't be happier. The battery life is amazing. The picture quality it amazing. The price is amazing. The phone itself is amazing! This is the brand I will chose from now on. I switched from an iPhone and will never go back or buy a phone over $300 again.

I purchased this for my wife for Christmas. My research on this product was it had a larger batter a good battery life, it did not disappoint. She primarily used the phone for calls, text and occasional photo. The battery last for 4 or 5 days. She is very happy. Happy wife happy life ð. We would recommend this product. As for the 4 stars for picture quality i am not sure if is the camera or our ability to use it properly. We have taken some very good pictures and some not so good. We are leaning on we need more practice.

The device is a premium built device. Display quality is also very good. However, the sound quality is poor. At it's loudest the speaker sounds muffle and distorted.
