My only other gripe is that when I am downloading files (personal privately owned) and try to play a video simultaneously the video freezes. This never happened with my P9 lite which only had 2GB memory.

Like it so far. A bit slower on some games than iPhone 8, some weird patterning issues in background stuff, can't change notification volumes without changing ringtone volumes.
Nice weight, nice size.
Color palette is a rude awakening after Basic Amoled Galaxy for the past 5 years. Hurts my eyes a bit even with eye safe setting and twilight. No auto-stabilizing on video and photo. This is a biggie if you like to take photos. Still a good camera, though, even if low-light (as many people have said) is not good. Battery? Better by far for certain games than a similarly aged iPHone 8. Lighter than iphone 8 even with the Spigen case on. REALLY light with the provided Huawei case on. Overall, a good deal on a great phone. No real complaints.

After a month I'm very happy with the Mate SE, much more so than the Honor 6X (which I returned). Bright screen, always super fast, uses the 4G LTE bands that AT&T operates on in my area, really good call quality, more than ample storage, decent-or-better camera, and the EMUI is more customizable than the Honor 6X's version. The fingerprint sensor is a welcome time saver.

The phone has only two mild downsides for me: 1. The media speaker placement and volume aren't great, but they aren't horrible either, and I don't need booming speakers from a phone. 2. The notification LED didn't work until I downloaded, installed and configured the Light Flow app. Now the LED works. It's small and dim compared to what I was used to, but it's visible enough.

The Mate SE ships with a case but I opted to buy a tougher one, the Spigen. https://www.amazon.com/Spigen-Rugged-Huawei-Resilient-Absorption/dp/B076V3D2F5/ref=sr_1_2?s=wireless&ie=UTF8&qid=1529708632&sr=1-2&keywords=huawei+mate+se+spigen Glad I did. Dropping phones had been rare for me, but I managed to drop this one twice in only a month, and with no ill effects on it. Would the standard case have protected it? I'll never know and I don't care. I trust the case I bought.

Seriously, this is the best cell phone I've had. My last phone was an LGG4 and this phone is light years better. I don't read much into the whole US government vs Huawei bs. if you are looking for a premium phone at a budget price, this is the phone to buy.

I have been very impressed by this phone, I have been using it for the past 3 months and have only good things to say about it. People also are very impressed by the design some believing its an iPhone. It clearly has an iPhone design its very sleek and light, the fingerprint sensor is super fast. You cant go wrong with this phone.

This Mate SE is my second Huawei and has a few shortcomings. It will not access a 5G wireless router whereas my 5 yr old Mate 2 would do so. The battery life is shorter than my Mate 2, but not a real problem.
Having said that, in other ways, the Mate SE is superior. The display is clearer; the colors more vivid, the camera superior, the bluetooth is far better, the overall speed of all the functions is pretty amazing
Setup was extremely easy, and all of my settings, contacts, apps, etc, imported via Google with just one touch. I don't swallow the spying nonsense and barely gave the spiel a thought. I would recommend this phone with the caveat about the 5G and battery life.

This phone is simply awesome, if you overlook the charging type, it is the best phone out there for the price. The colors are gorgeous, I love the size, and as an audiophile, the output of sound when connected to my car speakers is super clear and has loud bass. I really am proud that I trusted the reviews on here, before this phone I owned a ZTE Axon 7 Mini and I was in love with it, until it broke from one simple fall. I was worried that this phone wouldn't meet my expectations when it came to sound output etc but oh boy IT DOES. Apart from that make sure to get a good cover for this phone.

I placed the order for a new Huawei Mate SE phone Sunday and got it 2 days later as anyone would expect via Amazon Prime. I have been waiting for my holiday gift since the order was completed at Amazon. This is my second Huawei phone. So, my expectation is very high. I have had my Huawei Mate 8 for almost 3 years with great experience: great battery life, much better camera than other big name's, running smoothly, and no damages after dropping many times etc. I still use it with little issues. So, I decided to get a Huawei phone again for next 3 years or longer hopefully. This time, I like to get a smaller screen size, specifically a little less wide than Mate 8's. After finishing my order at Amazon, I can't wait for receiving the new phone - Huawei Mate SE. Wow, it is an amazing phone after playing it a little bit. The size is just a great fit with my hands. Installing a few popular Apps runs very smooth. There are a lot of popular Apps pre-loaded on the Mate SE. I will explore more features on this Huawei Mate SE...

This phone is fantastic and screaming value.
The form factor is great (thin and tall with small bezel and soft angles), the screen and camera are really good, and the (active) dual SIM card feature a godsend for foreign travelers like me. it feels like a much more premium phone. Too early to say how durable battery will be, but so far so good easily a (light) day use and more. Couldn't be happier.

- Battery with amazing life lasts for entire day and even more, I spend all the day using mobile data for my social media work, at the end of the day is still 40%

- Software is good, and will get even better with the new OREO update that huawei confirmed will come soon

- Fast and smooth no bugs or lags, even amazing for games and never heat

- Camera is good, not as good as the 1100$ iphone or 800$ samsung note8, but comparing the proce difference, it is good

- Now some might say that its not good cz there is no NFC, or fast charging, or low volume level;
I say that i don't care, I never use the NFC tech, and the battery is more than good it lasts the entire day, no need for fast charging during the day, and the volume is acceptable

so if you want a mobile that is fast, up to date, great battery with an amazing price 229$, this is the one
but if you are looking for a mobile only for the top camera and loud volume speakers, this is not your choice

Awesome value, buy this phone. Only things missing, NFC, temperature and some other none important feature. Check the Hauwei web site to find other unmentioned features the phone does have. Daylight pictures are outstanding, night time pictures could be better. If picture taking is your main concern buy a camera, the pictures this phone takes are good enough for most. Buy the phone and enjoy all that it can do including Android 8.0 which will update when you start the phone.

I was sceptical to buy a phone off of Amazon. I mean I had bought phones off Craigslist and FB but for some reason I was still hesitant. That being said this is the coolest phone. The battery lasts for days with moderate use, like during the work day where im maybe not doing as much browising I only charge it every 3 days. Three days! Without having to charge my phone!! Sorry but having converted from the iPhone that was insane to me. Oh and the phone was brand new in the box everything worked out fine. I popped my SD card from my iPhone into the Huawei and it worked immediately.

Very good phone at a reasonable price. Many people ask me if it is an iphone. I teach school as a subtitute and go to a lot of different schools. The High School and Middle School students tell me it has a lot of nice features and the comment is almost always, "I thought it was an Ipnone." Functionality is excellent. I haven't owned a lot of nice phones so this is by far the best I have had. Only issue I have is it takes a little longer to charge than I was expecting. My husband has the same phone and does not have this issue with his.

Galaxy S series is overrated. This machine does all you need at a fraction cost. If there was a 7 of 5 rating I would. Am able to minimize youtube, gps etc while still using other applications. Forget about split screen. This phone gives you a floating youtube or gps screens etc that you can move anywhere on the screen so you can easily multitask.

The product is good. and works great. The price is good. The only glaring problem i have is that the phone is not fully encrypted like the majority of other phones. As good as this phone is, and it is good... if i would have known this before buying, i would not have gotten this phone. I value my privacy.

I've now had this phone for over a month, so I feel like I can give some feedback and judge the phone objectively. Note that for work I have an iPhone 8, and went to this Mate SE from a Blu Life X2 after it took a tumble.

Phone as a whole:
It's nicely built and looks sleek and modern, as expected from Huawei. The back finger print scanner works extremely well. The size is good for my hands and I can reach all of the screen with my thumb one handed. All apps run smoothly and I haven't had any issues yet. The speaker phone is nice and loud, not too tin can sounding.

Screen:
Bright colors, compared to the iPhone 8, the colors are very comparable. No issues with videos at all.

Battery:
I play Pokemon Go, and I have hosted 2 other devices (kids) with this phone for 4 hours straight and went from 100% to 25%... the kids phones were dying. Brother in law's Samsung Galaxy new version was also in the red. So... pretty nice. For standard usage, this phone lasts all day. Very impressed.

Camera:
Clearly it's not an iPhone, but the pictures are more or less comparable to the iPhone 8. It's not 100% there, but it's crisp enough to print out pictures with Santa.

In all, the wife likes it so I'm buying one for her too. I'd give it 9/10 stars as it's clearly not a flagship phone, but who cares, it's $250.

This is an awesome phone considering the price point. I already own a blu vivo 8 and this is a much better phone in terms of performance. The mate SE runs very smooth with little to no lag. The phone just performs like a flagship phone. i really don't care that it doesn't have usb type c because all my previous phones were micro usb. except the Blu pure xr which i owned briefly. The only issue i have with the phone is the display which comes out of the box looking a little bit too warm. Luckily , this can be adjusted in the display setting menu. The colors on the display are a little bit muted and i would have loved it if it was more saturated , which would have let the colors pop out more. I wish they would have put a color saturation slider in the settings menu, honestly i don't know why phone makers don't have this option by default (The closest i have seen to it is video enhance on the note 8). This phone seems to have the same color issue with the Pixel XL 2, although google fixed that with an update. I hope Huawei will also update the color saturation and make it more vivid. This is still a fantastic phone, which i have no regrets buying. I have no problem recommending this phone.
Update: I recently noticed that the brightness of the screen would automatically dim when I open apps even though I have got auto brightness set to off. Huawei needs to look into this issue.

Bought this phone as a backup for my Huawei Honor 8. Good phone, but not as good as my original Honor 8, so I gave it to my daughter. She loves it!
Also recommended it to a couple friends to replace their old Samsung's & the like their Mate SE's too!
Overall great product at a great price!

This cellphone is not much different than any other cellphone I've owned. Is OK nothing out of the ordinary. I bought it after reading many reviews, but I'm not impressed by its performance. Is just a cellphone people. I have nothing negative to write about this phone. So, feel free to buy it, you won't be disappointed. I'm not . âº

Very fast. I have a galaxy s7 and it is a pretty good phone, but mate se is faster. For a budget phone it is very good. The camera is not as good as s7, but it costs much less. In bright situation the photos are good, but in low light situation the image quality goes down. The finger print on this phone is VERY fast! just a touch and it is unlocked. The position is very good, it lets you to drop down the notification bar which is good for a person with small hand.

Overall, good phone at a very good price.

If you want a great phone with amazing battery life at a $250 price tag than this is it. I've been a Google Nexus phone user for years. But I couldn't pull myself to spend $800-$900 on a Pixel. Plus insurance and if something happened to the phone. It's a huge headache. Long story short I got a cheaper phone and I love it. The battery on this thing is incredible! I could go 2 days with normal use easily. It's a quick and very responsive phone. Anyway if you want a great phone at a great price you found it!!

This is my 2nd Huawei phone. The first one I bought during a trip to Asia unfortunately was not compatible with the US networks. This one completely works! I've got LTE through TMobile. Happy with the 64gb memory and battery life. Rear camera isn't bad, simulates the blurring or bokeh effect of the iPhone by having dual rear cameras. Fingerprint reader works faster than that of my wife's iPhone. For all the hardware available: 64gb memory (expandable with micro SD) octacore processor, HD+ screen, 3340 mAmp battery, its really worth the price.

I had to relearn android with this new phone from an iPhone. Fast processor, cool fearures, fairly serviceable phone.

However I just discovered an issue that may be a deal breaker. Just got off the phone with Huawei support and they said there is no fix to my problem.
While on a phone call, every time I click on something the person on the other end can hear All the clicks. If you jump into say Facebook they can hear the videos you are playing, Yikes!

Huawei support just gave me the impression that that is " normal" and there is no fix for it.

I will check to see if there is an Android fix for this to be certain and update this review if I find a fix. If not sending phone back.

I've only had this phone two weeks now. I honestly love it. Looks great, is small and comfortable, and is fast, to boot! I'm very pleased. I was skeptical because I can't even pronounce the brand name, nor have I heard of it before. However, it's been treating me well and has exceeded my expectations. The camera is pretty decent, as well (something I was concerned about). Definitely a better quality phone than the price leads you to believe. If you're on the fence, I suggest you take the plunge.

I have had the phone for a couple months now. I am coming from an HTC Desire 510 with 8 gigs of storage.. 8 gigs! So anything would have been an upgrade. One problem I had initially with the Mate SE was that I couldn't receive mms messages (group, Pic, sound texts, etc.) I figured out I had to reset some apn settings I found on cricket's website. Some negatives: the sound quality isn't the best, but it's as if I have gotten used to it and it doesn't bother me anymore. The phone has also spontaneously restarted itself a few times, but it's not been a big deal. It feels like good sturdy hardware but it is very smooth and slippery. I'm happy using the clear tpu case it came with. The camera is fine for my standards. I like the 64 gigs of storage and 4 gigs of memory. It's pretty zippy. I LOVE the fingerprint scanner on the back and the ability to pull down notifications with it. The scanner is fast and accurate. I like the display. I'm using a nova launcher and it all functions great. Very happy for the price I paid.

After using iphone since its introduction, never thought would like any other phone. After getting tired of low quality voice reception and battery and cost of new iphone, settled for Huawei unlocked phone after lots of hesitation. Surprisingly, this turned out to be great pick and happy with the purchase. I like my phone to have good quality phone voice quality and reception, good emailing and good pictures. This phone does not disappoint. Expensive phones finally have a competition.

For $229. What a nice phone, does everything as advertised without a glitch and at very fast speeds. Enjoy it way more than the iPhone 5c it replaced, really like the drag accross the screen to type feature, and great to increase your memory with a SD card. Most normal people will not be disappointed with this purchase unless if you need the option of sending videos via SMS, which it doesn't offer. Thanks Amazon

I like the most is very quick to transfer my old phone into my new phone without calling tracfone company just answer all the question in the phone,the camera really good,and the battery last longer until i get home from work,,maps is good .Its look very nice ,thin and brand new you can compare of ipone quality.I recommend this product if you want to save money no monthly bills just load one time in a yr and watch before expiration you can load more mins,its depends also how you use it.whats inside the box,adptor charger, pin and basic bookletguide ,i didnt read all yet whats inside if they have warranty,Only 1slot drawer for nano sims card and sdcard small size.I love my phone

This phone lived up to all my expectations and more. I was on the fence with this phone and the Moto g6..but the specs for the mate was much better not to mention the dual SIM cards. If you're looking for a great non-flaghip phone with flagship specs this is the phone for you. Oh and it works flawlessly with MetroPCS/TMobile.

I am giving my opinion and fact on this product. Many people tend to buy this product mainly for dual sim feature. Unfortunately this mobile will not suit this requirement for the following facts.

When I purchased this product, I went through many reviews in Amazon and based on some satisfaction I went ahead and ordered but got to know after receiving that the second slot which can be used for either second SIM or for memory card supports only 2g. So I am in United States and in this country mobile providers have discontinued 2g long back, very very limited tower gives you 2g signal. My second number which is from India is 4g sim, it did not work as expected in this mobile due to the second slot supporting only 2g. I did not get signal for second slot and I got signal only once for few minutes.

So in my opinion, this mobile is not fit for dual sim facility in ðºð¸ United States. This mobile might work good in other country where 2g signal are available.

Since I haven't used the mobile much, I am not giving my feedback on mobile other features like camera, etc.

Hope this helps for customers who are looking this mobile for dual sim facilities.

Wow I am impressed. I have an iPhone 7 which is great no complaints but got bored of it. I wanted something different and I happened to see the Huawei phone and the price was reasonable.

Im disappointed with the phone selection in the US. After looking online at phones across the pond , I realized there are more devices available that we never hear of in the US. Anyway, I gambled and received it today. I've been messing with it for a few hours and am impressed with the response no lag time.

Fortuantely, I already have AT&T and slipped in the Sim from my iPhone 7, no problems with the LTE and it connected to my router with no problems either. I'm just glad that I didn't have to spend $700+ for a another phone. I'll be putting my iPhone on eBay!

I have been using this phone for a few weeks now. This may not be a "flagship" phone, but it sure feels and runs like one. If price and quality are important, then this is definitely the phone for you. I use my phone for everything, browsing the web, Netflix, YouTube, Amazon. It's also my only phone, no landline. I've owned several Galaxy series phones, the old lady used them, I wouldn't trade two of her s7's for one mate se. This doesn't have some of the most up to date features, but I haven't found that it takes away from the experience. This not only feels like a quality phone, it operates like one.

I recently retired. I was issued an iPhone 6 plus at work. I decided that I did not want an IOS device and decided to shop Android devices.
This phone is a great balance of features vs. price I've had for 1 week.

The good:
Good battery life
Great screen
Very responsive
Easy to use
Pretty good camera
Super fast fingerprint reader
Very reliable so far.

The bad:
Shaky video
Low light photos a little grainy
Hard to pronounce phone name Huawei (wowway) :-)

Nice phone. It's a steal at around $200. 4gb of ram, 5.9" screen and a lot of customization to this phone. Loaded up all my apps from my old phone, no performance hit at all. That 4gb of ram is really showing on this phone. My available memory stay above 2gb. The battery life on this phone has been solid for me. If the phone is optimize it will slowly trickle. But we will see how that last.

OMG I love this phone! It has all the power I need to do any task I need it to do. And there is no bloatware on it like other proprietary phones. Just android plain and simple. The camera is awesome. Front AND back. Seriously, why pay 500 or a thousand bucks when you can pay 200 and get nearly the same quality? I'm completely happy with my purchase. iPhone who?

This phone is a great value for money. It has proven to very stable, smooth to operate and has great battery time. The camera is reasonable for the price and every other feature I need in a phone meets or exceeds my expectation. The phone feels and functions like a premium phone.

Way too many apps open unintentionally. If I wore a sports jacket where I could keep the phone inside the breast pocket it may work-or a woman carrying a purse with a designated isolated pocket inside the purse for the phone yes maybe. With the push switches extruded from the side of phone one is asking for trouble. I do not like wearing blue jeans but have found they are the easiest and safest for roaming the world. The only way around this is to turn off phone. Then you have to turn it on before using. The size of phone is too long for an isolated front shirt pocket to button up. Even then you may get assaulted and loose phone anyway. Many times I find my front jean pocket is getting warm. Maybe 5 apps have opened up and could be calling someone unintentionally at the same time and battery will be very warm. You have to keep all pressure from these push witches. Also when I misplace my phone it will not ring using skype. Use to find my old phone maybe once or twice a month using this method. Believe I have found a method to remotely access my voice mail. Use to be a snap before. On the question forum I asked this question using a different profile name. I sure do like the feel of the phone and the rear camera. Hopefully someone will debug my skype problem on the question forum

It is pretty fast for the price, and seems to get really good signal for cel, wifi and bluetooth. It isn't a flagship, but honestly I haven't noticed any slowness. I like that it has 4gb of RAM and 64gb flash.

The only issues I've had so far is the tactile stops working in whatsapp (but seems to work elsewhere, so this could be a whatsapp problem - still investigating). That, and I can't figure out how to do a screenshot on it. The power-up-arrow combination starts something that records the screen (video), rather than a screenshot. I just need to look up how.

So far it makes good phone calls, etc.
I give Two stars because. Incoming calls are not answered by me. The phone does it automatically. I don't know someone called unless I hear them saying hello. I need a replacement

Did extensive research on the budget smart phones, and no other phone in the high $100 to high $200 range even comes close to the bang-for-the-buck value this phone offers. This is essentially an upgraded Honor 7X, and the extra $30-$50 difference in price for extra RAM and double the storage was definitely worth it. The best value in the next price range ($300 - $400) would be the Xiaomi Mi Mix 2, but whether you still consider that to be a budget price range is up to you. Pulled the trigger and bought two Mate SE's, one for me and my wife. The research did not disappoint, we absolutely love these phones, I got the black version, she got the gold. The response of the phone is very snappy, the display is beautiful, and the pics from the dual cameras are great. An upgrade to Oreo O/S was immediately available once I got the phone up and running, so that was fantastic, as well.

This phone looks fantastic. It runs great and I love the extra screen room it gave compared to my older phones. However, the hardware inside is really, really cheap. It took less than 3 months for the headphone jack to break, and while my headphones did get ripped out of it often, my last phone the Huawei Honor 6x took over a year for the same issue. I got the part replaced and again it took less than 3 months for it to break. Frustrated I bought another part to replace it and found that they started using new parts in the newer models so the old parts weren't in stock anymore, it shouldn't have been an issue except for some stupid reason, the new parts don't fit into the older phones (same model, remember), and the only way I could get the newer parts were to get it shipped form China which takes 3 weeks minimum.

So great phone when it works, which isn't that long at all. Also, if you plan on fixing your own phone, for some reason, this model doesn't show up at all when you look for parts for it, it uses parts from the honor 7x which really makes me wonder if this is a separate phone at all.If you plan on buying a cheaper phone, DON'T BUY THIS PHONE, other Huawei products are way better and honestly, they have better competition at Xiaomi anyways.

This is a good phone if you want most of the features and performance of a high end phone but don't want to spend $1,000. It's decently powerful, it works perfectly for Facebook, YouTube, Snapchat, web browsing, and a few simple games I tried. The sound and camera aren't as great as some of the flagship phones, but they are decent. The battery is pretty big so it should last all day for casual use, if you aren't running 50 things with the brightness cranked. It also comes with a free clear case which is nice, most companies don't do that. So it's great for casual users unless you really want to spend 4-5x as much for a flagship phone.

Just got this phone ... Upgraded from a LG Aristo 2. I'm a MetroPCS customer ..... Swapping service to new phone was simple as well as transferring apps...simple
The phone display is so vivid .. the fingerprint thingy is quick. Love love love this phone. Didn't want a contract to get an iPhone or Galaxy. Great price 4 a Great device !!! Definitely recommend this phone for bargain hunters ð¤¤

The charging port is not USB Type C which is a real bummer. Anyone who has converted to the Type C connector will know how much better it is. I just converted most of my cables to Type C and when this phone arrived I was shocked to see the antiquated micro USB connector that is a decade old. Yikes.

I LOVE this phone..
The best budget phone, I've owned thus far.
1. The fingerprint scanner opens faster than any budget Samsung device I previously owned, and it's easily accessible compared to budget Samsung devices.
2. The display... AMAZING
3. SPEED!!! It's really quick
4. Space... Unbelievable for the price.
I'm completely happy with my phone.

The only draw back is the camera, while it's way better than other Samsung budget phones... It's not that gr8. But all things considering, I got really good specs on a budget & I don't regret it.

Thank you Huaweið

I had the honor 6x it was great. So I was hoping the 7x was going to be better.... Nope. The battery life is awful. With regular normal use it's dead and needing recharged by like 5-6pm.
It also has Bluetooth - and wifi connectivity issues... Which after researching I seen this has been a flaw.
The camera doesn't seem as great.
The phone is kinda slow and it should not be.
My husband got the honor 7A. Since we are being honest, save the $100 bucks and go with it. It has more features. His battery last all day. And..... Well.. the dual cameras aren't worth the extra $. Just saying.
Also... Case selection for these phones suckkk.

Only one day in and I am blown away. I had a surprise last week when my Samsung S8 screen stopped working all of a sudden (no drop, nothing). Took it for a screen replacement which was going to cost $229 plus tax. Got a phone call from the tech saying the motherboard was shot. Awesome.

Anyway. After a bunch of research I decided to pull the trigger on this budget phone. I liked the aluminum back and the specs seemed good enough. So happy!!

The UI is better than Samsung's for sure. Photos not quite as good. Speed seems the same in apps. Fingerprint on this is far superior to the S8 (better placement and faster).

I'm really impressed. And heck. If something happens to it I am only out $229. Win win. By this phone.

I've had this phone for around 4 months now and couldn't have asked for more in this price range. I have always bought mid-range phones, trying for the biggest bang for my money. For it's price, this phone stands out. Processing power, RAM and ROM capacity. The most impressive feature for me is it's camera and display. Picture quality is fantastic, each picture taken is over 5 MB in size illustrating the amount of detail captured. Display is sharp and crisp! A happy customer.

Wow I love this phone! It's huge! It has so many features, great picture taking and I've had zero problems with it! I got this as a birthday gift and I'm sooo happy with it! Only silly complaint is the lack of cute cases for it but seriously this phone is awesome!

I love this phone. Works very well. Great features. Looks and acts much more high end than it's price would indicate. I bought the gold one, and it looks very classy. I am totally satisfied with my purchase, and the price point was low enough that I will not mind replacing in a few years if needed, unlike with an $800 phone. Glad I took the chance on a brand I was unfamiliar with. Also, Huawei support was great the one time I needed to call them with a question.

Lightning fast, fingerprint scanner is virtually instantaneous, bright HD display, great build quality, clean design, size is just right, and photos are nice and clear. My only real issue with it is that the speaker is very "tinny" and lacks bass. The volume can get very loud though thankfully and there is a headphone jack at least. It's an incredible phone for the price and despite the speaker, it's the best smart phone I've had to date (LG V3, LG V20, and ZTE Axon 7).

I love this phone. It feels well made. I've had not problems with it in the three months I've had it. Camera is pretty good for the price of the phone- especially if the subject is well lit. Not as good at night but I didn't buy it for night photography so that's not really an issue for me.

This phone is amazing in terms of speed , battery , picture quality etc. For $219, this phone is incredibly better option than Samsung or Apple. They charge you more for their brand name. I am using T Mobile sim card and found no issues with network. One big advantage is the dual SIM card capability. I am very impressed with this phone. Thanks Amazon for selling it and Huawei for selling it at an affordable price.

Switching over from years of LG. My V10 went through batteries like it's no one's business, as did my other LGs. This phone isnt perfect still learning it. The battery life of the huawi is great, never have to take my charger with me last all day and if not using regains some of it's charge. The OS is 8 too that takes time to get used to, what's nice about that is the self cleaning cashe. Doesn't seem to get above 600mb. The LGs had no problem getting over 2gb.

I wanted a phone that had a great camera. Check! And great battery life. Check! The camera is the best phone camera I have ever had. In low light, bright light, whatever... It takes fabulous pics. The battery lasts 2 days with pretty heavy usuage! The speaker is very loud too. And it's fast responsive. So many pluses and honestly not any minues I can think of. Buy it! You will not regret it, I promise! XO

I got this phone and I was really excited!
Here I can tell you some of my opinion about the huawei
pros:
*Beautiful photos
*Beautiful phone
*Nice resolution
* Just need to put the active sim and it works
/ unlock with your finger

cons:
* it take fooorever to charge the phone, I would say like 5-6 hours to have 90% of battery
* Its not compatible with Fitbit, Garmin, and some headphones
( I am really sad and disappointed because I have a fitbit and a Garmin and my Bluetooth earphones I can only use it with the tablet so I can only use regular headphones
* Because you have so many apps it get really slow

I've never owned a phone that cost over $130 so buying this one was a "splurge" for me. I caught it on sale earlier this week for $220 and I'd definitely say it's worth the extra money spent. Fast response times, excellent call clarity, nice design... If you're on the fence like I was because of the extra money, just get it. You'll be glad you did.

I've had this phone for about a month now and love it. Has the quality of the type of product others are spending upwards of $700 on. Overall, amazingly fast, no crashes at all, can use intensily all day long running a bunch of things at once and still have at least 60% at the end of the day. Camera takes great photos, struggles a little in low light without flash, but what camera doesn't. Photos in natural light come out brilliantly. Runs Bluetooth flawlessly - works great with my ticwatch and uconnect. No issues at all with T-Mobile - put SIM card in, logged in to Google and everything was transferred quickly and seamlessly from old htc phone. I highly recommend it.

I love this phone. It's my first Android and it's beautiful. Graphics are great. Huge memory. It's unlocked for overseas travel. Big bright beautiful screen. The battery life is phenomenal in "Ultra power saving mode" I mean phenomenal. It's got a really great camera. And the price!!! Wow!
Goodbye forever Apple!

Just got it at weekend and now is using this new phone ... Impressively moved by its high quality phone material and great looking design, lighting speed finger ID unlock feature, and long lasting battery, and sharp display image ( but weak point is when you use it at outdoor with sun Glasses on , hardly to see the displayed contents ) , and smooth app response, and great speaker sound quality , camera looks good and I think it has more space to improve , and so many other great features ( so far I don't have not have enough time to check all yet) ...
Anyway, back to the POINT : This is phone is really worth to buy compare with other phones, it is really close to other expensive phones in quality and feature wise but the price is only 1/3 compare with these ''supper expensive phones - i & S '' ( I am these phones user too at same time ).
GO Wow Way, expecting you bring more excitements to this market.

Only an idiot would buy anything costing more than this phone. I have tried the Samsung 9+, IPhone X, and even the Huawei Mate 10. Who are the morons that stick the fingerprint sensor right below the camera lens? What good is that? Touch the sensor and smear the lens.
This is a fantastic phone and it just updated the software to 8. I just put a 256 GB card in it so I can watch Red Dwarf, Green Acres and House on it.
Dear Huawei, I have recommended your phone to megapeople. Not just here on Amazon but person to person, too. I think you might think it appropriate to send me your next gen Mate SE for free!!!!

I was looking for an upgrade and this phone is awesome! It is fast enough to tackle apps I throw at it and there is no lag with the EMUI interface. You have to be nuts to buy an expensive phone on a contract when this is available, unlocked, at a great price.

The battery life is awesome! I have never owned a phone that kept a charge as long as this one does, and I do a lot of camera (video) viewing. I love how the phone feels, the size is perfect for me (I like a larger phone) I had this phone for a couple of months now and haven't found one thing I dislike about it. If something changes, I will be the first to write an update. As a side note, I was surprised to see when I turned the phone on, this had step tracker in the lower left hand corner. I believe you can download another tracker that probably gives detailed information but this one is fine for me! All in all, I think anyone who purchases this phone will be quite pleased!

when my LG G3 started to fry my battery i new it was time for a new cell phone, but i didnt want to spend $600 plus on a phone.
i did some research and found the Huawei mate SE, this phone has really impressed me and im very happy with it, i have been using it non stop and the battery life is incredible it can go three days on one charge using facebook,instagram,messenger and others without using battery saver mode
i have not not had any problems and im very happy with it

I love this phone I only wish it was slightly wider and a full 6 inches instead of 5.93 other than that I really have no complaints. In fact, if at all possible, this is the only brand of phone that I will ever buy again. It has all of the bells and whistles of any of the higher priced phones (Samsung/apple in particular) and even better customization. Just the fact that you can have 64gb of internal memory for only 250.00...what is not to love.

The phone has everything I need from a smartphone at a great price.
My only gripe is the speaker isn't great, but it works well enough, and for movies and music I just use headphones and thankfully there is a headphone jack for my daily driver headphones. Also USB-C would have been nice, but it's whatever.

Overall this phone is snappy, responsive, has a great finger print scanner and has suited all my needs so far.
Definitely recommend, especially at this price!

Love it!
What a phone. Works absolutely great out of the box.
I'm on T-mobile and if you select automatic mobile network it will work on 4G LTE with no issue whatsoever.
Comes with Android 7, but you can upgrade to 8 rigth away like I did and you're set.
Alluminium body, great back camera, decent front camera, amazing storage of 64gb and 4 gb ram.
Screen is top-notch and battery lasts for at least one day of power usage, two days if you use it lightly.
I'm impressed.
Huawei is the new way to go.

All I can say is wow. I really thought I'd be disappointed, but I was not. This phone is a great phone. It's fast and clear and I can hear. I haven't ever used it up to my ear to talk because I'm a headset person, but it works great with Bluetooth. I'm not sure that anyone should ever purchase a phone through their carrier when you can get a super high quality phone for a 1/2 of the price of a phone with similar specs through the carrier.

I love this phone!! Us government doesn't like it because it can shut down their secret little running processes. I almost never loose battery power..I hate Google running my life Soo this phone takes care of that. I can get into settings that u normally can't in any other Android phone. For a serious technical person this phone is great. If not too techy stick with the smell of apples..thanks Huawei for standing up to the big dogs

Love this phone got the grey version and people won't stop telling me it looks and feels like an iPhone then I tell em what it is and it's much cheaper and they are shocked. Zero complaints so far super fast boots up with ease. Camera is good but with water shots it struggles a bit but nothing too bad. Can insert dual Sims but I have a 128 gig micro SD card in mine. It comes with emui 5.0 but there is an update to 9 right out of the box. Some people complain about the lack of a USb type c really I could care less it comes with microUSb. Bottom line is you can't beat this phone for the price

I bought this for my wife and so far her and I love them. Best phone for price that I could find.The phone looks and feels like it costs $500-$800. Not as fast as the flagship phones but I can wait 1 second for screen to load instead of .5 seconds. Buy it you wont be disappointed.

Bought this model due to it's terrific review. But very disappointed with it when after 10 hours on the charger, it was only 60% charged. Also it wasn't reading pics stored on my on my SD card. I think it's s great phone as it oerfirms flawlessly except the charge time and not reading the my pictures on my SD card which I installed from my old Samsung. Returned it for refund and purchased another brand.

Love this phone. Works and feels as a high end phone. And I got such peace knowing I am not making payments for 2 years in a iPhone. Why waste your hard earned money. Some of my iPhones won't even update anymore. Great purchase .

Great phone. Bought for wife. She's had no complaints. Fast enough. Good storage amount with Microsd expansion available, which is harder to find. No alot of case options, but get one. Doal camera for portrait mode gives so-so results. Primary camera in standard mode is better. Fingerprint sensor is fast and handy. UI is fast and unobtrusive.
Over all good phone if you don't need it for navigation or Pokemon Go, etc etc. The GPS/antenna on this phone is straight garbage. Really disappointed in it.

This is a really really good phone when you factor in the price point this phone is an amazing phone in my opinion is the best phone on the market well yes it might lack some of the high-end features of the iPhone x like facial recognition I gladly give that up for the $800 price time difference I cannot recommend this phone enough the screen has been Fantastic Four picture quality no scratches processor speeds fantastic hard drive space fantastic I've had this phone for over 2 months and I have had zero issues with it.

Never thought I would need it, but just started a job in a dead spot (AT&T service). The phone doesn't have Wifi calling...I never have needed it in the past many years / decade...

Also, for some reason, my phone and tablet has a problem loading "weather.com" but does fine everywhere else. Really weird...if I stop the browser and then refresh, it usually goes through. Other than these, pretty legit phone / tablet (Huawei MediaPad M5)

I havent had any issues with the phone except the gps. I dont know if its not compatible with google maps or vice versa but it's so incredibly glitchy... It freezes, doesn't always orient to my location, and just sucks.

Pros:
- The camera is incredible!! Everyone always wants to use my phone for pictures.
- battery life lasts long time when in battery saver mode
- phone calls are fine

Getting this phone setup and using it was non-eventful. It is fast and screen has bright image. Very easy to transfer my information from old phone using AT&T Mobile Transfer app. If this phone continues to work this well for a couple of years it will be the best I've owned. My original plan was to get the Samsung Galaxy S8 (old phone S5) but given price I gave the Huawei Mate SE a try. So far, I think it's great.

Fast shipping and packaged well! We love this phone! Bought it a few months ago and have had not one issue! Itâs been dropped and no scratches or breaks! Wasnât sure about ordering this brand and honestly have not one regret! Has a lot of space and ways to add so much more space. Also super easy to keep the storage cleaned out and battery last a long time! One of the best purchases we have made so far online!

Just got the phone the other day, so far so good. Only giving it 4 stars because I haven't had it long so I can't write a super detailed review. Much faster than my old phone (blackview), holds a charge well, gets good service, I like the layout and the setup of the features. Great camera! That's a big selling point for me and the pictures come out great and it has some cool features to play with like stickers, manual camera settings and some great editing options. Optional additional storage is great too. So far I really like this phone and would definitely recommend it.

This is a great phone! I know there has been some negative press about Huawei and even warnings. Not sure what all of that is about, but I have zero negative things to say about the phone. It is running Oreo and is fast, snappy! Picture quality is great. Video is great. I am really picky about phones and this one ticks all boxes! I use straight talk and added a 64gb card to it. If you are looking for a budget phone, not sure you can find a better one!

I have had this phone for almost 3 weeks now and find it to be exceptional. It is the best phone I have ever owned. Picture and sound quality are superior. Reception and call quality are great either with or without my Blutooth headphones. The functionality and overall performance is on par with the most expensive cell phones available. I cannot believe it cost me less than 300 dollars and performs as well as any IPhone or top dollar Android device available. Well worth the money and I will remain a Huawei customer in the future.

I bought this for my partner whose LG Stylo 3 was all smashed up. My partner loves this phone and so do I. We activated on Metro PCS which is basically T-Mobile. The phone has great specs, never lags, the camera is good with a lot of features I wish my Pixel XL has. I would rather have this phone that my Pixel XL. I'm really happy with this phone and it's performance. Huawei makes fantastic phones.

So I took the plunge and went for it. I also use Mint Mobile and the sim started working as soon as I put it in and restarted the phone. This thing seems to be awesome so far. Very solid phone, not the fastest processor I suppose but way faster than anything I have gotten from Metro PCS or Boost. The RAM is also its strongest point. Its amazing and the large screen with small bezzles allow me to read my kindle app with ease.

I would give this 5 stars but GPS is horrible. I have used programs to help but to no avail. I use my phone for tracking my business miles thru MileIQ and the phone just will not reliably track my driving miles with the GPS. Otherwise, its a great phone with awesome features for a basic user. I do not game and do not listen to music on my phone. But otherwise, a great little phone for the price. Gave up my Iphone for this and was not disappointed in the basics...only the one gripe about the GPS.

Huawei continues to deliver high features at a fraction of Samsung or Apple. I needed another phone as my honor 5x was over 3 years old. I was still impressed with what my old handset could provide but outdated Android Software.

Which networks; Apparently no one can read the Amazon Description GSM: In Mu'rica T-Mobile or AT&T. I use Straight Talk AT&T no issues

Pros:
Metal Silver Case; looks sharp and included a outer protective sleave to protect the finish.
Finger Print recognizer is faster than my Honor 5X
Camera what an improvement. I'm taking less fuzzy pictures
Uploaded Huawei Themes; now it emulates icons similar to Samsung or Apple. Cool feature and free
Screen is beautiful and battery has lasted about as long as my old honor 5X throughout the day.

Struggles:
I had to reinstall the GMAIL app. Got hung up trying to sign in to multiple accounts.
Bluetooth seems to struggle on initial setup with headphones. Still pairing with vehicles will update.
No USB C. Slow charge like my older 5X

Overall I am impressed. I purchase my phones outright because I do not finance a phone for two years. Seriously, is that Phone X worth $999 that is made next door to the Huawei Chinese Factory for a quarter of the price?

Update:
Included Android 8.0 Oreo updated on the the west coast the best coast 11 May 2018 on a budget phone.

Great phone for the value. Picture and battery life are fantastic. Sounds could be a bit better but it's not too horrible. Fast speeds and connects with Cricket Wireless with zero issues. I'm very happy with my purchase.

Nice phone at any price and a super phone for $250.00. Once I found the transfer apps I got almost everything swapped over from my aging Samsung Galaxy. 64BG is lots nicer than having only 16GB memory, nice photos, pretty screen. The only problem so far is they won't "pair" with my hearing aids. I switched from AT&T to Consumer Cellular, happy there too.

This phone was a huge surprise. Even the camera, that I thought wouldn't deliver, was very good enough to take good pictures. I, always thought, there is no excuse to buy a $800-$1000 phone in our time when you can get a decent phone for 1/4 of that price. What I didn't like is the EMUI (won't bother you) and also the unlocking of the device (you have to go through the swiping up). Overall, a great phone from people who know how to make a cheap phone for the working class.

I like the design the look
I love everything about this phone except that it does not work on Boost.
I called Huawei customer support and they said that at the moment it only works on the T-Mobile Network because the government is telling companies to not support this brand
I'm sorry Huawei but im gonna have to return this.

The phone is top-notch. Plenty fast enough, the screen is sharp & the sound isn't terrible. The main camera is pretty good, the front facing camera is on par with other phone maker's offerings. Definitely got our money's worth with our purchase. We bought two, the wife got the white/gold one that is quite sharp. I got the other one, black/slate.

I love these phones. Huawei phones are wonderfuly priced and work amazing. This is my second one. I decided to upgrade a bit but I bought one for my mom and one for my dad they love them. My friends are jealous of how clear my screen is and how nice my pictures are.

I had been using a service provider smartphone before this. It had 8gb of storage and was slow beyond conparison. I have been very satisfied with this phone. It is sturdy, crisp, relatively light, thin enough, and for the price i cannot complain. In fact I have actively tried to convince others to get this if they were looking for a new phone. Huawei has its own version on android called EMUI 8.0. This version has a lot of neat features like in the camera app where you can take switch from multiple different modes to get what you want. All around it is a great phone. While i do not like what Huawei does with user information and i think it is terrible, for someone like me, i have nothing that is sensitive so it doesn't affect me. All around great phone, would and will recomend (and no i am not paid by Huawei to say these things, just a satisfied customer)

Overall solid performer. Was nice to get an upgrade of the honor 7x in sense of ram and memory. Nice having cases out lwary for it although I would like to see a full body case for the with a attached screen protector. I would say it is safe to assume it will receive 8.0 Oreo like the 7x is supposed to. It is worth the value of what u get

This is my phone I use now. I love it. It works well. I'm only 21 but I feel like 80 when it comes to new technology. This phone has a lot and bells and whistles that I don't use. But I think it's pretty cool.

This phone works just as well, if not better than my iPhone 7plus. Itâs the exact same size. Itâs a beautiful phone and so far havenât had any issues running apps on it. Bought this as a gift for my daughter who needed a new device and I didnât want to spend $600+ on an iOS or Samsung phone. She plays ROBLOX and AJPW on it and it runs smoothly. We only use it on WiFi, no phone plan on it, but thereâs plenty of free messaging apps that can be used to text and make calls with other android and iOS devices. We love how fast the fingerprint ID technology works on it. I always have issues with my own iPhone. Totally worth the price!

Pros:
great screen
fingerprint sensor
great value
Powerful and with good storage

Cons:
Speaker quality is ok, but my moto g4 had a better sound
Not a stock Android rom, the interface is somewhat improved over the default android but it takes a day or two getting used to it.

Verdict:
I like this phone very much and recommend it.

It is absolutely amazing phone for the price point. It has a nice display, it's fast, has plenty of storage, feels solid, and has Android Oreo. The camera works great in good lighting, but is the phones weak link. The rear camera struggles in low light and the front camera is decent. The bottom line is a better phone will cost at least double.This phone is better than my OnePlus 2 it replaced. Including the camera.

Very nice very cheap (priced) why would you pay more. I purchased this for my wife but had an upgraded galaxy for myself I bought a while ago. Wish I had found this phone 6 months ago. I spent $400 for an Edge 7. I could have bought this for $250. I can see why some stores don't want to push this. Their lines would run dry with people purchasing the Huawei Mate SE. Too funny

Replaced a G5s which replaced a HTC 10.. The G5s is 3 months old.. This phone is better in my opinion than the g5s due to the fact that for the same price it has Android 8.... My HTC 10 was bought in Dec. 2016 and got 8 in January 2018...!!!

For the price range phone runs great.

Dont like the huawei bottom lock screen (i.e no slide right on bottom to unlock, brings up a MENU!) Still figuring out in themes how to change it.

I've had this phone just about a month and I'm really loving it. I like that I have more memory and storage as that was my primary reason to purchase. The battery life is good, the picture quality is good and the sound is OK. All features considered, I think it's a good buy.

I LOVE this phone! Very nice in appearance. Got a refurb, but very gently used- looks and feels new. Some of the "minor" things that can irritate you with a phone are all taken care of...very pleased. Great system. My first Huawei, will definitely buy again from this company.

Love this phone have had a couple months now and it's functioning as promised. It exceeds all my expectations. Good sound, awesome camera, great amount of storage for all my needs. Had a note 2 before and a honor 6 but finally ended up with this phone and it was a good fit for me.

I absolutely love this phone! Seriously.

My three most recent androids were Blu phones prior to this (all 3 failed after about a year and crashed a lot of the time and didn't consistently send texts) and was considering an Apple iPhone.

This phone completely exceeded my expectations. It is absolutely the best of any android phone I've ever used!

Fast, no crashes and good quality feel to it.

I ordered 2 of used like new from amazon wearhours and I Can't believe that there is no inspection, I got 2 defective phones back to back, -soon as finish the setup got stuck in loop restart only way to stop it switch to recovery mode and wipe everything and start over, the same thing happened for the second time , thanks to Amazon solved the problem

After quite a bit of research I decided to buy this phone even though I had obstacles such as AT&T deciding not to sell it then Best Buy doing the same. I came here, saw it, bought it and, after a few months in, am quite satisfied. No 5-star rating since it doesn't have OIS or NFC. The fact that it only has 2.4GHz WiFi isn't an issue. Who needs a $900 phone anyway?!

5 months later and this phone is the best phone I have ever owned, works like the day I bought it. For 230$ the phone feels like a luxery phone with it's metal body and doesn't feel lightweight like most cheap phones to. I never thought I would move away from Samsung, but Huawei blows Apple and Samsung out of the park. I also bought my fiance one for her birthday :)

Had the phone for about a week. Works well, no problems. Very happy with the quality of the phone...

Update: have used the phone for about 2 month now. The only problem I have had is that it locks up for some reason and then it takes 2 to 5 minutes before it resets. I haven't messed with removing the battery and now that I know what happens I guess it's not a big deal. For under $200 it's a small thing to deal with.

After 8 months of use I do not have any type of phone complaint. The life of the battery is very good, the phone works very well and never stays stuck. the camera is not the best of the phone but it works correctly. This phone will be with me for at least 4 years.

I got this phone for my wife. She uses it on T-Mobile. The sound is up to expectation for cell phones. The pictures are not as good as my Samsung smartphone generates, or my daughter's iPhone, but they're still OK.
We like the battery life - when running with a 4G signal, we can get almost two days of use between charge. The battery is quite good.

This phone has about everything I need. I'm not buying into all the Huawei spying crap that's going on so I'm very happy. The only thing I miss is gorilla glass, but for the price, it's understandable you can't have everything. I don't care it doesn't have NFC because it's a feature I don't use anyways. Charging is not the fastest either but it easily lasts a full day so night time charging solves that issue.
The phone makes pretty good quality pictures, not the best but more than acceptable. For great pictures, I still have my Nikon camera. Lots of storage (more than I need), enough RAM, fast enough CPU, bright screen... I'm a happy camper who's done with expensive Samsungs now.

Overall works great. I use USMobile as my carrier. Was able to transfer data from old phone no problem.
Cons:
Sound works fine but sometimes have a hard time hearing ring tone
No fun themes
Pros
Big screen
Fast connection n surfing
Lock screen options

Would recommend

This phone in incredible. I have had it for about five months now, and it still works as well as it did when I first bought it.
Pros: Dual rear cameras, great picture quality, fast finger print response, navigates quickly through apps, large high quality screen, loads of storage
Cons: While the portrait mode is awesome 95% of the time, sometimes it gets wonky and focuses on random things in the background as well as the subject. This is literally the only con I can think of.

For the price point, this is probably the best phone on the market right now. I love it.

I'm extremely impressed with this phone. After having two different iPhones and a Samsung galaxy through the years, the Huawei Mate SE is hands down the best smart phone I've owned. It easily has the best battery life and offers the same or better features for a fifth of the price of other phones. I've yet to have a single issue with it after almost one year. My battery when I go to bed is usually around 50%. I've never had to charge it during the day. The fingerprint sensor is amazing as well. I have no complaints. I kind of feel cheated after paying so much for iPhones and samsungs in the past.

This phone appears to outperform my Pixel XL for about 1/5 the cost. It replaced a defective LG 5 phone and there is no fair comparison between the two of them. Battery life is insane...at evening, battery power is still about 75%. It does everything exceptionally well. I highly recommend this phone at any price and for under $250? Wow! Nothing else can touch it!

I only recently converted from a Nokia Windows phone to Android since I was tired of nothing being compatible. Tried a low-end Samsung first and was really disappointed--good screen definition but it was slow and I disliked the home button. I then decided to upgrade to the Huawei Mate SE instead and have been totally impressed. It's responsive for my needs. I enjoy the simplicity of the fingerprint button to unlock the phone. I'm not the most sophisticated smart phone user but I can confidently recommend this phone.

This is a great phone, the specs of this phone are great, for the money you are paying. I highly recommend this phone, what more could you want for less than 300 dollars great camera, great quality and great battery. Perfect for anyone looking for a great phone with out wasting 500 dollars. Also it has a 1 year warranty which is great!

I had some trouble transferring data from my old phone to this new one. Otherwise, it is working fine and is a very nice midrange phone.

Actually a pretty good phone for the price. I was disappointed that Huawei stopped providing bootloader unlocks for these devices, but for what it is stock it's a good phone. Great camera and with an octocore processor it is very fast. Fingerprint sensor responds immediately and facelock was a cool feature too. I don't care for the speaker placement for playing games because holding this phone in landscape makes you cover it. Gaming is pretty good but I did expect better performance in 3D games. So far battery life is good to average although when this phone is in standby there is almost zero drain. Comes with a clear case which is cool till you get what you want.
Do not buy this phone if you use Verizon for phone service. After much to do, this phone was found to be unusable on my Verizon contract. I wish Amazon would've noted that, Very disappointing.

... I got this in a pinch after my son dropped (and killed) his phone while away in college. He loves this phone. It looks great with metal finish, the screen is bright and clear, the sound is good and the pictures it takes are reasonably nice. Best of all it was delivered in a locker at SBU the very next day!

just received this phone and so far, really impressed with it. I came from an s6 and I am pleasantly surprised with this phone. I really don't care about the technology hype, this phone is fulfilling its task and more. I would definitely recommend it.

Upgrade from a Honor 6X after dropping that phone and smashing the screen. I loved my old phone and this one is even better. Very snappy, wonderful build quality. Huawei makes the best phones for the money in my opinion.
Nice phone, very fast, and the power is longer than others.

I have purchased many many unlocked phones, but this one is by far the best. The phone is fast, copies the good parts about iPhones, provides plenty of customization, and is speedy with very few hiccups.
For $250 , this phone is a steal.

It has great spec, incredible value. The only thing I donât like is the micro usb charger port. Huawei Honor 8 introduced in 2016 already has usb c charger port.

Now the best part is the metal case. It is extremely light weight. IMHO, this is the one reason to get this phone. I own Huawei Honor 8 and it has a glass case. Most of the more expensive phones use either glass or crematic for the case. They are heavy and they break easily when you drop your phone accidentally. So you are paying more for expensive phones by having greater risks.

Am I a fan of Huaweiâs phones? Not yet. I own Huawei Honor 8 and its battery went bad in 11 months, So I will update the review of Mate SE a year from now.

In addition, for USA, Huawei 7X and Huawei Mate SE are similar but Mate SE is better.

US version Mate SE = International version of 7X

US version of 7X. = Trimmed spec of the international version of 7X
I love it, and for the price!!!!!! Great!!!!!!!!!!!!.....No contact or extra bills for an expensive phone that will do the same things this one will...

So far, I like the phone very much. My only complaint so far is, when I am finished with a call and bring the phone down in front of me, the screen is dark, so I can't hang up, with out pushing the button to turn the screen on. Otherwise very fast response time. Lots of space and memory.

Let me preface this by saying I never write reviews for Amazon purchase unless they really stand out. I bought this as an upgrade from a terribly slow (but also very cheap) smartphone - Blu 5.0 Advance. The difference is astounding. The call quality, speaker, and camera are great. The phone is very quick. I have no problems using apps like Snapchat without any lagging issues. Please note that this phone can only use nano sim cards (1 nano sim and a micro SD or 2 nano sims). If you're hesitating to buy, make the jump you won't regret it. I did a lot of research on phones under $300, and this is the best bang for your buck. Best purchase I've made in recent memory.

Is Huawei using this device to spy on me? Possibly.

Is Huawei using this device to give me accurate turn-by-turn directions? Nope.

I am very happy with my decision to purchase the Huawei Mate SE, very happy! I love how responsive it is to my commands, how I'm able to stream a movie and watch the movie without it having to buffer all the time. Nothing worse than interruption, right? The 4 gig of RAM allows me to actually multi-task on my Smart phone! Facial reconition and how about the fingerprint identification system that unlocks in a super sonic 0.2 seconds? Yeah, that's what i'm talkin about! Yeah, I'm pretty excited as you can tell and I could go on but I don't wanna bore you. Take my word, I'm 63 years young you should buy one too. I promise you won't be dissapointed.
Sincerely,
Buck James "1955"

Loving it so far. Has a great feel from aluminum construction, tons of ram and storage and the battery is phenomenal. Can't recommend enough for a sub $300 phone. For context, I'm coming from a galaxy s5

I bought this phone because my iPhone 6 died after getting wet, and I didn't want to spend almost $700 (or whatever they're ridiculous prices are) for a new phone and a used one was almost $300.

So far I've had it for 3 months and have zero complaints. The screen resolution and size is great and the camera is on point. It takes better pictures than the iPhone in my opinion. I don't have a problem with WiFi and Bluetooth which I know some people complained about. I use them all the time at the same time and it works great. The battery life is also really great. It will usually last me about 1 1/2 days and sometimes 2 if I'm not on it a lot.

In all honesty the phone is great and the price is unbeatable.

This is a very good phone for the price. I use it with a pre-paid carrier, and there was no problem in setting it up. For the routine usage of a smart phone, like calling, text messaging, taking pictures, and downloading/playing games, videos, music, and podcasts, it does its job. It is responsive and runs smoothly. No problem with different Wi-Fi connections. I do find the camera focusing function tricky, but I do not use this phone often for pictures.
I could lower the cost using freedompop sim. I use Google hangout for talk instead of crap freedom pop app.

Honestly, I'm still biased toward my old iPhone 6 and miss it, though unfortunately it's more expensive on my plan. This phone has a problem with viewing text messages, it jumps around and lags. The touch sensor on the back of the phone really only works to unlock it and not much else.

This is perhaps the best phone I have ever owned at a fraction of what I used to pay for Samsung, LG and iPhone.

It is fast and most importantly battery last 2 days with heavy use. If you don't mind no wifi calling, the this the phone to have. You can't go wrong with that price.

Very nice phone,fast,not much to choose from in a case for it.not much in choice of screen glass(a good one that is),phone is great.just can't figure out where sd card goes to expand memory.not much instruction included in sealed box pertaining to that.i have it running on straight talk.works perfect

The minus 1 star is mainly for the shipping. There was no packaging in the shipping box so the contents were moving around inside. For a delicate device like this I'd have expected better considerations. Thankfully the phone seems to have survived anything that might have befell it.

I'm upgrading from a Galaxy S5 so this is a major overall improvement for me. Thought I'd give another brand a try.

After trying one of these phones I bought two more for people in our office. In my phone the setting will say Mobile Data is turned on, along with roaming, and enabled 4GLTE. Yet When i go to use the an internet dependent application they are not working because I am offline. I will restart the phone and the applications will work again for a period of time.
Overall it is a well constructed phone, but everyone of us is having problems with how the phone interacts with the operating system.

great phone for the price. way faster than my old honor 6x. This Mate Se has extra 1gb ram and 64gb storage. Definitely well worth the extra few bucks over the honor 7x. I'm absolutely delighted by this phone, as of the price and its specs, you won't get better deal other than this. My previous phone was also Huawei, it worked perfectly fine. Highly recommend this phone.

Dont stomp on your phone guys

This phone is a freak of technology for the price point! I ordered on a Friday and received it on Sunday! Unboxed it, immidiately did the system update and been zipping and zooming ever since! It's lightning fast, the camera is amazing and the Battery is outstanding! I watched Netflix for 4hrs straight and still had 70%. The finger print and facial recognition response time is pheonominal! The only negative thing I can relatively find to say about this phone is that I have a hard time with some of my wireless Bluetooth headphones but other then that, if you want a Galaxy Quality phone for $250 this phone is your answer!
This is a pretty decent phone. No issues I almost have it 1 year
Ok phone has issues and bugs

The Huawei works very well for me. Used it in Europe with local inexpensive sim card and it worked like a charm. Now use it at home with my current carrier (Freedom). Very happy with the purchase and I'm staying away form the big brands and their crazy price swings.

I love the camera on this phone. I don't know much about technology but this phone is awesome for the price. I use YouTube, Netflix, WhatsApp and many other apps on this phone and it has never slowed down. The battery life is awesome too.

The heads of six U.S. intelligence and law-enforcement agencies told the Senate Intelligence Committee this week that they could not recommend that U.S. residents buy Huawei products. The implication of this very public warning is that the Chinese brands pose a risk to national security â and possibly to consumer security as well. I returned this phone and no one should even touch Huawei with a barge pole.

Great phone so far. This one I got for my brother and he loves it. I have been using Honor 8 for two years and I didn't have even one issue with it. That's why we decided to get another Huawei phone. This one looks very solid, bigger screen, faster and you cannot beat the price. I always wonder why people pay nowadays $1000 if you can get a better phone for just under $300, plus unlocked???

I've had this phone for about six months and I use it heavily every day for work and play... Is been Absolutely flawless!!

The touch screen had EXCELLENT responsive, the screen is large and very clear, the phone is Fast with a 2.36G octa core CPU, 4 gigs of RAM and 64G of storage.
Apps open usually in a second or less, web surfing also loads pages in less than a second most of the time. Phone switches beautifully between WiFi and cellular data, the camera takes excellent pictures with it's dual rear cameras and even the front facing selfie cam with basic built in beautify options work well.

The screen has an excellent built in coating that makes your finger slide over the glass very easy and it almost never builds up fingerprints, but when it does, just wiping it on my shirt cleans them off almost completely.

I have scores of apps on the phone and there are no conflicts with any of them, even lesser known apps work great as well as the bigger ones like Twitter, Skype, Facebook etc.

The battery life is very, very good as I rarely have to charge it more than once a day even using it for 7-10 hours a day with videos, movies, being on the phone for sometimes a couple of hours a day for work etc. It's 3385MAH battery works excellent.

The fingerprint scanner is BETTER than on my Samsung Galaxy, BLU and LG phone to, though the LG is second best. Just touching even a part of my finger to the sensor opens up the apps or unlocks the phone.

While the phone does NOT have an encrypted file system, which I really wish it did, it does come with a built in encrypted file safe for photos, documents, music or anything else you want to put in it.

It also has a built in app protector so that no app can be accessed without either the password or your fingerprint which again works within a third of a second every time. I like this as I'm very big on security.

So far I've gotten numerous updates from Blu including updating to Android 8.0 and many security updates.

I had an issue with certain apps and I contacted their online customer service via the chat feature. I got someone within 30 seconds and unlike most customer service who give you basic bs answers or stock answers, they understood the problem right away, which was not related to an issue with the phone but was a problem with the latest version of Google play store. Once they told me to remove it and download it again, the problem disappeared right away never to return.

Even though I have a good case in the phone, I've dropped the phone about 7 or 8 times and the phone still works great with no scratches on the screen at all.

I also like that the phone requires you to enter the password every three regardless for security reasons.

The phone call quality is absolutely beautiful and clear as it uses 4G for HD quality sound as good as my brothers $900 Galaxy 8. I've also NEVER had a dropped call even when being on conference calls of an hour or more and everyone sounds like they're right in the room with me. I also like that the phone has a built in Black list option to stop annoying spam calls which seems to be getting worse lately.

This is just an absolutely fantastic phone and several of my co workers have bought them after seeing my phone and hearing my praise of it. It's no wonder that Huawei sales have no SURPASSED APPLE to become the number twi phone seller in the world.

I was limping along with my Nexus 6P and it finally decided enough was enough. I wanted an interim phone to get me through to the next Pixel release and decided on this since my Huawei 6P lasted me 2.5 years which is a lot for an android device. I am very impressed with this phone. For the price it is quite feature rich. The system is crazy smooth. The storage is 64GB which is twice that of my 6P. Memory stands strong at 4GB. This is great as long as management of it stays on point. The camera is good. Not great but it is quite usable for a device at this price point.

Pros:
- 64GB storage
- 4GB Ram
- 6" screen
- Works on Tmobile and AT&T LTE bands (no verizon or sprint)
- Crazy fast fingerprint reader in the CORRECT SPOT
- FM Radio and a headphone jack (common in Chinese phones)
- Good camera, but won't blow anyone away
- Dual SIM with great management tools
- Actual good battery life will get you through the day easy
- Slick all metal design, this is nice but also slippery. Luckily the phone comes with a free clear case. I bought the Spigen Honor 7X case though.
- $230???

Cons:
- Micro USB connection, better dig up your old cables
- No NFC, I use contactless payment a lot and this hurts
- No wireless charging, but this is a metal phone so eh
- EMUI skin is quite intrusive, I recommend Nova or Google Launcher on top, much better this way
- Only running Android 7.0, hopefully the Honor 7X beta program means Oreo will be coming to this device eventually, don't hold your breath though.
- This is a Chinese phone and these companies sometimes have questionable practices when using your personal data. Keep this in mind when buying lower end devices such as this. Probably doesn't matter though since your data is being harvested and sold by all phone manufacturers most likely. Might as well save a buck.

Overall I am very happy and impressed with this phone. Budget phones have come so far from the last time I had a lower end phone that I honestly did not expect this device to perform the way it is. This phone is easily worth the price. Micro USB being the biggest downfall of this device is understandable at this price point. This phone may get me to skip the new Pixel altogether! Buy this if you need something to hold you off until the next big thing OR if you are budget minded but still looking for a feature rich device.

**1 MONTH UPDATE**

This phone is still a great deal and I figured I would put a few more thoughts in this review since I have been using it for about a month. First the reason I am dropping this device to only 4 stars, battery management. This battery management is probably the opposite of what you think, it is TOO AGGRESSIVE. This phone has settings to kill what it considers "power intensive apps" when the device is locked and the screen is off. This option can be turned off which I have done, but it does not appear to be listening to me. The result of this is that I do not receive notifications for messages, smart things events, and many other things that I want to know as soon as they happen. Therefore I end up getting 3 or 4 notifications when I unlock the device. I have white listed all the apps that I want to continue running but the phone does not care. This is pretty annoying so I may end up rooting the device to remove EMUI.

The second annoyance I have found is that the phone does not allow you to set specific notification sounds per app. You get ONE notification noise for ALL your notifications. That sucks pretty hard. But, per my previous point, the phone doesn't tell you when you have notifications anyway so whatever I suppose.

The other notable point is that this device DID receive an Android Oreo update. This is great and unexpected on a budget device so I am happy to be on this later version of Android. Unfortunately, this isn't enough to save them from dropping a star.

Still a great device! Hopefully I can figure out a workaround for the battery optimization that kills your apps.

I did try the finger print ,it,s ok i guess but i did not like it as i have big hands and i did not really like it.so i tryed the password thing and you guess it a pain .over all the phone is easy to hear well talking.easy to hold with a new cover.i bought a black plastic rubber one.i,m sure glad i did not half to work two weeks to pay for my phone .

Bought this for my daughter whose Oneplus 3T died. She loves the phone. It is quick, very attractive and has excellent specs. The price point is unbeatable. This is one of 7 Huawei/Honor phones my family uses. We are all very happy with them. I don't think you can beat it at this price point.

What we can do in these phones with their native applications can be achieved in Samsung phones by installing third-party applications.

I like it so far but a lot of space on the phone was already taken up by the system and preset apps which was very annoying. Otherwise it's a solid phone so far.

Update:
I have had this phone for almost a year now, and I am pretty happy with my purchase.
