I suggest getting a shock absorption case along with tempered glass protector for extra long life. The screen is huge! But still fits comfortably in the palm of one hand.

Model Warning!!!
The BLU A5 Energy aka A250 does not exist. It is the Gray version of the BLU Grand Energy G130.
The box/package reads "Grand Energy" with an added "A5" sticker on it.
The only reference to A250EQ is on the proof-of-purchase/bardode sticker on and inside the box.
The quick guide inside clearly shows the Gold version of the Grand Energy.
The inside booklet tells you to go to the eu.bluproducts site for user manuals and warranty, yet the site has no reference to A5 Energy, but Grand Energy.
The phone "About device" section reads "Grand Energy" as Model number, as well as a reference to G130 in the Custom build version.
The bluproducts site has an empty "Energy Series" section, and does not reference a BLU A5 Energy anywhere.
When searching the web for A5 Energy, specifications sites will reference Android 7.0 Nougat while in fact, you'll get Android 6.0 Marshmallow as expected with Grand Energy.
etc ...

Also

Dual SIM beware!
BLU's reply to buried Amazon product review comments reveals the Dual SIM feature is a hybrid, as the microSD card has to be removed (if any) to insert a second SIM card. Besides, no info is given on the dualSIM technology used such as DSS (single stand-by), DSA (active), or DSDS (dual stand-by), not even on the Dual SIM Installation Guide inside.

MicroSD beware!
The sales flyer/doc (Grand Energy) on BLU site - as well as the "From the manufacturer" section (A5 Energy) on Amazon - will promote twice "8GB Internal Memory, expandable to 64GB" while scrolling further down the exact same page will read "MicroSD up to 32GB".
Is SDXC (>32GB) not supported? only SDHC (<=32GB) is supported? or is SDXC supported but limited to 64GB?

Conclusion.
The value for the money seems great, but the deceitful old/new rebranding is upsetting, and the technical information in order to make a sound choice for the customer is fundamentally lacking.

Edit: answer from BLU "The A5 energy is an Amazon exclusive line, the hardware may be the same but the software have been optimize for a better customer experience. We can confirm the A5 energy supports Micro SD up to 32GB".
What exactly has been optimized? We don't know. And the "expandable to 64GB" claim from the manufacturer on Amazon is false.
Just received it!! So far I'm impressed. Speedy,..with a big, bright screen. Not sure you can beat it for the money. As always, Amazon's delivery was incredible!!

Mine came with Android 8.1 Go, and not too much bloatware - no Facebook app or any of the stuff some of the other users mentioned. However, right out of the box it was extremely slow. I tried everything the other reviewers suggested, and I'd highly recommend:
1. Disable 'google hello' and anything resembling it. No "OK Google" or ad suggestions or any of that
2. F-Droid + Lightning browser, then disable Chrome and Youtube
3. Get a FAST SD card and format it as an extension of internal storage - in theory you'll have more SWAP space for when your phone runs out of RAM
4. Lightning launcher (or your light launcher of choice)

Having done that, I actually like this phone. For $40, it's pretty reliable and up to date. I use it primarily for taking calls as an IT technician. The call quality is good, the screen is readable, and the battery life is fine. I can google things when I'm in the hardware store, and I can send Google Voice messages to clients. If that's all you need, it works just fine. The physical build quality is pretty good, I like the button placement and the screen looks fine. I love that the entire rear of the phone snaps on like a case instead of having a little panel, that's a really smart idea.

HOWEVER, there are a few things this phone just will not do, no matter what I've tried:
- Navigation. I don't think it has a GPS module at all, it relies on cell tower and wifi networks to get location. Google Maps will barely run, and none of the alternatives will ever actually get your location no matter how long you wait
- Fitbit. It will run, it will connect, and it will not stay connected to save its life
- Outlook and other larger office apps will drag it to its knees. Luckily, Gmail GO edition now supports exchange, which is working fine for me
- Facebook. I use Messenger Lite to talk to people, but if you want full-featured chat heads and facebook posts, you do NOT want this phone. You'd have an easier time hiring a guy to physically travel to facebook's servers, draw you a picture of your feed, and travel back.

In short, this phone is extremely low-end, but is a pretty good telephone that will also run some apps. If what you need is a facebook browser that can also call people, you're going to want to spend about 10x as much and get a real phone.
It's a great phone. However, when looking at BLUs website, it would seem that the A6 does not even exist. There is not mention of it anywhere. Oversight?

This is absolutely the most horrendous phone I have ever had. What's with the gd ads every 2 minutes, even when the phone is off and just sitting there in the coffee table minding its own business, here comes some strange music to and add even when the screen is off.... So slow it's unimaginable. And it would randomly so things on its own while you're in the mode of a txt , another app pops up!!!! Terrible worst phone ever!!! WARNING... DONOT BUY

First off, It's rather strange but I did not receive the phone I order. It's supposed to be a ADVANCE-A6 device, though it says on the overall packaging which was delivered good. But when I uploaded the information, its called a Studio Mega, why I don't know?! The phone for the most, works and for the very low price-you cannot expect too much with the bells and whistles like you'd get out of the more expensive phones. But I at least expect the features to work which they don't!
1. VOLUME- HORRIBLE!!! Barely can hear when the device rings, no matter how loud its set,
2. NOTIFICATIONS- Terrible also! Sometimes this feature works and sometimes it doesn't.
3. LED NOTIFICATION - WORSE! Does NOT WORK AT ALL! There is NO light to indicate incoming messages, sms/texts, or voicemail calls.
4. BATTERY- HORRIBLE! You have to charge 2 or 3x daily, but depending upon if you don't play a lot of games and use a lot of apps battery is okay.
This phone would be good for emergencies when you're in between cellphone-devices or just need for a point of contact.

I bought this phone as a cheap back-up phone when traveling, but it wouldn't acknowledge my T-Mobile SIM card. The product description said it works with T-Mobile. I have been dealing directly with the Blu manufacturer and they have sent me 2 more phones and none of them will acknowledge my T-Mobile SIM card. This is the SIM card that I have been using in my main phone all this time, so it is not the SIM card.

Love the size; the ease of use and how good it looks. Will update review if I discover any issues

Update on review.
I would NOT recommend you buy this phone. It looks great but it is very useless. It keeps freezing and crashing. I have reset it twice I think, and I don't even use it everyday. It was meant to be a backup phone but it has been very slow, and buggy. Additionally after just having it for less than 5 months, the thing is now dead and won't turn on after trying to charge it for 2 days!!
Very useless. Contacting Blu and hopefully I can get my money back. DO NOT BUY THIS MODEL OF BLU

These are more like tablets not phones lol ..I was excited these worked well for a few days only then they started to malfunction terribly sad part is I bought two of these for my kids now they are so sad the top peice fell off one and they did send me a replacement only for the tablet to not even be placed together all the way I had to push it down to snap it in place.. what a shame save your money you get what you pay for .

I was hoping for an inexpensive phone for one of my kids. One that would function, without the need for bells, whistles, and high performance. Out of the box all seemed well. It powered up and recognized the T-Mobile SIM, but that's where the fun ended. The one thing that needed to work was the phone's antenna, or reception. While we enjoy 4 bars at the house on our $500 phones, we barely got 1 bar on this BLU phone. Sending a 'test' text message took 7 minutes. If that wasn't enough, there was a speaker issue. When we finally got a call to connect there wasn't any sound. I'll also add that the device ran pretty slow...opening apps, etc. But, again, the antenna quality on the phone is a key issue. We're going to have spend the money and get a higher quality device. I'll give 2 stars because it did power up and recognize the SIM, but performance is dreadful.
Ordered it for a friend. She seems to like it. She ended up getting 2 Because Amazon failed to deliver the first one on time lol. So far so good!

First of all let me say that I love this phone. The only reason I knocked a star off is because if you want a two sim phone, you cannot have an SD card installed. That's right. You have to choose between having one sim and one SD card or two sims, an no SD card. Fortunately for me, I only need choice number 1. The other reason is that the battery is not easily removable. If I ever need to replace the battery, I'm sure it could be done, but it will be a major pain. I wound up buying this phone because I originally had the BLU Advance 5.0 for over two years with no problems at all. My significant other needed a new phone that was reliable, and simple to operate. I wanted to buy her a BLU Advance 5.0 because I am very familiar with Android 5, and I knew she would like it. It was not available new, so I purchased a used one through Amazon Warehouse Deals. I had purchased a Kindle that way and had no problems, so I went for it. The only problem was that it didn't work right, so I had to return it. I was a little worried about trying another used one, so I found this one for only $9.00 more. When it arrived I gave her my old phone which she is happy with. I am pretty happy with more ram, a larger curved screen, Android 7, metal case, etc... Something interesting though, The packaging, and sticker on the back say "Blu Advance 5.2", but the software in the phone identifies it as a "Blu Grand M2" I did a little research and discovered that Blu no longer lists the Advance 5.2 on the web site, but they do list the Grand M2. The phones are exactly the same, so I'm thinking that it underwent a model name change. What this means is that you can shop for cases and screen protectors for both models, and they should work.
I will, as usual, update this review if anything interesting develops.

Update #1 5/6/18 Because this phone has a 2.5D curved screen, finding a glass screen protector that fits it properly is basically impossible. You will, at this time anyway, have to settle for one that won't fully cover the screen, and still have a "halo" around the edges.

I was anticipating the arrival of this phone for my daughter. I knew that by the description AND the price that this was NOT going to be a $1000 iPhone. I bought it for the sole reason to keep in contact with her and her to us. She did want to put a couple of little kids' games on it, so that was more than feasible. Easy to set up, worked well with her Speedtalk sim card, no problems there. Upon going through it, personalizing it and downloading a couple of children's apps, I noticed sufficient lag time between pressing a button and the response time. I would hit the "play" button on a game and it would literally take about 10 seconds for it to respond. This was consistent for all of the games. Its processing capabilities were beyond slow. It was one of those "keep hitting the button, that will make it go" kind of deals. It was frustrating enough that we decided to return it and try our luck with one that was $20 more and seemed to have better speed to it. Again, I knew going in that it would not be blistering speed, but it was just way too slow. If all you need this phone for is to make phone calls, this would work as it did well talking and video chatting (though the video was not clear as could be and lagging).
excellent phone, light easy to use and the best you can use it in another country, recommended

Loved the looks and feel of the phone. It looks and feels much more expensive than it was. Beautiful picture. I installed a 32gb card before starting it up as a couple of other reviews had suggested. But I was very disappointed with the service. Very slow...I mean VERY slow. Constantly getting locked up and having to be rebooted time after time. I hated having to send it back because it is a very good looking phone with beautiful picture. I am member of Amazon Prime and wished to use this phone to watch movies and the other benefits of Amazon Prime..

This is a good phone, it's slow but I'm able to stay connected with people I know.

When I got my phone, I had an issue setting it up; thankfully I was able to chat with an Amazon Technician who was extremely patient and walked me through every step of the phones Diagnostic System... now it works just fine (that could of been just me). The picture quality is poor, but in a pinch if you need it, at least you have a camera you can use. As for this phones battery life, I can get about two or two and a half days on one charge... but that's only because I don't have a Data Plan and my phone isn't constantly connected to the net. My father on the other hand has the same phone, he's not entirely happy with it either; sometimes I hear him complaining that the battery power doesn't last long... maybe about two thirds of a day before it needs a boost or full charge (his phone is always using Data). I think a nice feature of the phone was the automatic startup tutorial when I turned it on while setting up the phone, unless you're from the stone age or are technically challenged; using this phone isn't hard... it's different and you'll have to acclimate to it, but it basically works like most touch screen smart phones.

So in the end, I think I'll settle for 4 stars. The speed at which the phone process information and app handling could be improved a bit, but for an unlocked phone at this price; I'm satisfied.

Works fine as a tablet for what I need it, ham radio apps, maps, and weather radar/storm spotting apps. Didn't intend to use it as a phone so the poor reviews regarding being used a such did not bother me.

12/31/2018: Have used this tablet very little, picked it up today and the screen was completely separated from the tablet. It wasn't dropped or anything, however it was in my vehicle overnight with temps in the upper 30Â°s. I have only had this tablet since April. I will likely superglue it back in place but this really shouldn't have happened. Dropped to 1 star.

Just received the phone today 7/2/18. So far the phone has a great feel and sleek look. The A6 came with a charger and cord, as well as, a USB charging cord, it did have a clear case and face protector included. Transferring the sim and storage cards to the phone was easy, and I even downloaded an app to view how long it would take, Surprisingly, it fast. I'll give another update in a week to relate if the phone is of good quality.

I bought this phone to replace a Blu Life X phone that got caught in a downpour. I had been very pleased with Blu phones, but I must say that this phone was a let down. I realize that you get what you pay for and that this is a low cost, low end smart phone, but almost immediately it started shutting down apps that had been pre-installed on the phone because they weren't responding. There is very little space on the phone, 8 gigs is just not enough and I don't really add much as I am not a gamer nor do I use my phone to stream video, which is a good thing, because this phone has trouble with that. It was very sluggish and the battery life diminished after only a couple of months. The apps that I added for my smart home devices would not function and it had difficulty viewing web pages that contained any kind of pop ups or advertising such as news feeds. The screen is large and the display is satisfactory. It takes decent photos but would not save or open them on the phone and if you added an SD card, you had to set it up almost exclusively for the camera as an external drive which means that you can't use the SD card as an internal drive to store and access downloaded apps you have to save the photos on the SD card and then upload them to Google photos to be able to see them. This creates extra steps and more time just to take and view the photos. I think that this would be a good, inexpensive option if you wanted to get a phone for your kids, but it is not a very practical alternative if you need the phone for your personal everyday use, especially if you depend on your phone for any work related usage.

I was excited to receive my new Blu 5.2. It is a larger than my R1 HD. The setup was easy. Operation straight forward. Camera quality looks good.

The issue appeared quickly. Apps loaded on my phone would disappear. I would go back and try to download them again and get an error message. I have made a number of calls to Blu support, gone through their diagnostics only to be told to do a factory reset. They also stated this would not affect my SD card. When you do the reset you must reformat the SD card. So I was able to get the phone working properly but would loose everything I had.

After months of this Blu finally offers to fix the phone. There is now an issue. A very small crack at the bottom left corner. I knocked the phone off my chair arm. They now say this voice a!l warranty and I just pay for repair and a new screen. But he screen does not affect operation or serviceability.

I had been a big fan of Blu. It looks like they are pushing me away now. Stay away from a company that will not support their product. I had tried multiple times to get this resolved before tbe "physical damage". Blu would not support their product.

Just got my phone a few days ago and it's a good looking phone for the money the colors are vivid and bright and the camera works well so it's too soon to say but I have been purchasing Blu phones for the last 5 years and I hope this advance phone last and works up to its my expectations and does not disappoint .I am giving this phone 4 stars maybe it's jumping the gun but so far I am very pleased with this phone by far .

I got this to use as cheap secondary handset. Holy cow, it's slow. Like really slow. Like really REALLY slow. It can barely open one app at a time without crashing.

The battery life is utterly terrible. For boasting about having a 4000 maH battery it sure sucks it down fast. Leaving it idle all day results in only 20% life after 12 hours. Screen time is about 1.5 hours tops.

Yeah I know it's not a flagship, but it's also not usable. What a joke.

I had the R1 for a good two years, and it was fine. Not a high end phone, but it could handle browsing the web, being a phone, and playing a couple games. I bought a replacement because it was starting to fail, after a reasonable lifetime for the price. I figured the new model would perform about the same. But, it doesn't. It lacks the processing power to do literally anything without lagging, to the point where composing a text message with no other apps opened seemed to be asking too much. There was close to a second's delay per letter, which crosses the line from underwhelming to unusable.

Basically, if you're looking for a budget phone with performance proportional to it's price, you can do far better than this one.
dependable phone but slow as snail, good for a back up phone, but for the price what can you expect.

I bought this item for my mother six months ago. She lives far from me. She is an older woman (almost 80) and I wanted a big and simple cell for her, BUT NEW. I am from Venezuela. I Had a very sad surprise when I visited her and I observed this cell had a lot information since 2016, and a friend who helped my mother to install aplications told me he believed I would buy a refurbishes cell .I checked and I bought NEW. Cells work well yet but.... I considered BLU was unfair. and I do not if cell starts to have problem why I have to do. Sorry I am not write well in English. I take photos to show all the memory it is used by someone else. It is incredible!!!

Seems good for what it is. Seems good. Only used it for an hour and a half so far, but seems good. Dad helped me set it up. I experimented a bit, too. He's a computer engineer. Again, seems good.
I got it as my first touch screen phone, I'm 30. To use an app I wanted to try while walking and exercising. Good price at $30 or $40.

recharges quickly. only half hour I think for the first time:)...

I bought this phone for my roomate for her birthday and she loved it so much. After about 3 weeks it completely stopped working. Phone store said it was gonna be 80 bucks to fix it...that's how much the phone cost almost. Right before hers stopped working I bought myself the same phone and it's on its way out already. But if you need a quick phone fix this is your best option. But don't make it your only option...like I did...

This phone does not work. It takes forever to load everything including just plain texting. Then lags just trying to text. It's impossible to use. And I'm simple. I don't need YouTube or games. All I want is calling, texting, WeChat, and Skype. NONE of those works. I can receive a call and receive a text...but to perform the task myself is a nightmare.

Very nice screen display, bright and clear. Comes with a clear protective soft case and a screen protector. The screen protector is not easy to put on without having some bubbles or to align it onto the screen properly. I ended up not using the screen protector. Don't expect too much speed due to 8GB of RAM and slower CPU. Everything was good, especially for the price.

I was not going to review,but I had to note this. You get what you pay for. I was in the middle of a call and this Blue 5.2 with Android said We are going to do a Security update RIGHT NOW. No warning no options to delay or yes or no.
It hung up on my call and went into update for 15 minutes. Then rebooted like nothing every happened.

You get what you pay for. I will take some responsibility and call the support team and ask the question
Why would I Not be given any choice WhY. Yes , delay, Not right now. Later . Nothing The phone hung up and took control.

J

Bought this for my 11 yr old. Build quality is good. Screen is big and bright. Looks like a high end phone at a budget price. It's good for games and YouTube not sure about calls. Not bad for the price.

my 40 year old daughter broke her phone then lost it I found this phone on amazon and called at&t and they sold us a sim card and installed it for 5 dollars my daughter thought she would have to buy another phone from them but couldn't afford one at there prices. So if you have a contract and break or loose your phone these phones may be your way out inexpensivly, thanks to at&t and amazon for saving us money again! MIKE

I bought this as an between getting a better service for an iPhone 5. I didn't think my expectations were to high but it was a very frustration experience mostly due to the fact that often you don't know if the phone knew that you had clicked on something and sometimes it would just go to sleep before it responded. Or if I had an incoming call I would first hear it buzz..... Then the ringtone would kick in......... Then the screen would come to life and if you are quick you can swipe to answer before it goes to voicemail. Ugg
The product works perfectly fine and it comes with free earphone and charger. I would strongly recommend people buy this product your not gonna regret it.
Well at first was happy till I tried to turn it up with metro and it did not work but amazon wonderful that they are sent me another one overnight and works great with metro service so yes very happy
Bought for my wife, wanted a duel sim card phone. I have an other Blu model that works very good.

This is the 4th BLU phone I buy. I bought this phone as an emergency one until my Vivo 5 gets fixed by BLU and simply put this phone does not work, it's no good. When you type a text, it takes 3-6 seconds to send, or an "app not responding" message appears, videos and music keeps reloading and reloading for minutes! Battery last about 4 hours. It should be advertised as a bare calls only phone. In all fairness, my old BLU Studio 5.5, Vivo 5 and my wife's 5R perform pretty well and I believe they are a bargaing! They tend to overheat, buy they deliver.

This phone worked just long enough for the return window to expire. STAY AWAY.
I should've known..I'd first ordered it for the large screen ( I have visual deficits) in July, it had problems- I figured I'd just gotten a bad one and returned it for the same model....now the one I exchanged it for has FAILED, but now I cannot return it because the time to do so has just passed!! I feel CHEATED & DISAPPOINTED.

I haven't been using this as a cell phone. I use it for flying a drone. I connect it to the drone remote control using an OTG cable, and then place the cell phone in airplane mode ... I don't need the phone functions, just the nice large screen. It has worked perfectly for me. Thank you BLU.

The phone is cheap, and it works with a T-mobile SIM card, which are what I got it for.
It is cluttered with apps, very slow, very little on-board memory, tends to be dim, inadequate camera, small screen; which are natural byproducts of costing 1/4 a typical Android phone.
I got this instead of a flip phone because $25 for the life of the phone seemed like a reasonable marginal cost for wi-fi access and the versatility of being able to download apps. I find myself not using these functions much, probably because I would rather use any other device, but they do work.
If you use internet or data heavily, it would definitely be worth it to pay a little more for a higher quality phone.

The seller for the phone is fine, had no hiccups in ordering nor receiving the phone. This review is to warn people not to expect much from this phone. I bought this phone as a gift and it's been nothing but problems. The screen will freeze like Androids were more likely to do 5 years ago. The phone randomly slows down and cuts off at times. It's just not great. Invest in a cheap ZTE or Motorola phone instead.

Dual sim feature is great. I cant force to run 4g or 3g GSM or CDMA only which present a security or problem when running 2g.

Still using phone after six months. Never broke by dropping. Phone seams came a little lose and broke glass because I was rough with it trying to snap it in place. The phablet is so big it hard to position it over ear to listen to phone convo. Otherise it still functions and works quite well

This phone works great for what I intended (no sim card, only use as a Spotify player and to access the Chariot app). I bought this to use as a device when I wanted to disconnect but still wanted portable access to music. Running these two apps individually I haven't had any issues.
Only major drawback is the phone is definitely laggy compared to high end devices and what most of us are likely used to these days. But give it a little more time and it still works just fine. I've not tried running multiple apps at once on it but I would not expect that to go very well.
All in all, worth the $40 but definitely a device that feels worth about that. Certainly not more.

Bought this as an unlocked phone to have while traveling in Ukraine. We followed the advice of someone else and updated it, and that helped. No, isn't the world's fastest phone - it's pretty slow - but it served its purpose, and for $39, it's fairly priced. After purchasing a local sim card, were able to make calls, text, and access apps such as Uber, Airbnb, Maps, etc.

I bought this phone to use at work because it is cheap and if it breaks it's no big deal. It works fine for making calls, texting and using the Voxer walkie talkie app. I downloaded the Facebook Light app and it works good for that also, That being said, some other apps I've tried to download aren't compatible and it is very slow and frustrating to surf the internet and basic games like Word With Friends are almost impossible to play because of the lag time .

It's worth the 50 bucks I paid for it, but that's about it.

its good phone i bought it for my friend but its not same as in picture its BLU C4 not A4 but i think its a little better than A4 because it has quad core CPU and newer android 8.1 version and also silicon case was not in box i dont know why it was mentioned in description so overall its good but it will be better if description was correct

You're better off purchasing a phone from a second-hand store, which is what I had to do after purchasing this garbage. It's slow, it's out of date, and the call quality is terrible. Complete waste of money; I've never been more dissatisfied with a phone.

This phone is straight trash I charge the phone fully charged put my SIM card in it turn the phone on and literally use the phone for about 24 hours okay the next morning I get up go outside do my work drive around phone gets low I plug the phone up close the case you know assuming that the phone is charging so maybe 20 minutes go by I grab the phone and her phone is just black so I press the power button to turn the phone on nothing happened I plug the charger in again nothing happened the phone went black and stopped working on me within 24 hours the speaker is horrible the pictures like lag while you take a picture I've never seen drag in a picture before. I purchased the phone 11-4-2018 I returned the phone on 11-5-2018. The phone is trash. Don't buy .....

This is a great, easy to use, smart phone! Even if you've never had a smart phone before, this one is for everyone! Very clear, larger key pad, UTD Android system, a very smart phone! I'm with Consumer Cellular, and it works with their system! Huge + in my book! I don't think I'll need another phone, but, if I do, I'll get another one of these!
Good price and the phone works properly, nothing to complain about

The thing that I don't like is, its too smooth in the back.
The phablet works very good.

Does NOT work for T-Mobile as advertised. Not a bad phone otherwise, but returned it because I needed it for a T-Mobile line and tried every way to connect it and was not able to do it. Three T-Mobile stores tried it and when they couldn't do it, I then called T-Mobile customer care in New England & discovered that it is definitely not compatible.

Terrible phone. Had two in the past that were great but this one is terrible and I wish I had another option. This phone does not keep pictures. I take pictures today they are gone tomorrow. I brought a sim card for the phone it worked two days now it says it no sim card, 2nd one by the way. I opened up the picture section one day and I see a bunch of pictures from I am guessing the previous owner, mind you this is supposed to be a NEW phone. That day is the day all my pictures along with those began to disappear. Highly disappointed. First Blu phone I feel like i have been cheated on. Very upset!

I bought this phone to use with a SIM card in Europe. I tried the phone at home in the US with Wi-fi and it seemed to be fine. I installed the SIM card and the phone responded. But when I tried to use it the first time in Europe, it literally died. I bought a new pLG phone in Europe which I use with the same SIM card, no problems. Don't buy this phone, it is a gamble.

Excellent phone for the money. Comparable to much more expensive phones. The key to a good experience with this phone is using a fast SD card, 16gb or more. Using a fast SD card frees up the phones internal memory for system use and the phone works awesome. Hard to believe you can get this good of a phone for the price.

I BOUGHT THIS FOR MY SISTER IN JAMAICA. UPON TAKING IT TO JAMAICA WE DISCOVERED ONE OF THE SIM CARD SLOT WAS DAMAGED SO SHE FIGURED IT WAS OK AND I DIDNT WANT TO TAKE IT BACK TO AMERICA COS SHE DIDNT HAVE ANY PHONE. LATER ON SHE DISCOVERED THAT SHE COULDNT EVEN TRANSFER ANY APPS TO HER MEMORY CARD SO SHE COULDNT DOWNLOAD APPS OR TAKE PICS. ALL THE TIME PHONE KEEPS SHOWING NO SPACE NO SPACE. HMM WHAT A PIECE OF JUNK. EVENTUALLY IT JUST STOPPED WORKING. LESS THAN A YEAR? COME ON. IM SO MAD I DIDNT TAKE IT BACK AND GET MY MONEY BACK. SO DISAPPOINTED! TOO LATE TO RETURN IT SO I LOSE!!!!

As much i like this phone for it size, unfortunately i have to return it.
The phone can't pick and connect to Wifi at work or at home.I tried everything i could to fix the problem without any success.

Ive only had it for a day, but so far this has been great. It isnt the fastest, but for 40 dollars this is amazing! You can google and call. My sim didnt fit, so i am going to verizon tomorrow but i got a free calling app that is working fine. I dropped my iphone off a rollercoaster and sixflags basically just sent me a completely disasembled phone. I got this until I can afford a new one and so far I am pleasantly surprised. So far its a great phone!

Loving the battery life and the metal frame.
Display is pretty good too and I'm happy for the flash on the front camera. Rear camera is lacking thou so don't expect any great pictures. So far it functions ok with little hanging up here and there but for its price it's a deceat phone.

First off, this is you get what you pay for. The battery life is not what I was hoping for, I got about 90 minutes of game play and watching videos. Android system is solid, however several apps I wanted were not compatible with this device. This would make a great secondary device, just not for me.

There is no documentation on this device. BLU further is violating the GPL by not releasing the source code or device trees or rom files. It comes pre-installed with mtklogger.apk, a known undesirable program.

i have never written review before bt this time i cud nt stop myself, nt because its good bt because it is the worst one in my life....it stucks for no reasons n gets the not responding sign every seconds. Also it gets suddenly out of network n WiFi connections. It only increases my blood pressure.....I had hard time using it for couple of months until i get the iPhone XS. I will never recommend it for any one....really disappointing :(
I wasn't sure if my sons tracfone simple would work. All I did was take his sim card out of his old broke phone and put it in this one and made a call. So simple. Phone is also as fast as my Note 5.

I decided to finally switch away from my windows phone since they aren't selling apps for it anymore. got this phone and it works like crap! I finally got sooo frustrated with people not being able to hear me, saying I was cutting in and out or really quiet that I switched back to my old windows phone. Also it was sooooo slow even when it has no other apps open. many times I'd be unable to run any apps or even listen to my voicemails because the apps will constantly crash. I wish I could get my money back!

I got the phone on time. I fell in love with the size. After setting up the phone I found out it was a waste of my money! It only looks good but not worth a dime! The phone freezes at every turn. You spend more time unfreezing the phone than anything. I have been a fan of the BLU phones since they came out. I had a blu studio before the Advance 6 it got wet and stop working. The Advance 6 is slower than dirt! (you know dirt don't move) best phone I had was the studio XL. So i'll be getting another Blu Studio XL 2 & throw the Advance 6 in the trash!

I bought this phone because it's Cricket compatible and I prefer a large screen/phablet because of my eyesight. It's a nice phone for my purposes because I don't spend all of my free time on the phone. However, I had to get rid of all of their built in apps and I STILL couldn't keep all of my downloaded apps. Also, it requires charging more than I ever did with my previous Alcatel phone.
Its not a phone for hard every day use, but it was perfect for what I wanted. Response time a bit slow, but still Very nice for the price

in less than a year it stopped being able to find the SD card. Thus the camera only worked if you uploaded directly to social media. The volume was always low and the sound through the headphones was barely audible. The phone is worse than a brick. Seemed Okay at the time.

I don't expect much from cheaper phones, but lasting a year is definitely one of them. Phone became slow (almost unbearably so). This phone single handedly made me want of any other Blu phone.

Spend the extra money, and buy something not "Blu"

I currently have 7 of these phones. They all do what they say they will do. The price of $60 is reasonable. One of the seven phones has a screen problem. It looks like some kind of liquid leaked inside. But it still functions well. I live in Vegas and am outside allot so these phones are subject to some extreme heat.

Nice phone. Happy with appearance. A little slow. Wonderful price. I needed dual SIM with a USA number and my Mexico number. Works Perfectly. Zero fuss. I'm not happy with Amazon or the delivery. I did get phone before Thursday as this is when it was expected. I received Sunday, and I didn't have anyone home to receive so I was worried they would leave at my doorstep in my apartment complex. And sure enough they did. Amazon is reporting they handed it to someone directly. They DID NOT! It could have been stolen!

I love my phone, its really big and the camera quality is really good, its cheap, really good phone for the price, the item is big PLUS , it comes with a phone case, a earphone and a screen protector. It has two camera, both camera has flash on it. The screen can be split into two as well. So you can ask for anything better than that

Almost four years ago (November 14, 2014 to be precise) I posted a review about my BLU STUDIO 5.5 D630u phone, to which I gave a 5 star rating.

Although my old phone is still working perfectly well, I decided to buy this new BLU A6 for two reasons.

First, because my old Studio 5.5 works on Android 4.2 and BLU refuses to let people upgrade their OS. This BLU A6 works with Android 7, which is supposed to be better. Please note that the latest version in June 2018 is Android 8, BUT the phones running that OS 8 do NOT have a removable battery.

And, indeed, the main reason why I bought this BLU A6 was because this is one of the few new phones with a REMOVABLE BATTERY and I wanted to have one before this feature disappears forever. A fixed battery on a device kills the sale for me because I refuse to pay mucho, mucho money for a technician to replace the battery, which has to be replaced periodicallyâ¦ Unless you buy a new phone every six months, which I donât!

UNFORTUNATELY, this new BLU A6 has several drawbacks and I had to return it for an immediate full refund from Amazon, which is always great, as usual:

1) My old Studio 5.5 from 2014 has a LED that blinks red when the battery is low, and then it turns to solid red while charging and logically becomes green when the battery is fully charged.

BUT THIS NEW A6 DOES NOT HAVE THAT BATTERY LED, which is surprising.

French author LA BRUYERE wrote in the seventeenth century that âCommon sense is the most widely spread thing in the worldâ. HE WAS WRONG!

2) When I open the BLUETOOTH on my old Studio 5.5 from 2014, I read a message saying that my phone is only visible to paired devices.

BUT THIS NEW A6 WARNS ME THAT IT IS VISIBLE TO ALL BT DEVICES NEARBY! And, indeed, when I turned the BT on, I saw a dozen devices without name, only with a series of numbers.

It is very embarrassing to know that your phone can be seen by anybody around without being paired!

LA BRUYERE was wrong againâ¦

3) Finally, (and this is the reason that pushed me to rush this thing back into its box and request an RMA from Amazon), unlike my old Studio 5.5 from 2014, THIS NEW A6 HAS NO OTG possibility!

As I explained in my extensive and comprehensive review of November 2014, the OTG (On The Go) is a cable with a micro USB male on one end and a female normal USB at the other end, where you can hook either a USB external drive, a memory card via adapter (SD, micro SD, etc.) or a USB keyboard, etc., etc.

I have several USB drives of 128 Gigs each (I said GIGS, not megs!) that I connect to my old Studio 5.5 and extend the memory ad infinitum. These USB drives are filled with videos or music, leaving the internal micro SD (of 128 Gigs also) for other files.

Well, THAT EXTERNAL MEMORY EXTESION IS IMPOSSIBLE ON THIS NEW A6 because it did NOT recognize any of my memory cards or drives via none of the 5 OTG cables that I tried to connect to it!

This LACK OF OTG CAPABILITY killed the sale and I decided to return the phone immediately because, if I could accept the SLOW phone and the SHORT battery life, I cannot accept the lack of OTG on any device that I buy.

There again, LA BRUYERE WAS WRONG!

How can there be such a lack of COMMON SENSE in 2018?

First impressions, it's good for what I'm using it for. I like using old phones as mini tablets and my old tablet/phone broke. I love my current phone, a Studio XL2. This A6 had almost the exact the same dimensions but it's lighter weight. It's also a little laggy by comparison and the battery life isn't great. I fully charged it this morning and tossed it in my purse. Half hour later it was down to 93% and I hadn't even used it yet. Bluetooth, location and wifi were off. Storage sucks too but I added a 32gb SD card so no problem there. Can't figure out how to move apps from internal storage to SD card yet, so there's that too.

For my needs, as a tablet so I don't run down my main phone battery streaming music and playing games, it's a keeper. If I was using it as my main phone, I would've sent it back. As a cheap tablet, I'm good with this.

Update 10/11/18

There's a lack of detail in the description for this phone. Unlike its predecessor, the Advance 5.0, which had two SIM slots AND a micro-SD card slot, this model, the Advance 5.2 gives you an option -- you can either use a nano-SIM (ONLY), and a micro-SD card for storage, OR you can use two nano-SIM cards, with no extra storage. The base storage in the phone itself is only 8GB. The selling points for this phone would seem to imply that that you could have two SIM cards (the size is NOT specified) and an additional 64GB micro-SD card for external storage. Not the case. For an unlocked phone, it would have been nice to have space for the mini-SIM, which is the legacy most people want to port to another phone. So, note: nano-SIMs only; only one SIM if using extra storage.

I had a really good experience with my last BLU phone so I didn't think twice about ordering a newer model. But this one is terrible. I've only had it for 4 months and it's been so awful that I'm already looking for something else to replace it. Here are the highlights:

1. Lack of phone storage: I don't know why they decided to decrease the phone storage so much from the BLU R1 HD (16 GB), but it's so bad you guys. It doesn't take very many apps to fill it up, and I think that being so close to maxed out storage is what's causing some of the other problems. There's no way to move the apps to the external storage (I have a 64 GB memory card in the phone that's barely got a dent in it from music & photos.)

2. Apps freeze up or stop working CONSTANTLY. For the first couple of months, I got constant pop ups telling me that "messages" weren't working or some other app that should be working all the time on a PHONE. It didn't even matter if I was trying to use them or not. They interrupted calls, emailing, etc. Stupid. I Googled around and found a setting on the phone that would stop apps from running in the background, and that resolved this issue, BUT...

3. Now I'm not getting text messages at all. Or sometimes I get them and sometimes I don't. Or sometimes I get other people's messages but they don't get my responses.

4. Oh yeah - and being on a phone call causes the phone to freeze. Let me repeat that: Being on a phone call causes the phone to freeze.

I just can't with this phone.

Pure Trash. I wish I had received one of the good ones everyone else is reviewing. This thing has a battery that will die within four hours of idle time with no use. Very disappointing that they would even sell this.

I don't know what the Blu Advance A4 is but it is not a phone. The incoming phone volume is barely audible rendering the phone useless. This is my second A4 with the same problem. I managed to contact Blu's Tech Support but they were no help suggesting I upgrade the firmware, which I did, but there was no improvement. I spent some time on the 'net trying various software 'fixes' for Android phones with low phone volume but none worked. I also installed several volume boost apps, again with no effect. The speakerphone worked well however and callers on the other end of the line could hear me well enough. My advice is to save yourself time and frustration and stay away from this 'phone'.

This phone is not a quality phone. It does not keep up with today's demands of a smart phone. 1. Poor battery life. The battery life last on average a few hours a day with normal use. Do not try to use the phone while charging because it will drain quickly and shut off. 2. The software is not compatible with today's applications. Todays applications require a large use of space and processing which the phone can not keep up with and freezes or crashes with using a simple Uber App or Google Maps. So I had to remove all apps and only use this phone to text/call. 3. Even if you keep it to simple calling and texting only the phone simply crashes and freezes. Just to note: I have NO apps downloaded anymore because the phone. 4. The calls do not come through clearly. On numerous occasions people tell me the phone is muffled, they can't hear me, static, etc. I have to stand very still and do not move just to talk to many people. I wasted my money on a cheap phone that gives exactly a cheap phone results. I definitely recommend staying away from BLU technology and products all together. There's a reason they are not known in today's American cell phone market.

Just bought this phone but am returning it right away. Within 45 minutes of setting it up, it became very hot. I checked the battery but it wasn't as hot as the phone. Even after turning it off for several minutes and cooling down, it became just as hot. There wasn't anything running in particular. I hadn't even activated the new cell service or had the chance to do much with it and yet it was alarmingly hot. Hopefully this was just an anomaly, but I won't be taking my chances with a replacement.

Otherwise, it would have been nice: lightweight, nice screen display, and it came with a clear phone case and screen protector.

I mean for the record this thing is getting me through until my RMA replacement comes in a couple days, but don't even consider it for a daily driver.
