They say sure it will take another 24 hours and it will be done. Today I call back to get a status and they say the person you just talked to screwed the account up and you will have to call back in 24 hours to get it fixed. I asked to speak to the manager after a little bit on hold they come back and tell me they will call me back in 24 hours. I have also been charged for service and activation on a device that cannot be used. I am trying to get this working for an elderly parent. I am so glad that I didn't send the phone directly to them.

very awesome phone love the big screen and big buttons bigger than any other cell phone you can actually see the number that you are dialing the phone who you're calling and your texting and I really love the big red button at the bottom of the phone it is called five-star for emergencies only love the idea the price of the phone is not too bad either the price of the phone plans the amount of talk time and price is not bad either and they take the money right out of your checking or savings account if you wish but the best thing I like about it the best is no contracts so you can pay for it as long as you want one month two months whatever

I would not recommend this phone or service to anyone. The phone is cheaply made looking. The service is horrible even in a buys city. Working with customer service was a joke. They kept telling me to raise the phone in the air to see if that would help with service. What's the point in that, then you can't use the phone. I personally would not recommend this service to anyone who wants to give it to their elderly family member.

Bought for my 97âyrâold dad who loves it. It has the loudest ring of any other phoneâand I have searched them all! Very simple to use, including the texting feature which he can manage very well. I recommend to anyone with less than agile fingers and poor hearing.

Any senior reading this review should have this phone, it is a phone, no data, no texting no computer, just a phone that is very, very easy to use and set up. You won't bump into any body, fall into a hole, or take your eyes off the road while driving. It's a phone, just talk into it. Best of all the total cost per month for 200 minutes is $20.00 with all the taxes. That's over 3 1/2 hours of talk per month.

While this seems like a good idea( might be if it worked) this phone is just a lump lying on a table. After 3 weeks of trying to get the phone to work consistently, I finally got a customer service rep who finally told me that the company is aware of the problem and are working on it . In the mean time they still happily collect your money.
The problem is it dosen't ring every time and even if it does both sides of the call can't hear the other side. Occasionally the phone works as advertised- maybe 1 out of 25.
Also when you activate your phone they're rude if you just want the phone, no medical. My mother is in assisted living and doesn't have need for it but it is her only phone. After the initial activation customer service good and based all in the US.

I purchased this phone for my mother who suffers from macular degeneration. The phone would have worked well for her, had it been comparable with Verizon. The Jitterbug is a 3G phone and Verizon is a 4G-5G service.

i purchased this phone for my disabled mother in law. Sheâs never used a cell phone or ever been on the internet. I read the negative comments about activation regardless I ordered the phone from amazon. The call to GreatCall was about 20 minutes long and not difficult or frustrating at all. There was an activation fee that i wasnât aware of until I called GreatCall. They recommended that I charge the phone for 12 hours prior to activation. Activation took minutes and was easy step by step process. Screen is clear and bright, colors can be changed, volumes increased. 2 great features that I wasnât aware of until i read the manual, 1. set up contacts on the MyGreatCall.com website was easy and quick. the best feature for the disabled is call the operator and tell them to call contact in phone book. amazing! For my Mother in law this phone is perfect. Also, the 5 star button gives us a sense of safety and security when she has to be alone. I shouldâve ordered this product for her years ago but I wasnât aware of it.
Bought this for my husband. It's a very bad phone. You can't text with it, unless you are very patient. Sent it back.

It's a little premature to write a review, but so far it seems like a great phone. I bought this for my father and he loves it. He had an iPhone before this and it was a waste of money. He is actually very savvy on the computer, but using a smart device was not his thing. It was a bit hard for him to touch the screen and navigate through menus. This Flip phone gave him all the basics he needed and the speaker is very loud. It's easy to use and very light weight. Service is easy to setup and customer service is friendly. If you need to port-in an existing number, you'll have to call in.

It's meant for seniors and as someone in their 40s, I found it hard to hear. Often had to smash the phone to my ear and plug my other ear to try and hear the person talking. Audio quality is very poor. Often people on the other side of the phone call have a hard time hearing me. Using earbuds with a microphone is usually the best choice. The phone is also very delayed when you enter commands. Pressing certain buttons, you have to wait for the phone to catch up (adjusting volume, scrolling through phone book, etc). Often it takes multiple attempts to adjust the volume. It is very delayed in notifying of texts and missed calls. I've had it where my wife texts that she is on her way home, she gets home, we talk and 10 minutes later I get her text. It will also notify me of a missed call that occurred 15+ minutes prior and the phone never rang. I had voicemail at one point, don't seem to now, but that's more of an issue with Great Call and not necessarily the Jitterbug. One nice thing is the flashlight/torch. It's very bright and very accessible. The two games on the phone are entertaining...for about 5 minutes. When texting, there is no cursor and by that I mean, if you notice you misspelled something, you have to delete everything back to that point...you can't move the cursors back to the error, fix it, and move back to where you were typing. So text slow and carefully or live with the errors. Was looking for a flip phone with no internet which is getting hard to find nowadays and this is what we ended up with. Not impressed.

Purchased for my older sister. Its simple to use and the layout is great. You can add to the phonebook online which is handy if your person is computer challenged. The service network is "greatcall.com" which operates on the Verizon network. I highly recommend for those who will not or can not use a smart phone.

I bought this phone for my mom over a month ago and she LOVES it. Its very easy for her to use which is a big plus because she cant operate a smart phone to save her a**. So I found this phone for her and its working perfect. Also the emergency call button is a blessing just in case something should happen when I'm working at night.

My husband has Parkinson's Disease with Parkinson's Dementia and the phone is so good because of it's simplicity. I tried a smart phone for him and he just didn't understand how to use it as well as calling or hitting buttons and not knowing what he was doing. I also tried a flip phone from Verizon and it was more complicated than the smart phone. I looked up the Jitterbug, read the reviews and decided to give it a try. Well, my husband can actually use this phone. He gets confused at times, but it is so much simpler to use and he can't make a mistake and call someone when he didn't mean to. I highly recommend this phone for a person who is not into or does not understand today's technology.

Absolutely no problems. I've just given up on the California Lifeline free phone. A smartphone with data. But only 5 Mb of data a month. The darn thing stuffs move updates and spam onto it than that. Storage always full and not operating. I've spent hours on the phone to India support trying to get it back running again. In comparison the Jitterbug is such a pleasure and incredible good support for a lot of thing withit. Simply gets messages and calls, loud speaker, big numbers on it's screens. That works for messages and calls. Plus a ton more elderly services if wanted.

This is a straight forward operation phone, which I especially need since the tech scene is simply not my thing. I miss my rotary phone, okay? I like its large numbers so that I don't have to find my glasses before using it. I like the louder, clearer sound than I have experienced with other modern phones, cell or otherwise. The speaker phone gives a very clear sound so that my husband and I can have conversations with our kids together. On the other hand, our reception is constantly rated by the phone as poor, even though according to their reception map we shouldn't have trouble. We find we often are restricted while talking to sitting by a certain window. The phone does seem to need much more charging than my husband's cell phone, even when we are not using it. I find the small volume control on the side frustrating since it can easily be bumped while at the same time difficult to maneuver after being bumped. Finally, although I don't need their elaborate alert system (which costs extra) and I'm not interested in access to the internet (their smart phone), as an elderly person it sure would be nice if on this simpler phone I could nonetheless schedule a bell or beep to remind me of the time (meds, check the oven or the sprinkler, make a call, etc.) As for durability, I may have an opinion in a year or two.

The phone looks wonderful. But looks aren't everything..tho in this case they were since it would not function inspite of our best efforts and the efforts of two operators. one who spoke incredibly fast apparently not realizing if she had slowed to half speed everything would gone much smoother and faster
The other operator was as rapid a speaker but also had a thick accent.. Oh yes.one more thing. you go through this hassle to save 30%, sure you do, but then the phone needs activating and the activation cost brings the bill to full price again. so I was a sucker.don't be one too!

the customer service sucks! I called to activate (as per instructions), and they were TERRIBLE. The girl was ditzy, and then rude. I have a typical Scottish name, and I've NEVER had to say it 3x for someone, THEN spell my 1st AND last name both, 3 times EACH (we hadn't even gotten to any of the registration details yet)! She had a nerve to get impatient, then she couldn't remotely activate my phone. After several attempts, she switched me to another dept. The guy informed me that after multiple attempts, I would now have to wait 24 hrs to call back and try activation again, as the system would need time to reboot or something. 45 minutes of time...wasted! This phone was for my 86 yr old mother, and I could only imagine the tears and frustration if it had been her. NO THANKS! I had to upgrade my own phone anyway, so I did more research and got her a similar phone on my new plan with another T-carrier. The phone is ALMOST as good as the Jitterbug, but at least a cheaper deal and much better service. The Jitterbug phone itself is REALLY great--perfect for the elderly and everything I wanted for Mom. However, you can only turn it on with their service, and for me it wasn't worth it for her (financially or emotionally).

The phone is clearly designed to be simple to use for seniors. There are a number of little details that show the thought went into the product. You need a phone contract with Great Call to use this - make sure you read the small print to see what it is included in the fees and how much extra for taxes etc will get added on to the final bill.

The Jitterbug Flip is intended to be a phone for seniors to use in emergencies, but it is so buggy that it ends up being less usable than any ordinary phone. Immediately after purchasing this phone, it disappointed and certainly doesn't perform like a phone should from this century.

From day one, the phone behaved like it was possessed. It froze up, spontaneously rebooted, couldn't make outgoing calls, and the ring function worked only sporadically. I've never seen a phone with so many major problems.

The phone takes a minute, maybe more to boot up to a point where a call can be made. The user interface is designed to be easy to use but my elderly parent found it more confusing than a typical tablet-like smart phone. Similar to a Ouija board, it only has YES , NO or arrow buttons to navigate through menus, but it should have a dedicated home button and X button like old 90's era flip phones that are familiar to seniors.

The battery life on the phone is abysmal, lasting only one day on standby. Even though only test calls were made on the phone, the battery died within a few months and had to be replaced. Even with he new battery, the phone randomly dies and the battery has to be removed to revive it regardless of the state of charge. One bright spot is the battery is easy to replace, but the Jitterbug manual warns owners not to replace it, as if this is a cardinal sin.

The phone has terrible reception, and shows POOR on the info screen in areas where smartphones show all bars. We haven't tested the emergency call button, but it isn't much good with all of this phones other failures. This is not a phone I would recommend to anyone, and certainly not anyone whose life depends on it.

Bought this phone for my elderly mom because they said it would work on the Verizon network and she needed a replacement phone that would be easy for her to see and use. Phone has a great design but it will not hook up to Verizon. I wanted to keep her phone number and her on my family plan and it could not be done. I spent about 4 hours over three days talking with Verizon on the phone and making multiple trips to the Verizon store because they thought it should work, but to no avail.Verizon went the extra mile to try and get it to work. Had to return the phone. Thank you Amazon for your great return policy.

As a senior lady who didn't need all the tricks of which my previous phone was capable I read lots of reviews and chose this. I like the large number keys, the loud speaker, and the red key to call for emergency help and I think I would be very happy if it just worked. Intermittently the light inside will not come on when I flip it open. When it does come on, the screen keeps flickering or it keeps turning completely off and on. I removed the battery to force a hard reset but nothing changed. Now I have the hassle of returning it. I'm not a happy camper. I guess I'm a grouchy granny.

I purchased this phone for my brother, who is "technology challenged". He has no car, no TV, no Computer and no Cell phone.... He has a land line that he can only receive calls. I took a chance that he would be able to use this (and not be afraid of it). After a lot of grumbling... he is now very comfortable with the JITTERBUG. Now he can call his friends instead of waiting to be called by someone. Customer Service at GREATCALL takes a while to get through.. but once you get a person... they have been so very helpful, patient and polite. I HIGHLY recommend this phone for Seniors. Buttons are big and well lit and the display screen is BIG so even my brother, who is blind in one eye, can easily read it. The phone itself is made with quality materials... feels good in the hand. You have an awesome product here !

I don't actually have an opinion about this phone because I was never able to activate it. The product information and the original Amazon representative I called said that Jitterbug would work with my existing Verizon plan. When I went to my local Verizon store, the rep tried to set it up but could not. He then replace the Jitterbug SIM card with one from Verizon but that the Verizon SIM card would not sync with the Jitterbug phone. So basically I had to return the Jitterbug and start from ground one. So, as far as I can tell, the Jitterbug does not work with an existing Verizon plan...

Basically it's junk. Voice calling wouldn't work even after several calls to tech support. Contacts are only listed as they were entered, NOT alphabetically. You need to step through them till you find the one you want. Phone discharges quickly. Left unused all day it would be dead by the next morning.

got this for my mother in her 80s. biggest dial i can find out there in the market. it comes with many options but i only needed for her to dial out. bit confusing about the plans they offer once you call to activate the line. the box says 14.99 per month but it turns out it was around 30 per month plus activation fee of $30. they told me i can down grade the plan after a month so she can only have voice call. the lower price on the box doesn't come with long distance or vm option according to the rep. no choice but to upgrade service. quality of the phone was OK. not as solid as LG or other brand name phones. sound was OK even with speaker option. for me it was all about the big dial so have to compromise on some items. i just got it so let see how it works out in few months. they also separate plans by per min so expect to pay for that as well.

Never turned on. Actually, bought two for my parents in their 80s. Went on line to activate, and fee after fee kept popping up. Stopped trying, and called Verizon where she had her account, she got a new flip phone. Added $6.00 to pay for phone. Has unlimited everything. Thought the Jitterbug would be a good deal. Not even close! Just remember; Even if John Walsh is on the TV telling you how great this is..... do not believe it.

Got this phone for my 96 year old mother-in-law and she loves it. It has looked up a couple of times though, requiring a call to the very friendly support staff and resetting by removing the back and battery, reinstalling them and rebooting. She is very hard of hearing, but does quite well with this phone. She's learned to take pictures and receive pictures, on her own.
Large keys and screen. East to use makes the Jitterbug the best option for seniors' cell phone use.

I purchased this for my 90 year old mom with mid-stage dementia. It was pretty easy to use and the buttons and screen easy to read. The ring tone is way too soft, however, even at highest setting. Another design flaw is how difficult it is to seat the phone properly into charger and the connector is also very tiny. I was most unhappy with the quality of the phone (or? possibly the software). The buttons became harder to push and some of the functions quit working properly (example: it would say no voice mail message when there were messages) after 6 months of light use. I would say it's easy to use but may not last long.

This is without a doubt the worst cell phone I have ever had. It worked intermittently for six months, went dead and was replaced. Now it's six months later and same problem. Works intermittently and dead. It's worthless and I am now looking for a more reliable phone. What a waste of money.

I feel really bad because I convinced my older sister to purchase the Jitterbug as her first cell phone. Her phone rings frequently during the day for no reason.

Everything about this phone is.great. It's simple to operate . My mother wears hearing aides and has no problems hearing with this phone. On the old phone she had tremendous issues with being able to hear. None of her 6 children nor her personally could enjoy a phone conversation with any of the prevoius phones she had and she tried several different phones. The Jitter Bug phone has solved those issues. Not real thrilled that she has to purchase monthly service. She uses very little of her monthly minutes and they roll over every month-old so even though she.is accumulating quite a few minutes, if you dont.pay the.monthly plan fee you won't have phone service. She could save a lot of $ if she.was able.to pay as you go. Meaning you have phone service as long as you have minutes. I would still recommend this phone to anyone especially seniors that are.not.into all the high tech features of today.

I purchased this phone for my 77 year old mother with the beginning signs of dementia. She loved the phones simplicity. I noticed that the signal strength is always poor, at times she can hear her own voice echo, and I have had a hard time hearing her couple of times. Talking on the phone to customer service can be a huge pain for me so I use Email. I sent an Email last week telling them about the issues and thought maybe It had a bad SIM card but I got absolutely no response from the company. Maybe they will see this message and answer my problems but the next bill is coming due and I'm not sure I want to keep this phone. I would love to update this review with a more positive one but, who knows.

Of course, this phone has many good features. Unfortunately, there is no way to block calls. In this day of robo-calling that is no longer acceptable. The phone number received from GreatCall was previously attributed to someone who had very persistent callers who didn't want to believe that the number was no longer that of their friend or creditor. The inability to block these callers was a great disappointment. We have now requested a new number and so far, so good.
Purchased for my 81 year old Mom. Love it - super easy to use and exactly what she needed. Large fonts, clear buttons and not complicated at all.

Disappointed in the styling of the keys, especially for elderly people. I bought this for my father who suffers from Alzheimers, and because he reject most technology, giving him an iPhone was out of the question. I needed to upgrade his existing phone to one that I could GPS track, and GreatCall is the only remaining service provider that offers the GPS in a flip phone. But my issue is the usual keypad that would display a red phone for hang-up and a green phone for answer is replaced with YES and NO buttons and arrow buttons that are not as easily used to navigate as one would hope for. For the amount of monthly charges $45+ for this phone, it's leading me to research some alternative way to be able to track my dad than watch him struggle with this phone.

And for the record - my dad is in great health otherwise and takes many walks throughout the day in his neighborhood, but every now and then he'll be out longer than expected or forgets where he is. So being able to track him is extremely important. GreatCalls tracking app features are awesome and worthy of 5 stars, but the phone itself sucks.

The phone is okay as far as numbers, and screen is concerned. The ringtone however, is not nearly good enough for an elderly person that is hard of hearing. Even the vibration is pretty weak. For the price, I should've gotten my grandma a smartphone instead since theyr'e louder. Also there are no pay as you go plans. Only month to month, even if you don't use all 200 minutes from the cheapest phone plan.

Beware. a software problem can cause this phone to freeze and not respond to any key. this was not disclosed prior to purchase. However 6 weeks after phone was activated, it froze and wouldn't work at all. Customer service talked me through a process to reboot ( pull out battery, reinstall and then hold on button for 30 seconds.) this did work, but was advised that phone will need to be turned completely off 1 or 2 times per week to prevent it from freezing again. apparently "they" are working on the glitch and may come out with a fix. the big numbers on the keys and screen are as advertised. would think Great Calls should have disclosed this known problem before sale. What other surprises lurk?
Got this phone for my Mom, easy to use no very reasonably priced. Phone plan is perfect for her, she is 91 yrs young!!!!!

I bought the Jitterbug Flip Cell Phone for my 92-year old mother, and she has learned to use it! Initially we were concerned that she might just outright reject using a cell phone, but I showed her how it works and set up her phone book. She now calls me, other family members and friends!! Even when she forgets how to use a specific feature, the phone is simple enough that she can figure it out again. Really a great phone for seniors!
Terrible connections. AFTER buying you find out Verizon, the carrier only uses the secondary towers fr this phone. Nothing you can do to change it. So now it's a throw away and out the money!!!!!!!!

If you are a Senior it is a hassle, hard to understand....you can NOT put this phone on your current plan with ATT---TMobile etc - so don't even try.....If you want to give ALL of your personal informaton to GreatCall BEFORE you can understand their plan options....go for it.....Basically if you want to reinvent the wheel, buy this phone....
My mom - age 91 - is doing okay with Jitterbug, when she remembers where she put the damn thing.

I would give it a zero if I could. I have had all the problems others have said. I suspect this phone works well if you don't get a lemon but there are so many lemons out there it is a crap shoot.

I will be returning the phone.

This is a great phone for those that don't want the fancy do everything device. Great Call is so much better than Cellular One in every way. I also get the 5 Star button that connects me to the emergency services if I need help and the first 200 minutes are included. This gives me the same as Cellular One at about the same price but works.

I don't know if it's the phone or the cell service but we only receive about 50% of the calls that are made to us on this phone. What I mean by that is, in only 50% of the cases, the phone rings. The other 50% of the time, the calls go straight to call history or voicemail. We've worked with Great Call customer service and, of course, they can't replicate the problem. Our other cell phone is an iPhone and we don't have this problem. Texting is also a pain - no popup keyboard. Suggestions welcome!

We have had a few problems but for an emergency phone it is not recommended. The calls sometimes fall off and there are times when the person you are talking too cannot hear you. I have had to call the help line twice and we have only had the phone a short while.

I bought this phone for my husband who uses a cell phone just a couple of times a year. I was trying to find one that was easy to use but also save us money. The ease of the phone is fine, but the cost advertised is increased by regulatory fees and taxes by an additional $4.03. I was replacing a Cricket phone he was using, the cost quoted was what we paid. Although there likely were these fees included, we were quoted the total correctly. I expected this phone to save us $15 a month. It saves us $10 instead. I cannot comment further on the quality of the phone as he rarely uses it.

If you want a simple phone, not one of those do everything smart phones, than this is the phone for you. My husband hates tech stuff of any kind but he loves his new flip phone. It fits easily in a pocket, gets service dang near everywhere (he is out in the woods or on the water a lot), has nice big numbers that are easy to see, and it is soooo easy to use. Love it!
Got one for my mom who is having visions problems and who has little need for a fancy iPhone. She loves it and can easily see the numbers, even with her macular degeneration.

This phone is perfect for my 80+ year old great aunt. Buttons and screen are large, high contrast, and easy to read. A plus: the phone is always asking a question (i.e. display reads "select?") and the buttons are "Yes" and "No" instead of the common phone buttons (select and back). GreatCall is also a really great service that is perfect for my great aunt who is still very independent and travels often. GreatCall using cell phone towers for access has been very useful multiple times. Customer service is awesome.

We bought this phone for my 96 year old mother for a Christmas gift for 2016. Great Call activated the phone the beginning of February 2017. We have had nothing but trouble with the phone itself. It keeps shutting itself off. Great call has sent us 3 new phones since February and as of today, April 20th, the 3rd phone has shut off 3 times and my mother has had it for only 1 week. Great Calls answer is pull the battery out and reboot it. Does Great Call expect a 96 year old to pull the battery out everytime, not to mention unless you look at the phone you wouldn't even know it is off. I am calling Great Call for the last time tomorrow and am ready to cancel this service. I only hope Amazon will give me a return credit on this very inferior product. If you have an elderly parent do not buy this Flip Phone.

I like the jitter bug flip phone alot. I was able to get the plan that I wanted without all the other things included with a phone packag, such as texting, using internet storage and the five star button.If I choose to use the other ootions I can easily add them when I need them. The camera takes nice pictures an the magnifer works great for small print.

I bought two of these for my parents, they just needed a simple phone, or so I thought. As soon as I got them activated my 88 year old dad said "How do I put a picture on the screen like your phone?" So far so good, I think they have actually used them once - called each other to see how they sound - otherwise they just charge all day forgotten when my parents leave the house.
My mom is finding this phone much easier to use than her other phone. The yes and no controls are easy to understand. Nice big letters

Bought this phone for grandma in assisted living. It proved too difficult for her to use due to her mild dementia. It is probably only suitable for younger seniors with no or very little cognitive impairment. We found the Xlink product which allows you to connect an old fashioned standard dial up landline phone to a cellular network through any cell phone. Thought we could use the Jitterbug with this, but it turns out the Jitterbug phone is the only cell phone available that does not work with the Xlink, as it does not have proper bluetooth connectivity. From Xlink support -

"The jitterbug flip phone by Great Call does not dial out with the XLink.

In the last 15 years, this cell phone is the only cell phone we have come across that does not support Bluetooth HFP. This means that devices like the XLink or many CarKits cannot use it properly. It lacks the ability to dial phone numbers when the XLink wants to make a phone call with it.

We have no solution and there is no work around. We advise getting a different cell phone. We have not come across a single other cell phone that lacks this ability and it is a shocking ommision.

We strongly suggest contacting the manufacturing and registering a complaint about this."

We cancelled the service with Great Call, and were able to use the Xlink successfully with an old Moto X phone.

The display is bright and the phone book function works well. However, there are issues with the ringer. It only has 3 volume settings and the loudest setting isnât that loud. The ringer also seems to cut out and basically has a poor sound quality. Also, the buttons on the side that control the volume are too easily pressed when you use the phone and there is no way to lock the sound level in. This is a fatal flaw as far Iâm concerned and I would not recommend this phone because of these issues.

Good service for an older guy like me. Some are cheaper but $30 a month for 600 minutes and 200 texts aint bad. Ya get the emergency button for that too. I broke my ankle this last Christmas sure wish I had this.

Don't be fooled into thinking your carrier will support this phone. I gave my mom my old Samsung phone, and she had trouble learning how to use it, so I decided to get the famous "Jitterbug." I bought it through Amazon and after reading the information I was led to believe that I could add this phone to my current Verizon phone plan. After several hours of phone chat, changing SIM cards, etc. I was finally directed to go to the Verizon store, which I did. This phone will not work with Verizon. Do not be fooled into thinking you can use Verizon as a carrier for this phone. This is part of one of the answers I looked at to decide to get this phone... All Jitterbug cell phones and smartphones are unlocked per nationwide standards, but we cannot control which carriers choose to accept or activate our phones. In this day of Amazon giving consumer ratings, I am amazed that they do not tell you that you can't use a company as huge as Verizon. If you have any existing phone plan, don't assume your carrier will support the Jitterbug. While I was at the Verizon store, I bought a flip phone from Verizon for a trade in on my Samsung, and spent a little more money. The worst part for me is the wasted 10 hours of ordering, dealing with and eventually sending this unit back. Hopefully I won't waste more time.

Overall, a bad phone for elderly folks. First of all, if you're going to make a device for seniors, make it loud. The ringer, the speakerphone, everything should be audible to old ears. Next, there's the dock. Horrible design. The phone never feels like it's securely docked. We ended up just plugging the cord straight into the phone itself. Then there's the UI. Complicated, non-intuitive. It takes multiple keystrokes just to see how much charge is left on the battery. The big buttons are a great start, but Jitterbug really should have put more thought into the design of this device.

I bought it as a Christmas gift for my mom and she really enjoys it. If you are looking for a phone to mainly make calls or send texts, have issues with smart phones; or just want a simple, easy-to-use phone, this is a great solution. Takes decent quality photos as well. Simple to set up and use.
Worked for only 3 months. Dead and buried waiting for return service request.
Not tracpone. Great call may be good, too expensive for my buget. Wish Amazon could create a red star for do not purchase

it died after a month. it was impossible to contact them by phone. I could reach no one..not even to cancel plan.
i cannot believe john walsh is connected here. the people were actually rude. there should be a NO STAR NOT ONE STAR.
This phone is either defective, or just a piece of junk. It will not consistently work, and the buttons occasionally stick. I'd buy a better phone that can be relied on.

I disliked the tone of voice and the manner in which I was treated by the call center young man. He was sharp, impatient and severe...not someone you would expect to help an elderly person....which is why I bought the phone. I am very upset by my treatment and have called Amazon to let them know how I feel.

Very poorly made. Worked OK the first 50 days or so, then the keypad stopped working correctly, the ringer stopped working, so all calls to me went to Voicemail. They don't allow returns after 30 days and No Customer assistance after 60 days. Bought directly from Amazon. The charger died less than 2 weeks after I got it and the phone wasn't far behind. GreatCall is your ONLY carrier option with the jitterbug phone, which is also a problem.

Very good simplicity for tech challenged seniors. Mom's vision is not what it used to be and the large font size is very helpful. Good device and good "Great Call" service plans. I was most impressed by the Great Call operators who actually spoke english with an American accent and were very friendly and helpful.

GOING "BACK TO THE FUTURE" FROM MY "SMART" PHONE, I AM EXTREMELY HAPPY WITH ALL ASPECTS OF THE "JITTERBUG"!!! IT DOES EVERYTHONG I NEED, USING A VERY USER-FRIENDLY FORMAT!!! ESPECIALLY FOR SOMEONE WHO LIKES SIMPLICITY!

I purchased the Jitterbug Cell Phone for a 85 year old partially blind friend of my wife and I. It is everything that she wanted and is quite pleased with it. She has had it for several months now, no functional problems, large keys, easy to see and illuminated to help. Best of all, it's affordable for someone on limited finances. She has easily mastered listing contacts and enjoying the user friendly operational system. I know she would recommend it here but does not have computer access and so I am doing it for her.

I bought this phone for my Mom--I had to return it because after a couple of weeks, the phone would no turn on. Amazon was fantastic in sending me a second phone however, the phone has issues at times where there is trouble in hearing the person. To be fair, it could be the GreatCall service which is the service that is required to be used with phone. The functionality of the phone is great and it is very user-friendly! Works great for seniors!

Everything was great until I tried to activate. Setup auto pay and I noticed a $25.00 activation fee!
This fee is not disclosed in any of their marketing information. Called to complain and they correctly told me it is disclosed in the fine print on the tab of the box!!
I also discovered that incoming calls are charged to your minute allowance. A 14.99 charge could easily be replaced with a 100.00 to $200.00 charge and with auto pay would not notice until I reconcilled my accounts.
I am planning on returning to Amazon as it is misrepresented and misleading.

Although reasonably simple to set up and use by seniors, the one BIG FLAW is the stupid placement and operation of the side volume buttons! Why they didn't realize that seniors don't notice these buttons, and by merely holding the phone in their hand would accidentally turn the ringer volume completely off surprises me! I got one for my mother, and although we showed her how to use the phone and how to use the volume buttons, we constantly find that just holding the phone...she is pushing the volume down so far she can't hear it ring. Good job Jitterbug! What they REALLY NEED is a way to LOCK THE RINGER VOLUME.

Got this for my mom after failing with several smart phones for her to remember how to use it. This has a very simple setup, large print, and my mom's been calling friends and family non-stop since getting it. I also love the affordable monthly plan options, her's is at the most basic and is only $14.99 per month.

I bought this Jitterbug phone for my elderly mother but returned it. The phone has large numbers and probably works Great Call describes it, but the lowest cost monthly minute plan through Great Call is $25 per month ($300/yr.). My mother stills uses a landline and only uses a cell phone in case of emergency. I went to Walmart and got her a Tracfone that had a speakerphone. Annual minute plans are much less expensive.

Jitterbug/greatcall is built on the verizon network. Do not expect T-mobile OR sprint to work on this phone. They advertise the phone to be unlocked, but you can't even turn it on without it trying to go through the set up process. Thus not allowing you to check network connectivity, or utilize the phone in any manner.

the product has a lot of potential, but the false advertisement and horrible customer service is why i'm rating it a 1 star.

I bough this as a back-up because my real phone (Samsung Smartphone) gave up the ghost after 4 years and I haven't replaced it yet. I dislike this phone intensely. It is a "dumb" phone. It's a good thing I have my tablet and laptop.I hate having to press yes or no for everything but at least I can make phone calls which my defunct phone can no longer do. You won't believe (yes you will) that even with the new phone number I am getting robo calls. OMG!

I bought this for my elderly parents with the understanding that they would be able to add it to their Verizon plan. Verizon refuses to help them in any way. The return window closed on this purchase as my parents live a distance away and I just retrieved the phone. Iâm very disappointed in this purchase! Want to return so it might work for someone else! Customer service at Jitterbug was great. But canât use phone as intended with current carrier.

My husband is 80 and completely defeated by his Virgin Mobile smartish phone. The Jitterbug Flip does many fewer things, which makes it a much better fit for his needs. Customer service at Virgin Mobile, his previous carrier, was nonexistent, and he was always very frustrated by his phone and their lack of help. The GreatCall customer service is outstanding: a sentient human answers the call on the first ring and treats us with respect and concern. I could not be happier with this change.

We have had a Jitterbug phone for many years and love it...especially my husband who is high tech phobic! Recently we decided to get rid of our landline and so bought another updated Jitterbug for me. I love it! It is easy to use , is very attractive in its red case and serves our low tech needs. Thnak you for making it available. I highly recommend the Jitterbug!
Its not a Samsung anymore, its some off brand. Lousy quality - kept freezing up requiring numerous restarts. Very frustrating for my dad - we returned it

The phone is very simple to use. I had to call Jitterbug three times to set it up and I was so happy that EACH TIME I CALLED, I got a person who spoke English and I could understand them plain and clear. Thank you for that. It is VERY FRUSTERATING TO CALL WHEN NEEDING HELP AND YOU CAN NOT UNDERSTAND A THING THE PERSON IS SAYING. IF A PRODUCT IS SOLD IN AMERICA, THE HELP SHOULD BE IN PLAIN ENGLISH.

We purchased this for our daughter who specifically wanted a "red" phone. As she is challenged this phone with its emergency button was especially what we needed for her. It is working just fine. Love the docking station and so does she.

bought this for my mom but its not the great product its cracked up to be. The buttons are big enough and the instructions are dubious at best. Still trying to find out how to delete a number from phone book.
good price easy to set up and use

The phone is great but when you go to get service from "Great Call" that is an entirely different story. I tried for FOUR HOURS to get the phone to activate. I called the company - and sat on hold forever - THREE times and THREE different people gave THREE different reasons why the phone wasn't setting up properly. The last one tried to convince me that the phone wasn't yet activated - even though the first two people told me it was and I had called the number from a landline - one told me it wasn't charged - it was, I certainly know how to tell if a phone is charged - and one told me that the service wasn't strong enough in my area to set the phone up ... see, according to her, the service has to be stronger service to do the set up, but that my 89 year old father would get service after that???!!! What the heck? Like I have never activated a phone before? I blew up and cancelled everything and returned the phone. A great phone is of no use if you can't use it. I went to Verizon at the last minute and got my dad a phone that worked so his birthday was not a total bust.
It doesn't work and 45 days later, I can't return it. Thanks Amazon

Durable, very good coverage, easy to learn and use, good clear sound and volume, safe in pants pocket, didn't want internet access on cell phone, had 6 other cell phones w/TracFone but this jitterbug and the Verizon service is far superior. Verizon only provider that covers my home area and most everywhere else. I am now a happy camper. TracFone customer service in a state of decline. Was with them 10 years until now.

The Jitterbug phone was not suitable for use with the phone systems used in New Zealand . A fact that I was unaware of when I purchased the phone. I found this out after spending many hours trying to have it set up, to no avail. The fact that the phone could only be used on a USA phone net work system was not mentioned in the information given. I have returned the phone and I am waiting for reimbursement
The Jitterbug phones are great. My husband uses his and he's not techie. Simple, easy to use phone. It's that simple.

Bought this for my 92 yr old mom. She has learned to operate it easily and got rid of her house phone. It is easy to charge, easy to handle, and, at least, we have peace of mind that she can call for help if she falls or needs assistance. She doesn't use texting, so her monthly bill is quite manageable for her.

Ordered this for my Mom (92). She had the older version of the same phone and we expected this one to work the same. Unfortunately, it did not. Something was haywire with it and it was frustrating to my Mom that is scared of new "gadgets". I contacted Amazon and was able to return it and order a second one that seems to be working like it should. Thanks to Amazon Customer Service!
Kudos to Jitterbug customer service also for helping to set up both phones.

Not very easy to use by my elderly father, which defeats the purpose of getting it. Setup is complicated, even for a tech-savvy person and routinely fails, requiring a call to their customer service and an extra charge. The ringer is NOT loud enough for people who are hard of hearing. Since very few similar cell phones exist that are designed for the elderly youâre pretty much stuck with this dog. Itâs strictly for emergencies. Too much trouble for my dad to use as a regular phone.
Phone was DOA

In the description for the Jitterbug, it said it works on the Verizon network. We have Verizon as our service provider so I thought it would work for my disabled husband, however IT DID NOT WORK.

I had to return the phone to Amazon. Their return policy is amazing, very easy to do.

Fantastic phone for most elderly. A few design improvements could make it a lot more friendly for "low vision" customers. My grandmother is finding is extremely difficult to use with her macular degeneration. The firmware was well thought out but the hardware and service leave a lot to be desired for low-vision. The buttons run together with minimal distinction to be able to hit buttons by feel. More prominent buttons with physically distinctive raised characters would really help a lot. If you have great sensitivity in your fingers you can feel your way through but the tactile experience is NOT adequate for aging fingers.

Because service for this devise is restricted to only the one company, with no other choices, a few comments on the service are equally relevant to this product review. In this case, the manufacture, service provider, and seller are all one and the same:

Customer service is a real pain. If the account holder is not the same person as the end user, prepare for endless frustrations. If you want to have an account where you manage devices for multiple family members, forget it, they don't allow that. You have to actually create a separate email, if you don't already have one, and run completely separate accounts.

The operator assisted dialing is almost a total waste, you actually have to call customer service so wait times can be long and after-hours takes forever. Operator assistance should actually be an operator, NOT an extra rout to customer service. Worse yet, they keep calling my grandmother by my name.

This company has some good potential but they need new management that can actually make logical choices and get them back on the right path. Hopefully they will get their act together some day.

I bought this for 87 year old mother who lives in an assisted living facility. The quality of the phone is excellent. The network works well where she lives. I was looking for a simple phone that she could use with no cumbersome menus or even voicemail. This phone produces a dial tone when open and hangs up when closed. She uses the speed dial. All she has to do is open the phone, press a number to display the person to call and press the big yes button. I did not use any of the other features which cost a few extra dollars which would be useful for elderly people living alone. The only thing I don't like is the inability to add this to my ATT family plan.

This was a replacement for my stepdad's old Jitterbug. It has larger buttons and is so much easier for him to use/see. I was upset at first because I was told that a lanyard could not be used with it. Upon closer inspection I found a place for the lanyard at the top left. It's a must for him since he is wheelchair bound and in a nursing home and impossible to keep up with otherwise.

The phone itself is great for its large buttons and screen. However the volume control for the ringer or in-coming calls isn't sufficient at its loudest setting. Also, it was disappointing to find after the fact that voicemail isn't included in the monthly service fee.
Did not work right out of the box. sent it back for a refund.

nice looking phone, its clear easy to read and use. When I tried to use Bluetooth with the car it paired up, could not call out or receive calls. The phone would freeze up. had to remove battery to reset the Phone. If u are using the phone around the house its alright. Its not that good when it will not work in your car with the Bluetooth system

Basically, this is a easy to use phone with large buttons and large display. It is perfect for seniors that just want a simple phone or cannot figure out how to use a smart phone. The emergency call button built into the phone is a wonderful feature to have. Great Call is friendly to work with for activation and customer service.
Two things to know. Although there are no contracts or cancellation fees, activation is through Great Call and them only. While the Jitterbug phone itself is relatively inexpensive (depending where you buy it), the monthly level of activation plan is where things can get expensive.
So far, mom is happy with the phone... and that says it all.

I bought this for my mother because it is nice and basic, easy for my mother to operate. Excellent customer service, too. The woman on the phone was infinitely patient and empathetic when my mother was having difficulties because she freaks out over anything technology-related. It doesn't get any more simple than this.

Got this for my 90 year old mother who is a bit hard of hearing. She can use it with or without her hearing aids and has learned most of its functions on her own without the manual. Successful purchase in my case.
Got this for my Mom and she really does like it. She can hear much better then her old phone! The customer service for the phone is particularly good. Those folks have a lot of patienceð

Bought this and a Jitterbug for my mom's 85th birthday. Over the last couple of years she's been falling after breaking a hip.
She also has poor hearing and vision. Never usually picked up the phone, prompting someone going to check on her and not knowing if she was alive or not. So, so scary and stressful.
Now I can reach her any time. We also have the added piece of mind that she has 5 star!

Phone worked for sort time then failed to ring. Called Greatcall customer service. They told us to just turn the phone off and back on. It worked initially but quite ringing. Called again. Went through all the trouble shooting. It again quit ringing. Called again told them we wanted a new phone. They agreed but wanted to charge us for shipping. They said they would not charge us after I said I wasnât happy about that. New phone. Reactivation and worked for a short time and quit ringing. Not happy with this phone.
I absolutely love this phone. The buttons are large, the screen has large numbers and letters on it and it is very simple to use. I am very happy with it and really glad I got rid of my touch phone.

You cannot add this to your Verizon wireless plan as others said. I called Verizon plus went to two separate stores each trying without luck of activating on Verizon. Phone itself is ok, easy for Grandma to use but charging dock is finicky to get phone to charge as it has to sit just right.

Easy to set up. I do wish the volume control was not on the side of the phone. When my mother holds her phone she presses on the volume button while holding it. So then she had no volume but she canât understand how to fix it with her dimentia issues. Do..... she canât hear her phone ring because she turns the volume down. You canât talk into this phone whiteout holding onto the sides. Just another problem for the elderly.
This phone is perfect for my 83 yr old Mom. She has limited eyesight due to Macular Degeneration but these numbers are big enough for her to see.

I have had this phone for 9 months and a bit disappointed. The cradle charger no longer works, and the when turning the phone (on or off) it takes quite awhile to respond as does putting in a new phone number to call someone who isn't in my phone book. It would be nice if accessories for this phone were be a bit easier to locate. ( Would I purchase this phone again?) Probably not.

Since purchase this phone has never worked ...not for calling out or for receiving calls. This is serious since we are seniors and
need working phone. Have spoke to representatives two or three times to no avail. Terrible experience for months.
Watch out....

The phone is of good quality, but you will not be able to use the phone with your own carrier. You will have to use the service provided with the phone. Ordering a sim card from your own provider will not work - believe me.

They don't tell you that you cant use your own cell provider to save money, the sim card is programed to use there provider only. buyer beware, many hours on the phone to try to make work, waste of money

Very easy to call someone but i do want voice dial for future use loosing eyesignt, and havent had much luck getting it when Calling . The text messaging is awful. Feels like i stepped back in time 20 years its real time consuming to type a message. Not sure i want this phone now, i send a lot of texts to my grandkids and with this phone I will probably get mad and toss it. I like the large letters and will keep it for future use. Get a smsrt phone next time.

My husband is 86 years old. He has used a flip-phone for years. Since flip-phones seem are getting close to extinct, and he needed new phone ... we tried Jitterbug Flip. We wanted a quality flip-phone. We got that. The phone is of great quality. However, for someone who is familiar with using a cell phone, it is so simplified it is agonizing. He has to answer about a half dozen questions to accomplish what he could have on another flip-phone done with a couple taps on the key pad. So..this phone is for someone who has no idea how to use a cell phone. It is NOT for someone who is familiar with one, Great quality. Otherwise, frustrating.
Never opened it. Misleading about wether it was unlocked. I wanted a phone that was notre-paid

The Jitterbug I purchased for my wife is perfect with the S5 care button and flip to answer and close to hang up. I am planning on setting up the link to my phone and our daughter so that if she uses the care button we will be notified. The two things that keep me from 5 star rating is the monthly cost for minutes and the fact you are charged for incoming calls by the minute as well as out going.

I am totally dissatisfied with this product. The phone would not activate and I spent over 2 hours on the phone with"great call" reps trying to get it working. 5 of the 8 reps I dealt with were less than adequate, the others were fine to work with, just ineffective. They are sending me an activated phone that I should have in 2 days. I bought this phone for my 85 year old father. Thank goodness I had it sent to me instead of him. He would have been a basket case going through what I went through. Friendly people for the most part, inferior product for sure.

Great style phone. Bought for my 89 year old father because of the thin profile, large buttons, and emergency button. Sad part is I am not able to use it with my provider. Shame would have helped him very much. Too much trouble to convince the old-timer to get a new phone number and add another service to my bills. I highly recommend it if it's the only phone in your plan or if your elderly family member is willing to change numbers

Item was stolen from me, Iâm sure it should have done what it was intended, I have a Samsung S6 working great. I bought the Jitterbug for an elderly neighbor,
Who broke his Iâve fallen and I canât get up. Button, the
Jitterbug should have solved his problem. Regards Joe N.

Got this for my Mom, so far so good. Customer Service was friendly when I contacted them. About the only thing I don't like is it doesn't put your contacts in alphabetical order, so you might want to write them down how you want them.

My dad is not tech savvy but needed a cell phone. He gets AARP mag and I saw this shown in an issue. Ordered it and so far so good. I love that he has phone numbers at a click and can contact a service that has all his medical information if something happens to him and I am not home. I love that the numbers are massive and simple to use.

1st phone quit working camera and magnifier function. Received replacement phone and its ring volume didn't work. vibrate worked though...
Not reliable. Will return the phone but no replacement.2nd time.

Bought this for my grandmother to keep with her when she leaves the house but because it lags and freezes and has to have the battery removed to unfreeze it, it is basically unusable and she might as well not have a cell phone at all! Piece of junk, useless phone. On the rare occasion that needs to be used the thing is always frozen up and unresponsive to any buttons. Waste of money because I can't return it now.

My mom really likes having her own cell phone. Easy to use and has all the features she
needs and more.

Got this phone for my mom age 84, hearing not great and wanted to get away from landline costs of $60+. She's at a assisted living facility so the phone is her lifeline to the outside. I might not have read all the info on site but when I called to activate there was a $25 or $35 charge from great call. $25 if you do online or $35 if phone assisted. There is an activation charge regardless of who you buy from. Two negatives- if you have voice mail the phone might only ring 3-4 times before it goes to voice mail and volume of ringer not that loud even turned up to max.

We couldn't get it to work-the people at Jitterbug were great to work with-we just couldn't get a product to work. Within days we had a refurbished product rather than the original new phone and couldn't get it to work either. We have been assured no charges will be incurred-so far that has been correct! It was worth a try.....not helpful in the rural area where we live.

This is 2nd Jitterbug for my husband who is extremely hearing impaired. He likes the phone. Can hear well on it. Likes larger numbers/letters for easier dialing and text messaging. Voice mail recording is a confusing for him but I think any phone would be.

No complaints. It's certainly a lot easier to use than a smart phone.

I ordered this phone for my husband primarily for the ease of use and large buttons and display. We had problems with it almost from the beginning. Buttons began to stick and not respond, phone would not turn on all the time and we would have to try multiple times in order to get it on, no call waiting, you cannot view missed calls unless the number is on your contacts list. I really could go on and on. It became so frustrating we have already thrown it away and replaced. Do not recommend it to anyone.

I got the phone for my mom (she asked for it by name) and when I call her I am very disappointed with the voice clarity. It may be the area she lives in but the coverage map say her area gets very good coverage.

was going to get this phone for my grandmother to use. as great and easy as this phone is and looks what the description doesn't say is that its "unlocked" with limits. anyone who is going to use the phone I would check with your phone service to first see if its compatible before you buy. had to return because of this, a disappointing decision I had to make. I have T-Mobile
The first cell phone my husband has been able to use... thank you Jitterbug
Difficult to charge, needs to be placed in the cradle just right or it wont charge! Charging without the cradle is very difficult for senior's
did not cost to use it the price it was advertised at--not $19.99--more like 39.00$/month

I had purchased the phone for my mother as a Christmas present. My mother had been having trouble with the phone. When I was saving numbers on the phone the button sticks. When she tried to dial a number and scroll the menu to check her call history the button sticks. Her phone also has a bad signal. She would like to return the phone and cancel the service. It's giving her a hard time.
Bought this for my elderly father. When I call him his voice sounds very muffled (poor). It does not have a battery life indicator so you need to go into the settings to see it (poor).

On Flip Phone from Amazon $35 to Activate $10 if you buy from them. Plus there in more they will start @ $15 for 200 min + all the taxes & surcharges. They will run up the cost with voice mail, texting plans & more mins. A normal cell plan is around $65.

Was a great phone for a year...slowly the buttons are not responding like they did new. Occasionally multiple presses are required to scroll the menu. My mom uses this and not on the phone much. Just expected it to last way longer.

My dad is 80+. He has never used a cell phone until I bought him a jitterbug. He calls it a litterbug (he's bourder line losing it). The point is .... He loves it and won't part with it. Finally he has embrassed a form of technology. Whoa hoo
I got this for my aging parent. She has fallen a few times, I like that she has a service to call for help. She really likes the phones big numbers and the volume.
Easy to use! Got it for my "not computer savvy" husband.

I bought this phone for my elderly father and while we loved the size of the buttons and the ease of use, the sound quality was lacking. Even at top level he (nor any of us) could hear the speaker well and the phone did not ring very loudly. For the target audience of elderly customers we were disappointed. We tried to work with it for several months and missed the return date. I would not recommend for folks who need the ringer and voice function to be loud. This phone was actually quieter then a regular flip phone which we went back too!
all that I need

Purchased for a relative. Sometimes when she's talking, her voice goes silent to the person on the other end for 10-30 seconds. When she calls, another person's name appears on the recipients' Caller ID. And the Voicemail doesn't work right.

When my mother began having problems with her cell phone and wanted something simpler, she began noticing all of the GreatCall advertisements. She thought that it would be very simple to use and make her life easier. After signing up for the service which cost much more than it was advertised she found that the phone, while simple, was not intuitive as it originally seemed. There was no way to set alarms, so you had to opt in for a medication management service that would call and bug you to take your medicine. The support was atrocious and they were not friendly. On top of it, the phone stopped working in the first week. Their technical support didn't even try to help, but instead tried to sell another phone.

Phone did not work. Jitterbug Customer Service could not resolve problem. Returned phone immediately. Plan is advertised to senior citizens - but it is expensive for limited features. You need to pay more for something as basic as voice mail. Phone clunky. Hard to flip open for a senior. Not at all intuitive.

Great phone but when we went to activate someone else had already previously done so, took a little extra time contacting customer service to correct the problem but worth it. My mother says it is easy to use, enter contacts and large numbers are perfect for entering numbers, but you do have to pay extra for added services such as messages.

This red jitterbug was purchased for my 91 year old mother. It is easy to use, understand, and is chic... she has vision issues, so it has made her ability to call family so much easier. Great little phone... and a great price as well. Much less expensive and much better use.

After having a Smartphone for several years, it was becoming increasingly difficult for Mom to understand how to use the "swipe" feature. She would tap too hard or push on the screen, finding her efforts mainly unsuccessful & frustrating no matter how much I tried to teach her how to use the touchscreen. Her eyesight is also failing so she was pleased to receive the Jitterbug with the easy to see number pad, large text, the fact that it flips on or off. The reason for 4 stars is that we live in a newer area in a big city & the signal strength is consistently poor in the house. I was down the street at the neighbors and our call dropped twice in less than a minute, so frustrating. I will contact customer service to see if there is a resolution to that issue.
Need to return phone. Won't turn on. Had three months.

This "Jitterbug Flip Easy-to-Use Cell Phone for Seniors" phone hasn't worked since we got it. My mother hasn't been able to even place a call out. We've also received messages from people we don't know and there are photos of someone's vacation, photos we did not take. I'm ready to throw this in the trash.

My mom 74 years old and she loves this phone they're big buttons it's basic phone talks and text the issue is is you have to pay $15 a month for the basic phone service and then you have to pick a service of so many minutes a month or unlimited so with the basic I have was $15 and then the unlimited talk came out to $56 a month talk text
wife's first cell phone.... she's 88 yrs old and likes it... very easy to use

We have had our Jitterbug for 2 months now, and we wonder why we waited so long to get one. We just need the phone for sending and receiving phone calls and texts. The Jitterbug does this slam dunk with no hassles and no headaches. It simply WORKS. I love the word "simple". We are sold. Not a single problem. Just satisfaction.

I purchased this for my Mom (90 y/o; hard of hearing) when her old flip phone finally died. Sorry I didn't purchase it earlier. It's very easy to read, easy to use and the sound - esp the speaker - is excellent. Despite being tech averse, she learned to use it in an hour.

It would be fine for a younger senior who is a little used to technology but my 98 year old sister in law cannot handle it. There is just too much things available and it blows her mind. Some seniors need just a plain flip phone.

Shipping took way longer than expected. For a senior this is a good phone although service is expensive for phone minutes. Have not used the 5Star feature yet for service. I was not happy with features that were listed in the instructions, Voice Dial, which were not active on my phone. I called the company but to date I don't have voice dial active.

My 90 year old Mother likes it better than her old cell phone. We makes and answers calls on it. Has other options like a camera that she wanted but has not used as yet. The monthly fee is about double what you see in their advertising by the time you sign up for service but it includes emergency assistance which so far she has not had to use.
This phone is a replacement for the one that failed. This phone has to get rebooted at least once per day in order for it to operate properly.
great price good phone or elderly visually impaired this new jitterbug flip doesn't come with a starp holder recommend buy a case my mother wears around neck
Service from provider horrible! Would not recommend to anyone!!!! Huge rip-off (I returned phone and got my money back from Amazon)
Simple cell phone that does a lot of stuff for the money. Great for someone who doesn't need a smart phone, such as an older person like me.
My dad loves his updated Jitterbug. The screen is much bigger and easier for him to see. He will not be texting or taking photos, but it pleases him immensely.

Got this for my 90yr old grandfather and he can actually use his phone again. We tried to give him a touch screen phone and that was a big fail. He had another flip phone and had trouble doing anything with it except taking making phone calls. Now he can read messages and take pictures. Screen is very easy to read and simple Yes/No questions are easy to understand.

I got this for my 95 year old mother, even set on high the ring tone is too low. We have tried all of the tones and none are loud enough for her to hear it all the time. My mom does where hearing aids and has no trouble hearing my cell phone.
Purchased for a gift. I highly recommend this phone for seniors and people that just want a phone, not a space craft.
Company does not tell you if you have horizon towers are not too functional in your area then you will get poor quality and it will be too late to return the phone. Extremely poor customer service

It's never worked properly. I bought this for my dad and we hate it! The ring volume at it's highest is barely audible. I have great hearing and I can't hear it if the TV is on . He never hears it so then he doesn't answer and I think something has happened and he's unable to answer it . Shop for a better phone!

They should advertise their Bluetooth as Proprietary since it won't work with any non-Greatcall products. Support danced around the issue on 2 different calls for help, finally realized it was proprietary in Phone store where my old flip phone saw 12 bluetooth devices and Jitterbug saw none.
Plus: There is also no way to transfer contacts from old phone. After trying a multitude of methods including Best Buy, and Greatcall customer service, had re-type all contacts.

I thought it is an open phone that I can use other sim card on,but lo and behold I tried it and it didn't work,due to my schedule didn't have time to visit a phone shop to ascertain why it wouldn't work,and when I had time,after trying again, we got a notification to call a number,when we did that,they asking me to have an account with them,which I dont need,I bought a flip phone because that's what my mum is used to,and not getting another prepay service, on checking my order window found that the return date has elapsed,now am stuck with something we dont need and wont serve our purpose.
Good construction. Mediocre software. Terrible account management website.

So far so good. My 96 year old mother needed a phone for when she goes to mailbox and not near a phone, in case she falls or needs help. We tried a smart phone and she was not able to hear on it or figure out how to use it. This was recommended by her Dr at Miracle ear. It seems to be working fine and she is able to hear with it okay. It is very simple.
This phone's specs SAID that it is compatible with the Cricket network. IT IS NOT! AND it doesn't provide a SIM card.

Great phone just didn't work with my carrier as I requested when searching for a flip cell phone. I had to return it regrettably especially since it was very good phone with all the features my husband needed.

This is a great phone for the elderly. My elderly parents have trouble with today's technology, so this phone was a perfect solution because it's VERY simple to use and helps keep in contact with my parents when they are away from home.

I like the idea of this phone but I am disappointed in the reality. I bought this phone for my 85 year old mother who had become frustrated using "smart" phones. There are 2 BIG problems with this phone. First, it uses the Verizon network through Great Call, which would not be a problem if her home was not in a Verizon dead zone. Once problem 1 was discovered it led to problem 2. This phone can ONLY be used on the Great Call network (using Verizon). There is NO option to unlock this phone to be used on another network (Isn't that illegal?) and Great Call offers no solutions to get around the very weak signal issue. Unfortunately Mom has missed many more calls than she has actually received. This becomes a real problem since her number is tied to the access gate where she lives. This phone has done more harm than good in providing cell connectivity for Mom and has added to the decline of her quality of life. Any future option I offer will like be met with great distrust and reluctance. So sad!

Nice phone, easy to use--if it would only ring. Also, the yes/no buttons have to be stomped on to register. Such a disappointment. I thought we must have a rare lemon but I see in the reviews that plenty of other people have the same problem.

Phone is clumsy and heavy. Cannot delete old texts (phone does not permit that function). Great Call claims there is no contract...try cancelling. Time on phone exceeds 20 minutes and customer service is augmentative. Most unhelpful. Little over a week in use and absolutely hate this phone and there are not polite words for Great Call's âcustomer serviceâ.
Great phone for my wife, very easy operation. Very happy with this phone.
Phone keeps locking up. You have to remove battery in order to get phone to turn on. Great idea and service but not a quality product.

Bought on 10/21/2018, quit taking a charge on 1/10/2019. This is one of the worst phones on the market (5th one we have purchased for our 95 year old family friend & none have lasted more than a year) but itâs the only one on the market with numbers she can see. Looks like another manufacture would see the need for a simple good phone for senior citizens.

I purchased this product for my 92 year old father-in-law. The large numbers and easy to maneuver screen is perfect for someone who does not want to learn how to use a smart phone. He loved the red color too!

More complicated that you would imaging, and no way to migrate contacts from the old phone, makes setup a pain in the butt, Add to that the high pressure attempts to increase the features of the program and it can be a senior SCAM very quickly. All that said, it functions well and the sound is clear.

Cheap product .... buttons stick .... continuously have to pop out the battery so it âresets â NOT a reliable product for the elderly..... I complained and got a replacement sent to me ..... same issues with the â newâ one ..... donât waste your money
It was exactly what we needed....

Got this phone for my mom. Buttons and screen were big which is nice for her. Navigation between functions was somewhat challenging for her but I figured it out. Volume was crystal clear on both ends which was a big plus. However, the biggest disappointment was the phone would cut out and lose volume several times during conversations. This happened on every phone call she made. She tried to get it resolved through Greatcall with no success as the problem persists. She gave up and is returning the item.

.35 per min you go over. $0.50 per text message. Phone is ok for simple calls but self deletes messages and very difficult for basic usage. A lot of hidden fees get added and bill could be over $70 each month. Go with Strait-Talk they are the best!

Ringer - not loud. Speaker - not loud at all. Has their "star" button at the bottom that just confuses my dad who has dementia. Very disappointed with the overall phone. I will probably be looking for a different provider.
My Mom loves it and the emergency feature gives me a peace of mind
Great for my 94 year old uncle! Reception is good where. He lives and couldn't get with other provider service.

i would give it 5 stars. but it go,s dead on me often i have call jitterbug about 5 times they manage to help me but it keeps happing. i really feel i got a lemon all i wanted was a phone i could depend on its not this phone.
WORKED FINE FOR A WEEK, THEN IT BROKE.
Poor sound quality for the hard of hearing. Very low ringer volume even on maximum and reception is poor. Would not buy again!
We intended to add it to an AT&T account but they said they could not activate a Jitterbug.

This product was a piece of excrement. I babied it and kept it working (off & on) for two months at which point
it completely died. And then I found the return policy was for two months. And I was just past that date.

Which proves - don't buy a refurbished phone with a two month return - buy it from jitterbug - it is worth the extra $50.

Jerry Carson

I thought this would be a good phone for my dad, but even I can barely hear on it, even with the volume on max. I wonder if I got a defective phone or if others have had this problem. Another smaller issue: The red 5 Star emergency button is too similar in location and appearance to the hang up button on iPhones, so my dad calls 5 Star frequently. User friendly phone, though.
Got this for my uncle, great for emergency plan. The number size is great for clear visual

An easy alternative for an aging population. Many older people just want a phone for emergencies - they don't or can't text or surf. This fits that need at a reasonable cost. Not confusing as a smartphone can be. Some people just need basics. My 92-year-old mother was happy with this gift.

This unit was a bit buggy. It wouldn't always ring, sometimes it locked up and required a restart. It was replaced under the warranty within a few weeks. The company was very helpful and replaced it at their expense. It's easy to use and everything is large and easy to read. Customer service is very good.

This is a great phone for my husband who doesn't care for all the 'fancy' stuff. Second one he's had. Little 'fancier' than the first but still within his tolerance. Setting it up was a breeze through the Jitterbug website. He could keep his old # which was very convenient. He loves it, I love it. I'll stick with the 'fancy' stuff, thank you. Couldn't be an easier, better phone for most everyone. Takes pics, he can text, magnifies, and a few other slick features. And you can't beat the price! Very, very satisfied.

Not as pleased as I should be for the price. The phone feels cheep, drops calls. It is very easy to operate. I'm still trying to get my husband to quit asking for his old phone back. Would not buy again.
It worked for 3 months and now the ringer doesn't work.
Great for use as a basic phone
Easy to use.. Yes or no on any task. Button are big and well lit

Dependent on where you live, you may or may not have good coverage. I purchased 2 flip phones for my parents and while one of the phones read that it had good coverage strength, the other one could be standing in the exact same spot and would read fair or poor coverage. I needed these phones to work for my parents, however, my mother had to keep taking the battery out of hers in order for it to work. And that shouldn't need to happen every day.

Just after 1 month the phone started having problems. When you open thr flip it takes about 5 seconds before the screen lights up. Then you have to press each number a few times before it registers. This phone was for security. So much for that.

Charging dock does not work. USB charging does work. Need a new dock. Short customer service hours. No online customer support. Mfg will not send a dock must return the entire package for a 25 cent part. Took the offered 15% discount.

My mom, who accidentally called 911 on a smart phone, swiping or tapping something that she didnt understand, absolutely loves this phone and is not afraid to use it!
