It was great until the screen went black, and I couldn't find any way to get it back on; it simply came back on its own once, then went black again and didn't come back on. I was unable to contact the "seller" because Amazon ran interference. The Customer Service Rep couldn't understanding that I couldn't send the phone back before getting a new phone because I needed to transfer a considerable amount of Tracfone calendar days, minutes, texts, and data units, not to mention to port my phone number over, but did issue a return label. Then he wanted to have a cell phone support person call me on my husband's Tracfone and put me on hold, which would have run my husband's time down. However, I'd already ordered another phone for my husband, so I transferred my number to the newer phone when it arrived, and ordered yet another phone, since my web searches weren't showing a pattern of similar problems, just loads of happy reviews. The return was easy, and Amazon made the refund as soon as they were notified that the package was on its way back to them. Now that I have a working phone again, I'm extremely happy with it, and my husband is similarly happy with his.

Prior to that episode, my review was Five Stars, and as follows:
Tracfone hasn't managed to dumb down this smartphone, and it really does act like one. I love that it runs the android apps I use on my Nexus tablet, and runs them well. It's got nice speed. Phone call quality is excellent.

Tip #1: If you've already got a Tracfone, you don't need to buy a card to use when activating it. You'll be credited with text and data along with days and minutes when those are transferred to this phone.

Tip #2: if you've got wifi, make sure your phone is using it before you start downloading apps. I thought I had the password in correctly, and my phone didn't inform me otherwise, so the initial app downloads ate up a chunk of my data allocation.

Tip #3: If you don't already have a Google Voice phone number, get one, and set the phone up to use that first. When you're on wifi, you won't eat up your Tracfone minutes.

As a cell phone it's great, as a smartphone it has limitations. There is not enough internal memory to allow more than a few apps, and I find I'm constantly trying to clear cache, etc. just to be able to update the default apps that came with the phone. I didn't think the lack of close focus or a small flash would make a difference, but it's also limiting. No scanning bar codes, etc. I bought my wife the LG L22C (Power) a month or two after I bought my Moto E. Now I wish we both had the Power. However, I'll continue using my Moto E until a new batch of improved Tracfones come out with a lot more internal storage. The ability to use a micro-SD card with the Moto E is not that helpful, unless you want to store music, videos/photos. Not many apps can be moved to the SD card.

A very nice, cost-effective device UNTIL it fails. My speaker failed after 2 months. This was a predictable disaster; the Moto-E customer forum shows speaker failures dating back to June 2014. I will praise Motorola in one respect; their customer support site, RMA provision and Device Exchange process works very smoothly. I can only hope they have found the flaw and fixed it. I will then modify my rating upward. A real shame!
added : Warning!! Do NOT return defective Tracfone branded Moto-E's to Motorola!! The replacement they deliver do not have MEID's recognized by Tracfone, despite having a Tracfone modified OS. This prevents transfer of your account from the broken phone. Tracfone insists that you return your device to them for exchange .. and it takes "forever"!

I have been using the moto e for a year and can't find much that it cannot do when compared to my daughters $400 iPhone .. If there is one complaint it would be storage, but it is easy to disable the stock aps that are preloaded that you don't use freeing up room for aps that you do, I have Amazon, Waze,Textra, 3 bank aps, FB, messenger, words w friends, and a few more that all run fine. The camera is not the iPhone quality but can focus on checks for mobile deposits which is important to me. The case is really rugged and unless you are extreme I don't think an external case is neccesary, the case material is a non slippery mat finished hard rubber like material that extends a little beyond the screen giving it great fall protection. I think it is much better than iPhone in this area. The "gorilla glass" on my 1 year old phone looks new despite occasionally sharing space in my pocket with keys.. All in all along with tracphone service this is a really cost effective truly smartphone option.

Fantastic cell phone. However, purchase the Moto E that comes with a 400 minute card for $99.00 from shopcelldeals.com. They are selling it without the minutes for $99.00 also, so be careful which option you chose when you buy. The reviews said the dual core snap dragon is not as good as the quad core snap dragon on the Moto G. I have used this phone for two weeks and it is fast, really fast with the dual core snap dragon processor. Lots of apps run concurrently with out the phone speed degrading. The phone looks like it is worth significantly much more than a $99.00 phone. People have asked me about it and when I tell them it was $99.00 they can not believe it. And when I tell them it comes with a 400 minute card that translates into 1200 minutes, 1200 texts and 1.2GB of data they think I am lying. Essentially you get the phone free. I moved from a ZTE Valet which I used for 6 months. It was OK but a "starter" smart phone. This one is a real smart phone. I am told the new Moto E will have a quad core snap dragon processor so they must be clearing the inventory to make room for the new one. You can wait for the new one but this fits the bill. I am not sure you will get the deal with the 400 minute card when the new one comes out.

I struggled for a year with the Tracfone ZTE Valet Android phone. The slower processor, smaller screen an older operating system made it cumbersome to perform simple operations.
This Motorola Moto E is slightly larger, but much more user friendly.
Why did I wait so long?
I have been a Tracfone customer for 10 years, and this is by far the best phone I have used.
Here is what I paid:
$85 for the Moto-E phone.
$95 for a 1 year service card. This card come with 400 minutes, but the Moto E triples the minutes, triples the text messages and triples the data plan. So you get 1200 minutes of talk time. 1200 text messages (send or receive) plus 1200 MB of data usage.
For me, that lasts over a year.
So my annual cost is less than $200 -including a new phone every year.

Processor:
With a 1200mHZ dual core processor, this phone is faster than you would think. It plays Minecraft, Asphalt 8, and other 3D games easily.

Display:
The qHD display on this phone is beautiful. It has great color, dark blacks, bright whites, and both text and video looks very sharp. It has good viewing angles, however dims slight when tilted to the left, however this does not effect use.

Camera:
The 5MP camera is decent enough for everyday photo shooting. Of course, the lack of flash makes night shooting poor, and the lack of autofocus does not allow close ups. However, it has HDR and produces photos with great color, and at a decent resolution.

Sound: The front firing speaker is very loud and clear. Although it doesn't have stereo sound, it is still good enough for watching movies. It also has a built in equalizer, which is good for both the speaker and headphones. The "Mobile Theater" setting makes stereo headphones sound like a surround sound system, and it works very well.

Great phone. Previous phone was the Samsung Centura. This phone is far superior in its processing speed, display and options. For the price it is a very good buy with tracfone service. I believe it utilizes the Verizon network. It has a relatively slim profile and is no heavier than my previous phone making it easy to carry in a front pocket. Has a solid feel, accommodates a data card for memory expansion, and has front firing speaker that is clear and adequate in volume. The blue tooth easily paired with my cars audio system for hands free use. I used Motorola Migrate app to move all contacts and images from my previous phone. The app worked flawlessly. I think I will be very happy with this phone for some time.
If you are looking for a smart phone with tracfone service I can't see how you can go wrong with this phone. Triple minutes apply to new minutes purchases and my previous minutes, text, and data were transferred from my previous phone upon activation. Activation was easily done online and accomplished within minutes. The camera images are good enough for my use although there is no flash for low light conditions. Also there is no front camera for Skyping or selfies. A few limitations, but what can you expect for a $100 smart phone. Strong reception of wifi. Use wifi and save your data. The display is Gorilla glass making it very durable and resistant to scratches. Will be adding a case cover to protect against drops. Battery seems to last several days depending on use.
Again, good overall buy if you are looking to keep the costs of a new cell phone and service in check. Personally I cannot justify spending more for my use.

Love this phone, its our second one. We use Tracfone exclusively because we there is no plan out there that is as reasonable in cost. The Moto e is a smartphone with triple minutes for life which replaces our older tracfone with single minutes. We have two and the Moto e we buy the least amount of minutes for costs less than $7 a month. The other one has been running us about $10/month with the 200 minutes / 90 day card.
No, there is no front facing camera so it doesn't work for skype. Yes, it is only 3G, not 4 G. But, it does have wi-fi and wifi doesn't use up minutes. It has mobile data which can be easily turned on and off with an app to turn 3G on and off.. This gives you internet anywhere. We use it with google maps for driving directions which are much better that the ones on the garmin.
Two phones for just over $200 a year - if you need an economical plan and want to move up to smart phones, this is a good start.

Cute little tracphone smart phone. Purchased for 19.99 for my son whom is 10. It has internet capabilities i didnt purchase data but he can use wifi at home and still be able to get on the internet. Hes able to get 500 minutes a month with our safelink plan and unlimited text. I thi k this is the best 19.99 spent . it even has a fm eadio already installed on rhe phone. He has downloaded games thst he can play to and from school . and i believe if he needed additional minutes its a double or triple minute phone... I might not have to purchase a real phone for him for a while.. Hopefully.. As long as he can talk or text he should be good. Only thing is it takes a longgggg time to charge.... Not sure why

At first this was a gift for my husband because the phone he had the screen broke. I wanted to get him something he could also listen to music on & of course thought of Tracfone because of the low monthly plans available. When I saw this phone I took note of the many good reviews saying the camera took great pics (in bright lighting), also video (also in good lighting), has a glass screen, water repellent back, also is by Motorola (a solid company).
This phone has wifi capabilities, hooks up to blutooth devices, including wireless headphones, the camera takes wonderful pics given there is enough light or else there's a little feature on it that you can lighten up a 'dark' picture before taking the pic, the video is nice with good lighting & the sound quality during calls or playing music is excellent. 4g of internal memory after all the factory apps doesn't make the phone slow & it can hold a 32g micro sd card for those apps that can be put on a sd, or music and videos. I am able to run the "This Life" app by Shutterfly to upload all my pics & videos onto, or just view them on the phone. There is an internal music player, GPS (that works, thankfully), google search by voice. I like that service is only $10 a month on the pay as you plan with Tracfone, which is broken down to 90 min of calls ($1 a min), 90 texts & 90 mb (how ever you say that one) of data. I use a text app so while i'm connected to wifi I am able to text for free on the app without using any of my 90 texts from the Tracfone plan. Calls, I still do make on the Tracfone plan, because there just isn't a free wifi app to make those. Bummer.
All around this phone is great. I bought it initially for my husband & really like it so I bought one for myself too! We haven't had any problems at all with these phones. I have taken so many pics and videos already & have a ton of songs saved on my sd card. the phone works wonderful & loads apps fast.
I have read reviews saying this phone is on Verizon but in my case, I'm not sure if the phone is or not, because sometimes I have a poor signal & other times there's a strong signal-either way, I haven't lost a call yet due to bad signal!

Be aware that this is the 1st generation of the Moto E (released 2014). The more in-depth manufacturer description for the phone is INCORRECT when it states that it has a 4.5" screen (which is only true for the 2nd gen Moto E).

This model does NOT have an autofocusing camera, so no close up pictures will be in focus. We were trying to use this with a barcode scanner and were puzzled at why it would not focus.

I have never owned a smart phone before and wanted something affordable. I really like this smart phone. Its my very first and easy to use! Since I have trac phone with pay card, I didn't feel like switching to a plan. So I could me old trac phone number! Its very nice. The camera takes really sharp pictures- even though its only 5 megapixel. I'm not a big "selfie "person. So if you like to talk selfies, this phone will be more difficult, as it has no self facing camera. I can use instagram, email, and all apps with ease.
Some Pros:
If you're a trac phone user, switching from a non-android to an android phone is a breeze. You can keep your phone number and all the minutes.
Its big enough , but still more compact than other smart phone or tablets
The camera takes clear pictures and video for the amount of space it has
I had no trouble finding out how to use this phone and it was my very first smart phone ever
Its incredibly affordable for such a nice phone

Some Cons:
Apps drain the battery more quickly than i expected. I usually must charge after 12 hours of use
It doesn't have self facing camera for "selfies", but I'm not a narcissist so I don't care
It smudges easily so keep it in a case
Phone calls sometimes pixelate or not as "clear" as some other cell phones.

Very good phone. I use it for a mp3 player for my car. The battery lasts several days before I have to charge it. It is running 4.4 which is pretty old, but for my purposes it works perfectly. I'm sure I could have gotten an actual mp3 player for cheaper, but this works great for my purposes. In the off chance I loose my main phone, I can use this in place of it and basically have a fully functional phone at a moment's notice.

The camera is pretty bad, but then again we are talking about a phone running Android KITKAT which was released pretty much three years ago. Even though that may not seem a long time, vast improvements have come in cell phone technology.

The default 2gb of storage is pretty trash. I was able to only hold a couple songs which would have defeated my purpose. I got a SD card which I am able to fill up to 32gb. The speakers are average, and I can't actually hear too many audio differences between this and my iPhone 6s. The only time I can really hear a difference (audiophiles, please feel free to shoot me) is when the volume is maxing. However, the speakers don't matter to me as I just plug the phone into an aux card which leads to my cars speaker.

I didn't activate the TracFone service so I can't comment on whether or not it's good. Apparently TracFone uses Verizon for the Moto E, so I can't comment on that either as I am a T-Mobile customer.

I'm not sure for other purposes, but for mine, the phone is great at what it does. If you somehow rate this phone less than 4 or 5 stars, it's more than likely your fault. This is an old phone and is not the cutting edge of technology anymore (or ever for that fact, the Moto E was for entry level customers).

TL:DR; I use it for a MP3 player. Buy it.

Well worth what I paid for this phone. I still have problems with some of the features, like there is no way to get acknowledgement when you receive text messages when you unlock the phone. Every phone I've had up to this point always had this feature but this one only acknowledges when you send messages. Hmm, I know when I send messages. Don't need the phone to tell me that. I am not 'techy' and I'd rather the phone be user friendly. But otherwise I like the phone. It was well worth the 40 bucks I paid for it. And you get triple minutes when it's a tracfone. Since I don't hang on the phone like a lot of people do I pay only 20 dollars every three months for service. That's less than 7 bucks a month--can't beat it. If you aren't a techy phone fanatic that always has the phone in your hand this is a great buy.I play games, use this as my work phone, and use the internet on it and never seem to run out of time or data with it.

Awesome Phone!

I've converted from iPhone to Android because the price/performance is compelling for this device.

It takes some getting use to because this phone is highly configurable. We purchased two of these and ditched our older iPhones.

The cost savings are compelling. We are saving $1,000 per year in cell phone bills by switching to Tracfone. No contract or monthly payments for overpriced iPhones.

Screen size is good. I don't do selfies so did not care about not having a face camera. But, what annoyed me was that the description showed this phone could keep a charge for up to 8 days. After 12 hours, the phone would be at 50%. After 24 hours, phone would be dead or close to it. I would try everything to slow the power bleed. After another search, did find a forum post about the exact same problem. The poster noted that if you turn off your mobile data (his was 2G, mine is 3G) there is no longer the power suck. I do go one step further, I go to settings and turn off WiFi. This does not stop incoming and will auto on if you use it. I noticed it does not drain as much either when I do this. Please note this doesn't happen with all Moto E phones and I could never figure out why some and not others but please with phone now that issue is over. This is not my dream phone, but after I got the power suck under control, it works, it does what I want it to do and if it didn't...there is an app for that!

Well worth every penny! I got this because the low cost Samsung junk I purchased last year for $85 was constantly locking up and requiring reboots. I'm so happy I made the switch to this phone!
I currently have this Bluetooth paired with my smart watch Asus ZenWatch, with no problems. The two stay in contact through most of my 1 bedroom condo. Buy an SD card and move as many apps to it as possible. The phones internal memory is small.

Pros:
1. Fast boot up time.
2. Fast access to whatever I'm doing. No freezes or lockups like the Samsung junk phone.
3. Switch is protected so it's not constantly turning on like the Samsung junk phone.
4. Nice camera.
5. Good WIFI.
6. Excellent Bluetooth.
7. Battery last a minimum of 16hrs and looks like I could get 24 hours with the battery saver activated. Recharge is quick.

Cons:
1. Wish it had more internal memory. I added an SD card, but some apps insist on being installed on the phone.

I think that people are initially hung up on having a two-year contract with a cell phone carrier. I used to be the same way. I will say this much when you have a contract you may have a better functioning telephone, as far as features, but overall most of these phones are capable of doing what we needed to do. So anyway, I needed an extra phone for various reasons and I just went on Amazon one night and found this phone and it's worth it. it's a smartphone it has a qwerty keyboard. It has various ringers. Various screensavers that are actually cute. It's no different than any other phone I can check my email I normally log into my internet service at home if I need to watch videos on my phone or whatever. So for the money, which prepaids are generally reasonably priced, this phone is really awesome if I had to recommend it to somebody I would. The only thing I did notice is the other day I tried to use the flashlight and I didn't see a flashlight option on the on the screen on the settings so I downloaded a flashlight app but otherwise it's fine. . So my last point I wanted to make was I opted for this phone because I knew that I would only need it here and there. So even though there are prepaid services that you can pay for monthly, this phone I purchased minutes and the minutes never expire they kind of roll over. Purchasing minutes is not something that I'm really big on but for what I needed this phone for it's perfect

I was looking for a cheap phone, because to be fair, I have an old iphone I use with the wifi on it only, and do most of my talking online or through watsapp, so I didn't really need a fancy (and expensive) phone + subscription.

However, one for calling people outside of watsapp and apps is kind of handy so I was looking for one. And found this one. I'll be honest - I thought it would be a crappy phone with snake and solitaire game on it.

Much to my surprise to find a phone like this with app store, browser, camera, and everything you'd want in a smartphone. It can seriously compete with the modern android and iphones, that's much how it caught me off guard.

With the Tracfone subscription I pay 20 dollars for 3 months, giving me 60x3 (this phone tripples your airtime!) 180 minutes of call time and 180 text messages. Absolutely perfect. It has since then replaced my old phone as this one is so much better. And that only for $18.50 with a $20 3 month subscription.

Skeptical me however is still trying to find a catch as all of this sounds too good to be true. Or it's just a perfect fit for me personally, who calls rarely and uses wifi for most his phone business. Definitely a nice surprise.

Edit: Update 4/8/2017 - The phone has slowed down a lot and I have to adjust my review a little bit now I have been using it for a longer period of time. It's still a good phone, for sure, but even with added memory (microSD) it will have little space to install things on. Keeps asking me to remove things in order to update apps.

It's also slow, and apps sometimes just fall apart when using them, especially the more modern ones like Snapchat. The camera is really poor on it also.

However - it's still a great phone for this price. Just not as smooth as it was in the beginning and you can't install/update unlimited stuff on it. For calling and cost it's excellent however.

Wow. I love this phone! I have had a basic tracfone for several years, and needed to upgrade to an Andriod to get current. I got this at $34.99 (originally introduced at $120 in 2014) after reading reviews and realized that it was the phone to take me into this century. It has wonderful features which I never imagined I would be able to get at a Tracfone price. I even have loaded Netflix onto the phone and can use it, if I really want to watch something on that small of a screen. I have loaded my email account onto the phone and it is great to be able to screen my emails as the come in. I cannot always see the details on the emails, such as some pictures, but I go to my Kindle or computer for that anyway. It connects easily to wireless networks, which really helps keep the data use down. I love the feature where I can text by talking, search google by talking, etc. This is the Motorola Moto E First generation, which is smaller than the 2nd generation. I like having this smaller phone. I got one for my husband, too, so he can get his work emails, too. The only downside I have found is that it is 3G, but not 4G. I was in a very remote place last weekend (Chama, NM) and did not get a signal, so I was out of contact for the time I was there. The batter life is quite good. It can probably standby for about three days before requiring a charge for someone who it not a phone junkie. With tracfone minutes, I will probably still not spend more than $10 per month with this triple minute phone (triple talk, text and data in three different totals). My Dad is now looking in to this very economical and very smart looking phone!

FINE SMARTPHONE FOR NEWBIES w/Helpers
This smartphone is the very first smartphone I ever touched. And after reading some reviews both before and after purchasing it. I need to say I was able (after 1.5 hours and getting transferred a couple times to Tracphone reps that donât speak the English language very well) to transfer my tracfone flip phone number, time remaining and minutes. That also gave me equivalent text and data units. This DOES come with Triple minutes. That does NOT mean that minutes come with the phone. You must either buy an airtime card or have some minutes to transfer. What triples is the minutes bought on an airtime card.
The phone does NOT come with ANY logical instructions. So if this is YOUR first smartphone it will be a good idea to have someone around to show you how to use it. I didnât even know how to answer it when it rang. I have been using computers since 1978, but smartphones are a different thing all together. Be careful if buying a case for it. Cellphone cases are VERY individual. (this is a Moto e 1st generation) I did purchase a memory card for it. It has very little memory and it will tell you you cannot install anymore apps due to memory limitations after you have installed just a couple. I wish I had NOT changed the ringtone because once you do, it has an issue with the initial volume; you canât hear it. As it rings the volume increases. By the time you can hear it the caller may have hung up!
Iâve only had this for about 2 weeks. When I learn more about it I will update this review.

This is a great phone at a great price, but it has one severe limitation that I wasn't aware of when I placed the order. This phone has only 2 gigs of built in memory, and that means one simple thing, you will not be installing apps of any significant size! I found a few apps that I wanted to install that simply don't fit in the onboard memory. There are some games that simply won't fit, even if it's the only app you try installing. Sure, you can install little apps, things like a Restaurant App for ordering from your phone, but most games are just out of the question.

It's a real shame, because I love the phone and the price is perfect for someone on a limited budget, but that issue with memory is an insane omission! Not having at least 8 gigs is unbelievable. Having only 2 is a deal breaker for most people. Had I known it was that limited, I'd never have purchased this model phone. I've included a 32 gig memory card, but sadly, most apps won't install there regardless, so the main purpose of the memory card is photo's, music or video's, apps just can't install there, or at least very few, as some show that segments of apps can install on the card, but most will not.

I wanted to upgrade from a bare bones flip phone; however, I'm a senior citizen and before I spent big $$$ for a phone I wanted to see if we were compatible. The good new is we are! I'm still learning but overall I'm very pleased with this purchase. The sound quality is very good, the screen size is close to perfect and I have no bad things to say about it.

Due to google's increasing bloatware and Motorola not allowing the boot loader to be unlocked for rooting to uninstall that bloatware (the tracfone version of this phone is not eligible for unlocking), this devices memory will be almost full the second you enter your google account info and all the google bloatware begins to update. This device won't let you move the google bloatware to the sd card, so even though I only use one or two of the 12+ google apps like google drive, youtube, etc - it sits in main memory and prevents me from installing apps I'd actually use. For this reason, there are better options for the money right now.

I rarely use my cell phone (when I want to use it, the battery's frequently too low). I had a phone with a built in keyboard that I liked, but TracFone discontinued service for it. I bought this one to replace it. I prefer the old keyboard, and I liked that the phone kept track of how many minutes I had left. TracFone's website used to let me check with the phone number and the last 4 digits of the SIM card, but now I have to login in order to see how many minutes I have (it's been so long, I've forgotten the password). The last time I bought a card, I didn't get a text stating that minutes were added, only that time was added. I could not get the TracFone app to download on this (it kept stalling), and the TracFone app didn't work well on my Samsung tablet. It may be time to switch to a monthly plan, but I really don't use it enough to justify the expense (I think I've bought 2 cards since spring). I do like the Triple minute plan that this came with (so I'm spending less), but I'm buying cards by guess instead of knowing what my minutes are these days. It seems silly not to have something pre-installed on the phone to keep track of it when it's a pay-as-you-go card phone.

The battery these days lasts about a day or so before it needs charging, but I suspect that's from abuse (leaving it with low battery without realizing it), rather than a flaw in the phone.

I'm new to smart phones. Note that I rarely use the WiFi part. Can't say much about the web performance. I rather use my PC for browsing.
Battery life is good. Easy to use. Decent camera. Phone reception for calling (over Verizon) is good. I'm still no friend of touch screens but the typing assistant makes life much easier. If you use it straight as a phone for calling and texting I would recommend it. So far no problems with speakers (it's not a boom box after all - it's a phone...). This is not the latest Moto E model. It's the previous one that works (triple minutes) with Tracfone. Hope to see newer versions of this for Tracfone in the future. Only gripe: Went $30 cheaper after 4 weeks of purchase. But that can happen...

Update: ok, after a couple months of usage I can say it's still pretty good phone. But I'd like to update a few things.
WiFi is not great from a rural area. From my place I usually have only a fair connection. Camera is pretty crappy and makes
blurry pictures sometimes when you don't hold it steady, and unfortunately there no flash available which makes it for picture taking in the dark useless. The dimension listed here on Amazon are WRONG. This phone is size is NOT 8.2 x 6.4 x 2.1 inches but rather 4.91 x 2.55 x 0.48 inches! Otherwise it would be bigger than an Iphone which of course it's NOT.
Again if you use it only for phone calls and texting is works pretty good and for the current price of around $40 and triple minutes with Tracfone it's a no brainer.

I bought this for my wife about a month ago and she absolutely loves it. I was really surprised that it is such a quality made product for the price. I think I paid about $40 less for this phone than mine (and they both are Android 4.4). The QHD display is really sharp with vibrant colors and fast graphics. I added a 32GB card to it that should provide plenty of memory for pictures, video, and music. I'm very impressed. And a happy wife gives me a happy life. Thanks Motorola. :-)

This is an Impressive phone for such little money, IMPORTANT INFORMATION !!! YES, this phone IS SafeLink Compatible.
When calling Safelink to activate (either new service or transferring information from current Safelink service) if Safelink customer service representative tells you this phone can't be used, simply say thank you, hang up and call back. You'll get a different representative,
This happened to me, I was told I couldn't use this phone, after doing some reacearch on Tracfone and Safelink, I called back to ask why I couldn't use this phone, I never got the chance, the second representative was kind and efficient, the phone was working perfectly in less than 10 minutes, all my information, minutes were transferred, I've had it 2 weeks, with out any complaints at all.
I hope this information is helpful, I see this question asked several times, with various answers.... confusing!
DON'T hesitate if you're thinking of purchasing this phone.
If you have any questions, I'll be happy to answer them. A very Happy Amazon Shopper

No, not even as a backup. Well, I suppose if it's 20-buck$ like it was when I got it on sale and you are absolutely certain it will be a temporary(as in less than a month) backup it can be tolerated. It might even be a good thing because of how much one will learn to appreciate the smarter Notso-Smart Phones.
I mean after using the Moto E for a while I even appreciate the LG Sunset which I had begun to dislike almost as much as the ZTE(any ZTE but especially the ZTE Valet).

Too many 'Notso-Smart' irritating items to list so will just give one: if you press any phone number summary, those, um, people at Motorola call the number. You cannot get squat for info about the NUMBER THAT CALLED YOU without jumping thru hoops backwards.
That and other firmware and software make it the weirdest default phone setup I have ever had in the 45 years I have been buying phones.

Well, a second Notso-Smart item: BATTERY LIFE IS OUTSTANDINGLY BAD. If I had to use this phone for work for a week I'd lose my mind, or my job. With NO activity(other than incoming spam calls), it does not last more than a few days.

You can of course do whatever but You Have Been Warned, ;).

I've had the Motorola Moto E, Smart phone (Prepaid Tracfone carrier),for about 5-weeks. Tracfone CANNOT make my phone deduct minutes correctly. It's OVER CHARGING for text messaging. How much you ask? EIGHTY-SIX voice minutes for every text sent. The phone even did this for the tech guy when he tested it, after adjusting settings 'Over-the-Air" (the ordinary way they program/activate phones. Over the course of three days, I've Made four calls to their customer service/tech, and each time a tech changed settings, but only improved the condition. After their last adjustment, it now deducts two minutes of voice time for every text. They cannot fix the problem. I've chatted with them three times online, and they're indiifferent to the situation, enjoying the fact I've used 128 minutes of my call plan trying to get them to fix their "settings". I'm going back to a plain-old cheap "feature phone" that makes & receives calls & texts. This phone with Tracfone service is terrible.

I didn't expect much from such a cheap little thing - I just wanted to replace my old flip-phone. And at first, I wasn't too surprised. It took a while, and a lot of fooling around, to get anything other than the phone working. Even the TracFone MyAccount app took forever, and there were some tricks to make the wi-fi work with my home router. But once I started to understand it, I was amazed. Now I even have my Kindle app, and I can read all my books - yes, the tiny screen is big enough to read. I downloaded hours of music and figured out how to make it play random selections. Its only remaining pain is trying to type on the tiny virtual keyboard. Sometimes it will expand when turned sideways, but not always. Texting with your thumbs? Forget it. But that's a small price to pay. And I would love to see a document that tells what all the little symbols at the top of the screen represent. Even the Motorola site is no help. In summary - despite some minor, almost trivial shortcomings, I don't think I've ever bought anything that was a better value for the price.

My grand kids ages 10 & 7 absolutely love their Motorola Moto E phones. Even better, I love these phones for them. Especially with the Triple Minutes deal from TracFone... $29 card with - 120mins, 120txts, 120mb data for 3 months = 360mins, 360txts, 360mb data for 3 months. The data is a bit low but not really a problem for young kids. It is easily managed when you consider that they can run all the data they want on home wifi or at McDonald's or all over town where free wifi is provided by businesses. They download games at home and play them offline when and where they want while having the phone handy for calls and texts. The batteries last several days with moderate use and the screen, camera and sound are great! The three of us were flying together during the Summer and watched the Olympics on their phones... Great!!! We added 32GB SD cards and rubberized Tekcoo cases... All good. Oh, and here's the kicker, every one of their friends want one too... Get on the bandwagon now!

I have only had this phone for a day, but I am totally awed by it. I will admit that my last phone was a low-end Huawei Glory, which I purchased from Tracfone when I signed up for their service. The Huawei served me well, but there were several things that I didn't like about it. One of them was that it had a plastic screen, and that means that it was not as responsive to my tapping as glass screen is. I have an old iPhone 4 that I play with, and noticed right off that the Huawei with its plastic screen was not as sensitive or accurate when tapped. The Huawei was also very slow, but it was a low-end phone, so I didn't discredit it for that.

Now, the Moto E isn't the most advanced smartphone you will find, but it is plenty powerful enough to suit my needs and wants. This phone has the Corning Glass Gorilla screen, which is a pleasure to use. Sure, glass makes the phone a bit heavier than plastic, but it's a very worthwhile trade. The screen is larger than on the Huawei, but not so large that the phone won't fit in my running waist belt.
Everything about this phone tells me that it was well designed, and built with quality in mind. I have always thought of Motorola as the leader in radio technology, and what is a cell phone? It's a radio!

If you get this phone for Tracfone service, get it here on Amazon from Shopcelldeals. You can read my review of the seller if you want more details.

I have always liked Motorola products. They are well though out, high quality and this Moto E smartphone is no exception. You will want to throw your ZTE smartphone against the wall and stomp on it after you get to use this phone. That's how good this phone is in comparison. The only downside if any is that it could have more internal memory and have a front facing camera as well. But for this price I really cant quibble. Buy an micro sd card and move as many apps to the SD card that you can to save your internal memory space. If your not going to put a lot of apps on the phone the internal memory should be sufficient for everyday use. The phone has a great response and battery life is good on a charge. The WiFi reception is far superior to the ZTE and overall cell reception is what you would expect in a cell phone. The android system is KitKat and comes with a few moto apps that come in handy. Highly recommended!

Wow... such a deal.
For me its a portable Wi-Fi device to play with and likely never will see use as a cell phone. Will spend its life connected to the internet.
Reading and watching some video's had said it has wifi A/GBN but there is no A, sadly - but 2.4 Wi-Fi works flawlessly well. I'll just need to enable 2.4 on my laptop for moments of Lenovo uShareIt file transfers to or from, or plug in a usb cable.
Slow to charge, maybe 4 hours from maybe 35% - but the charge is very long lasting... surely should run idle well over 24hrs with 2 messenger apps, two mail apps, plus OneDrive, OneNote, a calendar and Netflix always connected, plus the ok google and moto stuff listening to me and to the internet. I charged it to 100% and spent 24 hours most playing with it installing apps and goofing with Netflix videos before charging it again.
Android 4.something auto-updated quickly to 4.44, apps cant directly write to a microSD card, cant root it as the tracfone bootloader is unlockable. Might search Moto E XT830C .. nobody seems able to get root privilege on its android KitKat 4.44 sadly. Software will save pics/video/downloads and minimal configs to SD. Another words, you can only install a few apps even after disabling some of the included google apps.
Out of box said something like 2gb of storage and quickly went to 800mb free. So it needs a SD card added to move stuff and apps into.
Only have had it two days.. hope it last a long time .. .$20 for a touch screen internet tablet, but miniature size, seems like a pretty good deal.

I love this phone. I don't use my phone a lot & Tracfone has always met my needs while my wife uses a Verision iPhone. My last phone looked like an android smart phone but actually functioned more like an old flip phone. It finally gave out & I found this for a great price & decided to try it out. As time went by it completly blew me away. I discovered it did about everything my wife's iPhone 5s did & did it just as well. I had never texted before because of how difficult it was with the old phone but now do. The navigator, the web browser, the android equivalent of Siri, the music player, I love it all. And it's very easy to figure out. My wife pays $70 a month for her service, I pay $30 every 3 months for mine. When I switched to my new phone they let me keep all the minutes, including the triple minutes that I had on the old one & added an equally amount of data plus the minutes & data that were included with the phone when I bought it. My wife tried it & likes it as much as her iPhone & when her 2 year contract ends in February plans to get one of these & go with Tracfone. Or course for hardcore IPhonies this would probably never do but if you're not married to the brand save yourself a lot of money & give this a try. For most people this phone would be more than enough.

I personally have used only TracFone prepaid phones for as long as they've been available - at least 15 years. This particular model is the best one yet. It has more "bells and whistles" than any of the other cell phone brands TracFone has used (LG, Samsung, UMX, ZTE, etc). It's also easier to use than my last one and has interesting options where you can set it to go to sleep and wake up at your choice of times. It also had an app that made it possible for me to transfer everything from the old phone to this one (including text messages, photos, call history). It did have a slight problem with my contacts - not all of those migrated over - so I had to add the rest manually. The most amazing thing about TracFone prepaid phones is that the only problem I ever have is (like any other cell phone), the battery life eventually shortens considerably making it necessary, of course, to buy a new one. I've never had a call dropped, had the phone turn itself off, or been unable to log on to WiFi. There is also the added attraction that when you buy a "card" you get triple minutes, etc.; you can buy minutes, data, and texts separately; or set up a monthly add on of minutes, etc. There is never a contract. And lastly - TracFone cell phones are reasonably priced. This one was $20.00 on sale as most (but not all) are - so much easier(!) to afford than the $500 or $600 cell phones touted by T-mobile or Apple.

While it appears that you must register the phone, you can bypass this by tapping the back/home buttons and jumping to the homescreen. From there, this can be used as a wifi phone, and it works incredibly well for the price ($19.99+tax). I use it primarily for an app Vikings: War of Clans, in which there is a slight amount of delay once in a while. It plays the app perfectly, let's me check my email, and provides a backup phone if I ever need to use it for its intended purposes. It does play with apps well though. My one complaint is that it does not support some apps (such as Vikings), but there are several third party markets available to bypass this limit (I used APK Pure and downloaded what I needed, which worked perfectly). All-in-all, for the price, this is a great smartphone. It feels great as well, has a nice semi non-slip backing, and great haptic feedback. All-in-all I'd highly recommend this as a backup/second phone, or even a phone for a youngling (a smart phone for $20!). It's also pretty durable all on its own.

This phone has a excellent performance and it runs very well for a Tracfone. This is the best Tracfone. I bought this as a gift for my Mother, she couldn't t believe how well the performance was for this phone. It gets the job done for her needs.
Unfortunately, The volume on the phone went out in less than a week. I had to contact Tracfone, and they have to send a replacement. I am a bit disappointed with this issue. Hopefully the replacement will work out with this phoneðð

Purchased for no-techy husband. Its his first smart phone and he has been able to adjust quickly from his old LG flip phone. Have been using the phone for the past 2 months and have had no problems with texting, photos or making & receiving calls. He wanted a basic easy to use smart phone and this suits him perfectly. He has had to adjust to charging more frequently than with the flip, but that is expected. Sound quality is good as he does have some hearing loss and this was an important factor in his decision on which phone to purchase. He does not use for games or browsing.

I've always preferred Motorola and was extremely disappointed a couple years ago when I tried to transfer my TracFone account into a great Motorola phone. I gave them everything they asked for to verify my account, and was then asked, "Which Tracfone would you like?" So now, Motorola made this one available and I was quick to transfer my Samsung Century. The actual transfer of data took about a half-hour with a very good tech from Guyana, but it took the rest of the day and into the evening to sync everything up like is should be. I have my preferred ringtone, which came from the other phone, and I've uploaded a couple apps so far. Getting everything in Google to work took a while. I still endorse this one, but be patient. And it helps to have good tech savvy friend, or some friendly teens! Good luck.

Bought this phone a couple of months ago to use with my Tracfone service. It's my first smart phone (I'm a late adopter!). The Moto E is an excellent, high-quality phone. At the price I paid (an advantage of being a late adopter), it's a screaming deal. Nothing about it looks or feels cheap. One of the most impressive features for a phone at this price is the "gorilla glass" used... very highly scratch resistant except for sand... I couldn't be more pleased with this purchase. The camera is a step or two below the norm for today's phones, but that matters little to me... I use an actual camera for any photography that's important.

If you had a ZTE Valet and you're sick and tired of the wi-fi then this is your phone. The screen is very responsive, The voice and reception is good. Everything transferred over to my new phone after downloading the Motorola software. Basically all I did is follow the instructions do a QR scan of my new phone and it used my wi-fi to transfer everything over. The camera is OK for a cell phone but it doesn't have a flash. The ZTE Valet's camera wasn't much better at night but at least I could use the flash light app. That's the only thing that sucks. I can't use the flash light app. But everything else is so much better, faster and clearer that I don't care. After all, I only wanted the phone triple minutes and texting. Everything else is gravy. Can't beat the price.

I absolutely love this phone!!! I had the samsung galaxy centura for 3 years but it kept freezing and couldn't get on the internet. This phone however is awesome, fast and i can actually say its a true smart phone. Camara is pretty awsome too! I had no issues transfering my tracfone number to this phone and all my contacts and what not were imported as well. Very happy!

Best phone I ever owned from Tracfone. I had the Samsung Galaxy Centura, I hated that phone. It would freeze all the time. It always needed to be rebooted and there were other issues. If your considering buying a new Tracfone you will definitely love this phone. I have none of the issues I had with the other phone.

I have been a tracfone user for several years and their prepaid plan works perfect for my needs. I have had the Moto E for two weeks now and it works flawlessly. Screen responds fast to user input with brilliant clarity. The 4.3" screen size is just right to handle ans fits easily in a front pocket. I have used a majority of the features and I am very pleased; good sound quality from front mounted speakers, gps is perfect, FM radio (nice addition) and very good wi-fi reception. Picture quality is OK but, I didn't plan on using it as a hi-res camera anyways.

I ordered this new tracfone to update my older one that went out of service and am amazed of the features this phone has compared to my older one I had for about 12 years with no such problems at all. this was shipped very well with all the accessory's that was advertised with it, I had to get help from tracfone in order to transfer my number to this new one , the company was excellent with there help and expertise to get my phone activated and in service, I would recommend this tracfone for anybody upgrading to a newer style. thank you . DALE

I am very happy with this Tracfone cellphone, that I just bought. Prior to purchasing this cellphone, I checked the Tracfone website, in order to be sure, that the tracfone would be useful in the geographical areas, where I normally travel. Because of this and its features, it suited my needs. The price was also to my liking. I recently installed a 32 GB memory chip, which I bought locally at a Target store. I had no trouble in transferring my minutes from my old Tracfone, model v176, to this new Moto E Tracfone cellphone, through my account with the Tracfone website. I made one phone call the next day as a follow up, due to a request for final confirmation, via email, from Tracfone. The cellphone was already working, so I didn't see the need for a phone call, but a short phone call was easy. All the hard work was already done on the website the previous day. It will take me a while to get use to all of the phone's features, but this task is not difficult. This phone is definitely a big step up from my v176 Tracfone. I will use the cellphone primarily for emergency purposes, as I did before, so a Tracfone is ideally suited to my needs. It is cost effective. I also just purchased a protective skin for this cellphone, that I expect to receive shortly. Because this phone has triple minutes, data, & text, I may begin to use this cellphone a bit more often, than I would have otherwise. This phone is quite a deal !!!

This phone, I've had it for over two weeks now, is great! Does everything, even pictures, very well. The screen is excellent, with vibrant colors. It is fast and smooth to the touch when in use. The phone call quality is excellent in both directions. Its size is comfortable in both the hand and pocket, too! What more could I ask for? A flash would be nice, but then, my iPhone 4 didn't have a flash either. Moto E is an excellent product at any price! So easy to use I bought one for my 86 year old Dad, he actually uses it!

It truly feels like the future when you can get this much phone for this price. And with Tracfone, you can cheap out on service as much as you can afford to cut.

The phone does everything an average Android phone owner would probably want, with the exception of taking good pictures, because the camera is kind of poor...compared to phones that cost a lot more. And I guess no front-facing camera means no video chat...but who cares.

If you're a Tracfone customer in a place in your life where you want to buy a smartphone, get this one. It's not worth it to cheap out with one of the lesser offerings.

Got this on a deal-of-the-day and I couldn't be happier. I visited a gal who lives in the boonies and she has spotty cell service. Not me My Trac Phony worked just fine (she has AT&T). This phone is a lot of fun for this ol' granny. Welcome to the future Alice! Takes great pictures too! UPDATE: Phone still works perfectly! For a "starter" phone this deal rocks!

I was paying $200/month to Verizon for 2 lines (the phones were free with 2 year commitment). Yes Verizon and is much more expensive, but Ii have tried ATT, Sprint and Cricket and Verizon has by far the best coverage. I heard Tracfone uses Verizon's network and that seem to be the case since i noticed no difference in coverage Since I use my phone only for short calls and text the 1 year plan for $100 worked for me since 2016. But did not work for my wife, she ran out of minutes with a few months. As far I can tell this is Tracfone's last triple minutes phone. I heard they were phasing it out in 2017. And am surprised it is still available

Battery life on this phone is one of the best I've ever encountered. Nice phone. Bought as Tracfone and was supposed to be the last of the 'triple minute' phones still available before being discontinued. Didn't get triple or even double minutes so I don't know what's up with that. One thing I don't like about phone it doesn't tell you if you have any texts/messages on the Home screen app icon. You have to go into the App to check. Not returning because I got a great deal and it's a nice phone.

I am really happy with this phone. I have used tracfone for 15 years and this is by far the best one I have had. I love being able to use the WiFi so there are no charges off my time when I do emails, etc. This phone isn't even available at tracfone yet, so was really glad to get it at Amazon. It was super easy to transfer my 7000+ minutes and my year subscription to the new phone. Did it on their website which is much easier than using the telephone customer service because I have a difficult time when people don't speak good English and that is what you get a lot of on their customer service. So this was a good suprise and plan to keep this one for a long time. Found some really cool cases at Amazon and have ordered several for protection, etc.

As a mom, I went through that awful dilemma of what to give my son for his first phone. Ultimately I settled on this. He uses it only for emergencies but I feel much safer with him having it. Itâs not expensive to put the minutes on either. I had originally considered a flip phone but for this price, you couldnât go wrong!

This are solidly built and perform well. Despite being a few iterations of OS behind the most current standard they still perform admirably any task requested. I use these to run programs and have left several running multiple tasks 24/7 for weeks at a time and they just keep on doing what they are asked to do. All this for a fraction of the price of many phones of lesser quality. The main issue is the relatively poor quality of the fixed focal length camera. If, like me, you don't use the camera it's not a problem. If you do anticipate heavy camera use look elsewhere or use this as an additional phone. I bought my first last year, currently own six, and have yet to experience an issue with any of them. Only missing a star because of the camera but for my purposes they've been perfectly rock solid reliable.

Great deal! At 20 bucks this was a steal. My 7 yr old broke his moto g and I happen to find this for dirt cheap. He only uses it for the WiFi to play games and watch movies. I won't be activating it at the moment but a brand new phone for my kid at this price was awesome. So much so we replaced out 5 yr old moto g with this one also. It works out better because this phone allows an SD card and the moto g did not.

I purchased this Moto E Android Phone thru Amazon back in February and I've loved everything about it since activating it! I find it much more user-friendly than the other Samsung Android phone I had and I love it's features, color clarity and how well it fits in my clothing. Who says OLD people can't use technology? This makes it so much easier once you familiarlize yourself with the operation, features and what is possible with the Moto E.

Extreme value. Phone works exactly as stated. Neither of us talk that much and most of our use is texting. Long live Tracfone! $7 a month is a lot better than $40-$70+ a month.Motorola Moto E Android Prepaid Phone with Triple Minutes (Tracfone)

If I had reviewed this earlier, I would have given it four stars. It loses a star because I added a 32 gig card and then, three months or so into the life of the phone, the phone stopped "seeing" the card. Trying to get the phone to "see" the card again has been a nightmare and so I eventually gave up, living with the limitations of the decreased storage space. Of course, if anyone out there has any great ideas about how to go about getting the phone to "see" the card again, I'm all ears. This was a "starter" smartphone for me anyway, and it was cheap, so no real skin, as they say. Still, as for a recommendation, I'd suggest going with a more up to date phone than this. It's shelf-life is really short, unless you just want something extremely basic and I mean extremely.

This is the phone that finally liberated me from MagicJack. Within my household we've got four Tracfones (some bought directly through Tracfone, others like my iphone I brought over using the Bring Your Own Phone program), and we haven't had a single problem in all the years we've been with them.

I've also been using MagicJack for my home phone for several years now, and it was one headache after another. I was looking into other Voip options to replace it, but then realized I could just buy another tracfone and designate it as my home phone. I had my doubts about whether or not I'd be able to port my MagicJack phone number over (I read a few horror stories from people trying to get their numbers from MagicJack) but it was a breeze. I filled out the online form and waited the stated two days it might take to transfer over, and that was it. I entered the activation number, and my new Moto E is now receiving and making calls using my ported MagicJack number. It could not have been easier.

This phone is fantastic, but I'm actually going to pick up a Link2Cell cordless phone (this one:Â Panasonic Link2Cell Bluetooth Enabled Phone KX-TG7875S) tomorrow so I can have standard handsets throughout my home, but I'm actually thinking about upgrading one of my older tracfones with this one.

I searched Google for a "smartphone that is easy for a senior citizen" and this phone was among the recommendations. Since I had never used a smartphone, this was a great choice. It was easy to transfer from my flip phone which was also a Tracfone prepaid, and I am slowly "getting it". Motorola provides excellent online video how-tos to help whenever there is a question. It also is a good size - not too small and not too large, and the Corning glass screen stays really clean. I will probably never use even half the available functions, but it takes great pictures and has very good sound quality. And when purchased as a Tracfone I get 3X the data, text, and phone each time I purchase a card. I highly recommend!

I bought this phone for my preteen to use for after school. Let me first say that it DOES work with safelink although it says on the package that it doesn't. I called Tracfone customer service and just simply told them I wanted to transfer my number to the new phone I just bought. They never asked if I was a safelink customer or mentioned safelink at all. Maybe it helped that the previous phone they gave me was a tracfone too. I'm not sure if that's normal for Safelink but thought I'd mention it here. Anyway, it took about 3 hours for the service to kick in but it works fine with calls, text and web surfing. Regular data is slow but we use wifi so it's pretty fast.

As far as the phone itself goes, it's awesome. Perfect for my son. There are plenty of apps to download like Netflix, Snapchat and YouTube and they all work great. I'm used to an iPhone 6 and have no complaints. It's a cool little android and definitely worth the price.

Bought for my sons birthday. I bought it end of June (26th) and tried to activate after his birthday (July 27th) and the phone won't turn on or charge. Log onto Amazon and the return window had closed. Manufacturer won't do anything either :/ so I'm just out 40$. Expensive paper weight and disappointed child.

The quality of this phone is great for me. I used to use BlackBerry devices that were given to me at work. For my simple needs the Moto E has a nice, bright and easy to see screen. The touch screen is very responsive. The general interface and ability to turn WiFi on and off easily is a plus. Camera picture quality is quite nice for the price. The quality of communication is good and I sometimes I am told I sound so clear! The price was right too.

This phone is great for kids! Both my 11 and 12 year old kids have this phone and its been very nice for them to have when going to and from school and when they are away from home. Motorola has an alert app where you get alerted when they leave or arrive somewhere, they also have skype for free that they use for a select few friends, and we also added an app that allows our family to communicate between each other for free. They've barely used their minutes using these features so its been very affordable. We have one phone set up for 100 mins a month and the other gets 80 mins and it costs less than 20 dollars a month. I'm very pleased with these phones and recommend them to anyone that have younger preteens that want their own phone. They go great with the case described as Moto E (1st Gen.) Case, ECâ¢ High Impact Rugged Armor Hybrid Holster Shockproof Case Cover with Kickstand + Belt Swivel Clip. the ASIN # is B016W5KVTQ. Love Love Love these phones.

I've been using Tracfones for years. This is my first smart phone and I'm having a ball with it. I read review after review of this phone and am so happy I got it. This one cost me $99 and came with a 1 year card and 400 minutes which, with triple minutes, gave me 1200 minutes of talk, 1200 texts and 1200 mb of data. I couldn't find this deal when I ordered my wife the same phone so I paid $69 for it. Transferring the service and minutes on both phones was a snap and my wife ended up with more minutes than she'll ever use. Neither of us are heavy cell phone users (unlike some people who seem to spend more time on the phone than on real life).
My only complaint so far is that the battery doesn't seem to last as long as I had hoped, but then I have no basis of comparison with other smart phones. Maybe my experience is typical.
All in all, If I had to do it again I'd do the same thing.

Great price and a great phone so far. added a 32gb sd and already familiar with android tablet not with phone service, so yeah, that's okay, slight learning curve. I am somewhat relunctant to use it for banking or other sensitive data applications where I could be snooped. But hey it's only money!

Caution, data minutes go fast. I had wifi set 'on' but not the correct data setting (thought I did, oh well) so in a few minutes I used over 100mb of my 1200 alloted. Ouchy. Under Wireless and Networking. More... uncheck mobile data enabled. If in doubt, the tracfone website has lovely robots that can assit you in chat (be patient).

Haven't tried Bluetooth yet (not sure if I will) and other than web browsing and email, wll works as expected. Good quality phone, hard to beat unless you spend considerably more, and over the long run (if your not a chatty Cathy on the phone). I should have minutes left over at year end, and the ability to use wifi calling via Google Hangouts Dialer will help make that magic happen. Should spend about 1/3 to 1/4 less than a contract phone annual expense.

I'm nothing if not thrifty.

Really nice phone for the price, hard to believe you can purchase a smartphone like this for this price. does everything I need it to do. Still playing with it and I really like the voice activated messaging this has. Had a regular cell phone before this one, now my wife and I have one and we love The triple minutes through tracfone. Shipped fast and super price, works great, very happy with purchase, was able to keep my old phone no. and minutes too.

I've had this phone for several months now. I use the basic features (phone, camera, text, internet) and it performs all quite well. I haven't been able to figure out how to zoom in when using the camera and am not even sure it will. I did learn after I purchased it that the battery is not replaceable so I'm hoping the one that came with it will last a good long time. It holds a charge for several days even if left on all the time. The screen is bright and crisp. It has many ring tones to choose from. After some help from Tracphone I was able to get some of the settings set correctly.

This is my first smart phone and I am learning as I go along. I have an ipad so I am familiar with touch screens and apps. The phone works well and is a nice size, not too big or small. The keyboard for texting is a little small for my fingers (and I have small hands), thank goodness for predictive text! I bought it because I have a tracfone but wanted to upgrade to a smart phone. This one is so much better than my flip phone. I sometimes have bad reception in some buildings, but talking to others in the same places I have found it is the buildings, not the phone. I have not found anything else wrong yet. This is not being used for posting to websites or surfing the web. I have the ipad for that. This is mainly used as a phone and to text family & friends. It works very well for that. I am pleased with my purchase and have recommended it to friends.

This phone is my first smart phone. I have had everything from a bag phone to a flip phone. I had avoided a smart phone until now.
The phone is easy to set up and operate. I found a caller ID app that provided an easy way to answer or ignore an incoming call so I am surprisingly happy with this phone.
I would recommend this phone as a transition step from a flip to a smart phone.
UPDATE 5-15-2017
I still like this phone. It is very easy to use. I am glad I chose this phone. Tracfone service is fine with me though I believe that I will add my minutes on line next time. I had a hard time understanding the service rep when I did it through the phone. The rep had a very heavy accent and I had to have her repeat things several times before I could understand her.

I prefer products that do what I ask them to do without having a lot of tech I either can't or won't use. However, I must admit this phone is quite an improvement over my last phone. The voice sound quality is superior, the ease of entering contacts is better, and the calls themselves are being handled more deftly. It also allows calendar inputs for appointments with reminders. So, it more than meets my expectations. The seller proved to be efficient and got the phone shipped and delivered somewhat ahead of schedule. Another plus but I've only had the phone for a couple of weeks so I cannot speak to durability. If similar to Motorola products I've had in the past, I think it will be around for awhile.

This is a first generation Moto E with only 4GB of built-in storage, which is tiny by Android phone standards. It comes with KitKat 4.4.4 and does not offer any OTA upgrade to a newer release. It may be possible to upgrade the OS, but I'd be afraid the result would be constantly running out of space on the device. Even on KitKat, I've installed a 32 GB microSD card and laboriously moved everything possible to the SD card to preserve scarce internal storage space. As for transferring minutes / days / number from my old phone, for once I was able to get there without having to call the TracFone 800 number and wait on hold. But the web site waited until I clicked "Do the transfer" before it saw fit to mention that getting ready for me to try to activate the phone might take a couple of days, and the signal that they were ready would be that my old phone would suddenly stop working.

Okay so here's the deal. My son loves music. He's 8 years old and he also enjoys going to the YMCA and doing the kids fitness program. I could not afford an iPod Touch or iPod Shuffle and pay for all the music he wanted from there. At the YMCA there is Wi-Fi and at home there is Wi-Fi and he's able to use YouTube and Pandora and I don't have to put minutes on it or allow data or let him call. There are a few of the features available, some minutes, some texts but for the most part it's a smaller device than his tablet that he is able to take to the gym and listen to his music. I think it worked out great.

Just got a few days ago and after set up , I am impressed,,,Nice size and feel to it, especially with the " Tank " cover on...Screen is very clear and bright, doesn't fade totally in the sun and has very good angle viewing...I like the front speaker, about time, but not that loud at the highest setting for speaker phone use,, plenty loud though for video's, alarms, ringtones, etc...,so can't understand that...main use for a phone is to talk......The camera takes fairly nice pix quickly, and that's what you want ,,after all a cell phone is not a camera ,its for communication, like some complain about the quality or no front lens for "selfie" garbage.....Other thing is the apps needed for the time and minutes remaining,, should be like older tracfones, showed all the time, and you don't get the bonus minutes either when adding more...The sealed battery might be a problem down the road, time will tell.....Overall, I like it a lot ..like a small tablet with you for internet on the go, with or without Wi-Fi....

This is a great little phone! I use Google Voice along with my Tracfone account for free VOIP phone calls when I'm home or have a WiFI connection, so it's a very economical smart phone setup. I don't like to receive phone calls when I'm out and about, so it works out pretty well. I'm surprised at how much I use the built in FM radio, which is an added bonus. The Android interface is very peppy and responsive. I would recommend this phone to anyone who doesn't need a selfie cam, and who doesn't talk on the phone much when they're not at home.

I bought 2 of these phones for myself and my husband in August 2016. They work fine for the most part but mine lost all my pictures in the photo gallery .One day they were just gone and no way to get them back . Even the ones on the extra card I installed had disappeared . I tried everything I could find online to no avail.Tracfone said they couldnt help either. So if you have one of these phones ,be sure to download your photos to a flash drive frequently.Then the speaker on my husbands phone stopped working and the only way he can use it is to put it on speaker phone.(so much for privacy) The price on these phones was great (29.99 each with free shipping) and since we had never had a smart phone before ,we thought these would be a good learning tool and they have been for the most part , but now we are looking to replace them because of these two problems that evidently can't be fixed.

I bought this phone strictly to use as a wifi *tablet* to replace the tablet my son broke. My son has a habit of breaking tablets but not phones, so i ordered this so he could watch youtube videos on it and apps. While its not an expensive phone, it does the trick. Only thing that is annoying that everytime i turn it on, activate phone comes on but i can press a button to get off that. I strictly use it with my wifi. It loads pages fast and easy to use. I recommend it. I can't activate the phone though because it says it won't activate. But it is still usable.....minus the having to get off the activate screen every time i turn it on. Its quite loud too. Its definitely worth 30 bucks. But if you want a lot of memory, buy another phone.

My husband is whit I will call a techno- phobe. No smart phone, loves his flip phone. Purchased this for him when his flip phone died. He likes it. Simple to use, does all that he needs ( call, text) . Could do a lot more but he chooses to ignore that option.
Very simple operation. If my husband can use this..anyone can!

This is my first smart phone and I am learning as I go along. I have an ipad so I am familiar with touch screens and apps. The phone works well and is a nice size, not too big or small. The keyboard for texting is a little small for my fingers (and I have small hands), thank goodness for predictive text! I bought it because I have a tracfone but wanted to upgrade to a smart phone. This one is so much better than my flip phone. I sometimes have bad reception in some buildings, but talking to others in the same places I have found it is the buildings, not the phone. I have not found anything else wrong yet. This is not being used for posting to websites or surfing the web. I have the ipad for that. This is mainly used as a phone and to text family & friends. It works very well for that. I am pleased with my purchase and have recommended it to friends.

I bought this phone for my preteen to use for after school. Let me first say that it DOES work with safelink although it says on the package that it doesn't. I called Tracfone customer service and just simply told them I wanted to transfer my number to the new phone I just bought. They never asked if I was a safelink customer or mentioned safelink at all. Maybe it helped that the previous phone they gave me was a tracfone too. I'm not sure if that's normal for Safelink but thought I'd mention it here. Anyway, it took about 3 hours for the service to kick in but it works fine with calls, text and web surfing. Regular data is slow but we use wifi so it's pretty fast.

As far as the phone itself goes, it's awesome. Perfect for my son. There are plenty of apps to download like Netflix, Snapchat and YouTube and they all work great. I'm used to an iPhone 6 and have no complaints. It's a cool little android and definitely worth the price.

Bought for my sons birthday. I bought it end of June (26th) and tried to activate after his birthday (July 27th) and the phone won't turn on or charge. Log onto Amazon and the return window had closed. Manufacturer won't do anything either :/ so I'm just out 40$. Expensive paper weight and disappointed child.

Case, ECâ¢ High Impact Rugged Armor Hybrid Holster Shockproof Case Cover with Kickstand + Belt Swivel Clip. the ASIN # is B016W5KVTQ. Love Love Love these phones.

I've been using Tracfones for years. This is my first smart phone and I'm having a ball with it. I read review after review of this phone and am so happy I got it. This one cost me $99 and came with a 1 year card and 400 minutes which, with triple minutes, gave me 1200 minutes of talk, 1200 texts and 1200 mb of data. I couldn't find this deal when I ordered my wife the same phone so I paid $69 for it. Transferring the service and minutes on both phones was a snap and my wife ended up with more minutes than she'll ever use. Neither of us are heavy cell phone users (unlike some people who seem to spend more time on the phone than on real life).
My only complaint so far is that the battery doesn't seem to last as long as I had hoped, but then I have no basis of comparison with other smart phones. Maybe my experience is typical.
All in all, If I had to do it again I'd do the same thing.

Great price and a great phone so far. added a 32gb sd and already familiar with android tablet not with phone service, so yeah, that's okay, slight learning curve. I am somewhat relunctant to use it for banking or other sensitive data applications where I could be snooped. But hey it's only money!
