Shipped fast and super price, works great, very happy with purchase, was able to keep my old phone no. and minutes too.

I've had this phone for several months now. I use the basic features (phone, camera, text, internet) and it performs all quite well. I haven't been able to figure out how to zoom in when using the camera and am not even sure it will. I did learn after I purchased it that the battery is not replaceable so I'm hoping the one that came with it will last a good long time. It holds a charge for several days even if left on all the time. The screen is bright and crisp. It has many ring tones to choose from. After some help from Tracphone I was able to get some of the settings set correctly.

A great little phone that I use as a spare. How can you not love this, for $39? Costs me about $7 per month to keep it active. Who cares about the memory or the games you can play? Get a bigger phone for that. Use this one to give the number for work or anyone that you don't want to have your "main" phone number. It does everything you need it to do, and looks sharp while you're using it. Not good for data, unless you use wifi, as that will eat up your minutes. Use this one for what a phone is meant for: calling and texting.

the phone itself is a good phone. The tracfone service i purchased this phone for is OK..... IF YOU ARE NOT GOING ONLINE OR SENDING FILES. The phone service/talk time and texting is good. Just like any other cell phone service. BUT when i need to send DATA a photo, go online, email it never works. I NEVER Play games/ or download any apps. I leave the phone pretty basic. When i get back to my house i log into my wifi that is the only time sending data works. SO if you want this tracfone MOTO E for browsing the internet while you are out and about, sending photos, emails ect. I suggest looking for another carrier. I will be handing this down to my daughter in the next couple of weeks. On to the next i guess.

This is my first experience with a smart phone and I really like it! Have used Tracfone a lot in the past and really enjoy the low payments and how you control your bill. This phone is really nice, however does not come with any minutes or airtime, only the phone, but it is easy enough to go on their website and add what you need. I mainly got it to receive texts for work and this will work great for that and so much more. So much better than signing up for a contract with a cell company and paying way more per month! An upgrade from my flip phone. Nice weight and size. It will take some getting used to for talking. One little issue is that the charger is really hard to plug into the phone for some reason, I felt like I was going to mess something up when I first did it.
I had paid for one day shipping, then had some issues with that. Deliverer said it had been delivered when it had not, then I found it the next morning. Amazon was great at returning the one day shipping cost.

I've had this phone for just over a year now. It has been a great phone. My husband & I both use Tracfone but have different brand phones. I have to say that there is something about a Motorola that gets better service than other models. My previous phone was also a Motorola and had better service as well. I use it a lot for facebook messaging, it works great for that. I do have to say that after all this time my bluetooth seems to be malfunctioning. Some days it'll sync up with my car & vivofit and other days I have to turn the phone off and restart it in order to get the bluetooth to co-operate. There are also times that people try to call me and my phone will start to vibrate and won't stop and I am unable to answer the call until I turn it off and restart it. So I may be looking for a new one soon, but Motorola Tracfones are hard to find and I've had the Motorola brand for about 10 years and love the quality of service from the phone.

After breaking an expensive phone in the gym, I bought this to use as a media player when working out or driving. I never even activated the actual "phone" part (there's nothing requiring you to).

Works great for the desired purpose. Spotify and Amazon Music both let you download thousands of playlist songs while you're on wi-fi, so they'll be available on the go even without a phone data plan. Same for podcasts, of course.

With a cheap case, this this is pretty much indestructible... and performs just as well as an iPod Touch that cost hundreds of dollars not too long ago.

My wife and I both upgraded to the Moto e. We have had the devices for 4 months. Very little data use, Mostly text use and occasional calls. The fact that separate Text and data refill cards are available is a giant plus. The speech to text feature is also a big plus. These phones are on Verizon network which seems to have better coverage then our older trafones that were on ATT. Very pleased with the phones.

I bought this phone for my sister who had to upgrade. I felt this was a good phone for her and there is little bloatware on the phone. It's fast, but only has a out facing camera, but she's not one to take a "selfie", so didn't figure this would be an issue. Got the phone and disabled some of the apps I knew she would never use. Bought a closed case for it so the front would stay nice. Very nice Tracfone and got some really good reviews on the Tech sites. For the price it's a no brainer because if she hates the phone she can get another one just as cheap. I have a Moto G and this phone is almost the same size and is really a nice phone to introduce an older person to the "smart" phone arena.

This phone is awesome for the $! My minutes/airtime not only transferred instantly online-I had 900 minutes on my old tracfone and they gave me 900 minutes+900 texts+900 data web!! You do need to charge your battery if it is low when it comes before you can transfer your old number-airtime & minutes. I've been a tracfone customer for over 10 years and prices and ease of adding online is just awesome!

For JRM, texting and receiving occasional photos, are my only preferences. Currently only $5 for an additional 1000 texts too!
In summary: " A $19.99 Smart Phone, Sure Smart to own! " And Thank you Amazon, for the remarkably super quick delivery!

If it had more than 2G internal memory, it would be a perfect phone. As is, i have trouble with the number of apps i can have installed - even when i move them to the external card. Its so good otherwise, i would recommend to anyone who does not need a lot of apps or the kind that cannot store their data on external drives - so be careful.

Bought two, one for me and one for my wife. First REAL smart phone we have had. We really like them. We have had them for a couple of months now and are still learning how versatile they really are. I love the fact that I DON'T have to type, just talk to it and the text appears!!!

Gotta say I bought this phone as a backup for my Samsung but after using it for a month now I like it better than my old Samsung cell phone I sort of put through the washing machine by mistake..oops. Battery seems to hold a longer charge but I do not use it too much either but for incoming calls mostly for a small business. Came with an activation card and a couple chargers which my replacement Samsung did not... Works very good in the boonies or sticks, country folks.

Personally, I love the way that this phone is set up, so simple and easy to use without all the immoral garbage on it that the more popular smartphones seem to be inundated with. The only reason for a 4 star rating, was that I purchased the same model this January 2017. And I had to replace it only 5 months later, in June 2017, because the screen froze black. The phone repair shop I contacted said that materials and labor would cost me roughly $125.00...... So I decided to buy the same model again, because my mom, older sister and younger brother have all had theirs for a while, and never really had any problems with theirs. So, hopefully this is helpful to whoever reads this. :-)

Although I've never owned an Android phone before this, I found the phone easier to use than I thought. Once I had the battery charged and turned the phone on for the first time, I found that the set-up process went very smoothly. And I was able to easily transfer my service on TracFone from my old handset to this one, and also was easily able to transfer my contact list to this handset from my old one. A friend of mine who has a Android phone explained to me how to get apps for this phone from the Google Play store which also was easy to navigate from the phone. The sound quality of the phone was very good, and when using the phones data or a Wi-Fi connection to access web sites it loaded fast with little or no lag time. And the battery lasts for a good while between charge ups. To sum it all up, for those like myself who are Android newbies this is a very good first phone to try before trying something more advanced. Very good and might I add durable product.

I gave this as a gift to someone I know is homeless and this will make it so much easier for her and her kid. When she adds minutes, it will triple them. The tears in her eyes of joy just made it worth it.

I'll start by saying my first smart phone experience was the Tracfone ZTE Valet, two of them in fact. At the time it seemed to be the best that Tracfone had to offer. Maybe I got a couple of lemons, but they were disappointing as smart phones, and just as phones. I used the screen going intermittent as an excuse to buy something new. I found the Motorola on Amazon for $50. It had better specs and good reviews so I took a chance.

So far, this phone is far superior in every way. The WiFi works great, 3G is good too. Phone function is fine. It is responsive and apps don't crash every two minutes. The only disadvantage is that I tend to leave the 3G on and I use a lot more data than I used to when I'm not in WiFi range. It's not as easy to turn the 3G off as it was with the Valet. But that's ok. I haven't had to buy airtime or data yet.

I got it as my first phone, and it really is a GREAT starter phone! The front camera quality is surprisingly good, it never lagged for me, and it played games like a champ, as well as music, YouTube videos and movie streaming!

My 2 complaints is one, there isn't a lot of storage on the phone, so I would recommend that you buy an SD card for extra G's of storage. Two, there isn't a selfie camera.

Overall, it's a solid phone for a great price, and TracFone offers pretty good service.

Works well but gets only minor use. I realize some people live on or with the phone, we do not. It takes decent pictures, does not lock up and has crystal clear sound. Easy set-up and had no problems with getting Tracfone number and account

terrible customer service
Motorola will not honor their one year warranty, says its a third party phone, buyer beware!!!
also a big run around with customer service reps, can't believe the lack of service.
crappy service, bad company

Update: If I were to buy this phone again, I'd consider the slightly more expensiveÂ LG Destiny 4G Android Prepaid Phone with Triple Minutes (Tracfone), with very similar specs, except that it has 8GB built-in storage instead of 2GB and runs a less-dusty version of Android (5.0 vs. 4.4). The extra storage would mean not having to deal with moving apps to the SD card right away, and the newer version of Android would be nice too. Still, I am extremely happy with the Moto E, and it has an FM radio, which the LG maybe doesn't have.

This phone is amazing for the price. I bought it because I go walking in the evening after work, and want to track my steps and have my music, and was getting uncomfortable with carrying my spendy iPhone, which I could easily end up dropping and breaking or losing in the dark. So I looked for a cheap MP3 player that wouldn't be a huge loss if something happened to it, and stumbled across this phone.

I DID NOT activate it. It is possible to skip past the activation steps in the initial setup. What I did instead was to set up a free phone number under Google Voice, and tie texts to it through Google Hangouts Chat, so that this is a fully functional phone when around wifi, all for zero dollars upfront, with no monthly service payments.

I also bought a $10 microSD card, 32 GB--the largest size this phone supports--and used the iSync app to copy all my playlists and tunes to the phone+card. I now have a *very* nice MP3 player that also tracks my walks (with the built-in GPS, which does not need phone activation to work and the free UnderArmor 'track my walk' app), uses bluetooth earbuds for a tangle-free music experience, and which sips its battery when not out walking.

The phone includes an FM radio which works pretty well, but it refuses to work unless you have earbuds plugged in because it uses the wires as an antenna. Since I don't use wired earbuds, this is frustrating, as it would be nice to listen to the radio sometimes while walking.

I also have an old Tracfone 'dumbphone' that I keep around for emergencies, which cost $7 up front and $20 every 3 months to keep active (and is another fantastic deal for the price). I am seriously considering moving my dumbphone's number to this phone, so that it is a true phone all the time, and I can make an emergeny call if need be while out walking.

Downsides: Compared to the iPhone, it's a bit less snappy / responsive, but still completely usable. The camera is pretty sucky, but not horrible, it works. All the Google services are amazing, but also a bit clunky compared to the 'just works' iPhone equivalents, and the phone is stuck on a pretty old and clunky (4.4) version of Android. It seems like some app or something needs updating (and Google Play needs to update too) every time I use the phone. The phone has only has 2 GB of internal storage, so you need to use an app manager to move apps to the microSD card or you'll run out of app storage space right away. Still, it compares surprisingly well to the iPhone, especially considering that the iPhone costs about 20 times as much.

Since it runs an old version of Android, it's probably a huge security hole, so it's best to not use any real personal information when setting it up.

Overall, for $35 total cost including the 32GB microSD card, I couldn't be happier with this phone. It's like an iPod touch on steroids for a tiny fraction of the iPod's price.

So far I like the phone very much. First real smart phone I've ever had. Only two real complaints. First the internal memory is very limited and is practically full after only downloading Facebook and YouTube APP onto the phone. Second is the camera, takes good pictures but very limited on functions does not even have a flash. Have thought of upgrading to a newer more advanced version but this seems to be the only Motorola product that TRACFONE currently uses and I don't like the other Android phones they offer.

I like this phone a lot. Tracfone is getting some true smart phones in their offerings and this one is a big leap forward from my Samsung Galaxy Centura. Transferring service, phone number and all my apps was easy and worked great. This Moto E is fast processing and the web pages load quickly. I think this phone will service me for quite a while to come. Would buy it again.

Couldn't be happier. $20. I use TRACFONE for telephone. Tracfone has internet time but I prefer to connect it to my wifi at my home. Plenty of bells and whistles. Loaded it with cool free apps. I listen to radio wifi programs. It takes great pics and nice video. It's bright, clear and colorful even with my old man vision.
Phone burst into flames when plugged in charging, 11 months after purchase. Called Tracfone under the 1 year warranty and they tell me warranty does not cover the phone bursting into flames.

This is my first smart phone. It is fast, capable, and just the right size. The screen is easy to read - even without my reading glasses. This phone is a great value especially when you consider TracFone's service pricing. I'm usually close to a secure Wi-Fi connection so I don't need to use the 3G connection very often, but it's there when I need it. I'm able to invest the savings from typical cell phone plans in fast Internet access with a back-up provider and state-of-the art digital home telephone service. It's nice to have three communication options. If one is down, we have two backups. My teenage daughter has one of these phones and she loves it too! My son has a Moto G. He loves the latest and greatest technology. He is very impressed with both the Moto G and Moto E.

ALERT I purchased this phone on June 16 of 2015, it was terrific. I had to purchase another phone on June 16 2016 when it wouldn't communicate with satellite for GPS any longer without a wifi or "hotspot" within immediate vicinity. It is now Nov 9 2016, and my second phone just did the same thing. Even after resetting, and following tech support instructions, both phones failed in the same way. Otherwise, I really loved this little phone, but unless they agree to replace it, I'm going for the one I bought for my son, which was an LG Tracfone with more storage, for about 30 dollars more.

I received the product on the day it was send to arrive. I've been using it since Thursday and only had to charge it once. It runs fast, the screen looks great, and games look great. I still haven't activated it with tracfone because I don't have a minutes card so I'm not sure how good text phone and data is but it works great on wifi. I would actually recommend this!

I don't know if it's just me and I'm not figuring it out right but I cant find a "call log" and I don't get an icon when I get a text. The little green speech bubble on my old phone would show a waiting text. This does not and I miss texts if I don't constantly check it. It gets a good signal and I use it for when I'm out of the house and texting only. I have a landline for most calls.

Worked fine for me...till it didn't. Then one day Uber/Lyft stopped working and the battery stopped holding a charge for more than a few hours. Now it's just a cell phone I'm using till I switch to a proper smart phone. Unless you hardly do anything with your phone, avoid this. If you don't do much, it's a great deal, though. Nice camera. Good phone quality.

Really enjoying this new phone. An inexpensive way to own a decent smart phone that does a lot. Glad I got it. Also glad I didn't pay full price for it on the Tracfone website! Amazon had a much bettter deal.

First the cons. For the people who never read the product description,It is a TracFone,you cannot unlock it,change sim cards or do anything else to it. It will not run on anything other than Tracfone's network. Next, it does not have forward facing camera or a rear flash. No selfies for you ! Internal storage on this phone sucks,only 3 gb. You'll need a Micro-sim card if you want to stuff it with apps,music and pics.
Now for the good stuff. The was Motorola's entry level smart phone back in 2014 when it came out and it got great reviews. Today if your not a power user this is still a good phone. Build quality is great and it feels good in the hand. Screen is nice and bright and the colors are great! It runs all the apps I've installed without any problem. Wi-fi and phone reception is great also. I live in a small valley and sometimes cell reception is the pits but I've had no problem so far. The phone runs 4.4.4 Kit Kat but can be upgraded to 5.0 Marshmallow according to Motorola's web site but I've not tried it.
All in all your not going to beat this for a $20 bill !

The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that photos aren't always clear. Could be because of the photographer. I had one of these before I drove my car over it. Went to an LG. Didn't like that one at all. Ditched that one, and found the Moto E on line for dirt cheap. A much better phone all the way around.

I love this phone. It does everything I thought it would and more. I have seen reviews stating people can not load apps to the SD card. I have not had a problem doing that. Some apps I can not move to the SD card and I do uninstall them and find another app that I can move to the SD card or installs on the SD card. I can even have the app data store on the SD card as well.
This phone is far superior to the Samsung Galaxy. I am glad I switched phones.

Motorola Moto E 1st Generation. Glad I was searching for the phone when I did because i paid less than $50 for it and a week later price went up. Love my new Tracfone. Got rid of US Cellular bill every month and got this great deal. Loving the Triple minutes feature. I never used 600 minutes a month of talk or text before so I know It will last awhile for me. So when you add a 200 minute card for $39.99 it gets tripled. Awesome. Will be saving money in the next few months.

The phone is as described. I was excited to move up to a smartphone and if you do not need help from tracfone it might be a good phone. I needed technical help from tracfone getting set up. These people are terrible,after several calls to them I still have a phone that is incomplete. All I am trying to access my voicemail and it seems to be out of their expertise to help

I've had it about a week, and so far, I'm very pleased with this phone. It works, unlike the crappy ZTE I upgraded from. Should have done it long ago. Not nearly as much glare in the sunlight either, and it's super-fast on FaceBook. Just be sure to download a decent power control widget, such as "Power Toggles", so you can easily turn the 3g data off, or you'll breeze through your data in no time. For some reason, the control widget that came installed doesn't have that option on it. I'm hesitant to give it 5 stars yet, but if it stays reliable over time, I'll definitely bump it up one.

This is the first smart phone I've owned. I found it easy to start using for the basics. Still learning more.
The only thing I did not like is that it's set to let every app work automatically in the background.
I had to disable all sorts of things as it was silently gulping up data usage at times when I was not
by a wifi connection. So far I'm happy with it, it seems very sturdy and the gorilla glass cleans up in a snap.

Santa got these for my 8 year old Twin daughters for Christmas. They just use the wifi for games and we downloaded a texting app so they can text me or Dad. These phones were great! They didn't come with a sim card though which I thought they did. Such an amazing deal for $20 then we bought them phone cases. Probably the cheapest and most loved Santa present ever! It's really easy to bypass the activation part and just connect to wifi.

I have had the phone for almost two years now and LOVE it. I am 73 years old and somewhat electronic litterate and set it up bu myself with no problems. I us it with Tracfone and find it very economical. I just bought a second one as a back up.

Bought 3 of these for the family. We were not disappointed. We upgraded from an LG840 Tracphone, and what a pleasant experience. This Moto E (gen 1) phone comes with triple minutes, triple texts, and triple data. Just a touch larger than an iPhone 4. You can limit your data usage to WiFi if you want. Memory is also expandable from the 4 Gig internal to an additional 32 Gig on a SDHC card. This is a definite buy recommendation!

The head phone outlet does not work great, I can't keep the jack in place. The memory is small. Don't expect to store too many apps. I have found that the micro SD card will accept certain apps and not others. This makes it hard to add too many features. For basic usage, checking email and social media it works great. The screen is sharp and clear. I also like the sleep and alarm features.

I've been a Tracfone user for many years, using a flip type phone that served it's purpose. But I've always wanted one that had a camera, so when this was offered at such an affordable price, I couldn't pass it up. The learning curve of an android phone is a bit daunting, but now with not only a camera and so much more at my disposal, I feel more in touch with things around me. And transferring my minutes and phone number was super easy.

Works great for basic internet mail and phone. Meets my needs very well. If you don't need an overpriced cell phone and just want the basics for everyday use I recommend this phone. Connects to wifi very quickly.So far I have not experienced any problems with this phone. Considering what I paid { $20} I am very pleased.

The first one I got came with a completely dead battery that would not take a charge. The replacement also came with a completely dead battery but did take a charge. After six months of use I haven't had any battery issues and everything works fine. For the price I'm very pleased.
Works great and love the service from TracFone. I highly recommend it if you are not a game player and just need a phone with text and internet access.
Bought it because I searched Safelink compatible phones and this popped up. Should be listed in description as "Not Safelink compatible"

This my first android, it's nice and light. I use it for emergency I'm one who's not on the phone all day. With this I
can check the weather when I'm out and about, check prices, and here and there make a call. I usually keep
my cell phones 10 plus years. I'm not new to cell phones...been using them for at least 27 yrs.

Good Loud sound, speaker is on the front where it should be. The phone also has small light on the front that flashes to show a missed call or message. Battery lasts about 12 days of light use 8 to 10 with medium use. Very good phone. I Would rate it 12 on a 1 to 10 scale.

The phone itself is really nice for the price. Sleek and has a black matte look to it. The phone cards for these are also reasonably priced and you can get them on yhr Tracfone website or even at most grocery stores. I was able to connect to my Wi-Fi no problem. The colors were vibrant and the camera was decent. Easy to set up. But know that this phone is not Safelink compatible. I didn't know until it came and it said it on the box itself. Speakers and sound were clear and reception is good.

So far so good. Good wifi. Telephone is great. I use this with wifi, seldom with roaming 3G, but everyone has wifi and it is fast. The only drawback is that it is hard to see in the daylight. With wifi in hotels and other places that have approval screens, you need to enter the internet with yahoo or some other non google entry. The battery is good. The ability to have a 32G micro card makes it easy to download video, photos and music. The size is just right. Camera is 5G, which is adequate for my needs.

I was very hesitant about getting a smart phone, but after reading many positive reviews helped me decide to upgrade from a basic, no frills phone. I'm not a techie and don't spend much time on a phone, and w/ the triple minutes, this seems like a perfect phone for me. Also, I'm pleasantly surprised how relatively user-friendly it is. I've not used the camera yet, but if I want to take a lot of quality pictures, I'll use a camera.

This is a great phone for most people. Its not an IPhone. Not the best that can be bought. But, If you want a smart phone at a great price, this is the phone for you. Easy to use, nice screen. Although it is only 3G, it is very fast in my opinion. As others have noted in their reviews, this is a perfect phone for those of us who are not into "keeping up with the jones".

Honestly, I haven't completely decided yet. When I first got it there were too many apps for me and it drained my phone too fast. I couldn't figure out how to stop the programs that were draining my phone. Once I reset it, the battery drained slower and I had just a few apps I use. If it stays like this, I'll give it five stars. Right now 3-4.

I has a Moto X with a different carrier. The only thing I really miss is this thing doesn't have a camera flash. But I knew that when I bought this one at Â¼ the price, so I'll still give it 5 stars. In reality there's very little difference, but this one feels a tad thicker because the X was more curved. Sure it's smaller, but bigger is not always better. Forget the bragging rights, Moto and Android have come so far, today's basic smartphone ain't dumb!

Excellent phone!!! But. The Corning gorilla glass scratches EXTREMELY easy. I wonder if it is in fact
glass. I suspect that it is just a tough plastic. Plus, there is NO Wi-Fi hotspot feature on this phone
as stated multiple times.

Dont drop it. My daughter just had to replace hers (with the same phone since she loves it) because the one time it fell it developed a odd spot in the screen from there it was downhill. During the year she had it thow it was great which is why she bought the same one with a difrent case hoping it will provide better protection.

Wonderful phone and much easier to use than I thought. Easier and less expensive than my previous carrier T-Mobile, who's prices continued to go up, and it wasn't until I decided to leave them that they offered me a plan that was less. I had some bumps in the road with TracFone from a prior purchase, but I am now getting good service and at a price that is affordable.

My husband bought this phone for me for our last anniversary, and when my father needed a new phone, I purchased this model for him as an early Father's Day gift. We both love how easy it is to operate, once you learn all of the features. The more I use my phone the more I like it. The camera takes great pictures as well.

We have given and upgraded Tracfones for our elderly parents for many years and this is by far the nicest and easiet for them to use. We would recommend it for someone who is not looking for the latest and greatest in terms of data usage, texting, photo taking etc. although it does all that. We just wanted them to have a phone for peace of mind when traveling etc. As always, read the reviews. This one had good reviews and was inexpensive.
Good phone for the price only drawback is it does not have the dual camera.

The speaker stopped working after a few days. This is a common problem with the phone. Search Moto E no sound. If you tap the top of the phone, the sound will pop on and off, so it's a physical connection issue.

I have used Tracfone for a long time and the Motorola Moto E is finally a phone that does everything I need when I need it. No lag, good pictures, and a great price. I bought it on Amazon for about half the price anywhere else. It is worth every penny. Goodbye Samsung!!#

I purchased this phone for my tween daughter and she loves it! Its the perfect phone for her to have when she has to stay after school. Its fast has reasonable storage space for apps and games. Downfall is it does not have a front facing camera but the back camera takes pretty nice pictures. It is a really nice little phone. I also purchased one of the cute cases that they sell for the Moto-E and its just a perfect fit for my daughter.

My son is in love with this phone. He picked it and I ordered it for him. he is on it all the time and he got familiar with it fast. I bought one weeks ago and sent it back because it would not charge. It was my fault. You have to give it a little time 15 to 20 minutes and then you will see it start charging. really nice phone for the money.

After years of paying $70 or $80 dollars a month this phone is the bargain of the year. Using Tracfone's annual data my phone is now costing me about $10 or $15 a month and its works as good as any of the IPhone's or Android phones we have ever had. This is a great alternative, and Android love all of our Google apps, email and calendar.

I really like this phone. The interface is quite fast and not bogged down with unnecessary junk. The Wi-Fi reception is better than I expected, and is very useful for voip. Also purchased a Samsung EVO SD card, which pairs with it nicely. A great inexpensive little phone that won't destroy your soul if you break it or lose it.

I read a lot of good reviews about it and bought it and got it fast. However, when I tried to get the service with Tracfone the problems started. I tried pushing the buttons to get it to work and the screen came on in Spanish. The tech on the phone told me to open the back and take out the battery. It was difficult but I finally got the back open. The battery was big and I could not see how to take out the battery. The tech read some more on the phone and then told me the battery does not come out. I told him that I wanted to cancel the service and he then told me that I had to find someone that speaks Spanish. I insisted that he cancel the service and refund my credit card. He got a supervisor on the line and she was sane and told me that she gave me the refund. She probably did but I will check my next credit card bill to be sure.
I am buying a non-smart phone and will try the Tracfone service with that one. I do not want one untrained tech to turn me sour on Tracfone. I sent the phone back to Amazon and they refunded me.
Great cheap phone. I only use it for basic tasks such as texting and talking. I works well.

Excellent price. Phone is ok, but not a lot of memory. I added an SD card, and it helped somewhat, but as with all Android phones, I can't get rid of the Google programs I don't use without going deep into techie land.

I bought this phone awhile ago, and wanted to wait to leave the review, till I really have tried it out for awhile. Well I just have to say I Love It. It is so easy to use, The separation of the text, talk, data makes it so easy to watch your usage and makes your minutes last longer. The features are really easy to use. Downloading apps are really easy to do. I just love it and highly recommend it.

Very happy with this phone. To me compared to my past phone this phone is pretty darn near nice smart phone. Actually bought 2. One for my wife and one for me. My previous LG phone was horribly slow. This one actually works. It is generation 1 in the Moto E line. But that is OK by me. Does all that I want from a phone. And the price was great at 49 bucks. Not a bad camera either. Put a large sd card in it and am good to go for a while!

This is my first smart phone. My old phone could call/text, nothing else. This is a HUGE change. It's been fun learning what all it can do. I've had no troubles so far. Bought one for my husband too & he said the FM radio app doesn't work very well. My battery only lasts 2 or 3 days, even if I don't use the phone. I have to constantly remind myself to charge it. It's taken a little time to learn to use but it's been fun.

bought 2 one for me one for my lady,we had old hello good by phones so it took us a while to figure eveything out but now lov it only wish it had a recorder so i could put my own ring tones on like my other phone ,still learning some stuff,for a not tec person an older folks i think this is a good phone,i don`t do all the downloads an games it`s just a nice low tec phone ,for the price an being on verizon for me works

It met my expectations 100%. I received it on-time and was able to transfer my phone number, minutes, data, and texts from my old Moto E that I had dropped in water to this new phone without a hiccup! It was absolutely fantastic! I love this little phone! I wish it had more memory, but I'll get one that does when I have more money in the future. Until then, this one will be just fine!

Phone may be a little dated. Instructions on use, useless. I'm an old guy, and I have trouble figuring out things. A little help would be appreciated. Tracfones tutorial helps, but does not explain even the simple thing I wish to do, like set, . alarms. really have to dig for info. Otherwise, good phone, but have to charge battery every 2 days. It works for me, but instructions are a little vague.

First of all I would like to say the Motorola Motto is the
nicest phone I ever owned.
I purchased the Motorola from Shopcelldeals fulfilled
by Amazon.
I owned many tracfones and even an iPhone 4 and
the Motorola Motto is a nicer phone.
Its quite an upgrade from the LG Optimus Dynamic.
The screen is 4.3 a larger screen than my other
Phones and another reason I like it and a speaker
on the front and sounds real good.
The batter lasts about 8hrs and the phone looks
Expensive you would say it cost $400.00.
I paid $79.00 for it and had the phone for 3 days.
I like it so much I will be purchasing another one.
Love this phone. Got it at an incredible price and it has everything I need. The phone quality is very good and has all that I need for a smartphone.

I bought it just to use it for some wireless/Bluetooth issues (not as an actual 'phone'); device seems solid and runs a variety of apps I needed to run (both old & new) Works well; hasn't crashed; for a cheap smartphone it's worth the $.

I like this phone, camera quality is good, sound quality is good. I bought the Tracfone lg LTE and I'm returning it for another Tracfone moto e. I dropped my 1st moto e, I like it a lot better than the Tracfone lg LTE even though that phone is more up to date. The features on the moto e are much better to Me.ð

Arrived on time through Amazon Prime. Phone has nice display. Kit Kat OS. Using on Tracfone/Veizon. All going well. Phone is simple by today's standards but was bought for someone who had been using a 2g flip phone. No front camera seems a little strange, even a VGA would have been ok. Good first smart phone at a great price.

This is a great stater phone! We got this phone for our very independent 10 year old. I thought maybe we would have service issues or the phone would feel cheap but that could be over looked because of our need and the price, but i was wrong! The phone is sturdy and calls and texts go through great! Its reliable. Now three of his school friends are getting this as their started phone. There is no selfie camera, which could be a good thing. Luckily my son doesn't want that phone works for him.

I've had the phone for a few weeks and so far I like it. no problem getting in, sounds good, can hear pretty well, though I use the speaker for the most part. I've had 3 phones in the past 6 months from tracfone, hopefully this one does better than those did.

Bought for my elderly mom. She likes it. Low to midrange phones are getting better and better. My next phone will be a mid-range. I'm done buying $600 phones every two years. It's a sucker's game.

There is no flash on this phone, and the photos are a bit soft. I wouldn't print them out and stick them in a frame. But I'd sure as heck email, share, upload them. Other than that it's a great little smartphone.

I really, really like the Moto E but it's not perfect. It replaced my LG 840. It's simply an excellent, solid Android phone with a really good touch screen... with lot's of great apps available for download. I was a bit disappointed that I could not transfer text minutes and data between each other like I could with the non-Android LG 840. So texts and data are silo'd so I can't take minutes from data and use them for texts and vice versa. And TRACFONE charges 1 min per text on the Moto E instead of .30 minutes for non-Android phones like the LG 840 for some reason or other. It is good that TRACFONE triples the minutes on both texts and data when I add a card. But it would be nice to be interchangeable between data and texts and it would be nice to use .30 min per text instead of 1 min per text. And data can go down pretty fast if not careful. Especially when using a popular app like Waze. As much as possible I try to use wifi and keep off the data hungry cell towers. The screen could be brighter in sunlight but its good enough. The only other problem is it's hard to get apps off internal memory to an SD card. Most apps want to stay on internal memory and don't offer easy options to slide over to an SD card. So I don't use as many apps as I would otherwise. There are solutions to this that can be googled up but it gets pretty technical and a bit time consuming. So you win some and lose some. All in all the benefits of the Moto E significantly outweigh the negatives for me.

OK value for the price paid (under 20 bucks for two year old technology) but lacking in features, mediocre camera, not enough memory to add more than a couple apps beyond what Google forces on us. It's better than what I used previously, but I'll probably look to upgrade soon. One good point, battery is good, charge lasts 2-3 times longer than my previous phone.

Great tracfone. I had a Samsung Galaxy and was tempted many times to deep six it. This phone is leaps and bounds better than Galaxy. It's quick and no pauses when in use.Again , very happy with the Moto E.

It arrived on time, and it was easy to switch over from my previous older flip phone. One thing for users who have a lot of minutes on their older phone, the maximum amount they will give you is 512 of each calls, texts, and data.And you can turn off the data when you don't want to use it. So I had like 1200 minutes and that was kind of a downer, but that's the only downside to it really.

Onto the phone: For utilizing a tracfone plan for a smartphone it works well. Easy to check how many calls/texts/data you have left. The phone is sleek and generally fast for being a cheaper smartphone. It works well, and has a good camera! It's not the BEST smartphone on the market, but for someone still on a tracfone plan, it's very worth it.

All in all, I would highly recommend it. Just don't expect to get all of your minutes transferred to the phone.

Takes beautiful pictures. Takes better pictures than the camera I used to have. Was a big help when we went on vacation and my old camera broke. I still didn't figure out a lot of the things it can do, but that is OK. I can use it for an emergency phone to call help and use it as a camera. The price is great.

Overall, I'm very happy with the performance of my Moto E. The internet speed, wifi reception, memory, and battery life are all good. It only has one flaw that I can tell; the camera doesn't have the ability to focus on objects within about 6" or less (like bar codes). That makes a lot of shopping apps that scan bar codes like Cartwheel not usable for that function.

Great phone! This phone was bought as a spare and work phone. Its simple and easy to use. It also runs the latest versions of pretty much any app like YouTube or Amazon. You get what you pay for, and for 20 bucks you can't go wrong! I recommend this phone for a child's first phone. It has durible gorilla glass and its only 20 dollars so if it gets broken its definitely not the end of the world.

Don't do it! I'm on my second one. There just isn't adequate storage (first one just died out of the blue). It's easy enough to navigate, but runs out of room in no time and that is only with a couple of apps. I was not able to move much of anything to the SD card. My husband has one too and within a month of owning one we were constantly getting notifications that storage space was running out. Other than the storage issue, I guess it's fine, but I suggest looking for something with more storage.

I'm not a heavy user of apps, but I love the FM radio feature. I find the way this phone handles messages a little awkward. I guess I'm used to the way my old phone operated. The browsing feature seems to work much better than my old phone(LG) This phone takes much better pictures than my old phone, but I still have trouble seeing the screen in broad daylight. For the price this phone is a great deal.

The item had been taped showing it had been opened. The sim card was missing . Very disappointing. Returned. Battery had been left in so even after charging it it would not stay on while trying to get instructions from provider. As noted these phones do not come with ample information from the companies but seem to assume everyone knows the" missing parts "since phones are so prevalent today. It might have been a nice phone .

This phone is listed at 59.99 now but when I bought it in March it was only $18.50. No idea why the big price difference. I didn't get a discount for signing up for an Amazon card. I like it fine for that price but wouldn't pay 60 bucks. It doesn't have a front facing camera and comes with so much preloaded that you can't delete, that there is barely room to install the apps you want. But it does work well. I get pretty good signal where I live and it connects to wifi ok.

Wonderful smart phone at a great price! My husband was looking for a Tracfone that was dependable and easy to use and we found it at a great price in this Motorola Moto E...plus we got a special triple minute bonus...Thanks so much for this deal...we could not have afforded to purchase otherwise!

Works great! Especially for the price!! This phone triples you call and message mileage automatically and we've had no trouble with it since activating it with Tracphone! A great alternative to standard phone plans and makes kid think about it before blowing data and minutes!

reviewerName: zee-Scotten zee-destroyer of duplicitous white collar criminals
reviewText: I've owned four of these. I ruined two on a kayak trip by putting them in a bag with a bottle of water that came open. Probably could have saved them if I could have gotten the batteries out. I have over 2,000 Amazon Prime songs on one of the phones. I've kayaked from Montana to Key West the past couple years and the phones have worked well.

Although I only paid $19.99 17 months ago I thought the battery would last longer. it will now charge but is depleted in about 12 hours. doubt that I could replace battery. I guess for the price you just don't get a phone with a decent battery.

I have never owned a smartphone until today. It absolutely boggles my mind that they're selling this phone for 50 bucks right now. This is a mini computer for *fifty dollars.* I haven't started tracfone service with it but can still do plenty of things by being connected to my home wifi. It's incredible. If you want an entry level smartphone for cheap, here you go.

Phone all in all very nice. It's smaller than the usual smart phone and so easier to hold in your hand to make a call but the text is also smaller. The only real negative is that, since I got the phone from Amazon (not HSN or QVC) my minutes did not rollover and my end date of service did not advanced a year (or at all)

I`ve had the Moto E for 3 week`s now,and i love it.First Motorola phone i have had.Have only had LG phones.I think the MotoE is a much better choice than the LG Optimus Fuel.Moto E is about 30.00 more than than the LG fuel,but is very much worth the price.

I'm pleasantly surprised with this phone. This is my first smart phone, and I think it is a great transition phone for those of us behind the times. Still getting the knack of it, like searching contacts and texting, but those will come with time.

This phone has an excellent picture. I have other LG306G phones for calls, but I could use this for calls if I want. I use this mostly for web use, to search, Facebook, and chat sites, as well as watch Xfinity 2 Go, using earphones. I can use it for free outgoing calls through an app. The size is convenient for listening to TV shows with it in my pocket to view the show when interested. The 4.4.4 Android is snappy.
Good product at a reasonable price.

I got this phone to use as a development test phone, as my everyday phone is a moto G, 2nd gen, I feel in love with this Moto E, build with then same design and usage as all Moto phones. I carry it around now all the time, I have never had an issue with it, feel amazingly great in your hand, battery life is good, screen is nice...

This phone is excellent. The android loads free apps fast with plenty of space for storage. The only negative is the camera is not reversible so no selfies. The price was good and performance is excellent. The camera is clear and clean photos and video excellent..

Upgraded from an LG L840 which, altho' supposedly a "Smart Phone", was not. This is everything I expect from a Smart Phone. Easy web access, fast downloads, and full access to apps. The screen provides crisp & clear pictures. Love this phone so much that I bought one for my son. Highly recommended!
First 'smartphone' for a skeptical baby-boomer...easy to learn to use with lots of apps / potential. Like the triple TracFone minutes - a real plus.

Having had this phone for about 6 months now I don't have a lot of good to say about it.
I continue to have problems when answering a call, the slide is pretty hokey way to open up a call. The phone also hangs up on me at times, combined with the high use of the battery this is a phone I will soon throw away

I bought this for my senior mom and she loves it but it was kind of hard to program to get it working. I'm pretty tech savvy but found it difficult to set up. Once set up, it's a perfect cell for new user. I suggest buying a bright E moto case to protect it from being dropped and makes it easy to find if misplaced.

I've been using Tracfone since 2008. There is no better service or deal out there for a senior low phone use person.This Moto E is far superior to the first two androids that I purchased; Samsung Galaxy wasn't too bad but the LG was very quirky awful.

I got this for my mom for her birthday. She wanted to try a smart phone and this has proven to be an easy one to start with. The android system is like her tablet so she's picking it up quickly. The pictures are great and the sound way better than her old phone. She couldn't be happier Since she is 2 states away- no pictures

By far, the BEST of all the offerings from TracFone I've ever used. It's pretty fast when I want to check the web. The apps and widgets work great. Google Play store downloads are quick. Wifi works great. The screen is larger than the ZTE Valet (my previous phone) and responsive -silky smooth when sliding through pages or opening apps. The sound quality if excellent. I gave it a four star because the 5mp camera is just ok (no flash) and well it's a TracFone not an i-phone. But still, it's pretty darn good.

This is a GOOGLE PHONE. That means that it will transfer
several Gigabytes of data to and from this phone whenever
Google feels like it. It transferred 18 Gigabytes in the
first 4 days after activating it. Completely blowing
out my restricted bandwidth. So far it has cost me $80 of overage
charges and I still have a week to go in the cycle. Why does
it have to update ALL of the dozens of apps every week? (answer:
advertising revenue). Why does Youtube play every video that
goes viral without even telling you about it? (answer:
advertising revenue). I have no idea what most of the
data ransfers were for but most of it was fom Google Play Store.
If you end up with one of these monsters, do the following:
1) disable WiFi during your prime time. 2) disab;e updates
3) disable background data tranfsers 4) disable foreground
data transfers. I'm still spending manhy hours looking for
more Google Mines.

What do you want for $50? Well these are well worth more but for us that's plenty of dough to spend, we have 3-$150 total. (Our previous 3 phones cost $15-total, $5 each, not bad for slider text, talk, and more.) Add SD card $10 ea, case $10; $70. Low price Won't last forever, good as an on hand emergency backup too.

Fantastic phone. It has a bigger screen (4.5 in), and lots of room for apps. It's by far and away the best Tracfone I've ever had. I would recommend it to anyone who wants a smartphone, and doesn't want to pay the high overhead of having a contract plan. This phone is a keeper!
Product was as described. Meets my need. Is Trac-fone ready.

I have been through 6 phones...THIS IS THE BEST PHONE I EVER HAD !!!!! I Love It ! I am still exploring the many many features..I received this phone 2 days early ...I cant say enough good things about it....However......(I wish it had a front camera)...it only has a back camera...lol

A very good phone for the money. Have used tracfone. This has worked well for me. Took getting use to the Android. I am an Apple user but the Moto e was my first smartphone. It was as expected works fine and is perfect for me. Like the size and fits my hand. Over all a very good deal and glad I bought the Moto e.

Boy was happy to have to use wifi and download games and have 911 available.his older brother didn't try to take this phone from him because it wasn't "cool". Price was under $20 for me but was worth more in his estimate.

I love my new phone, I like the sound. The Apps! I am starting to feel smart! It talks when you are searching for something with Google :) I read reviews of other Tracfone and being on a tight budget this is a perfect way to go!

Excellent purchase. I had found this phone on the Tracfone site available for use in my zip code area. The quality of this phone was far better than any of my past phones. It was quick and easy to upgrade my tracfone by purchasing from this seller. The phone was delivered quickly and was as advertised "new". I like everything about this android phone.

The phone works perfectly, and has everything that I expected. The camera isn't extremely good, but it isn't low quality either. Many complain about the storage of this phone, but 2 GB of free space is enough, at least for me. For only 40 dollars, this is probably the best phone you are going to get.

This is an awesome phone for the price. It's definately one of the best available for Trakfone accounts. Most of what you want in a smart phone is available and it has a zippy snapdragon processor. My previous smart phone was a ZTE which was so slow you were out of luck if you wanted to do anything besides take a picture or make a call.
The Moto E does have some obvious drawbacks mostly having to do with it only having 2 gigs of ram which limits how many apps you can have. You can add up to 32 gigs with an sd card, but most apps have to load from the phone itself and cannot be migrated. The Moto E also has a very limitted fixed-focus camera with about the quality of an old Kodak disposable camera. You have to tap the screen to take a picture, and this motion makes taking a clear shot next to impossible. Other than those two drawbacks, it is wonderful.
The phone was only 78 bucks and the service costs me about 7 bucks a month, a bargain at three times the price! Just don't leave your Nikon at home.

My husband loves his Moto E. With the bigger screen than the Samsung Galaxy, he no longer needs a stylus to text. We love Tracfone and will never go back to a contract phone. Tracfone phones keep getting better and more modern. Best thing...no monthly bills. The one thing Tracfone needs is to have Text Minutes that can be purchased separately like the Data Minutes .
Works very well. Still going strong after 2-3 years. Thanks, Motorola!

Has trouble with Bluetooth ,Amazon cloud as far as downloaded mp3s,and if they play on Google play only 1 track it seems locked in unless you hit a Wi-Fi hot spot ,then it changes,I am currently having a rough time with Bluetooth headphones
Thanks

For the price, it is a good phone. I am one of the very few people who do not own a cell phone, nor do I have any desire for one. But this TracFone is a great option for someone like me. Bonus is that with purchase you have your call time tripled.
Very disappointed I linked it with my family safe phone bought a case for it the case didn't fit and the speaker for listening to a call quit working so I'm not happy.

My first iPhone. It operates as described. It is not difficult to activate. I like it more and more as I learn to use this model. I didn't want to spend a bundle on an item I will not use heavily. I recommend this to others. This is a CDMA phone that uses Verizon's towers.

Great Tracfone choice with two exceptions: No selfies option and no scrolling of your account balance; if you want to check your balance you have to go through the app to do so, which wouldn't be so back except those of us that don't have wifi readily available, have to use our data to check the balance. Otherwise great phone!

This is exactly what I was looking for in a Tracfone. Does everything I need it to and then some. It also receives a signal where my old Tracfone wouldn't. You can't beat the price and does everything my daughters Galaxy does. Only one camera, but I'm not a selfie fan, but it comes with FM radio and GPS, which trumps two cameras in my book. The camera it has is pretty good too. Non focusing but takes good photos. Bottom line I could use it for 6 months, replace it and still would've gotten my moneys worth.

Geeze! For 20 bucks a nice buy. This is the first so called "smart phone" I've owned. Why oh why do people spend hundreds on smartphones from Samsung and Apple? I have an Amazon HDX Fire to do all that internet stuff when needed. And yes! I'm an older generation guy.

I love my new Motorola Moto E Android Smartphone with triple minutes.This phone works great and it has all the features op a expensive Apple smartphone without the high price.Best of all I only paid $35. after applying my $45.Amazon gift card.It arrived right on time and the details in the description was correct.I now have triple minutes,text and data all which was transferred from my old phone for free.Thank you Amazon,Shopcelldeals and Tracfone for such a great deal.

Came quite fast, packaging was nice retail, phone quality is impressive for the price. Feels a little heavy, which is good. Battery last pretty long. It is very responsive. It is a pleasure to use. I like the corning gorilla glass a lot. The only downside is that it is small, I press the wrong keys constantly.

This is a really useful bargain smart phone for use on networks like TracFone. The settings allow me to manage when the phone uses data so I don't run out and the call quality is much improved over my old LG. You're not buying a top of the line Android device or an Apple but you are getting a smartphone that lets you manage your minutes and data without big monthly bills.
Phone seems nice. However, it was advertised as triple the minutes yet, when I activated the phone this was not the case and there was no option for triple the minutes.

Never worked. Kept saying meid number didn't exist. Couldn't return it so we wasted money on this phone. We just wanted a replacement so we still had this for our kids when they biked around our neighborhood. Disappointed, yet still just want a replacement

Does this phone not have a speaker???? 'I'm so confused as to why I can only hear with the feadphone in which will not stay in my 3 year old reads. Smh. waste of money. We've literally tried everything to resolve this issue and yet to be able to. So disappointment. This was supposed to be his his christmas gift.

I have owned this phone for a month. It has been great so far. An easy transition from my old tracfone. It took less than 10 minutes to set it up on line. It took great photos when I took it on vacation at Disney World, it is too bad it doesn't have a flash, however, even in some of the lower light rides and shows it did a nice job.

Major upgrade to this beauty! Had old flip phone still, been tracfone user for over 12 years. It's perfect for my needs. Now with this new phone my text and phone minutes are counted separately whereas before they were counted together. So I get so much more. Glad I made the upgrade to it.
got this as a present for a friend works well and tracfone service works well out in the county

I love the fastness of the way that it loads but there is on problem there is not enough Internal memory on the phone and that cases a problem for me can't get all the app's that I won't on it. But for the most part I love the phone and it a lot better then the other phones that I had from Tracfone they keep freezing up all the time.

GREAT PHONE, LOVE IT. DOES JUST ABOUT EVERYTHING THAT I NEED, ONLY DRAW BACK NO FLASH ON CAMERA OR LED FOR FLASHLIGHT. DOES TAKE A GOOD PICTURE REGARDLESS. IF YOU BUY IT YOU WILL LIKE IT, SEEMS TO HAVE ALL THE RIGHT BELLS & TOYS. I'M HARD OF HEARING AND HAVE NO PROBLUM HEARING ON THIS PHONE. IT'S 5 STARS FOR ME, EASY SET UP AND CAN'T BEAT THE TRIPLE MIN'S...

I really didn't get to use the phone because horrible Tracfone can't give you any information correctly and this is a CDMA phone and not a GSM phone which they say (after you buy it) is what you need for it to work! I have spent more time on the phone with them for half right information that has caused me more problems and days and days of time and trouble! I used to like them but as so many say, they have gone DOWN HILL and have horrible customer service. They don't care if it costs you a bunch of money or minutes to correct a problem, they tell you AFTER THE FACT that things won't work. I just spent 50 minutes to find all this out which is almost half of the minutes on my card plan! So this might be a great phone, I liked the reviews, but Tracfone, is another sorry story. They don't care. I hate having to return it, Amazon got it out fast and sweet, and case and all the supplies, but thanks to Tracfone's lack of good help and info, I have to return it all, which hurts both of us.

Got this as a spare for my wife.
This uses the Verizon network. It even had data connectivity the last time we were in Northern Maine (U.S. Cellular), so voice/text/data work on that network as well.
bought this to replace an older lg I had that went crazy,,this is a much better phone and it runs so much smoother. Would buy again..great price and fast shipping...

This is a great phone - very good performance, good feel, no problems. I did notice slightly less volume from the speaker than other phones. But, it is loud enough for me and probably for most people as well.

Nice Phone, but the camera does not have a flash, and the Kit Kat 4.4 won't save to the mini SD drive. But it's supposed to have update capabilities. so that's not the companies fault. It's got 2 gb of room on the phone, so it's working, but I wish it had more like 32 gb.

Bought this as a first phone for my son. I know he was a little envious of his sisters iphone, and purposely tried to break it. Two years later, and a few rainstorms, many drops, it still works fine. Camera sucks, but oh well.
Best phone I ever had will buy this brand of phone for now on. can easily move through the phone but would like more detailed brouchure that comes with the phone

Great value phone from a quality brand. Nice interface. No issues with TracFone service. IF you are into using a lot of apps you might want to find another phone as internal memory is small. Still very recommended for voice / text / basic photo and basic web surfing!

Not bad of a phone for 20$
It has all the features of a regular phone and works just fine
It does have a small internal storage but with an SD card, you could solve that problem
It does not have a front camera which is devastating but I could live without it
If you want a cheap phone, get this right now
Our phone provider forced us to upgrade to Android so this was a good reasonable device.

There are definitely better phones out there and some are even cheaper, but unlike the others this was the best cheap phone that could be shipped to Canada.

My younger brother is very impressed with the product.
it state that it has simcard. but it doesn't. please fix discription.

They worked well in our rural area, easy to use. 1st generation of the model in case you didn't know. WiFi picks up well, has a radio feature. Easy setup and easy to transfer contacts via Bluetooth from old phone. Battery life is good so far.

Am still learning how to use the phone as it is my first smart phone but it seems to be very well made and I have spoken to others who have the phone who say that it is durable and reliable. The tutorials on the Trac Phone web site are helpful in learning about the product
Is a good phone, just has very little space so you can't have much on it

This is a great phone for the price. The size is nice and the sound is great. I prefer no contract phones -the only feature I would like is if it had a front facing camera on it otherwise it's perfect for me.
The best tracfone to date, it is just as good as my coworkers iPhones and androids and I pay in 1 year what they pay in a month for their family!! Well worth it, it's fast and user friendly!

It's okay, but doesn't have enough onboard memory. You can get a disc to put in it, which helps some, but most apps won't go to the memory disc and you will have trouble having even a few apps on it because they will soak up all the memory you have. It's fine as a phone, but not for storing lots of apps.
love the phone, when I buy minutes through tracfone I automatically get triple minutes, data, and texts. Glad I got it.

First smart phone--very happy with it. Easy to figure out--love the predictive text feature as I mainly use my phone for texting. Like the variety of apps & has good sound quality. Excellent value for the price. Transaction completed quickly.
good phone for the price works better than I expected. bought it for my young niece, many features fairly fast internet connections smart and handy

Such a great phone. It's cheap, and it works just as well as any iPhone. The best part about it is using it with tracphones byop program! One of my best Amazon purchases! (one tip though, buy a case, it's somewhat hard to hold it without one)
Really nice phone. Bought for my non-techy spouse, now she's a texting machine! Clear images, easy to use and set up.

Absolute piece of crap. My phone is less than 3 months old, and has no audio or sound w/o headphones. You can't play music, use it as an alarm or a GPS, can't watch videos or even use speakerphone. Factory reset and all the other advice you get does no good. Apparently this is a common problem with this model.

Dealing with overseas call centers was my problem. Most of the people tried to be helpful, but they were reading from a script and could not deal with the simple transfer of along standing TracFone account on an old flip phone to a new smart phone. After two days and more then 10 hours on the phone, I gave up. I returned the phone to amazon.
My experience was when finally getting someone after waiting on line for... I would ask for service, pause, would I "please wait on hold while I checked with my supervisor" and then silence... after 45 minutes, I would hang up and try again.
At the end of the second day the young man told me since straight talk and tracfone were sister companies and my old phone was now under straight talk and the new phone was a tracfone, I would have to cancel my old phone contract from straight talk and set up a new contract with TracFone. OK! OK!
So I call again to TracFone and said I wanted to activate my new smart phone. They could do that. Good. I said I would like to have auto-pay and here is my credit card number. Oh, he said, we don't do that. You have to buy plan cards and then we can active your phone when you get a card.
At this point, I was exhausted. It shouldn't be a two day job to get a cell phone set-up. A company doing business should take your money anyway they can get it. So, I contacted Amazon to return the phone.

I've owned two of these phones; the first one was purchased in a rush as I had just lost my job and with it my company-sponsored phone plan, and the second was a replacement for the first one. Overall it did what it needed to do, which was let me field calls so I could get another job, and I liked the phone enough to hold on to it for a while afterwards.

The good:
First of all, the price is phenomenal, as is the triple minutes deal you get through TracFone. I know a lot of people who are writing reviews have some very well-defined complaints about TracFone, but I have had no issue with them (especially when dealing with my phone dying) and still use them to this day. I never had an issue with incoming or outbound calls with this phone, nor with texting or mobile data for that matter. Most of what I do with my phone, however, is over WiFi, which this phone handles very well. While the storage is limited (more on that later) I was able to install an NES emulator on it and run some games, giving me plenty of amusement whilst taking up very little storage space.

The bad:
This phone's processor isn't the best, and it has trouble handling multiple apps at once. Any apps running in the background will fall asleep, time out, or just fail - not ideal for when you're trying to answer a text whilst also waiting for an Uber. Even more annoying is the phone's lack of storage; if you are tech-minded like myself and can figure out how to A. disable onboard apps, B. move apps to the SD card, and C. occasionally clear cache and unnecessary storage for certain apps then you can keep it running somewhat smoothly, but you will find yourself fighting with the "running out of storage" notification from time to time. Bluetooth was a bit iffy, especially with my wireless headphones; occasionally it would use the onboard speaker when it was connected to my headphones, and I would have to restart the phone to get it to work.

Probably most egregious of all was the fact that both phones died under the same circumstances - they would run out of battery whilst charging, and would never charge again. The white charging light would turn on when plugged in, but when it got enough juice to kick the screen on the battery would die and the cycle would start anew. This is apparently a problem with all Motorola phones from that generation, and given that this is a lower-level phone I'd imagine it happens quite a bit more with them - it happened to me twice, both after only two months.

Thankfully, TracFone issued replacements both times, once giving me an LG Destiny instead, which is a far better phone. If you are frugal like myself, are infinitely patient when it comes to loading apps, can deal with limited storage, and (most of all) just need a phone right away (or would like a backup should you need a phone right away) then this could be a good phone, but don't expect it to be your go-to phone for more than two months.

I will add that for the money that this item was original selling I purchased a significantly better Unlocked phone to use on Tracfone's BYOP.

If I compare setup of the two the Moto E was set up in minutes by going online to the Tracfone website and transferring the phone number to the new Moto E. That is a plus.
The BYOP required a separate SIM card purchase (I knew this and ordered it at the same time) but required some setting in the phone to be changed manually in order to get Internet access via the mobile network and also required manual settings of the MMS setting to send and receive MMS messages.

So the fact that it is ready to go in minutes is the plus. But here are better BYO phones available is the negative.

I've been using this phone for about 2 weeks. My initial impression is that it's a solid phone. I haven't been talking or texting much with it, but I have been using apps like Twitter, weather and sports apps. I have my email and calendar on it and it syncs without any problems.

The phone will use 3g data unless you change the settings, so be aware of that going in. My first day playing with it I used 20mb of data on 3g downloading an app from Google play. That was intentional to know what kind of data usage I could expect.

The phone will track how much 3g data you're using and how much data you're using on WiFi.

I stuck a 32gb micro sd card in it and set the camera to record to the card instead of the phone.

I deducted one star for the following reasons:

The restrict background data setting (which limits data unless you're on WiFi) turns off easily. It leaves an alert icon at the top of the screen. When swiping down from the top of the screen the listing only needs to be touched to turn off the setting. I'd prefer to have it on all the time and only turn it off by drilling into the settings menu.

I've also been using my phone as an alarm clock. It seems to work well except I couldn't snooze the alarm when there were notifications that popped up overnight. I had to go into the clock to disable the alarm.

This Dumbphone is Complete Garbage! I purchased this as a gift to replace an older flip-top phone but I am switching everything (activation & minutes) back to the flip-top phone. The phone would not receive calls but you could place a call. I called tracfone support and waited 4 separate times, I was on hold each time for over 35 minutes. I was told to hang up and dial a code and that would take care of the problem but nothing, then I had to call back and wait another 35 minutes. I did the call back thing, they called me back and the message told me to press 1, when I did, it hung up. The Motorola software does not make it easy to just place a call, you have to press and slide to unlock then go to a different screen, too much B.S. Google is terrible as usual, you can't just use this, you need to set up an account and once you set one up, you have to sign in on a tiny screen even if you have it set to remember your login. Certain Google apps won't work and Tracfone, you need to download an app just to see how many minutes you have left but it freezes up all the time and you are unable to login to check your minutes. This was one bad purchase

Don't waste your money, this phone is a piece of crap. I bought this phone right before Christmas 2014 by March 2015 it would only hold a charge for 8 hours. I contacted Amazon to complain, they told me to call Motorola.

Motorola worked with me for a month. They were nice and tried to be helpful. Finally Motorola told me to contact Tracfone. Tracfone sent me a new phone. The new phone worked for one month when other problems began. This time the problem being that I could not hear the phone ring as well as not able to hear the person I was speaking to nor could they hear me. I called Tracfone but was not happy with their service. They had me reset the phone to factory settings which did not improve anything. I asked if I could exchange this phone for another but was told no.

It is now July 2015 and am disgusted with this phone and the service I received. While I was happy with my Tracfone service in the past this phone purchase has been such a hassle that I'll be changing my phone purchase and service provider.

I had bruised my fingernails struggling with the thing for 20 minutes and more. Ow. The 5MP camera takes great pictures. Internet connection feels seamless. From buying Tracfone in the past at time of purchase the phone is unlocked at point of sale or it had a XXXXXXX code number you enter in the phone which gives you 7-10 minutes of air time. I really liked this phone, enough to buy another one as a spare. Sadly my like turned to distaste after less than one month and less than 10 phone calls. The phone itself is not bad. It has a few quirks that I didn't like, like the inability to turn the Wi-Fi completely off. The phone was constantly hunting undesirable Wi-Fi networks even after I turned Wi-Fi off and the 3g on. The main problem is that Tracfone will delete your minutes. A google search will reveal that this is a common problem. A call to customer service ended with rep telling me that -"sorry we can't restore any minutes". I only lost about 90 minutes but I read horror stories about many many more vanishing. I could never trust Tracfone again. My spare, still unopened and in the shipping box is for sale.

I had this piece of garbage for less than three months. I'm done. For a second time in this small amount of time, I had to do a factory reset after a complete lock up and battery gauge calibration snafu. Only this time, after the reset and two hours charging, it still showed no charge. Tried restarting it again and then it wouldn't boot at all. I did nothing different on any of the three resets, it just stopped working on the third one. Besides, in about ten weeks time, it shouldn't have needed to be restored ONCE, let alone three times. I was hardly rough on this worthless POS, either. Texts, Facebook messenger and Fallout Shelter...that's about it. Simply put, this thing is just unreliable. I will give it this, though; it's physically very tough. I found this out in my frustration, throwing it into a wall several times.

This thing is cheap. But remember, as I was reminded; you get what you pay for. Spend a few extra dollars and get something reliable. I just did.

I bought this phone for my mom as her first smartphone. It's not worked right since day one. I only downloaded Facebook, Facebook Messenger and the Tracfone app since I knew there wasn't much onboard memory. I moved the Facebook apps to an SD card. I learned six months later that the phone always dropped calls, so she can't talk on it.

I recommended this phone to another family member who went out and bought it right off. Within a week he was getting the full memory warnings. At two months in, it froze on startup and never turned on.

If all you want to do is text, this will work for you. If you want to use this like a smartphone, continue looking elsewhere.

The description says the phone "Includes: battery, USB cable, wall charger, activation guide and Tracfone services guide." I bought this for my mother for an emergency phone and so she can listen to audiblebooks and music, and the USB cable was one of the featured accessories that mad this phone attractive to buy. We had to spend another $20 in town to buy a USB cable so that I can transfer books and music. Other than the lack of the cable, it appears to be satisfactory for my 82 year old mother. The font can be changed to extra large. The icons are smaller than my iPhone and will be difficult for her to see, but if we put the most important for her at the beginning, it should be ok. I bought this phone to replace a Tracfone flip phone of my daughter's (she is 13 years old). I transferred the number from the old phone to this phone online through my Tracfone.com account. The entire process took around 10 minutes and the new phone was up and running. I have never owned a smart phone before, but I'm fairly competent on electronics. I guess bottom line she is happy with it and likes it. There is no flash and no front camera, but she will live. She is happy to get out of the dark ages. The only concern I had was smart phones using a lot of data. I just turned off the mobile data function, so she has to do everything in Wi-Fi. I told her if she really needed to, to enable mobile data, and do what she needed to real quick and turn it off.

The two things I don't like are this. One, it seems to be ruled by Google, and it wasn't you (and it is easier) to set up a google account to get the apps and stuff. I'd prefer it to be Amazon friendly. I still downloaded the Amazon app so she can use the Amazon app store, but going with Google, seems to be what the phone wants you to do. Two, you can't check your service days and remaining minutes/texts/data, unless you install an app that wants to connect to the internet (thru Wi-Fi or mobile data) to tell your status. The old phone had it quickly available, this you have to wait for the circle of death to quit spinning to tell you what you have left. Seems to me it should be easy to get information, not requiring extra steps.

Also I have read that a text isn't .33 minutes, it is a full 1 minute deduction. I don't care for that either. But instead of spending 1000 dollars a year for a smart phone, as of right now, this seems to be a more reasonable compromise.
